story:
Rathna Charitable Trust has evolved to offer a variety of Services to society.
Rathna Charitable Trust was established in early 2005 by Chidambaram Sri S.Rajasekara Deekshithar. The Trust kick-started with an establishment of a Vedic School where the Disciples are trained with chanting of Veda Mantras. The Children are well trained to create a Vibrant Energy through chanting Veda Mantras and Slokam for all the goodness and prosperity of the Heavenly Universe. The Children stay at our school and enjoy the free Vedic Education.  The Trust takes care of all the Children and their basic expenditures with the help of some noble Philanthropists. Rathna Charitable Trust offers free Vedic Education through "Rathna Veda Vidyalayam" at Alwarpet, Chennai. 

We now own a traditional thatched house in the village called Anandhathandavapuram near Mayilaaduthurai for running a branch of our Veda School in order to accommodate more children and to expand our noble services.  The School building is a thatched one whose roof top is laid with brick tiles, which was built in 1940's and the total land area of 15k square feet consisting of a garden. Brick tiles laid over the roof top are almost worn out with cracks and tiny pores through which rain water pours into the school in some sections. More over the garden is full of a thick mass of vast unregulated plants, shrubs, bushes and wild trees.  

The School needs to be renovated to offer Vedic Education and other social events like Fire Rituals, Yoga, and Meditation programs in the village besides offering Vedic Education to the children.

We have also planned to raise a new space for old, disabled people and to establish a new school offering both Academic & Vedic Education along with Boarding facilities to the Children free of costs.


Our Activities include,

We organize Samashti Upanayanam to the Brahmin Boys once a year. The Sacred Thread Ceremony incites Children to chant Gayathri Mantra.

"Dhaanathil Sirandhathu Annadhaanam" is a saying in Tamil which signifies Food Donation is the most paramount of other kinds of Donations. We organize Annadhaanam (Food Donation) programs during the Festivities in India.

We fund disadvantaged and needy for their Education, and to satisfy their fundamental needs.

We organize Fire Rituals during Full Moon days, Chathurthi, and on Navarathri days chanting Sri Gayathri Mantra, Ganesh Mantra, Panchakshara and Shakti Mantra followed by rituals in a Traditional Vedic style.

We offer Retreats and Programs to teach Veda Mantras and Slokam in a very traditional method for global peace and prosperity. Chanting Veda Mantras in a traditional style will invoke noble energy from the mantras that enhances, re-energizes, revitalises and rejuvenates our Mind, Soul and Body.

We are about to start up with Yoga and Meditation programs with Siva Rathna School of Yoga for enhancing the spiritual connections.

Our Vision is to establish a school to offer both Vedic and western system of education absolutely free of costs with Boarding and lodging for the Children.

We have a future plan of enhancing agricultural education to strengthen the Green Environment and to sow seeds of organic & Eco-friendly atmosphere to the Future generations.

Let us all join our hands in rendering and expanding these noble services to the needy.

Our Noble Services continue...

story:
Short Summary

  • The University of Islam and Clara Muhammad School National Alumni Association was founded in the early 1990's by Alumni. The  UOI & CMS NAA is a tax exempt public charity under Section 501 (c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and honored to accept bequests, transfers or gifts. All Contributions are Tax Deductible.
  • The NAA represents a School System, most Schools are private and once, was opened to African American Children only. Today, the Muhammad School System has schools around the U.S, Bermuda, and Belize and does not discriminate on the basis of color, race, religion, ethnic or national origin. 

 

  • FYI: Official School Records and Transcripts of students and graduates are  accepted by the Public School Systems in the United States,  as well as Colleges and Universities around the world. 
  • FYI: Many Muhammad Schools had 1000 students or more. Most Schools were Accredited. 

 Eighty-five  years later, Muhammad/Mohammed Schools are still operating.  The Schools focus remains the same, which is to provide the opportunity for Children to receive  an excellent education. Especially, children of color.

 

  • Sadly, some Schools across the U.S. closed in the late 80's and early 1990's and there was not a "National Student Record Storage, Access and Preservation Plan" set up for the Schools and Administrators to follow. 

 

    Your may asked how important is your Support for this Campaign? 
    • We do not wish to demonize the Muhammad/Mohammed School System, parents, teachers, volunteers, staff, faculty or founders over this oversight of not having or implementing a Strategic Plan or Plan of Action for Student Records and Files".
    • The UOI & CMS National Alumni Association(NAA), would like to correct the above mention over sight, hence this Campaign. The NAA believes there is no time to spare in implementing a Project of this Magnitude. Every minute we wait, there is loss, loss from damage (flood or fire) or just lost due to  (death or storage difficulties)

    • We are asking for your monetary assistance in finding, digitalizing, archiving,  preserving and protecting the School Records of thousands of Muhammad/Mohammed Students. 
    • The CMS National Alumni Association for years has been the Contact for students, parents, and Alumni needing proof of attendance (elementary and secondary) or Transcripts and knows first hand how important this project is for students, alumni and schools currently and in the future.

 

    • FYI: Most of the costs to implement this National Project, after equipment purchases of (neat scanners (desk top and portable) lap top computer, and  printer, will be the part-time costs for a Information Technical (IT) Support (supervisor, analyst, and intern) and full-time Office support (prevailing wages apply), as well as Transportation  and Accommodation (for staff 2-3, to travel to States with Schools and/or areas that used to have a School, and Public Relations (national and community papers etc.).

  

    • It will be necessary to Travel from West Coast to East Coast and with the Weather being unpredictable, our schedule will begin with travels in late Spring and finishing in late Summer (6-7 months). RV Travel will be the mode of travel and the most economical (travel, and accommodation for three (3).  Whether to purchase or lease will depend on what is most economical for our Budget.

 

 This Historical School System and Schools have struggle to survive and stay committed to the Mission and Vision of the Founders (1930's.) The mission and vision has always been to provide an excellent education to children and to teach the importance of "giving back" to humanity and community. Today the "End-Product" of this Historical School System, is their Alumni. The NAA is an organization devoted to students, schools, alumni and the American education process. 

 FYI: The Smithsonian National Museum's, African American History and Cultural Museum is scheduled to open in September 2016. The CMS National Alumni Association is proud to announce that our First National Alumni Reunion Souvenir Journal, a sample of the girls elementary School Uniforms and other items were submitted and accepted and will be used for research and  exhibition.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • This Project will Kick-off in California. Why California? because the National Alumni Association (NAA) knows where the School Records are and have access to them.

 Equipment is what we need immediately to begin the Digitalizing process (scanners, laptop, printers, software). Payroll to pay IT and Clerical support. and Transportation & Accommodation from Southern to Northern California. Lastly the preservation packing and mailing of records to National Library of Congress, Archive and Records Department. Washington DC.

 

 With this Second Campaign Kick-off, we are asking for your help in raising Twenty-five thousand dollars ($25,000).

We are asking for your continued assistance because this Project will take some years to complete.

We will need to travel to every state that has or had a School, we will have to advertise to locate files that maybe missing. We will need to pay prevailing wages for our IT and Office support. Packing and Mailing of Student Records and Files etc..

 

  • Funding to fully complete this Project, we estimate to be $75,000. We will have to travel State to State and begin the process of digitalizing and copying of  each student record and files. Once Area Schools "student records/files have been digitalize, preserved and package, the Area School or Guardian" will receive their Digitalize copy of the Student Record Files. The CMS National Alumni Association will keep, implement and maintain this National Records Data Base.

  • To lessen the costs in search and travel for Student Records in States needing to be visited, we will advertise and contact alumni, parents and school personnel months ahead of any visit,

    •  

     

    • The Perks: Public Recognition at our Annual Event, an Invite for Two at our Annual Event for sponsors or donors of $5000. or more. Inclusion in our Public notice and Press Releases. Our Heart Felt Thank you!
      •  
    • FYI: Please note, If we do not reach our immediate and long term goals, the NAA will continue with this Campaign and Project and purchase as many of the immediate needed equipment we can. Than you.

     Here Are Other Ways You Can Help

    You may not be able to financially contribute, we do understand, but Hey, that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Please help us  get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
    • For your convenience, use the Indiegogo Share Tools to share with Family, Friends and Associates ... to help and get the  word out!

story:
Kalman Human Aid And Charity Organization is a non profit organization located in the northern part of west Africa(Ghana,Togo and Burkina faso,benni) where poverty and poor infrastructure have bedeviled that part of the country. The three northern regions have be declared disaster zones by the government following heavy flooding through torrential rains and spill over from a hydro-electric dam from neighboring Burkina Faso. It is one of the largest disasters ever recorded in the sub region, rendering government disaster control agencies incapable of handling the situation.. As part of efforts to restore things to normalcy, government has called on non-governmental organizations and philanthropists to come to the aid of the people.

Kalman Human Aid is one of such organization expected by the people to come to their aid. By this, the organization is therefor making a passionate appeal to all and sundry to lend a helping hand. The distraction caused so far includes loss of lives, 260,000 houses, 500 school buildings, over 1,000,000 victims, 100,000 acres of farm lands, several animals and food stuffs, roads and bridges. kalman Human Aid is appealing for blankets, clothes, shoes, food, tents, mosquito nets and other items conceded necessary for disaster victims. Funds will also be needed to help in putting up public structures such as schools and community enters. Remember that you can save a soul by a little help whether in kind or cash. We shall also undertake camping as and when building materials has being secured. Interested persons who wish to assist in building public structures at camping should write to the organization for up dates and inquiries. 

Aims

•To foster unity among people of different cultural, social and political background. 

•To empower, support and educate the poor and deprived communities in order to acquire vocation. 

•To be advocates of Human Rights, especially the vulnerable e.g. women and children. 

•To deal with issues related to sexually transmitted diseases like HIV/Aids and gono. 

•To advocate sound environmental practices in order to prevent high incidence of malaria and cholera. 

•To organize work camps for both local and international volunteers. 

Our Community Sponsorship Program is currently sponsoring over 30 families living with HIV/AIDS who live out in the local communities. Each family receives different support depending on their needs. Children receive funds for schooling, food, and/or medical care. Many come and spend holidays or weekends at the Children’s Home.

story:
Short Summary

We believe it is essential to protect the planet, children and future generations - at school and in the world beyond school - and we work to catalyse and support "green" actions by kids, teachers, parents, and policymakers to reduce the environmental footprint by:

    • Eliminating toxics
    • Using resources sustainably
    • Creating green schoolyards and buildings
    • Serving healthy food and 
    • Teaching environmental literacy and stewardship.


So, every dollar you donate will be used only on expanding Green Education, by putting courses in schools that don’t teach it already.

The Impact

We work to transform schools into models of sustainability for communities, engaging youth in hands-on, inquiry-based learning and action to improve the health and sustainability of facilities and operations. We advocate for policies, action plans, and professional development that foster high performance, cost-efficient schools:

  • Providing the tools and resources to support schools in reducing their environmental footprint
  • Advocating for state policies that support healthy and sustainable schools and environmental literacy
  • 1,000 educators from 300 schools trained
  • 250,000 children across South East Asia

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We would appreciate it if you could get the word out and shout about our campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • We seek to collaborate with institutions and gain support from green corporations, if you are one or know any please contact us.
  • Volunteer as a: Trainer; Coordinator; Assistant

story:
The Problem:

Currently the great majority of Armenian teenagers smokes, drinks or uses drugs. The teenagers from socially vulnerable families are in the highest risk group. Their quantity is getting bigger and bigger every day, which leads to increase of the number of diseases, newborns with different kinds of health problems and mortality rate among young population. It’s becoming a big issue for Armenia and an appropriate solution is needed.

We decided to move out from Yerevan to other regions of Armenia and support  the local communities initiatives to builds a modern sports and playgrounds in their cities and villages.  We focused our attention on Dilijan – one of the most actively developing cities from cross-border regions. We are calling everyone for action-to support the idea of bringing a new life to one of the abandoned parks of Dilijan. 



The Impact:

  • By contributing to this project, we will give a unique opportunity to those kids, who never experienced the joy of having a specific sportsground (a basic thing in a modern world), and feeling themselves as a part of worldwide community.
  • By contributing to this project, we will help children from Dilijan to obtain their first modern Active Park and let them make the right choice between being healthy and involved in the community or just being another brick in the wall. 
  • By contributing to this project, we will motivate the younger generation to get rid of bad habits and start a self-education. 

What We Need:

“Street Workout Armenia” is a non-profit organization that promotes healthy lifestyle and mass sports development in Armenia. Our goal is to contribute actively to building of a healthy, strong and smart generation without bad habits.

The full cost of this project is $30.650.  Street Workout Armenia is ready to invest time and finance ($8000) in this project and build a sportsground in Dilijan park. We have already built workout ground. The City Hall of Dilijan will also contribute $14.000 for reconstruction costs. To bring this wonderful project to life we need your support to raise another $8650 to cover landscape architecture design and construction costs, reconstruction of a mini football field, reconstruction of one wall (270 sq/m) and street-art paintings. Future sportground is designed to be multi-functional: children will be able to play not only football, but also basketball and streetball.

story:
First Annual PeaceAnon World Conference  

How, What, Why


WHAT

PeaceAnon is a fellowship of men and women who share their experience, strength and hope with each other that they may solve their common problems and help others to recover from the effects of violent conflict.

The only requirement for membership is a desire to recover from violence. There are no dues or fees for PeaceAnon membership; we are self- supporting through our own contributions. PeaceAnon is not allied with any sect, denomination, politics, organization or institution; does not wish to engage in any controversy, neither endorses nor opposes any causes. Our primary purpose is to activate non-violence in our lives and help others to do the same. 

- We believe that changing the world is an inside job. 

- We believe that the global cessation of violent conflict is possible.

- We believe that the physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual solutions embodied in the 12 Steps so applied will prove successful for a wide variety of populations.


HOW

This July we will host the First Annual Conference of PeaceAnon and your financial support will help make it happen. 

It is our firm belief that the 12 Steps can be modified to help individuals and communities to recover from the devastating effects of human aggression and entrenched violent conflict and activate lasting peace in their lives. 

Since its introduction in 1935 the 12 Step Method has been modified numerous times to assist sufferers in dealing with many different issues. From substance addictions to obsessive gambling to eating disorders to compulsive spending, the method proves effective for those who engage it with rigor.

Simply put PeaceAnon is another branch on the 12 Step Program Tree and will operate in full compliance with the 12 Traditions and 12 Concepts of World Service. 

At this summer's conference a group of 30 12 Steppers, peace-builders, change agents, therapists, artists and leaders from all over the world will meet in Sweden to support the effort of again modifying the 12 Steps towards helping groups who are struggling to free themselves from any form of aggressive behaviour and conflict. That’s conflict such as war, domestic violence, gang violence, racism, bullying, or personal aggression of any kind.  


WHY

The "why" is simple. 

It's clear that our planet is struggling to free itself from war, environmental collapse, racism, poverty, sexism, addiction, lack of justice, lack of compassion, and profound inequities. As recovering people we have discovered some tools that we think can help. This is our mission, to help - nothing more, nothing less.

We are adapting the 12 Steps and 12 Traditions found in Alcoholics Anonymous et al in such a way that those methods and practices can be applied to populations that are want to free themselves from aggression.  These communities could be neighborhoods, cities or any population struggling with high rates of domestic violence, gang violence or war of any kind. 

PeaceAnon will give willing individuals and groups the tools needed to change their behavior through an open source peer-to-peer shared model of self-transformation. 

The 12 Step Movement already transforms the lives of the addicted by the millions. It does so without the use of institutional funding, political entanglements, or paid professional facilitation. We intend to replicate and expand this process to the aforementioned populations so that they may free themselves from aggressive and/or violent behaviour.


WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?
The $5000.00 dollars that we are asking for will go to:

- $3000.00  
Support the First Annual PeaceAnon World Conference in Falun, Sweden July 4th through the 12th 2015. 
Our primary conference expenses are intra-Sweden travel, food, logistics, and accommodations for the 25 participants who are planning to attend this year's conference. 


- $1000.00 

Travel support for experts in the study of violence to attend the First Annual PeaceAnon World Conference. 

We need a lot of help in writing the book and imagining the program. We've invited peace-building experts from as far away as Ireland, Israel, Africa, and the USA to help us 12 Steppers better understand the special needs of individuals and communities suffering from violence. Most are travelling here on their own dime but a few need some help. This money will offset some of those costs.


- $1000.00  
The completion of our "Big Book". 
We are currently knee deep in the writing of our version of the how-to book for PeaceAnon. Creating this book is critical to the success of the program. It will be the primary guide to help people work the steps and begin to set up groups in their communities. These costs include office supplies and an upgraded hard drive for JW's aging MacBook.  

THE 7th TRADITION  "Every A.A. group ought to be fully self-supporting, declining outside contributions.” 

Regarding fundraising and the 7th tradition we wish to make clear that this fundraising effort is about supporting the PeaceAnon First Annual World Conference. It’s not about giving money to pay individual people. PeaceAnon groups will always be self-supporting through their own contributions. 

It’s for this reason that we are offering no perks, partnerships or products in exchange for your support. We are not a business. Making money beyond what is required to be of service to others is not our concern. Being of service is its own reward.


Risks & Challenges

We see the risks and challenges to creating this program as being mostly of our own making. That is to say we have to walk the talk and keep ego in check. As founding members of PeaceAnon we feel it is critically important to abide by the 12 Steps, 12 Traditions, and 12 Concepts of World Service in all our affairs. In this well worn way we will mitigate the ego traps of money, property, and prestige, keeping our focus on unity, service, and recovery. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you're interested but cannot contribute we'd still love to hear from you! You can follow us on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/pages/First-Annual-PeaceAnon-Working-Retreat/621102711353164?ref=hl
You can also:
- Write directly to us at sonofjud@gmail.com
- Start a group in your home area. 
- Tell your friends about what we're doing.
- Volunteer your time! We need help! We need webmasters, graphic designers, legal services, clerical support, and research support. Write to the email above if you'd like to volunteer!  

Disclaimer: PeaceAnon has no official, legal, professional or financial affiliation with Alcoholics Anonymous or any other 12 Step Organisation.
story_txt:
First Annual PeaceAnon World Conference  

How, What, Why


WHAT
PeaceAnon is a fellowship of men and women who share their experience, strength and hope with each other that they may solve their common problems and help others to recover from the effects of violent conflict.
The only requirement for membership is a desire to recover from violence. There are no dues or fees for PeaceAnon membership; we are self- supporting through our own contributions. PeaceAnon is not allied with any sect, denomination, politics, organization or institution; does not wish to engage in any controversy, neither endorses nor opposes any causes. Our primary purpose is to activate non-violence in our lives and help others to do the same. 
- We believe that changing the world is an inside job. 
- We believe that the global cessation of violent conflict is possible.
- We believe that the physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual solutions embodied in the 12 Steps so applied will prove successful for a wide variety of populations.
HOW



This July we will host the First Annual Conference of PeaceAnon and your financial support will help make it happen. 
It is our firm belief that the 12 Steps can be modified to help individuals and communities to recover from the devastating effects of human aggression and entrenched violent conflict and activate lasting peace in their lives.

You can also:

story: I wish that I was more in my son Aslan's life. He is 17 years old and lives in Los Angeles CA. I live in Jacksonville, FL. I am an Air Force veteran who is slowly coming up from a financial slump and trying desperately  to surprise my son Aslan, with a visit at his high school graduation. This would mean the world to him. He really is a great kid and from what his mother tells me, he has upheld himself socially, accepting life challenges without having a male father figure to help him through the pains of adolescence. I am very proud of him, he is my boy and these celebrations only come once in a lifetime. I really want to be there for him this time and show him that I care and love him unconditionally. I have many excuses as to why I couldn't be more of a father to my son, but I would love not to have an excuse for not showing up for this major event in my son's life. That is why I am shamelessly asking for financial assistance from you, my newly crowd friends. Help please. The money will be used for airfare, lodging, meals, and  for reestablishing acquaintance with my son for one week. I will also post pictures acknowledging, my gratitude for helping us with this very important event. Aslan is graduating on May 28, 2015.  Your help is deeply appreciated, thank you.

story:
My name is Emma Asonye, a linguist, academic and the President and Founder of Save the Deaf and Endangered Languages Initiative, a community based non-governmental organization working with the Deaf children and youths in Imo State Nigeria. Our organization organized and hosted the first Deaf Talent Show in Nigeria in 2014 tagged “Naija Deaf Got Talent”.

I developed my passion for the Deaf children in 2001 when I had the first encounter with the Deaf students at the Schools for the Deaf Orodo and Orlu in Imo State being in the team of delegates that accompanied a sign language expert from Canada, Anne Marie Wieseman to donate study materials to the schools. In the course of interaction, she noticed that there was no electricity in the building and she asked then, “In the night how do you communicate?” and the replied, “In the night, no communication.”

11 years after, when I began my research on communication disorder, I found out that the Deaf students and pupils of the above schools are still vulnerable to the different acts of stigmatization and isolation I witnessed when I first met them – abandoned in their world of darkness, living in dormitories with no security, no staff; exposed to all sorts of sexual violence and bullying, no proper medical attention nor information about their health, HIV/AIDS and sex education.

In 2014, we launched a long term project tagged “Fighting for the Vulnerable” through which we want to fight against Deaf stigmatization, Deaf street begging and sexual violence against Deaf girls and achieve the human capital development of the Deaf children and youths. This we are set to achieve with the collaborative efforts of the parents of the Deaf children, community people and a team of our volunteers made up of young graduates and undergraduates from different tertiary institutions in Nigeria.

Your contributions will help to restore sight to some hundreds of Deaf children and so prevent potential cases of deaf-blindness. Your contribution will for the first time bring HIV/AIDS awareness and sex education to the knowledge of these Deaf kids and give them a sense of belonging to the society.

The Impact

Our project of “Fighting for the Vulnerable” is focused on our commitment to the total human capital development of the Deaf children and youths, and our commitment to stopping Deaf stigmatization in Nigeria in line with the global commitment in stopping the stigmatization and victimization of the vulnerable.

As for the Deaf children, we found out that the stigmatization they are subjected to begins from their families as there is little or no communication between them and their family members, coupled with the age long erroneous belief that a Deaf child is a curse to the family. As a result, we began our “Stop Deaf Stigmatization Campaign” with various sensitization meetings with the parents of these Deaf students after which we created a sign language class for parents of the Deaf at our academy in Owerri. Then in 2014, we organized the first ever Deaf Talent Show in Nigeria, in which some selected Deaf youths from the two schools were given the opportunity of displaying their potentials in the event tagged “Naija Deaf Got Talent”.

Risks and Challenges

Our major challenge in this project is the communication barrier between the team members and the Deaf students, as none of my team members is a sign language user and most of the hearing teachers in the two schools are not effective sign language users and so cannot interpret for the resource persons. As a result, we are making plans to hire about 4 sign language interpreters from around the neighborhood to assist us.

Another obvious risk is in the case of any student being diagnosed of HIV/AIDS, to achieve a successful counselling and treatment would involve the parents most of whom put a callous attitude towards their Deaf children. Since counselling may be referred to a certified hospital, this will equally require the services of an interpreter and they are grossly lacking in our community.

The Present Project

In the present project of 5 days medical outreach to the Secondary School for the Deaf Ofekata Orodo in the month of May, and a 4 days medical outreach to the Primary School for the Deaf and Mentally Challenged Orlu, we want to give 370 students and about 250 pupils of the two schools the privilege of medical care focusing on eye screening and treatment, HIV/AIDS screening and awareness campaign, plus sex education.

Project Cost

We need the sum of $12,000 to execute this project which will cover the cost of:

-  Drugs

-  HIV/AIDS kits and other kits

-  200 pieces of frames and lenses

-  Transportation to and from Project site

-  Light refreshment for team members

Including the services of:

-  5 Nurses

-  5 Optometrists

-  5 Lab Scientists

-  2 Pharmacists

-  3 Medical doctors

-  6 Sign language interpreters

-  10 Volunteer workers on logistics

Meanwhile, if we do not reach our goal within the stipulated period, we will do the project only at the Secondary School Orodo.

Please assist us in achieving this project, you can also help us to spread this message on your social media platforms. Thank

story:
Short Summary

The 2015 Earthquake at Nepal occurred at 11:56 NST on 25 April with a moment magnitude of 7.8 and a maximum Mercalli Intensity of IX (Violent). Its epicenter was approximately 34 km (21 mi) east-southeast of Lamjung, Nepal.

We, Dr.Ranju Dev and Dr.Syed Safvi Mahmood are medical professionals with a keen interest in selflessly serving humanity and giving back to society. We have started contributing commodities on our own. We hope to work tirelessly towards bringing stability in Nepal in our small way and sincerely wish that some good Samaritans shall aid us in our noble cause.


About us 

Dr.Ranju Dev and Dr.Syed Safvi Mahmood are Medical Professionals. Dr.Ranju is a Nepali Citizen and Dr.Safvi hails from India.

Dr.Ranju is a Medical Physician, M.B,B.S (Bachelor of Medicine & Bachelor of Surgery) graduate from Nepalgunj Medical College, Nepalgunj, Nepal and is currently pursuing Masters degree in the Department of Pediatric Medicine at National Medical College & Teaching Hospital, Birgunj, Parsa, Nepal.

Dr.Safvi is a Medical Physician, M.B,B.S (Bachelor of Medicine & Bachelor of Surgery) graduate from Kasturba Medical College, Manipal, Karnataka, India currently enrolled in a Masters Residency program at the Department of Pathology at National Medical College & Teaching Hospital, Birgunj, Parsa, Nepal.

We have extensive experience in Disaster and Emergency Management having worked in different Institutions under demanding conditions, often with limited resources.

Dr.Ranju worked as a Medical Officer in the Emergency Department at the Institute of Medicine, Kathmandu, Nepal which is a Tertiary Referral Centre and currently spearheading the Disaster Relief process at the capital.

Dr.Safvi has exhaustive experience as a Resident at Dhahran Military Hospital, rotating through Internal Medicine, Interventional Cardiology and Neurosurgery.

Both are qualified BLS (Basic Life Support) Instructors and ACLS (Advanced Cardiac Life Support) Providers. In addition Dr.Ranju has successfully completed the PALS (Pediatric Advanced Life Support) course, all affiliated with the American Heart Association.


Why us

Secondary to the widespread destruction and frequent aftershocks a lot of residents have fled the Capital Kathmandu. However we have managed to establish a strong, reliable network through which Aid has already started being dispensed on a 24-hour round-the-clock basis. The first consignment was dispatched day before yesterday and was well utilised by the affected individuals.

Being medical professionals we have the expertise to deal with the current situation. Preventive actions have to be taken to minimise diseases that usually follow such natural calamities. Air and Water-borne diseases are already on the rise. Time and again we shall make a conscientious effort to deliver the goods on our own and ensure that the needful is being done in the most efficient and safest way possible.

We felt that we needed this platform to appeal for International contributions as our local resources are meagre and approaching the point of exhaustion. The ongoing political turmoil has made the situation worse.


What we need

Our initial aim is to raise $15,000 so we can buy relevant equipment and materials to aid Nepal's earthquake recovery efforts. 


How soon do we need it

To be honest: As soon as possible hence our campaign period is 15 days. It will take another 10 days or so for Indiegogo to transfer the funds. Moreover we have selected the option wherein we are guaranteed funds regardless of the amount, so please contribute. We have already started doing our bit by sourcing 14 boxes of Face Masks to the field, from Birgunj (an Indo-Nepal border town) as most of the shopkeepers at the Capital and other hard-hit areas are taking advantage of the helplessness of the survivors and charging exorbitant prices for simple medical and non-medical commodities.


Preventing Diseases

Prevention is better than Cure. Preventive actions have to be taken to minimise diseases that usually follow such natural calamities.

  • Face Masks to prevent contracting and spreading respiratory illnesses
  • Oral Rehydrating Solution (ORS) to prevent dehydration
  • Glucose Powder for preventing low blood sugar levels (Hypoglycemia)
  • Chlorine Tablets for safe palatable water to prevent water-borne diseases
  • Toilet paper rolls since Water is a scarce commodity
  • Paper-soap since it is more handy and hygienic


For the caregiver

The caregiver is the most vulnerable person to develop and transmit communicable diseases

  • Non-sterile Disposable Gloves
  • Face Mask to prevent contracting and spreading respiratory illnesses


For Children

Please keep in mind that many Children have been orphaned because of this calamity.

  • Milk Powder
  • Pacifier


For the Elderly

  • We shall try to get walking-aids made locally to reduce costs so that maximum people benefit.


Edibles (Food)

  • Pre-prepared Instant noodles that do not necessarily need to be boiled in water before consumption.
  • Dry Biscuits that have a long shelf life
  • Beaten Rice is a locally acceptable commodity that is filling and gives instant energy


Common over-the-counter Medications

  • Paracetamol
  • Pain-killers
  • Albendazole
  • Oral Antibiotics – Cefotaxime, Cefpodoxime, Co-trimoxazole, Ofloxacin, Metronidazole, Azithromycin, Cloxacillin
  • Cough Syrup


For Trauma victims

  • Povidone-Iodine Solution
  • Cotton
  • Gauze
  • Bandage
  • Handiplast


Shelter

  • Raw material in the form of water-resistant sheets that may be placed on the floor and/or stretched between locally available wooden/bamboo poles to serve as a roof.


The Impact

People from all strata of society regardless of caste, creed, culture and age shall benefit.

We have previously volunteered and led such campaigns albeit not online. We trust that the Internet is a powerful weapon and wish to creatively mold it to help carve the Nepal we knew before disaster struck.


Risks and Challenges

We understand that some areas may prove to be a logistic nightmare. Together, We pledge that we shall take up the challenge to cover as many affected areas as possible. At the same time it is crucial that none of our limited resources go to waste.


Transparency

A promise to buy relevant equipment and materials, with a very transparent accounting for the money utilised. The goods need to be accompanied by the original receipts during the transportation process. However a picture of the same shall be available for sharing. We shall try our level best to utilise ALL funds. Should any financial resources remain, we shall donate it to local NGOs (Non-Governmental Organization), and provide proof thereof.


Other ways you can help

Kindly spread the good word and Share using the useful Indiegogo tools please!

If you prefer, you may donate directly to:

Red Cross Nepal: http://www.nrcs.org/donate-nrcs


About the Earthquake

The 2015 Earthquake at Nepal occurred at 11:56 NST on 25 April with a moment magnitude of 7.8 and a maximum Mercalli Intensity of IX (Violent). Its epicenter was approximately 34 km (21 mi) east-southeast of Lamjung, Nepal. It caused widespread devastation, along with multiple avalanches on Mount Everest.

The death toll in Nepal has now crossed 5,000. The Nepal Prime Minister has said that the number could reach 10,000.

UNICEF announced that close to 1 million children were "severely affected" by the disaster.On 27 April, a local newspaper The Himalayan Times reported that as many as 20,000 foreign nationals may have been visiting Nepal at the time of the earthquake. As reports come in from isolated villages, it is possible that total deaths may reach or exceed the more than 10,000 killed in the 1934 earthquake.

Hundreds of people are still considered missing and more than 450,000 are displaced.


Please remember the victims in your prayers and do help us reach our Goal. 

Every Step is a Step Forward !

We Thank Each and Every one of You from the depths of our hearts.

experience in Disaster and Emergency Management having worked in different
Institutions under demanding conditions, often with limited resources. 
Dr.Ranju worked
as a Medical Officer in the Emergency Department at the Institute of Medicine,
Kathmandu, Nepal which is a Tertiary Referral Centre and currently spearheading the
Disaster Relief process at the capital.
Dr.Safvi has
exhaustive experience as a Resident at Dhahran Military Hospital, rotating
through Internal Medicine, Interventional Cardiology and Neurosurgery.Both are qualified BLS (Basic Life Support) Instructors and ACLS (Advanced Cardiac Life Support) Providers. In addition Dr.Ranju has successfully completed the PALS (Pediatric Advanced Life Support) course, all affiliated with the American Heart Association.

Why us
Secondary to the
widespread destruction and frequent aftershocks a lot of residents have fled
the Capital Kathmandu. However we have managed to establish a strong, reliable
network through which Aid has already started being dispensed on a 24-hour
round-the-clock basis. The first consignment was dispatched day before
yesterday and was well utilised by the affected individuals.
Being medical
professionals we have the expertise to deal with the current situation.
Preventive actions have to be taken to minimise diseases that usually follow
such natural calamities. Air and Water-borne diseases are already on the rise. Time and again we
shall make a conscientious effort to deliver the goods on our own and ensure
that the needful is being done in the most efficient and safest way possible.We felt that we needed this platform to appeal for International contributions as our local resources are meagre and approaching the point of exhaustion. The ongoing political turmoil has made the situation worse.

What we
need
Our initial aim is to raise $15,000 so we can buy relevant
equipment and materials to aid Nepal's earthquake recovery efforts. 

How soon do we need it
To be honest: As
soon as possible hence our campaign period is 15 days. It will take another 10
days or so for Indiegogo to transfer the funds. Moreover we have selected the option wherein we are guaranteed funds regardless of the amount, so please contribute. We have already started doing our bit by sourcing 14 boxes of Face Masks to the field, from Birgunj (an Indo-Nepal border town) as most of the shopkeepers at the Capital and other hard-hit areas are taking advantage of the helplessness of the survivors and charging exorbitant prices for simple medical and non-medical commodities.Preventing
Diseases
Prevention is
better than Cure. Preventive actions have to be taken to minimise diseases that
usually follow such natural calamities. 



Face Masks to prevent
contracting and spreading respiratory illnesses


Oral Rehydrating
Solution (ORS) to prevent dehydration


Glucose Powder
for preventing low blood sugar levels (Hypoglycemia)


Chlorine Tablets
for safe palatable water to prevent water-borne diseases


Toilet paper rolls since Water is a scarce commodity


Paper-soap since it is more handy and hygienic



For the
caregiver
The caregiver is
the most vulnerable person to develop and transmit communicable diseases 



Non-sterile
Disposable Gloves


Face Mask to prevent
contracting and spreading respiratory illnesses



For
Children
Please keep in
mind that many Children have been orphaned because of this calamity. 


Milk Powder


Pacifier



For the Elderly

We shall try to
get walking-aids made locally to reduce costs so that maximum people benefit.

Edibles (Food)


Pre-prepared
Instant noodles that do not necessarily need to be boiled in water before
consumption.


Dry Biscuits that
have a long shelf life


Beaten Rice is a
locally acceptable commodity that is filling and gives instant energy



Common
over-the-counter Medications


Paracetamol


Pain-killers


Albendazole


Oral Antibiotics
– Cefotaxime, Cefpodoxime, Co-trimoxazole, Ofloxacin, Metronidazole, Azithromycin,
Cloxacillin


Cough Syrup



For Trauma
victims


Povidone-Iodine
Solution


Cotton


Gauze


Bandage


Handiplast



Shelter

Raw material in
the form of water-resistant sheets that may be placed on the floor and/or
stretched between locally available wooden/bamboo poles to serve as a roof.


The Impact
People from all
strata of society regardless of caste, creed, culture and age shall benefit. 
We have
previously volunteered and led such campaigns albeit not online. We trust that
the Internet is a powerful weapon and wish to creatively mold it to help carve
the Nepal we knew before disaster struck.

Risks and
Challenges
We understand
that some areas may prove to be a logistic nightmare. Together, We pledge that
we shall take up the challenge to cover as many affected areas as possible. At
the same time it is crucial that none of our limited resources go to waste.


Transparency
A promise to buy
relevant equipment and materials, with a very transparent accounting for the
money utilised. The goods need to be accompanied by the original receipts
during the transportation process. However a picture of the same shall be
available for sharing. We shall try our level best to utilise ALL funds. Should
any financial resources remain, we shall donate it to local NGOs (Non-Governmental
Organization), and provide proof thereof.


Other ways
you can help
Kindly spread the
good word and Share using the useful Indiegogo tools please!
If you prefer,
you may donate directly to:
Red Cross Nepal: http://www.nrcs.org/donate-nrcs


About the
Earthquake
The 2015 Earthquake at Nepal occurred at 11:56 NST on 25
April with a moment magnitude of 7.8 and a maximum Mercalli Intensity of IX
(Violent). Its epicenter was approximately 34 km (21 mi) east-southeast of
Lamjung, Nepal. It caused widespread devastation, along with multiple avalanches
on Mount Everest.
The death toll in Nepal has now crossed 5,000.
The Nepal Prime Minister has said that the number could reach
10,000.
UNICEF announced that close to 1
million children were "severely affected" by the disaster.On
27 April, a local newspaper The Himalayan Times reported
that as many as 20,000 foreign nationals may have been visiting Nepal at the
time of the earthquake. As reports come in from isolated villages, it is
possible that total deaths may reach or exceed the more than 10,000 killed in
the 1934 earthquake.

Hundreds of people are still considered missing
and more than 450,000 are displaced.Please remember the victims in your prayers and do help us reach our Goal. Every Step is a Step Forward !We Thank Each and Every one of You from the depths of our hearts.

story:
Appleton West, the original Appleton high school, is celebrating over 75 years of building community.  The After Grad party tradition is the final time the class will be together before moving on to life after high school. 

What’s our Goal? An event for AW Grads to celebrate this important milestone before they move on into their successful futures.   The money we raise provides a safe, drug and alcohol free gathering.    Any amount will help.

story:
ENGLISH

Vicente Suarez elementary school is in a jungle area in the Sinai community in Bacalar, in the Yucatan peninsula in Mexico. 90% of the population of this community is of Mayan descent and still maintain their traditions and speaks the language, 40% of women wear the traditional outfit called Huipil and most of the people are field workers.

The school has earned the reputation of being one of the best in the area and is closely involved in environmental issues. In September 2014 they where awarded “the first rural school involved in sustainability” by UNESCO (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization).

Despite their efforts and achievements, the school is experiencing a resource crisis. They have basic problems on their facilities and this is interfering with their educational development, which is why we invite you to be part of this project.

The funds gathered will be invested in cement, construction sand, electrical installations, roofs waterproofing, paint, window frames and screens. 

Your donation can help raise the resources needed so that children from Vicente Suarez elementary school can learn in a dignified infrastructure. 


ESPAÑOL

La escuela primaria Vicente Suárez, está en una zona selvática en la comunidad de Sinaí en Bacalar, en la península de Yucatán en México. 90% de la población es de origen Maya y aún mantiene sus tradiciones y habla el idioma, 40% de las mujeres usan el traje típico llamado Huipil y la mayoría de la gente se dedica al campo.

La escuela se ha ganado el prestigio de ser una de las mejores de la zona y está estrechamente involucrada en los temas del medio ambiente. En septiembre del 2014 se ganaron el reconocimiento por UNESCO (Organización de las Naciones Unidas para la Educación, la Ciencia y la Cultura), por ser el primer colegio rural involucrado en temas ambientales.

A pesar de sus esfuerzos y logros, la escuela está viviendo una crisis de recursos. Tienen problemas básicos en sus instalaciones y esto está interfiriendo en su desarrollo educativo, es por esto que te invitamos a ser parte de este proyecto.

Tu donación puede ayudar a que logremos recaudar los recursos que se necesitan para que los niños de la primaria de Vicente Suárez puedan tener una experiencia digna en cuanto a su desarrollo educativo.

story:
Short Summary of the Team

The Pebbles curling team was founded in December 2013 and was initially made up of three members: Ana-Maria Săracu, Bianca Neagoe, Daiana Colceriu. Playing as a team, the three girls won their first Romanian National Women's Curling Championship in 2014. The need for a fourth player was fulfilled by adding Alina Cristina Marin to the team. In 2015, they have won together their second Romanian National Women's Curling Championship. 

Ana-Maria Săracu started playing curling in 2013, at the age of 24 and she has participated in the World Mixed Doubles Curling Championship in Canada in 2013 and in the Women Europeans Championship - C League in 2014.

Bianca Neagoe started playing curling in 2011, at the age of 25 and she participated in the Women Europeans Championship - C League in 2011, 2012, 2014.

Daiana Colceriu started playing curling in the year 2010, at the age of 28, and since then she has participated in the European Mixt Championship (2011), the World Mixed Doubles (2012) and the Women Europeans C League (2011, 2012, 2014). 

Alina Cristina Marin started playing curling in the year 2013, at the age of 19 and she has reached the semifinals at SSS Curling Championship in Glasgow and participated in the Women Europeans Championship - C League in 2014.

Besides being the members of the National Curling Team, Ana-Maria Săracu is a Business Analyst and Tester at SmartSoft Romania, Daiana Colceriu is a Kindergarten Owner, Bianca Neagoe is a Content Creator and Social Media Specialist, Alina Cristina Marin is a Neuroscience Student at Glasgow University.

The four Pebbles will represent Romania at the European Curling Championship C Group, for the second time together. This year they will compete against 6 other teams: Belarus, Croatia, France, Ireland, Slovakia, Slovenia and Spain. The European Championship – League C will take place in Champery, Switzerland between the 12th and 17th of October 2015: 

http://www.worldcurling.org/european-curling-championships-c-division-2015 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to be able to participate in the European Championship in Champery Switzerland, the Romanian National Team – Pebbles, needs to raise 3930 euros, representing the following resources:

Type Qty Cost/Member Total Cost
1. Training Session in Budapest
- Transportation   0     0 €     0 €
- Accommodation   4     15 €     60 €
- Renting of curling sheets at the Ice Arena   4     30 €   120 €
2. Training Session in Bratislava
- Transportation   0     0 €     0 €
- Accommodation   4     90 €   360 €
- Living expenses   4     85 €   340 €
- Renting of curling sheets at the Ice Arena   4     87.5 €   350 €
- Coach   4     65 €   260 €
3. European Championship in Switzerland
- Transportation   4     175 €   700 €
- Accommodation   4     185 €   740 €
- Living expenses   4     250 €  1000 €

If you wish to support us, please find the possibility to  SELECT A PERK from the ones presented on the right side of the page.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. A share on Facebook or anywhere else, will help other people find out about us.
We thank you for your support and we promise to make the best out of this experience and proudly represent Romania!

story:
• Drug discovery in 5 Pediatric Rare Diseases which could affect your kids:
    • Cystic Fibrosis
    • Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy
    • Gaucher Disease
    • Niemann Pick Disease Type C
    • Osteogenesis Imperfecta
  • These diseases affect more than 1 million children worldwide.
  • Using already known medicines; fast, safe, cheap and de-risked development.
  • In addition to this campaign, SOM Biotech will push any positive result to the market.
Versión en español

Rare diseases, also known as orphan diseases, are illnesses which affect a small portion of the world population (around 6-8%). According to the National Organization of Rare Diseases (NORD) there are around 7000 rare diseases known to exist worldwide, most of them without cures and significant treatments available. Research motivation into these diseases has been largely neglected due to small populations being afflicted, then continuing lack of knowledge and the potential low return on investments.

Pediatric rare diseases are one of the most complicated forms of rare diseases, with approximately 50% of rare diseases known to affect children worldwide. Moreover, many of the rare diseases treatments on the market are not applicable to pediatric populations. Some of the most continuing burdensome pediatric rare diseases include:

1. Cystic Fibrosis - Info

Abnormal production of thick fluids leading to obstructions and complications, of the respiratory and digestive systems.
  • Approximately rare diseas 70,000 - 100,000 people affected worldwide.
  • More than 95% of men are sterile.
  • Despite improvements, people have reduced life expectancies in comparison to the general population (˜35 years old).
  • Gene Mutation: CFTR (Autosomal Recessive Inheritance).
    •

2. Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy - Info

Progressive muscle degeneration and weakness resulting in: mobility, respiratory, and skeletal development problems.

  • Approximately 300,000 people affected worldwide.
  • Males primarily affected, rare in females.
  • Estimated 1/3500 male births affected worldwide.
  • Approximately 20,000 new cases/year.
  • Inmobility usually occurs by ˜ 12 years old.
  • Estimated life expectancy: 25 years old, >30 years old (rarer)
  • Gene Mutation: Dystrophin (Autosomal Recessive Inheritance).
    •

3. Gaucher Disease (3 types) - Info

Accumulation of fatty substances, including glucocerebrosides and glycosphingolipids, within cells leading to tissue and organ complications (such as enlargement of the spleen and liver).

  • Estimated 1/75,000 people affected worldwide.
  • 3 types exist (types 2 and 3 - most severe):
    • Type 1: Most common, without nervous system affected.
    • Types 2 and 3: Nervous system affected (Type 2: death usually before 2 years old.
  • Gene Mutation: GBA (Autosomal Recessive Inheritance).
    •

4. Niemann Pick Disease Type C - Info

Another disease involving the accumulation of fatty substances, within cells, leading to tissue and organ complications (including: brain, spleen and liver).

  • Estimated 1/120,000 births affected worldwide.
  • Can occur between infancy and adulthood, but usually in childhood.
  • Disease is always fatal (majority die between the ages of 10 and 25 years old).
  • Gene Mutation: NPC1 and/or NPC2 (Autosomal Recessive Inheritance).
    •

5. Osteogenesis Imperfecta (Brittle Bones Disease) - Info

Abnormalities in collagen production, leading to skeletal deformities and bone fragilities.

  • Approximately 6 – 7/100,000 people affected worldwide.
  • Males and females equally affected.
  • At least 8 types of the disease exist.
  • Types 1 and 4: Most common
    • Mild-moderate severity, near normal lifespan (with support).
  • Type 2 and 3: Most severe
    • Type 2: frequently lethal at or post-birth.
    • Type 3: fractures begin in early in life, shortened lifespan.
  • Gene Mutation: COL1A1 and/or COL1A2 are the most common (mostly cases of Autosomal Dominant Inheritance).
    •

SOM Biotech SL (SOM) is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical group established at the Barcelona Science Park (PCB), Spain, in 2009. We are dedicated towards discovering and developing therapeutics for rare diseases by identifying new potential uses for existing therapeutics (drug repositioning).

We presently have several programs under discovery including two rare disease programs in advanced clinical stages for Transthyretin-related Hereditary Amyloidosis and Huntington's Disease, both demonstrating positively significant results.

SOM Biotech was also the winner of the 2013 EntrepreneurXXI award, presented by La Caixa Bank (one of Spain's largest banks) in conjunction with the Spanish Ministry of Industry, Energy and Tourism. This prestigious award was presented to Spanish start-up companies with the greatest growth potential.

As a new initiative, SOM Biotech is now turning its attention towards discovering new therapeutic options for pediatric rare diseases. Specifically, we aim to tackle the 5 burdensome pediatric rare diseases mentioned.

SOM Biotech possesses a proprietary know-how discovery process, capable of identifying new activities for existing compounds which are already on the market for another use. Upon discovery, the compounds are validated experimentally and patent-protected before proceeding directly to Phase II clinical trials in patients. Later stages of the projects would be co-developed with other pharmaceutical companies to reach the market.

Drug repositioning (or repurposing) is a drug development process of discovering new applications for existing therapeutics towards other diseases. It builds upon previous clinical developments of the therapeutics' safety and for its original indication. In comparison to new drugs, repurposed drugs may bypass much of the early costs and time associated with clinical development (such as Phase I clinical trials).

There have been numerous counts of successes of drug repurposing throughout history in the pharmaceutical industry. Examples of repurposed drugs include Viagra, originally for Angina, for Erectile Dysfunction and Thalidomide, originally for Morning Sickness, for Multiple Myelomas. It is important to note the risks of drug repositioning projects failing are still as with any drug development projects, However, they are significantly lower in comparison to traditional drug development.

  • Target Funding Goal of the campaign: at least 300,000 USD$.
  • Funds will be distributed evenly among the 5 Pediatric Rare Diseases.
  • SOM will take responsibility to cover the entire developmental costs from the initial discovery stages to the market of any promising drug.

  • Limited funding has been provided to promote the health and scientific R&D sectors.
  • Improve scientific and/or clinical knowledge of the various pediatric rare diseases..
  • Possibility of discovering new therapeutic options which may be beneficial in dealing with the selected pediatric rare diseases.
  • Provide hope to the children afflicted from the various rare diseases, of which no cures exist to this date or ineffective treatments are available.

We welcome any help in making this opportunity happen, and hope to make a significant medical contributions through our discoveries. Please share this campaign and bring awareness to your friends, family, colleagues and everyone you know! Share our campaign link (http://igg.me/at/fightrarediseases) with everyone on Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin and other social media platforms!

For more information, please visit our campaign website.
Feel free to send us a message at the following address: fightrd@sombiotech.com.
In addition, please follow our campaign on Facebook, and Twitter.

We acknowledge the following worldwide organizations for bringing awareness to these burdensome diseases among others:

  • Spanish Gaucher Disease Patient Association - Webpage
  • Biomedical Research Network of Rare Diseases (CIBERER) - Webpage
  • Chinese Organization for Rare Disorders - Webpage
  • US Coalition Duchenne - Webpage
  • Duchenne Parent Project - Webpage
  • European Gaucher Alliance - Webpage
  • Spanish Federation of Rare Diseases(FEDER) - Webpage
  • Spanish Federation of Neuromuscular Diseases - Webpage
  • FEETEG Foundation - Webpage
  • Spanish Foundation of Niemann Pick disease - Webpage
  • Genetic Alliance UK - Webpage
  • Gauchers Association (UK) - Webpage
  • Spanish Foundation of Osteogenesis Imperfecta (AHUCE) -
  • Niemann Pick UK - Webpage

THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!!

Versión en español
  • Drug discovery en 5 Enfermedades Pediátricas Raras que pueden afectar a tus hijos:
    • Fibrosis Quística
    • Distrofia Muscular de Duchenne
    • Enfermedad de Gaucher
    • Enfermedad de Niemann Pick Tipo C
    • Osteogenesis Imperfecta
  • Estas enfermedades afectan a más de 1 millón de niños en todo el mundo.
  • Utilizamos medicinas ya conocidas; desarrollo rápido, seguro, económico y de menor riesgo.
  • SOM Biotech se compromete a llevar cualquier resultado positivo hasta su comercialización.

Las enfermedades raras, también conocidas como enfermedades huérfanas, son enfermedades que afectan una pequeña proporción de la población mundial (alrededor del 6-8%). De acuerdo con la Organización Nacional de Enfermedades Raras (NORD) existen alrededor de 7.000 enfermedades raras en todo el mundo, la mayoría de las cuales sin cura ni tratamiento significativo disponible. La motivación para investigar estas enfermedades ha sido desatendida, en gran medida, debido a la pequeña población afectada, además de la falta de conocimiento y el bajo potencial de rendimiento de las inversiones.

El 50% de enfermedades raras afectan a niños en todo el mundo, siendo las pediátricas las formas más complejas de enfermedades raras. Además, muchos de los tratamientos para estas enfermedades no son aplicables a la población pediátrica. Algunas de las enfermedades raras pediátricas más graves incluyen:

1. Fibrosis Quística - Info

Producción anormal de fluidos espesos que llevan a obstrucciones y complicaciones de los sistemas respiratorio y digestivo.
  • Aproximadamente 70,000 - 100,000 personas afectadas en todo el mundo.
  • Más del 95% de los hombres son estériles.
  • DA pesar de los cuidados, los pacientes tienen una esperanza de vida reducida en comparación con la población en general (≈35 años).
  • Mutación Génica: CFTR (Herencia Autosómica Recesiva).
    •

2. Distrofia Muscular de Duchenne - Info

Degeneración muscular progresiva y debilidad causando problemas de movilidad, respiratorios y de desarollo esquelético.

  • Aproximadamente 300,000 personas afectadas en todo el mundo.
  • Afectación mayoritaria en hombres, raramente en mujeres.
  • Estimación de 1/3,500 hombres nacidos afectados en todo el mundo.
  • Aproximadamente 20,000 nuevos casos/año.
  • Inmovilidad habitual sobre los 12 años de edad.
  • Esperanza de vida estimada: 25 años, raramente > 30 años
  • Mutación Génica: Distrofina (Herencia Autosómica Recesiva).
    •

3. Enfermedad de Gaucher (3 tipos) - Info

Acumulación de sustancias grasas, incluyendo glucocerebrósidos y glucoesfingolípidos, dentro de las células, dando lugar a complicaciones en tejido y órganos (tales como engrosamiento del bazo y el hígado).

  • Estimación de 1/75,000 personas afectadas en todo el mundo.
  • Existencia de 3 tipos (tipos 2 y 3 más severos):
    • Tipo 1: más habitual, sin afectación del sistema nervioso.
    • Tipos 2 y 3: afectación del sistema nervioso (tipo 2: muerte habitual antes de los 2 años de edad).
  • Mutación Génica: GBA (Herencia Autosómica Recesiva).
    •

4. Enfermedad de Niemann Pick Tipo C - Info

Se trata de otra enfermedad involucrada en la acumulación de sustancias grasas dentro de las células, dando lugar a complicaciones en tejidos y órganos (incluyendo: cerebro, bazo e hígado).

  • Estimación de 1/120,000 personas afectadas en todo el mundo.
  • Puede ocurrir entre la infancia y la edad adulta, pero normalmente en la infancia.
  • Enfermedad siempre fatal (la mayoría mueren entre las edades de 10-25 años).
  • Mutación Génica: NPC1 y/o NPC2 (Herencia Autosómica Recesiva).
    •

5. Osteogénesis Imperfecta (Enfermedad de los huesos frágiles) - Info

Anomalías en la producción de colágeno que dan lugar a deformidades esqueléticas y fragilidades óseas.

  • Aproximadamente 6-7/100,00 personas afectadas en todo el mundo.
  • Hombres y mujeres igualmente afectados.
  • Existencia de al menos 8 tipos de la enfermedad.
  • Tipos 1 y 4: Más habituales.
    • Severidad de leve a moderada, próximo a la esperanza de vida normal (con soporte).
  • Tipos 2 y 3: Más severos.
    • Tipo 2: Frecuentemente letal en o después del nacimiento.
    • Tipo 3: Inicio de fracturas en edad temprana, menor esperanza de vida.
  • Mutación Génica: COL1A1 y/o COL1A2 son las más comunes (en la mayor parte de casos es Herencia Autosómica Dominante).
    •

SOM Biotech SL (SOM) es un grupo biofarmacéutico establecido en 2009 en el Parque Científico de Barcelona (PCB). Nos dedicamos al descubrimiento y desarrollo de productos terapéuticos para enfermedades raras a través de la identificación de nuevos usos de productos terapéuticos existentes (reposicionamiento de fármacos).

Actualmente tenemos una cartera de programas en desarrollo que incluyen dos productos para enfermedades raras en estadios clínicos avanzados, para la Amiloidosis Hereditaria por Transtiretina y enfermedad de Huntington, ambos casos demostrando resultados muy positivos.

SOM Biotech también fue ganadora del premio Emprendedor XXI 2013, iniciativa impulsada por La Caixa Bank (uno de los bancos españoles más relevantes) en colaboración con el Ministerio de Industria, Energía y Turismo. Este prestigioso premio se entrega a empresas españolas de nueva creación con un alto potencial de crecimiento.

Como nueva iniciativa, SOM Biotech quiere centrarse en el descubrimiento de nuevas opciones terapéuticas para Enfermedades Raras Pediátricas. En concreto, nuestro objetivo es identificar y desarrollar una opción terapéutica para cada una de las 5 enfermedades raras pediátricas graves mencionadas.

SOM Biotech dispone de un sistema en propiedad de identificación de moléculas, capaz de identificar nuevas actividades para compuestos existentes que ya están en el mercado para otro uso. Tras el descubrimiento, los compuestos son validados experimentalmente y protegidos con patentes antes de llevar a cabo los ensayos clínicos de Fase II en pacientes. Las etapas posteriores de los proyectos se co-desarrollan con otras compañías farmacéuticas para así poder llegar al mercado lo antes posible.

El reposicionamiento de fármacos es un proceso de desarrollo de fármacos consistente en descubrir nuevas aplicaciones de productos terapéuticos existentes para otras enfermedades. El reposicionamiento utiliza la información de seguridad obtenida en desarrollos clínicos previos de los productos terapéuticos para su indicación original. En comparación con los nuevos medicamentos, en fármacos reposicionados, podemos evitar gran parte de los costes y tiempos asociados con dicho desarrollo clínico (por ejemplo, los ensayos clínicos de fase I).

Ha habido numerosos ejemplos de éxito en el campo del reposicionamiento de fármacos a lo largo de la historia de la industria farmacéutica. Claros ejemplos incluyen el Viagra, originalmente para la angina de pecho y reposicionado para la disfunción eréctil; y la Talidomida, originalmente desarrollado para las náuseas matutinas y posteriormente reposicionado para mielomas múltiples. Es importante tener en cuenta que también existe el riesgo de fracaso en proyectos de reposicionamiento de fármacos, tal como ocurre en cualquier proyecto de desarrollo clásico. Sin embargo, estos riesgos son significativamente menores.

  • El objetivo de la iniciativa es recaudar al menos 300.000 $ USD.
  • Los fondos se distribuirán uniformemente entre las 5 enfermedades raras pediátricas de estudio.
  • SOM se compromete a cubrir la totalidad de los costes desde el desarrollo de las etapas iniciales de descubrimiento hasta su comercialización.

  • Existe una financiación limitada para promover la investigación en los sectores de salud e investigación científica.
  • Mejorar el conocimiento científico y/o clínico de las diversas enfermedades raras pediátricas.
  • Posibilidad de descubrir nuevas opciones terapéuticas que pueden ser beneficiosas para el tratamiento de las enfermedades raras pediátricas seleccionadas.
  • Proporcionar esperanza a los niños afectados por estas enfermedades raras, para las que no existe cura hasta la fecha o los tratamientos disponibles son ineficaces.

Cualquier ayuda para hacer que esta iniciativa pueda llevarse a cabo, será bienvenida. También esperamos poder hacer una contribución médica significativa a través de nuestros descubrimientos. Por favor, ¡comparte esta campaña y difúndela entre tus amigos, familiares, compañeros y a todos los que conozcas! !Comparte el enlace de nuestra campaña (http://igg.me/at/fightrarediseases) con todo el mundo en Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin y otras redes socales!

Para más información, por favor visita el sitio web. de nuestra campaña
Para cualquier duda o sugerencia, no dudes en enviarnos un mensaje a la siguiente dirección: fightrd@sombiotech.com.
Además, también puedes seguir nuestra campaña en Facebook, y Twitter.

story_txt:
Drug discovery in 5 Pediatric Rare Diseases which could affect your kids:

 Cystic Fibrosis

 Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy

 Gaucher Disease

 Niemann Pick Disease Type C

 Osteogenesis Imperfecta




These diseases affect more than 1 million children worldwide.


Using already known medicines; fast, safe, cheap and de-risked development.


In addition to this campaign, SOM Biotech will push any positive result to the market.



 Versión en español



Rare diseases, also known as orphan diseases, are illnesses which affect a small portion of the world population (around 6-8%). According to the National Organization of Rare Diseases (NORD) there are around 7000 rare diseases known to exist worldwide, most of them without cures and significant treatments available. Research motivation into these diseases has been largely neglected due to small populations being afflicted, then continuing lack of knowledge and the potential low return on investments.




Pediatric rare diseases are one of the most complicated forms of rare diseases, with approximately 50% of rare diseases known to affect children worldwide. Moreover, many of the rare diseases treatments on the market are not applicable to pediatric populations. Some of the most continuing burdensome pediatric rare diseases include:
1. Cystic Fibrosis - Info
Abnormal production of thick fluids leading to obstructions and complications, of the respiratory and digestive systems.

Approximately rare diseas 70,000 - 100,000 people affected worldwide.
More than 95% of men are sterile.
Despite improvements, people have reduced life expectancies in comparison to the general population (˜35 years old).
 Gene Mutation: CFTR (Autosomal Recessive Inheritance).




2. Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy - Info
Progressive muscle degeneration and weakness resulting in: mobility, respiratory, and skeletal development problems.

Approximately 300,000 people affected worldwide.
Males primarily affected, rare in females.
Estimated 1/3500 male births affected worldwide.
Approximately 20,000 new cases/year.
Inmobility usually occurs by ˜ 12 years old.
Estimated life expectancy: 25 years old, >30 years old (rarer)
 Gene Mutation: Dystrophin (Autosomal Recessive Inheritance).





3. Gaucher Disease (3 types) - Info
Accumulation of fatty substances, including glucocerebrosides and glycosphingolipids, within cells leading to tissue and organ complications (such as enlargement of the spleen and liver).

Estimated 1/75,000 people affected worldwide.
3 types exist (types 2 and 3 - most severe):

Type 1: Most common, without nervous system affected.
Types 2 and 3: Nervous system affected (Type 2: death usually before 2 years old.

 Gene Mutation: GBA (Autosomal Recessive Inheritance).




4. Niemann Pick Disease Type C - Info
Another disease involving the accumulation of fatty substances, within cells, leading to tissue and organ complications (including: brain, spleen and liver).

Estimated 1/120,000 births affected worldwide.
Can occur between infancy and adulthood, but usually in childhood.
Disease is always fatal (majority die between the ages of 10 and 25 years old).
 Gene Mutation: NPC1 and/or NPC2 (Autosomal Recessive Inheritance).




5. Osteogenesis Imperfecta (Brittle Bones Disease) - Info
Abnormalities in collagen production, leading to skeletal deformities and bone fragilities.

Approximately 6 – 7/100,000 people affected worldwide.
Males and females equally affected.
At least 8 types of the disease exist.
Types 1 and 4: Most common

 Mild-moderate severity, near normal lifespan (with support).

Type 2 and 3: Most severe 

 Type 2: frequently lethal at or post-birth.
 Type 3: fractures begin in early in life, shortened lifespan.

 Gene Mutation: COL1A1 and/or COL1A2  are the most common (mostly cases of Autosomal Dominant Inheritance).








SOM Biotech SL (SOM) is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical group established at the Barcelona Science Park (PCB), Spain, in 2009. We are dedicated towards discovering and developing therapeutics for rare diseases by identifying new potential uses for existing therapeutics (drug repositioning).

We presently have several programs under discovery including two rare disease programs in advanced clinical stages for Transthyretin-related Hereditary Amyloidosis and Huntington's Disease, both demonstrating positively significant results.
SOM Biotech was also the winner of the 2013 EntrepreneurXXI award, presented by La Caixa Bank (one of Spain's largest banks) in conjunction with the Spanish Ministry of Industry, Energy and Tourism. This prestigious award was presented to Spanish start-up companies with the greatest growth potential.




As a new initiative, SOM Biotech is now turning its attention towards discovering new therapeutic options for pediatric rare diseases. Specifically, we aim to tackle the 5 burdensome pediatric rare diseases mentioned.




SOM Biotech possesses a proprietary know-how discovery process, capable of identifying new activities for existing compounds which are already on the market for another use. Upon discovery, the compounds are validated experimentally and patent-protected before proceeding directly to Phase II clinical trials in patients. Later stages of the projects would be co-developed with other pharmaceutical companies to reach the market.









Drug repositioning (or repurposing) is a drug development process of discovering new applications for existing therapeutics towards other diseases. It builds upon previous clinical developments of the therapeutics' safety and for its original indication. In comparison to new drugs, repurposed drugs may bypass much of the early costs and time associated with clinical development (such as Phase I clinical trials).




There have been numerous counts of successes of drug repurposing throughout history in the pharmaceutical industry. Examples of repurposed drugs include Viagra, originally for Angina, for Erectile Dysfunction and Thalidomide, originally for Morning Sickness, for Multiple Myelomas. It is important to note the risks of drug repositioning projects failing are still as with any drug development projects, However, they are significantly lower in comparison to traditional drug development.










 Target Funding Goal of the campaign: at least 300,000 USD$.

 Funds will be distributed evenly among the 5 Pediatric Rare Diseases.

 SOM will take responsibility to cover the entire developmental costs from the initial discovery stages to the market of any promising drug.








 Limited funding has been provided to promote the health and scientific R&D sectors.

 Improve scientific and/or clinical knowledge of the various pediatric rare diseases..

 Possibility of discovering new therapeutic options which may be beneficial in dealing with the selected pediatric rare diseases.

 Provide hope to the children afflicted from the various rare diseases, of which no cures exist to this date or ineffective treatments are available.







We welcome any help in making this opportunity happen, and hope to make a significant medical contributions through our discoveries. Please share this campaign and bring awareness to your friends, family, colleagues and everyone you know! 
Share our campaign link (http://igg.me/at/fightrarediseases) with everyone on Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin and other social media platforms!






For more information, please visit our campaign website.Feel free to send us a message at the following address: fightrd@sombiotech.com.In addition, please follow our campaign on Facebook, and Twitter.    






We acknowledge the following worldwide organizations for bringing awareness to these burdensome diseases among others:

Biomedical Research Network of Rare Diseases (CIBERER) - Webpage

Chinese Organization for Rare Disorders - Webpage

US Coalition Duchenne - Webpage

European Gaucher Alliance - Webpage

Spanish Federation of Neuromuscular Diseases - Webpage

FEETEG Foundation - Webpage

Spanish Foundation of Niemann Pick disease - Webpage

Genetic Alliance UK - Webpage

Gauchers Association (UK) - Webpage

Spanish Foundation of Osteogenesis Imperfecta (AHUCE) - 

Niemann Pick UK - Webpage




THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!!
