story:
We-Speek -- The Hottest New Language Learning and Social Media Platform!

Donate to help our website expand into new ventures and territories!

Our Story:

Hello, and thank you for taking the time to read about our crowdfund campaign! My name is  Artur Almakaev, and along with my co-founder Dima Hudyakov, we have created a brand new social networking platform that not only connects you with the world, but helps you communicate within it! We are very excited to share our project with you, and we hope that you take a moment to participate with us!

We-Speek (http://we-speek.com) is a new, free social networking platform that connects you with fun, interesting people all over the world, with the purpose of exchanging and learning new languages! Communicate with others speaking your native language, or use your connections with native speakers across the globe to spruce up your own language learning!


Ours is the first and only educational social network that provides multiple methods of communication, all dedicated to the purpose of learning multiple foreign languages in a fun, engaging, yet supportive environment. Using features such as instant messaging, voice and video chat, and more, we help you build the essential reading, writing, and oral skills necessary to fully learn and communicate within a new language! Make friends around the world, and add to your language skills at the same time!

We-Speek is absolutely FREE for our members to use, with optional paid services that enhance and compliment the experience of our language learners. The beta version of our website has been up and running for a few months now, and we have received incredibly positive reports from our users! They appreciate the ability to communicate with others all over the world, share their cultures and values, and acquire a new language all at the same time, for FREE!


Based originally out of Italy, we are ready to expand our social networking platform into new avenues, and we understand the value of developing our website within the United States! We know that, once we are able to move into new territory, our business will sky-rocket! But in order to do that, we need your much-appreciated support and donations to make this happen!

Impact:

In today’s global economy, having more than one fluent language under your belt isn’t just a nice add-on to your resume. Second language acquisition can make or break your chance to get a foothold in many job industries. Every day, millions of consumers search the internet for sites and services that allow them to practice language skills from the comfort of their own homes. For many, learning a new language can be a daunting task, not to mention an expensive one! Most of us can’t afford to run off to a foreign country for months at a time, immersing ourselves in the language in order to become fluent in a new language. And yet, the best way to learn a new language is to converse, live, with someone who is already a native or fluent speaker.  How can you do that with today’s hectic work and life schedules?

The way we communicate as people has changed as we become more and more dependent on the internet, but that need to communicate with someone in real-time to learn language skills hasn’t changed. We created We-Speek to help people all over the world learn a new language, all with from the comforts of home. Our vision is to provide both an educational and comfortable environment where people can learn practical conversation skills, exchange ideas and make friends in the process.


We-Speek offers a whole new way for students to build vocabulary, practice grammar and conversation skills, and become fluent speakers of any language they choose. Our social networking platform fills that void between online language instruction courses and basic foreign language learning message boards, while giving users the opportunity to communicate in multiple ways with other people across the globe!

Our Competitors Can’t Match It!

No other language learning platform can match what we offer at We-Speek. Of course, there are other, widely known language learning websites, but none allow for user-to-user conversation and interaction! But we stand out for more reasons than just that. We have a more diverse range of both free and paid services, and our interface is simple, easy to use, yet attractive and interesting for our users!

A Bit About Our Founder:

Artur has extensive experience in a variety of industries, and has a degree in business studies and foreign commercial correspondence. Knowing four languages, including Russian, Italian, German, Spanish, as well as English, Artur knows first-hand the importance of being able to communicate in other languages.

What We Need:

With our funding goal of $35,000, we will be able to firmly establish our company in the US, develop full mobile apps that compliment our already-live website, develop additional cost-free features for our members, and expand the boundaries of our growing social networking platform and mobile apps through advertising and marketing!


What You Get:

We don’t want you to walk away empty-handed! By donating to our campaign, you are becoming an active contributor and investor in a game-changing business! In order to thank you for your generous donations, we are offering a series of exciting rewards, based on your donation amount! Donate a little, or a lot, and we’ll make sure you get a little something back as well!

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can’t make a donation at this time, don’t despair! There are still a few ways that you can help support our campaign and get our project funded in time! Please take a few moments to share our campaign information with your friends and family, via social media, email, and through word of mouth! Let everyone you know about this unique language learning networking platform and help become a part of a revolution in how language learning and social networking is done!


Thank you in advance for your support and generous donations!

story:
As a healthy wanderlust my ideas about home have scarcely been conventional. The day I stopped worrying that was bad was the same I finally say it out loud:

I want to build my own house.

“...come with a dream, leave with plan.” -Lara, Earthship Academy

... were the words to eliminate doubt that the vision was just too big.


The DREAM

Naturally, there are a handful of scattered roadblocks and question marks emerge about the reality of this image.

  1. I don’t know how to build a house.
  2. I don’t have money to build a house.
  3. Even if I did, how would possessing either of those resources actually perpetuate my ultimate goal for creation of a connected and meaningful life
Then the existence of alternate, more integrative ways of living on this green earth began to jump out of the wood-work and I discovered the Earthship.

What is an EARTHSHIP and why take the Academy?

Earthships are radically self-sustainable buildings constructed primarily with waste material. They can be homes, schools, greenhouses -- anything -- and exist all over the world after 40 years of effort by creator Michael Reynolds and the ever growing community of collaborators. Building one requires more time, ingenuity and man-power than money, as with a conventional home.

Studying with the Earthship Academy (the knowledge-spreading branch of the concept) entails classroom learning and hands-on practice builds either in the home base of Taos, New Mexico or on a global project like the school I’ll help build in Uruguay this February 2016. Certification equips you with the preliminary knowledge to orchestrate your own project and opens doors to participate in Earthship builds around the world, both intentions of mine. 

I am a firm believer of resource sharing and the importance of spreading knowledge that benefits the global community, whether we’re invested in the image or not.

My vision is to be a resource for others who wish to do the same.

                    


What is a “RESOURCE”?

Knowledge. Experience. Networking and connections, a voice that’s heard. An extra set of hands. Piles of used tires, bottles, “waste”. My time and yours. 

And yes, sometimes, also money.

I believe money has been mistakenly honoured as our greatest resource. I am recalibrating what value means to me and how I can make valuable exchanges to serve many.

RESOURCES I NEED

I have confirmed a spot in the Earthship Global Academy Session in Jaureguiberry, Uruguay in February 2016. To make this happen I will require:

  • Tools for the build: Can you donate any of these items?  (4+ pairs heavy duty rubber work gloves, metal snips, linesman's pliers, 10"/12"/14" pool trowel, cement hawk)

  • Camping gear as alternate lodging: Have an unwanted tent, sleeping mat or hammock to donate or lend? 

  • A plane ticket to South America: Can you donate points? An airline “buddy pass” or access to one? Know alternate means of transport?  (***Mission complete! The points for my confirmed return flights to South America are currency as an exchange for my trip planning experience with a co-worker.)                                      

  • Funds

  1. Living expenses abroad: $500 US - Have a friend and billet in Uruguay? Know a local farmer/food producer?
  2. Tuition: $2500 US - Tips on grants?  Labour exchange for donations? 


My gifts to YOU

I am interested in sharing my skills, time and knowledge with you as an exchange for your support.

Faithful to open dialogue, the “perks” are available to anyone regardless of donation. ($1 is the minimum allowance on IndieGoGo.) The perks unite participants and generate a network of ideas awaiting realization. Please share these gifts with those interested in joining the conversation and taking action.

If you are inspired to contribute a wish-list item or monetary donation, please consider accepting an additional perk. I will open dialogue on how I can support your current needs and  manifestations and interactions will be on a sliding scale based on the donation

How can I be of service to you?

Need help instigating a project? Or finishing one half built? Yard work,  reiki, Spanish lessons, moving or studying?  

Take a walk with me and discover the power of an ear that’s listening.  

~

Thank you taking time to consider my offer and engaging in the image of something different. I hope you’ll visit, the door to Casa la Risa is always open.

Much love,

Laryssa

story:
Disrupt poverty with magazines and comics.

Literacy ends poverty. Most children and families in poverty have zero books at home or school. This is true across America and in every village in every nation on Earth. You have the solution in your hands right now to fix this. With titles for every reading age, interest, and language, favorite magazines and comics are the most powerful literacy engines on the planet. Everything begins with reading.

We need your financial donation now to fund MagazineLiteracy.org operations - we are a 501(c)(3) charitable organization - the first and only global, industry-wide literacy mission. We need every person and every company to believe in our campaign to end illiteracy and poverty. Donate now to make it so.

iMAGine literacy and make it so.

iMAGine what magazines and comics can do to end poverty. Literacy is the most powerful force for prosperity, freedom, peace, and civility. A child unable to read is a child lost. Adults unable to read were once children who didn't learn how. Reading is where it all begins. Reading materials at home significantly contribute to academic achievement and readiness for life.

MagazineLiteracy.org - the first-ever, global, industry-wide literacy campaign - resonates passionately with everyone who loves magazines and comics. Your financial support enables us to run our project and to conduct the outreach and logistics that get favorite magazines and comics into the hands, homes, and hearts of tens of millions of at-risk children, teens, and adults who are eager to learn and love to read.

When we join together to iMAGine the change we can make in the world, we make it so - this is our moonshot, and we need you and everyone who loves to write, edit, publish, and deliver magazines and comics to believe in our mission and to be onboard with a financial investment.

Why your personal support for our literacy operations is so meaningful:

According to Reading is Fundamental (RIF), two-thirds of America’s children living in poverty - 12 million+ kids - have no books at home - zero. Studies show that children in poverty hear 30 million fewer words as infants when their brains are developing for life. Your financial support means we can change that today.

Each night, 35,000+ women - many moms with children leave everything they know behind to seek the safety of a domestic abuse shelter. Your financial support enables us to comfort them tonight with the magazines and comics you love. 

Across America, hidden in every community are over 1 million homeless students. You know the power of reading magazines and comics - what it has meant to you. Your financial support today enables us to give homeless students the gift of favorite magazines and comics to inspire hope for tomorrow.

MagazineLiteracy.org provides new and recycled magazines and comics to at-risk readers via mentoring and job training programs, shelters and food pantries, and foster care. We have set a goal to provide every mom and child in every domestic abuse shelter with a magazine to comfort them. We inspire enthusiasts to share the magazines and comics they love with children in sports and other mentoring programs, creating a bond between mentors and readers around common interests. We are setting up newsstands in food pantries to feed children and families hungry to read, and supply culinary magazines to unemployed and homeless people learning new skills in chef and food service job training programs.

Be a superhero. Power-up our operations.

We need you and every single person who loves magazines and comics to believe in MagazineLiteracy.org and to make a personal financial commitment to fund our operations today. MagazineLiteracy.org is the only project of its kind in the world. We must raise funds for two things - programs and operations:

  1. 100% of community donations are used to send new and recycled magazines to at-risk readers via literacy programs - these are our program expenses.
  2. This industry campaign that you are supporting today specifically finances the outreach, operations, and logistics that are the foundation of our distribution to literacy programs - recruiting literacy agencies; mobilizing and supporting a massive network of volunteers in communities across the U.S. and worldwide - our ambassadors and change agents; and maintaining the technology that matches literacy wishlists to magazines and comics.

Every dollar counts. We need your support to achieve our goal of 100% industry participation.

A juggernaut is a force, campaign, or movement that is extremely large and powerful and cannot be stopped - with your support right now, we can be all these things and more. iMAGine the possibilities and make them so with your donation.

Multiply your impact, by sharing this campaign and asking your friends and colleagues to support our mission too.

Here's why magazines and comics are the most powerful literacy engines on the planet:

There are magazines and comics for every reading level, interest, and language.

Magazines and comics educate, inspire, and entertain.

Magazines and comics hold our attention, igniting iMAGination.

Magazines and comics give regular, timely, and timeless information.

Magazines and comics foster ownership and build self-esteem.

Magazines and comics connect readers and mentors around common interests.

Magazines and comics are familiar and not intimidating.

Magazines and comics are engagingly beautiful.

Magazines and comics are inspirational and aspirational.

People of all ages love to read and share magazines and comics.

How we put magazines and comics into the hands, homes, and hearts of at-risk readers:

Community donations are used to buy bulk copies and subscriptions for at-risk readers at mentoring and job training programs, shelters and food pantries, foster care, and other community literacy programs.  100% of these community program funds get magazines and comics into the hands and homes of at-risk readers. Generous financial commitments range from $25 - $10,000+ to support literacy needs with new and recycled magazines and comics.

Consumers buy gift subscriptions for at-risk readers in literacy programs - fueled by circulation promotions.

Consumers, students, businesses, and publishers recycle their magazines from home, work, school, and back issues from throughout the supply chain for literacy.

Consumers buy newsstand magazines collected for literacy at the point of sale.

We need your support to reach tens of millions of eager readers coast to coast and worldwide.

We are already sending new and recycled magazines to hundreds of thousands of readers, but millions more are waiting, We've opened a global literacy operations center in Trenton, New Jersey and global literacy outreach center in Madison, Wisconsin to mobilize tens of thousands of volunteers to support hundreds of thousands of literacy programs to reach tens of millions of readers, worldwide. With access to tens of millions of magazines and comics ready for eager readers, we are at the center of the largest literacy opportunity in the world. 

These success stories illustrate the power of engaging people who love magazines to support literacy:

Employees at a software company donated $11,000 to send Highlights magazines to 90 Ohio elementary school children for three years.

A sales training company in Ohio sent Spider magazine to two classrooms.

Prince Sports sent Tennis and Smash magazines to 200 kids in a Boston tennis mentoring program.

A Subway Sandwich Shop owner sent Time for Kids to 60 children in a Harlem after-school program. WoodenBoat and Fine Woodworking magazines were sent to a boatbuilding youth mentoring program in the Bronx.

Employees at an Indiana company donated $12,000 over three years to send children’s magazines to 800 elementary school children in an after-school mentoring program operated on 20 college campuses.

A team of Canadian companies, families, and schools airlifted 2,000+ magazines to Inuit children and families north of the Arctic Circle. Lacrosse magazines were sent to a team forming in Croatia. Thousands of magazines have been requested by schools from Detroit to Sri Lanka.

A large publisher shipped 40,000 children’s magazines to all the Head Start programs in Mississippi after Katrina. We delivered 150,000 children's magazines to a large food bank serving over 900,000 people in areas hardest hit by superstorm Sandy.

Highlights conducted a social media campaign and supplied 52,000 publications for literacy. Cobblestone/Cricket  supplied 10,000 children’s magazines for eager readers. Conde Nast, Time Inc., Hearst, Meredith, National Geographic and others have sent millions of magazines to our global operations center where they are flowing to meet literacy needs.

Quad/Graphics has been instrumental moving truckloads of magazines through our supply chain. Sappi Paper, Quint & Quint, Ryleco, the Greg Barber Company, the Majeski Foundation, Comag, PSCS Consulting, and others have supplied mission critical support. We are blessed having the MPA, PBAA, FIPP, Folio:, Linda Ruth, and Mr. Magazine - Samir Husni telling our amazing stories to the world.

Our first magazine recycling project was organized by a kindergarten class in San Francisco for children in a nearby homeless shelter. We are setting up newsstands in food pantries to feed children and families hungry to read. We  have set a goal to send a new gift magazine to every mom and child in every domestic abuse shelter.

We are recruiting thousands of volunteers to serve as literacy ambassadors across the U.S., Canada, South America, Europe, Asia, Africa and the South Seas.

A NJ Boy Scout earned his Eagle rank organizing our first supermarket magazine drive, and Girl Scouts organize Silver Award literacy projects. An Indiana 11-year-old collected and shipped us 200 pounds of magazines for literacy. A High School team collected 2,000 magazines for literacy programs. Magazine drives have been organized at New York University, Arizona State, the University of Wisconsin, Cornell University, Rowan University, UCLA and many more college campuses.

Operations funders like you are our angels.

We need your financial investment to underwrite the operations, technology, outreach, and logistics that form the foundation of our massive literacy mission.

By funding operations only with dollars from angels like you, we cankeep our promise forever that 100% of community donations deliver magazines and comics to literacy agencies for at-risk readers.

"Our passion is to build an enormous literacy pipeline and to challenge the citizens of the world to fill it with the wonderful magazines we love - to share them with new readers. With your support, we can put favorite magazines into the hands, homes, and hearts of millions of readers."

-- John Mennell, Founder 

Our impact:

Homeless Women's Shelter

"We LOVE this program. We have found so many ways to share these wonderful magazines... Women are able to relax before class with a magazine... We have shared the magazines with all of the families that come here... We've never had magazines to give away in the past, so we are excited about that. I've used the magazines in a group called "Women Leading Through Reading" - a small group of women who get together every week to read about issues important to them. We use books too, but the magazines are nice because they also have pictures! Like I've said before, magazines are so attractive and less threatening than books, so readers at all levels will pick one up."

Boys and Girls Club

"The magazines have enriched our Education Center, our Reading Buddies program and recreational time for our members. We are so appreciative to have these magazines, and the ownership the kids can take really encourages them to read more."

Homeless Family Shelter

"The first day Anthony received his magazine he said, 'Wow!' 'Cool!' He began to start reading as soon as he picked the magazine. I was so surprised to see him reading, because he always told me how much he hates to read. About two days later, Anthony told me how he would read his magazine at school during quiet time, and he would let his friends read the magazines also. Anthony reads to his 3 year old sister more often, and now he is comfortable reading out loud."

Domestic Violence Shelter

"We serve 35 to 50 children each day. Our children are almost always behind grade and culturally deprived. Therefore, we emphasize reading and learning experiences with them and their mothers... we are interested in securing magazines that we can use here and want to give each child, when he or she leaves, an age appropriate magazine subscription."

Youth Mentoring Program

“The Magazine Literacy Program has been an amazing asset to our programming for at-risk youth. Children are able to enjoy the magazine with their mentor and share it with other siblings at home. Magazine Literacy is an example of a wonderful community partnership.”

Sports Mentoring Program

"We strive to build resiliency in our kids through a winning combination of literacy and tennis instruction. Our experience working with at-risk youth over the past eight years has demonstrated that literacy is key to improving our students' academic performance and to building their self-esteem. Having their very own subscriptions to magazines not only provides a new opportunity for reading fun but also offers new insights into the game of tennis, a sport that teaches our students important life skills and one they can play throughout their lives."

Early Education Program

"The children loved the opportunity to receive the magazines. We hope that this program continues, so that the children in our program can access new ways to enjoy reading."

Magazine Harvest Volunteer

"I am met with beaming smiles from the children and words of gratitude from the mothers on every delivery. A program director commented that 'magazines are engaging, not intimidating, and the women love having the resource.' The shelters have used the magazines to teach families about health and nutrition, finances, parenting, and positive images in the media. I met a young woman and her baby boy in a shelter. She told me she and her son were moving into a new apartment, so she was thrilled with the home/style magazines and was grateful for the parenting magazines too. All of the shelters have said the magazines provide an immense source of stress relief for their residents."

Small Business Owner

"It still amazes me how many adults can't read or write, and even more amazing is that the numbers continue to grow. Something must be done to reverse this alarming trend. I believe that the Magazine Publishers Family Literacy Project, tailored locally by teachers and administrators to enhance school reading programs, can do just that. The magazines provided through this program will instill motivation to those who may not have it, and help children learn reading skills in an exciting, colorful and relevant environment. Given that solid reading abilities open up so many opportunities, this grassroots initiative can truly have global impact. It is an honor to be associated with a program that can have such a clear-cut, positive influence on today's children and tomorrow's leaders."

Third Grade Teacher

"Children's magazines enhance our reading program by providing our students with high interest, motivating reading material, exposing them to another reading resource that includes a mixture of fiction and non-fiction. When motivated, these students have a greater incentive to learn and practice good reading strategies. The magazines provide this motivation. Our students are able to take these high interest magazines home to read and enjoy thereby increasing their reading skills. They also share them with their families, which produces additional benefit."

Your financial support matters - thank you.

Thank you for iMAGining the change you want to see in the world, and joining with us to make it so with your financial contribution. Tell the world!

story:
Who am I?  My name is Camryn McComas, I am a junior at Mount Spokane High School and I have lived in Spokane, Washington for the last thirteen years.  Throughout my life, I have been interested in music, and specifically singing, reading, studying Biology, and recently, I have taken a great interest in humanitarian work.

 A few months ago, a woman who I know through my church shared her experience with me of traveling to Haiti to help young mothers. Listening to her experiences really sparked my interest for making humanitarian work a part of my life. I started looking for a way I could have a similar experience, and I found  "Humanitarian Experience for Youth," and I decided to jump aboard.

Humanitarian Experience for Youth offers trips to fifteen different destinations that are in need of humanitarian work. I was drawn to Cuenca, Ecuador because I will have the unique opportunity to interact with and care for orphaned children who have special needs.


Who will I get to serve? In Ecuador, I, along with a handful of other youth, will be working in the  colonial city of Cuenca. There are many disadvantaged children who have disabilities in Cuenca and other surrounding towns. Many of them were orphaned from a young age, but very few organizations are available to serve these children. I am excited to spend time with and get to know these children.

What will I do? For this project, we will be building new housing facilities at an orphanage that primarily serves severely disabled and disadvantaged children. This will allow the orphanage volunteers to be available to the children and will provide increased support for children in need. I will have the unique opportunity to see the children each day at the work site and volunteer in the orphanage twice a week. During the week days, we will be serving the locals, and on the weekends, I will have the chance to explore some of the scenery of Ecuador.

Why is this important to me? Because my family has adopted three children from China (two of whom have special needs) I have a special place in my heart for children with special needs.  I believe that in order for children to progress, they need love, and I am excited that I have the opportunity to spend time with the children in Ecuador and give them that chance to feel loved. Interacting with them and learning about their stories is what I most look forward to during this trip.

Where will your donation go? 
THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR DONATION!

  • $2475-international airfare from Los Angeles, food, lodging, activities for the duration of the trip, as well as materials and labor for the humanitarian project 
    paid to "Humanitarian Experience for Youth" learn more at hefy.org
  • $325- (estimated) roundtrip airfare from Spokane, WA to Los Angeles and back paid to the airlines with the best price at the time

The Impact

As I go and serve these children in Ecuador, I hope to make a difference in their lives. I will continue to travel, serve others, and experience cultures and people all across the world after this humanitarian trip. This trip to Ecuador will be the beginning of this chapter in my life, and I hope by the end of my life to have left a mark on the world. I hope to leave it, having served and loved, and cared for as many people as I can, so that they can know of the good out there. I know that if my siblings had not been adopted, they would be in similar circumstances to those children that I am going to serve, and I want those children to know that they are not alone.

Risks & Challenges

$2,800 is a lot of money to raise between now and July. However, I have a passion for this project and will do whatever it takes to go to Ecuador and serve.

Along with this fundraiser, I will be earning money through teaching ukulele and voice lessons, working, and babysitting.

I will also be putting on bake sales and fundraising recitals. I am going to do whatever it takes to get myself to Ecuador.

(If you are interested in babysitting, ukulele or voice lessons for your child, let me know:))

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing my campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, etc. (use Indegogo's sharing tools!)  is just as helpful as donating. Help me get the word out, so that I can go serve the children of Ecuador! Thank you all so much for your help.

:) 

Camryn

    The Impact As I go and serve these children in Ecuador, I hope to make a difference in their lives. I will continue to travel, serve others, and experience cultures and people all across the world after this humanitarian trip. This trip to Ecuador will be the beginning of this chapter in my life, and I hope by the end of my life to have left a mark on the world. I hope to leave it, having served and loved, and cared for as many people as I can, so that they can know of the good out there. I know that if my siblings had not been adopted, they would be in similar circumstances to those children that I am going to serve, and I want those children to know that they are not alone.
    Risks & Challenges $2,800 is a lot of money to raise between now and July. However, I have a passion for this project and will do whatever it takes to go to Ecuador and serve.

Along with this fundraiser, I will be earning money through teaching ukulele and voice lessons, working, and babysitting.
I will also be putting on bake sales and fundraising recitals. I am going to do whatever it takes to get myself to Ecuador.
(If you are interested in babysitting, ukulele or voice lessons for your child, let me know:))
    Other Ways You Can Help Sharing my campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, etc. (use Indegogo's sharing tools!)  is just as helpful as donating. Help me get the word out, so that I can go serve the children of Ecuador! Thank you all so much for your help.
:) 
Camryn

story:
Our Story

It was always important to my mother that her children be surrounded by positive representation of Blackness. From dolls to Christmas ornaments to art. I thought she was nuts...then I became a mother and I realized what she had done for me and why representation was so important. Black greatness was normalized for me so growing up instead of me wondering if I was capable of achieving something, the question was more, why wouldn't I be capable. Through normalizing greatness, my mother instilled a confidence in me that the world couldn't break. It wasn't until I was an adult that I realized how special my experience was. It is now my mission to do that for other children. 

  • Brown Toy Box launched in 2016 as a subscription box curating culturally affirming products for Black children. In 2018 we realized we need to be more focused, we weren't addressing a bigger issue. While it is still very important that our boxes are culturally affirming and builds confidence, we needed the boxes to be more purposeful.  We took a hard look at the tech industry, science, and all other areas of STEAM and recognized there was a major gap in what the diversity of America looks like compared to the diversity in these industries. We asked ourselves how can we instill  confidence, curiosity, and capabilities to engage in learning about STEAM. We are determined to make STEAM accessible, representative and fun. 

We relaunched the box to meet three goals:

  • To ensure Black children saw people that look like them positively represented in the STEAM driving the US economy and that will be the high paying jobs of the future.
  • To use fun and play to expose them early and often to activities and experiments that instills confidence in the abilities and a curiosity to learn and do more.
  • Encourage parental participation. Not enough can be said about the important role parental involvement plays in the success of young students. We want the box experience to be one that takes the intimidation of of STEAM making it more accessible. Ultimately activating parents as advocates of STEAM immersion for their children throughout their academic careers.

We have always known that some of the best and brightest young scholars who would benefit from our boxes the most, would come from families that could afford them the least, which is why in addition to our existing monthly direct to consumer subscription box, we continue to pilot programs and partnerships in Title 1 schools.


We know the need is national, actually global, but Atlanta is our backyard and we wanted to partner to support a nonprofit right here at home in celebration of back to school. 

How Does It Work

Give a Box or Get a Box. As a backer you can decide if you contribute your box to HEY! or you can opt to keep your boxes and give them to children in your village. 

 

What We Need & What You GetSave Campaign


We plan to deliver a minimum of 100 Brown Toy Box enrichment Boxes to HEY! this fall. In order to make this happen we need people who share our vision and support our mission to support this effort.

  • Each box cost $50.00
  • In every box a child receives a book on a Black STEAM trailblazer, an experiment or activity and a toy of other fun item, all supporting the same theme.
  • Every Box will go to a child supported through HEY!
  • In the event we don't reach our full goal, we will deliver as many boxes as the funding we raise allows.

Every Box represents more than toys and games, it represents an opportunity for us to equip each child to confidently dream, plan, and work towards becoming a future innovator, artist, and leader. 

Why HEY!?

HEY! is one of the premier youth leadership development organizations in the Metro Atlanta area and is working hard to ensure that young people are equipped in leading themselves. HEY! challenges youth to stake claim, prepare, and take action ensuring a positive, successful, and impactful future. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

So you can't contribute financially, we understand but here are some other ways you can be a gamechanger:

  • Help spread the word about the missions of Brown Toy Box and HEY! 
  • Share our campaign link with your network.
  • Follow us on Instagram @browntoybox Facebook @browntoybox Twitter @browntoybox

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who is Sociopreneur Indonesia?

We are Social Entrepreneurship Weaver in Indonesia. We research, develop, and connect with all of the stakeholders to create a better social entrepreneurship in Indonesia. We are not only thinking about our current social entrepreneurship waves, but we do take serious development in our future generation to become an "Agent of Change".

We promote collaborative-action since 2013 in order to create responsible ecosystem to nurture the growth of leaders with entrepreneurial mindset in business, government, academia, and socio-cultural.

However,

"The responsible ecosystem cannot be created without creating empathy first. Empathy will change one's perception to tackle various problems around him, it encourages him to involve and be a part of solution. We believe if he practices it regularly, he will create positive impacts to others. Thus, if a pool of like-minded people who share the same thought and taking actions collectively, they will change the world. That is raison d'etre of Empathy Project."

(Sociopreneur Indonesia)

So, what will be in Empathy Project 2018?

This year, Empathy Project 2018 will deliver four programs, as below:

Anak Hebat Anak Indonesia (AHAI)

AHAI was designed for primary school students by stimulating them to think creatively and imaginatively, to solve problems, to work in a team, and to improve their communication skills. AHAI is an intensive experiential learning program that uplifts students' skills through a series of creative games.

          

 

Be A Creative Innovator (BCreator)

BCreator is a-one day workshop for youth that adopting discovery learning and experiential learning through a series of fun activities in order to stimulate creativity skill of the participant.

          

 

Bootcamp for Young Technopreneur (BYTe)

Bootcamp for Young Technopreneur (BYTe) is a three-day bootcamp in a local industry that applies an intensive experiential learning program to improve each individual skills in solving problems, making a decision, and especially identifying opportunities, generating and developing innovative ideas to become a business.

          

 

Micro Library

On Empathy Project 2018, we will build four micro-libraries in Sembulang Village, Batam in order to provide access to literacy in the village.

          

          

 

How to support Empathy Project 2018?

          

 

Empathy Project 2018 - provides ways to anyone around the world to involve in the Project. We need you to make this happen by supporting through:

1. #EmpathyAction Campaign

Write a story about simple good deeds you've ever done to help others, take a picture related to your story then share it on your social media using hashtag #EmpathyAction, #EmpathyProject2018, and #Act4SDGs, don't forget to tag us and five of your friends to do the same.

2. Support our crowdfunding campaign

Empathy Project 2018 needs to raise $8000. This amount has been reduced from $10000 at beginning of this campaign (please read our UPDATE). These funds will be allocated to support a series of programs in Empathy Project 2018. These programs aim to reach:
1. 100 primary school children for AHAI program,
2. 100 youth for BCreator program, 
3. 30 scholarships for supporting future young technopreneurs to attend BYTe,
4. Build 4 micro-libraries to provide access to literacy in the village.

We are working so hard to meet our goal, but we really can’t do it without you. We are hoping that you would make a contribution and share our stories to as many people as you can to help us accomplish the goal.

 

UPDATE

Support from the Largest Publishing in Indonesia!

We would like to share our excitement as we've received support from the largest publishing company in Indonesia, Elexmedia Komputindo. They support our plan to build four micro libraries by providing hundreds of books for children and youth.

This support has helped us to reduce amount of funds need for the Empathy Project 2018. Now we only need to raise $8000.

Thank you for your endless support!

story:
“I’m sorry, mijita, I’m sorry, my child, but I’ve used up all the ruda I had and none of the neighbors grow it.” 
Prietita and the Ghost Woman / Prietita y la llorona
  by Gloria E. Anzaldua and Maya Christina Gonzalez
 


Photo credit: Carolina Adame Photography

Semillas de las Abuelas is birthed from our beliefs that we, as mothers, are healers that are healing as well as nurturers that need nurturing!  We are teachers that are learning!  Whatever mothering you do, we want you to feel loved and appreciated!


Photo credit: Carolina Adame Photography
 
Our Inspiration

Our children play together, they learn how to interact, they learn social skills, they learn conflict resolution, and they learn emotional literacy through play. We, as their mothers, look on partially monitoring any possible dangerous situations that may come up or any moments that might require our intervention. We also look on in the hopes that all the work we have done in our lives, in our spiritual, cultural, and social justice journeys will have an impact on their lives as well. We hope to impart all the lessons we have learned along the way with them, so that they might be grounded in the things we as children found ourselves desperately looking for. We hope they have a nuanced understanding of their ancestral culture, of complex and deep spirituality, of the structural inequality that impact their ability to move in the world. We also hope that like us they feel the call toward social justice work, recognizing that we can contribute to change in even the smallest of ways and in everything we do.

As educators, academics, mothers, Latinas, socially aware and radicalized human beings we situate this work in a critique of this country’s traditional schooling system as entrenched in systems of power meant to perpetuate a patriarchal, white supremacist, capitalist ideology; meant to marginalize and oppress people who are not white, cisgender, men, thin and able bodied. We recognize the long history of colonization in our country that perpetuated violence, slavery, and genocide on our ancestors, and our cultural histories. Yet, we have hope that we can offer our children the possibilities for a different world, the space to imagine true liberation and freedom. 

Photo credit: Carolina Adame Photography
 

Celebrating Our Culture

Our book celebrates the traditions, customs and stories of our ancestors, who are mostly of Mexican and/or American indigenous ancestry. We acknowledge the ways in which colonization and white supremacy sought to erase or otherwise suppress our ancestral ways of living and knowing. Thus, this book is born out of a desperate need to intentionally reclaim and celebrate our culture. In a world so often centered in the white Anglo-American experience this book works to resist those oppressive representations. We do this by highlighting the beauty and importance of the wisdom of our ancestors as a way to resist erasure, oppression and ultimately set us on a path of liberation. We must tell our stories, write them down, ensure their place in history, and secure them for the future generations.


Photo credit: Carolina Adame Photography
 

Who is This Book For?

Though we recognize the historical, geographical, sociopolitical, and cultural differences among the peoples from the different countries of the Americas marked by Spanish colonization, we also recognize the similarities in our traditions and customs, with other Latinx or indigenous ancestries. Thus, our book is meant to serve as a template for those looking to bring earth based rhythms into your families from a cultural perspective. We also acknowledge those families who might have been disconnected from their culture for one reason or another, and we hope this book can help to reconnect you with your roots so that you might be able to pass them on to your children.


Photo credit: Carolina Adame Photography
 

About the Book

Semillas de las Abuelas is a foundational resource book filled with songs, rhymes, recipes, stories and ideas for rituals and rhythms passed down to us by our Abuelas and other ancestors. This book is for new parents and for those already grounded in family life with a desire to integrate these practices and traditions into your own homes to create connections to the earth, to our families and to our culture. This book aims to inspire creative growth and deepen our intentions!

Semillas de las Abuelas consists of seven chapters that take you through the arc of the day and the seasons of the year.

  • Introduction: Teaching to Reclaim Our Rhythms: Resist, Liberate and Celebrate 
  • Chapter 1: UNDERSTANDING RHYTHM 
  • Chapter 2: DAILY & WEEKLY RHYTHM IDEAS
  • Chapter 3: SPRING RHYTHMS
  • Chapter 4: SUMMER RHYTHMS
  • Chapter 5: FALL RHYTHMS
  • Chapter 6: WINTER RHYTHMS
  • Chapter 7: LIFE RHYTHMS 
  • Epilogue: Reflection not Perfection

Included in this book:
- The photography of Carolina Adame!
- Our personal stories, poems, dreams, reflections on our family celebrations and rhythms. 
- Seasonal recipes from the kitchens of our Abuelas to make with our children.
- Ideas ideas ideas to be more present to our children and our ancestors.
- Songs to sing and play with our children for each season.
- Our artwork and prayers in an Oracle Deck to bring beauty and magic into our home. 
- Prompts to journal about our family culture and reflect about our place in our family tree.
- A rhythm wheel that can be used with your children to create a daily and weekly schedule? 

 


Photography by Lily Glass
 
We hope that Semillas de las Abuelas is your go-to family book: when you need a moment to breathe, when you need an idea, when you want to have a stronger vision of your family culture.  


“They Tried to Bury Us, They Didn’t Know We Were Seeds” - Mexican Proverb


Photo credit: Carolina Adame Photography
 

About the Authors

The four collaborators on this project - Carolina Adame, Dr. Renee Lemus, Dr. Cristina Rose, and Marlha Sanchez -- are women of Mexican descent rooted in culture, history and social consciousness. We are mothers, educators, artists and social justice advocates.

We  are artists, writers, creatives, thinkers, scholars. We have founded cooperativas and singing circles for our families.  We have created safe spaces for all stories to be heard and celebrated.  We have encouraged, through the gathering of songs and hopes and stories, a reclamation of ways we connect to our Abuelas.  These spaces have created deeper joy and more fulfillment in our whole selves and in all aspects of our lives. And, truly, these spaces and these feelings are the gift our children have awakened in us!   
Photo credit: Carolina Adame Photography
 

As mothers of young children, we understand these messages about endurance, family, and rhythm in a whole new way!  The clock disappears as parents of newborns as we learned to navigate new schedules, new priorities, and new appreciations for every hour of the day. Old terrors and new hopes came together in those moments (at 4am particularly!) as we leaned in close to hear for our baby's breathing.  We learned then that parenthood is a spiritual calling.  No doubt. And we called on the strength of our deepest intuitive selves and our ancestors to surround us. We called on the hopes of our past and our vision of the future thinking of the generations to come.  We began to write a new story by planting our self and our families as seeds in the ground of our home and our local community. 

Community Support

And, we cannot do this with out the support of our families and communities! You have already inspired and challenged us. And, we want to officially invite you on board to be part of the  Semillas de las Abuelas family!


Your pledges go directly towards the design and printing of the book. They will also cover the operating costs of Indiegogo, associated credit card fees and any ancillary fees associated with pre- and post-production marketing/packaging/etc. 


Funds will go towards: 
Publishing - Who to work with and more!
Marketing - Branding and Media and more!
Labor - Photography and more!
Production - Writing Retreat and more!
Crowdfunding Fees


All of the funds raised, including any addition to our goal, will be invested wholly into the creation of Semillas de las Abuelas.


Photo credit: Carolina Adame Photography

We hope this book will serve as a practical collection of approaches to pass on the wisdom of our Abuelas to the future generations.


Project milestones:
                          September 2019: Crowdfunding Campaign
                          December 2020: Print, Production, and Delivery


Copy and Paste this link and share it on Facebook! 


This works falls under the umbrella of Las Doctoras.  Check out our Interview on the Las Doctoras Podcast. And check out our website lasdoctoras.net/semillasdelasabuelas and IG to follow our project @semillasdelasabuelas

 


Share on Instagram (tag @semillasdelasabuelas, #semillasdelasabuelas, #teachingtoreclaim, #resistliberatecelebrate, #seedsofourgrandmothers, #latinxfamilyrhythms)

They will also cover the operating costs of Indiegogo, associated credit card fees and any ancillary fees associated with pre- and post-production marketing/packaging/etc. Funds will go towards: Publishing - Who to work with and more!Marketing - Branding and Media and more!Labor - Photography and more!Production - Writing Retreat and more!Crowdfunding FeesAll of the funds raised, including any addition to our goal, will be invested wholly into the creation of Semillas de las Abuelas.Photo credit: Carolina Adame PhotographyWe hope this book will serve as a practical collection of approaches to pass on the wisdom of our Abuelas to the future generations.Project milestones:                          September 2019: Crowdfunding Campaign                          December 2020: Print, Production, and DeliveryCopy and Paste this link and share it on Facebook! This works falls under the umbrella of Las Doctoras.  Check out our Interview on the Las Doctoras Podcast. And check out our website lasdoctoras.net/semillasdelasabuelas and IG to follow our project @semillasdelasabuelas Share on Instagram (tag @semillasdelasabuelas, #semillasdelasabuelas, #teachingtoreclaim, #resistliberatecelebrate, #seedsofourgrandmothers, #latinxfamilyrhythms)

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is AriAnnah Edwards and I am the founder of SisTreat.  While my background is in health insurance, I have worked with counselors and therapists for my mental health issues since I was a child.   
  • This campaign was created to raise funds to create a social media network designed to bring awareness and support to girls and women of all age groups knowingly and unknowingly suffering from mental health issues and everyday life struggles.  The importance of this campaign to me is almost indescribable because it's birthed out of my own personal mental illness struggles since I almost decided to end my life instead of seeking the help I desperately needed.
  • If the funds are raised you will be setting precedent to change how social media works and possibly impact girls and women of all ages who are suffering in silence with mental health issues. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $4000.00 in funding to cover the following costs:
    • Create SisTreat social media network: $800.00
    • Hosting Website for the year: $200.00
    • Server: $500.00
    • Marketing/Advertising: $2000.00
    • Other equipment (Office supplies, chair, file cabinet etc.): $500.00
  • SisTreat will have podcasts, radio, health/nutrition information, book club, online fitness/zumba/yoga as well as a directory/network for mental health care providers and other mental health resources
  • In the event this campaign does not reach it's entire goal we will use the received donations as planned and work vigorously to make sure the plan is still executed to launch SisTreat.

 

The Impact

  • This campaign will kick-start a turning point in social media for women of all ages dealing with mental health issues and the struggles of everyday life.  Studies have shown that social media has negatively impacted mental health especially in millennials and the numbers are constantly increasing.  Your donation could help women of all ages and potentially save lives!

 

Risks & Challenges

  • The main challenges SisTreat will face right now are: Technological issues, Logistics issues with ensuring proper security and of course competition against other social media sites.
  • SisTreat plans on solving the technological issues by having the appropriate equipment (servers, coding and programs) and working with the proper experts to ensure our social media network will run smoothly.  In addition, we will make sure our technology and programs are bought and built with growth in mind.  Logistics with proper security will be addressed by implementing a judgment/bully free security alert program that relies on both rigorous monitoring of members as well as addressing reported isolated issues justly and swiftly. Finally, while there is competition from other sites, we will focus on our target market audience and find ways to attract and cater to that audience on our social network which will also work in our favor with advertising.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • There are 3 ways to donate to this campaign: Your time by reviewing this campaign, your funds by donating to make this campaign a success and your voice by sharing this campaign for others to see!
  • Simply put, share, Share, SHARE!
story_txt:
Short Summary

My name is AriAnnah Edwards and I am the founder of SisTreat.  While my background is in health insurance, I have worked with counselors and therapists for my mental health issues since I was a child.   
This campaign was created to raise funds to create a social media network designed to bring awareness and support to girls and women of all age groups knowingly and unknowingly suffering from mental health issues and everyday life struggles.  The importance of this campaign to me is almost indescribable because it's birthed out of my own personal mental illness struggles since I almost decided to end my life instead of seeking the help I desperately needed.
If the funds are raised you will be setting precedent to change how social media works and possibly impact girls and women of all ages who are suffering in silence with mental health issues. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $4000.00 in funding to cover the following costs:
Create SisTreat social media network: $800.00
Hosting Website for the year: $200.00
Server: $500.00
Marketing/Advertising: $2000.00
Other equipment (Office supplies, chair, file cabinet etc.): $500.00


SisTreat will have podcasts, radio, health/nutrition information, book club, online fitness/zumba/yoga as well as a directory/network for mental health care providers and other mental health resources
In the event this campaign does not reach it's entire goal we will use the received donations as planned and work vigorously to make sure the plan is still executed to launch SisTreat.

 

The Impact
This campaign will kick-start a turning point in social media for women of all ages dealing with mental health issues and the struggles of everyday life.  Studies have shown that social media has negatively impacted mental health especially in millennials and the numbers are constantly increasing.  Your donation could help women of all ages and potentially save lives!
 

Risks & Challenges

The main challenges SisTreat will face right now are: Technological issues, Logistics issues with ensuring proper security and of course competition against other social media sites.
SisTreat plans on solving the technological issues by having the appropriate equipment (servers, coding and programs) and working with the proper experts to ensure our social media network will run smoothly.  In addition, we will make sure our technology and programs are bought and built with growth in mind.  Logistics with proper security will be addressed by implementing a judgment/bully free security alert program that relies on both rigorous monitoring of members as well as addressing reported isolated issues justly and swiftly. Finally, while there is competition from other sites, we will focus on our target market audience and find ways to attract and cater to that audience on our social network which will also work in our favor with advertising.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are 3 ways to donate to this campaign: Your time by reviewing this campaign, your funds by donating to make this campaign a success and your voice by sharing this campaign for others to see!
Simply put, share, Share, SHARE!

story:
There are hundreds of intergovernmental (or international governmental organizations – IGOs) on the planet. Without a doubt, the most famous of these is the United Nations (UN) and its various specialized agencies, funds, and programs (such as UNICEF, UNDP, UNEP, UNFPA, IMF, the World Bank Group and FAO, etc.) but there are several others of importance.

These organizations are created by two or more sovereign states or other intergovernmental organizations and carry out work which is highly relevant in a wide range of fields, such as security, human rights, integration, trade, technology, childhood, health, international development, aviation, and housing, among so many others.

Working at these organizations means making an important social impact on the world. It means being in a multicultural environment, with incredible people from all over the planet; it means experiencing daily challenges and achievements; it means earning a good salary and benefits; it means traveling and knowing a little more about the world… It is a dream for many people.

However, there is still a lack of knowledge about how to enter these organizations and difficulty in accessing information about the different recruitment and selection processes. The OpenIGO network was created to change this situation.

OpenIGO is an extensive network formed of professors and researchers from the best universities in the world, professionals from international organizations and Human Resources specialists, which has the following strategic plan:

To contribute to developing international careers and democratizing recruitment and selection processes in the UN System and at other intergovernmental organizations by producing and disseminating advanced knowledge.

To be a reference in the world of producing and disseminating knowledge about careers and jobs in the UN System and at intergovernmental organizations.

OpenIGO’s focus is on international governmental organizations: bilateral and multilateral, regional and global, which work on varying topics.

Taking an internship at the United Nations (UN) and their different funds, programs and agencies (such as UNICEF, TheWorld Bank, IMF, FAO, WHO, and so many others) is a dream for millions of young people around the world. More than a professional opportunity, a UN internship is a fantastic life experience. Some of the reasons for taking a UN internship are as follows:

 

Receive a good stipend and benefits. It is true that some of the UN internships are unpaid. However, what many people do not know is there are also many paid internships at the UN, which offer benefits and stipends higher than those provided by the majority of companies.

 

 

Working an enjoyable, multicultural environment with incredible people from all around the world.

 

 

 

Work at organizations that have important missions in a wide range of international development areas, such as peacekeeping, health, childhood, agriculture, the environment, water, economic and social development, employment, gender, culture, and city planning, among many others.

 

 

Have a global impact. Your actions will help people in a wide range of locations around the world.

 

 

 

Make your curriculum stand out, with experience that is highly valued by the world of work.

 

 

 

Construct influential networks that you will retain for the rest of your life.

 

 

 

Experience daily challenges and achievements.

 

 

Learn or improve a foreign language. A UN internship is an excellent opportunity for professional experience abroad.

 

 

 

Travel and see different places around the world.

 

 

Constantly improve your qualifications. Intergovernmental organizations make large investments in training and updating their interns.

 

 

Expand your horizons. Taking an internship at an intergovernmental organization will provide experiences, which will change your way of seeing and understanding the world.

 

 

The UN system offers thousands of internships every year. However, being selected is not an easy task. Millions of young people around the world are competing for these vacancies. It is essential that candidates meet all of the internship program’s minimum requirements, in order to become one of the selected few. However, this is not everything. It is acknowledged that people who have connections with United Nations staff have advantages in the different internship selection processes. This is not because there are predetermined candidates. The United Nations is a serious organization. However, since these people have prior knowledge, which facilitates their navigation through the complex United Nations System, they are better prepared for the competitive internship selection processes. In other words, the asymmetry of the information about UN internships benefits those who have knowledge of this system.

OpenIGO seeks to tackle this problem. We are developing and disseminating information that significantly increases your chances of landing an internship in the UN system. By doing this, we are seeking greater democratization of internship and work opportunities, which results in a more representative and fairer international system.

With your help, we'll develop the following products and services:

 

The UN is a complex system formed by dozens of international organizations. Generally speaking, each one of these organizations has an internship search system and its own program. It is extremely time-consuming for candidates to hunt for these internships and jobs.

In order to simplify this process, OpenIGO has developed robots that collate all the internship and job opportunities in the UN system in a single system but we need to make even further progress.

Our aim is that the OpenIGO system makes the match between the interested parties and the candidate profile with the professional vacancy that an international organization is offering. The candidate will be advised by email of all the new UN vacancies and at other international organizations that correspond with their profile.

Therefore, we will have a complete system: which collates all the job and internship opportunities in the UN system in a single place and, in addition, sends these by email to those matching the profiles, making the hunt for internships and jobs much easier.

For those who contribute towards our initiative, we offer unlimited access to the internship and job system.

Imagine an e-book that teaches you everything you need to land a UN internship and be successful in it. Our team of Human Resources specialists, UN staff and university professors are now developing precisely that. The “United Nations System Internships: the complete guide” e-book will have 10 chapters, which will be of great assistance in helping you land the best internships in the UN system. It will have more than 160 pages, separated into the following chapters:

Chapter 1 – The UN System and intergovernmental organizations;

Chapter 2 – UN System internships: an overview;

Chapter 3 – Seeking the best internships in the UN System; 

Chapter 4 – Prepare perfect curricula and resumes for your UN internship;

Chapter 5 – Prepare an effective cover letter;

Chapter 6 – Write an outstanding letter of intent;

Chapter 7 – Have successful internship interviews at the UN;

Chapter 8 – Be prepared for your UN internship;

Chapter 9 – Stand out during your UN internship;

Chapter 10 – Successfully complete your UN internship.

The development of this book involves a large number of authors, technical and linguistic reviewers and designers, as well as other professionals.

As you know, although some of the UN System pays its interns well, unfortunately, there is still another part that does not. As an example, is the important UN Secretariat, based in expensive cities such as New York and Geneva, which completely excludes people who are not able to work for free, especially those from peripheral regions and countries. In other words, only a small elite is able to take internships at these organizations. As people who take internships in the UN System are able to find jobs more easily at this organization, the result is important international organizations, which are vital for good global governance, with elitist and undemocratic staff.

With the aim of contributing even further with the democratization of UN internship opportunities, the OpenIGO Network, with your help, will launch an extensive campaign to mobilize UN decision-makers, in the search to make them aware of the importance of paying interns throughout the system. The campaign will take place on social networks, in videos and electronic petitions. It will start to run on October 2019.

The OpenIGO Coaching program was carefully developed for professionals who would like to start a career at intergovernmental organizations, such as the United Nations. On this program, you will have a coach with extensive professional experience at intergovernmental organizations, to help you develop a career plan; to better understand the sector and the different organizations; to identify your professional options; to better identify your skills; to learn to deal with conflicts and your emotions and to better understand your professional objectives and desires.

Your coach is an attentive listener, nonjudgmental, action-oriented, focused on results, encouraging, questioning, providing effective feedback and inspiring you. The coaching sessions provide a framework within which the situation that a professional needs or wants to address can be dealt with.

A coaching session lasts 60 (sixty) minutes and is held via Skype.

Your help is essential for our initiatives to be successful!

Contribute to the process of creating a more accessible, democratic and representative international system. You can help our project with as little as USD1.00.

To encourage your participation, we have prepared a range of rewards, which are listed below:

Helping us with USD 1.00, we will send you a thank you message by email.

Helping us with USD 2.00, we will post a thank you message on our social networks and website, with the name of all our individual supporters. If you wish, you can share with us your professional story at an international organization, which we will post.

Helping us with USD 8.00 you will have unlimited access to the“United Nations System Internships: the complete guide ”e-book, which will help you find the best internships in the UN System and be successful on them. Following its official launch, the book will cost USD 16.00. In other words, it will cost double the price currently on offer. This is your chance to change your life and to receive a 50% discount. The book will be launched in October 2019.

Imagine having unlimited access to all the internship and job vacancies in the entire UN system and at various other international organizations. This is what we are offering those who help us with just USD 16.00. The value that will be charged for monthly access will be USD 5.00, or an annual payment of USD 60.00. By supporting us at the start, you could save thousands of dollars.

With the system implementations completed, which is planned for October 2019, you will start to receive emails with all the job and internship opportunities that match your profile and interests. This service will help towards your professional development and find you incredible professional opportunities!

Helping us with USD 20.00, you will have access to the "United Nations System Internships: the complete guide”, e-book and our internships and jobs search system. This offer will help you save $ 4.00 dollars!

Helping us with USD 130.00, you will get an exclusive coaching session with one of our award-winning coach teammates.

Helping us with USD 140.00, you will have access to all the items already listed above.
