story:
We are Pukawin, a wellness inspired program presented by a collective of creative arts, dance, yoga, and holistic living instructors and educators from diverse backgrounds; Sharlene Aquilar, Michelle "Mochi" Camaya Julian, and LaMae Caparas.

('Pukawin’ in Tagalog means to inspire, excite, innervate, awaken, impassion).

Pukawin Arts & Wellness Program is the product of long-time friends who have worked together previously across both coasts of the US and internationally on community conscious projects and events including the Philippines. We have performed together in Broadway productions and various events and collaborated in educational and arts programs. As creative agents of change, entrepreneurs, award-winning performers, community organizers, educators and spiritual leaders, we hold a combined 50+ years of experience and expertise across multiple fields, and have synergistically integrated our complementary skills.

This March 2020, we want to travel to the Philippines and share our program with its communities, the first of which will be for Malasimbo Music & Arts Festival, a two day celebration of music, life, spirit, earth, and freedom at La Mesa Eco Park in Quezon City, Philippines, as they host their 10-Year Anniversary.

Pukawin will present a unique and uplifting experience for all ages that will celebrate and honor the work of Gina Lopez by introducing a wellness inspired program of yoga, dance, and eco workshops at Malasimbo to enhance the festival’s mission.

Gina Lopez was a Filipino yoga missionary, environmentalist and philanthropist known for spearheading notable environmental projects in the Philippines, including the reforestation of the La Mesa Watershed Reservation, the last remaining forest zone in Metro Manila, right where our program takes place. She was an advocate for corporate social responsibility, and received several awards including her most recent, 2017 Seacology Prize,  before passing away this past August 2019. Pukawin’s Yoga/Dance and Environmental Mindfulness workshop programs follow in the impactful footsteps of Gina Lopez and aim to reveal new skills to better serve oneself and the planet, refining ones practice, and finding enjoyment for a more compassionate, creative, and fulfilling life.

Our program will expand on the arts & wellness. Below are some descriptions to the workshops we will be offering.

THE ARTS

Sound Explorations: Explore music inspirations and its healing effects using various resonant tools, singing bowls from crystal to metal gong bowls, and musical instruments. 

Wild Nature Movement Series: These workshops inspired by the natural world, meld a variety of disciplines that dissolve mind -body boundaries by cultivating deep curiosity, ultimate compassion, and empathy for oneself and for others. 

Partner Dance: The introduction classes to this dance called the hustle will also incorporate traditional Filipino folk dancing while learning to interconnect with another, inspiring new levels of communication and freedom.

 

WELLNESS

Sustainable Living & Green Thumbing: Workshops that incorporate nature - related concepts and activities including mask making, composting, planting, vision boarding, and more. More sensorial and healing experiences are in exploring the relationship to the land to guide and inspire mindfulness, movement and lifestyle - in both present and ancestral connections.

 

Nature & Sound Bathing: Explore music inspirations and its healing effects using various resonant tools, singing bowls, and musical instruments as well as those found in nature. 

 

Yoga Guidance: Michelle Camaya Julian is the co-founder of the KAMOCHIMETHOD, a method which introduces 3 principles based on breath, alignment and vow. Their mission is to ignite and reinforce the circle of communication between the individual and the creative artist within. Her sessions are inspired by the natural and brilliant design of the human body, as she helps each person liberate their movement by increasing range of motion, flexibility and strength. Her classes are joyful & light-hearted and practitioners come out of her sessions more structurally aware and ready to dance through life. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to ensure we cover every aspect of our program plan, we are looking to raise a total of $3,000 to help fund our mission to the Philippines, to Malasimbo Festival, and reaching other communities in need.

Your donation goes towards our in-land travels, N95 face masks, donations, and program supplies (print outs, mats, wellness giveaways, and signage).

We have some amazing wellness offerings for your donation!

From traditional Philippine 'pasalubong' gift baskets to virtual classes, sound healing, private yoga classes, to wellness packages, we have an abundant amount of perks to give back joy and inspiration for your donation.

 

The Impact

We are five females empowered by another women's story and her work as a yogi and environmentalist.

Philippines, which is the third leading producer of plastic pollution, needs all the help, information, and inspiration, it can get to start shifting in the direction of becoming more environmentally conscious.

 

Risks & Challenges

The risk is that we don't raise the money needed to get all our guides there. 

In that case, our lead guides will go and we are happy to find local instructors to collaborate with and substitute this time.

Our group is experienced in events and live theater and troubleshooting was a learned skill in those industries. We are very confident in facing and finding solutions to any challenge.

We aim to include more partnerships and venues into our program as we move forward in the fundraising of this campaign. Any leads or support is greatly appreciated!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with all your family, friends, co-workers and acquaintances by using the share tools. 

Please share for corporate sponsorship, brands, and businesses that can contribute donations or supplies.

The more awareness we can get for our campaign the more donations, and the more people will learn about us and our shared missions.

The more partnerships we build, lead to collaborations, and the more communities we reach.
story_txt:
We are Pukawin, a wellness inspired program presented by a collective of creative arts, dance, yoga, and holistic living instructors and educators from diverse backgrounds; Sharlene Aquilar, Michelle "Mochi" Camaya Julian, and LaMae Caparas.
('Pukawin’ in Tagalog means to inspire, excite, innervate, awaken, impassion).
Pukawin Arts & Wellness Program is the product of long-time friends who have worked together previously across both coasts of the US and internationally on community conscious projects and events including the Philippines. We have performed together in Broadway productions and various events and collaborated in educational and arts programs. As creative agents of change, entrepreneurs, award-winning performers, community organizers, educators and spiritual leaders, we hold a combined 50+ years of experience and expertise across multiple fields, and have synergistically integrated our complementary skills.
This March 2020, we want to travel to the Philippines and share our program with its communities, the first of which will be for Malasimbo Music & Arts Festival, a two day celebration of music, life, spirit, earth, and freedom at La Mesa Eco Park in Quezon City, Philippines, as they host their 10-Year Anniversary.
Pukawin will present a unique and uplifting experience for all ages that will celebrate and honor the work of Gina Lopez by introducing a wellness inspired program of yoga, dance, and eco workshops at Malasimbo to enhance the festival’s mission.
Gina Lopez was a Filipino yoga missionary, environmentalist and philanthropist known for spearheading notable environmental projects in the Philippines, including the reforestation of the La Mesa Watershed Reservation, the last remaining forest zone in Metro Manila, right where our program takes place. She was an advocate for corporate social responsibility, and received several awards including her most recent, 2017 Seacology Prize,  before passing away this past August 2019. Pukawin’s Yoga/Dance and Environmental Mindfulness workshop programs follow in the impactful footsteps of Gina Lopez and aim to reveal new skills to better serve oneself and the planet, refining ones practice, and finding enjoyment for a more compassionate, creative, and fulfilling life.
Our program will expand on the arts & wellness. Below are some descriptions to the workshops we will be offering.
THE ARTS
Sound Explorations: Explore music inspirations and its healing effects using various resonant tools, singing bowls from crystal to metal gong bowls, and musical instruments. 
Wild Nature Movement Series: These workshops inspired by the natural world, meld a variety of disciplines that dissolve mind -body boundaries by cultivating deep curiosity, ultimate compassion, and empathy for oneself and for others. 
Partner Dance: The introduction classes to this dance called the hustle will also incorporate traditional Filipino folk dancing while learning to interconnect with another, inspiring new levels of communication and freedom. WELLNESS
Sustainable Living & Green Thumbing: Workshops that incorporate nature - related concepts and activities including mask making, composting, planting, vision boarding, and more. More sensorial and healing experiences are in exploring the relationship to the land to guide and inspire mindfulness, movement and lifestyle - in both present and ancestral connections. Nature & Sound Bathing: Explore music inspirations and its healing effects using various resonant tools, singing bowls, and musical instruments as well as those found in nature.  Yoga Guidance: Michelle Camaya Julian is the co-founder of the KAMOCHIMETHOD, a method which introduces 3 principles based on breath, alignment and vow. Their mission is to ignite and reinforce the circle of communication between the individual and the creative artist within. Her sessions are inspired by the natural and brilliant design of the human body, as she helps each person liberate their movement by increasing range of motion, flexibility and strength. Her classes are joyful & light-hearted and practitioners come out of her sessions more structurally aware and ready to dance through life. 
 

What We Need & What You Get
In order to ensure we cover every aspect of our program plan, we are looking to raise a total of $3,000 to help fund our mission to the Philippines, to Malasimbo Festival, and reaching other communities in need.
Your donation goes towards our in-land travels, N95 face masks, donations, and program supplies (print outs, mats, wellness giveaways, and signage).
We have some amazing wellness offerings for your donation!
From traditional Philippine 'pasalubong' gift baskets to virtual classes, sound healing, private yoga classes, to wellness packages, we have an abundant amount of perks to give back joy and inspiration for your donation.
 

The Impact
We are five females empowered by another women's story and her work as a yogi and environmentalist.
Philippines, which is the third leading producer of plastic pollution, needs all the help, information, and inspiration, it can get to start shifting in the direction of becoming more environmentally conscious.
 

Risks & Challenges
The risk is that we don't raise the money needed to get all our guides there. 
In that case, our lead guides will go and we are happy to find local instructors to collaborate with and substitute this time.
Our group is experienced in events and live theater and troubleshooting was a learned skill in those industries. We are very confident in facing and finding solutions to any challenge.
We aim to include more partnerships and venues into our program as we move forward in the fundraising of this campaign. Any leads or support is greatly appreciated!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Please share this campaign with all your family, friends, co-workers and acquaintances by using the share tools. 
Please share for corporate sponsorship, brands, and businesses that can contribute donations or supplies.
The more awareness we can get for our campaign the more donations, and the more people will learn about us and our shared missions.
The more partnerships we build, lead to collaborations, and the more communities we reach.

story:
The State of Alaska finally has a proper representation of its state sport; dog mushing. Bouchards International Dog Mushing and Sled Museum is located in downtown Fairbanks, Alaska 519 1st Avenue. The museum has been open for the past 7 months. https://www.facebook.com/dogmushingmuseum/?fref=ts

The past twenty years of dedication to preserving the culture and history of arctic travel with sled dogs has been a passion of the museum. I started dog mushing in 2006 in Wisconsin and was instantly in love with the sport! The interest I had in the sport drove me to search the history of the early days of dog mushing and how it all started. My quest to explore the roots of the lifestyle led me to discovering more information about historic dog sledding culture. This got me on my trail of searching out historical pieces, traveling to different villages in the north, placing adds in dog mushing magazines, etc.... that would have been lost as old heirlooms in dusty old basements and never brought to light again. Many of the families were honored to have their family members honored in a way no one else has. I finally realized why nothing like this had existed before because no one took the time or the money to search the world for these pieces of the dog mushing history puzzle.  As of now I have invested over $150,000 dollars to keep this disappearing lifestyle from fading away from the publics eye in respect for the native culture, as Joe Reddington saved the sled dog culture by creating the 1000 mile Iditarod race leading to the modern style races, as where Joe kept the dogs alive, in the same spirit I'm preserving the culture entirely.  Its a sad fact that we always historically  erase native cultures around the world to appease modern culture. They have worked so hard and gave up so much that their way of life should never be forgotten. I moved to Dawson City, Yukon in 2007 and started up my 50 dog company Slow Rush Kennels along with the museum. The response to the museum was overwhelmingly positive. I relocated to Fairbanks in 2014 to reach a larger audience of international travelers. Within eight weeks we became number eight out of seventy-seven activities in Fairbanks through trip advisor. We've received raving reviews. 

We are here to establish additional capital to stabilize the initial startup funds for Bouchards International Dog Mushing and Sled Museum.

We need your help to keep the doors open!

story:
Important: please check campaign updates tab for the latest information. 

Note: before you select your donation: MAJOR give aways among the higher pledges. Check description below to see how you can win a Baton Rouge Guitar, iSolo Pick Up, G7th capo, Dragons Heart Guitar Picks, and more!

Easy Acoustic Guitar: Learning the smart way

My name is André van Berlo and I am the founder of yourguitarworkshop.com. Next to 23 years of teaching experience and producing 250+ free online lessons, I also hold a bachelor and master degree in music. It is my mission to help as many guitarists as i can, to reach their goals, and beyond. This course will be one of the means to reach that goal! 

Easy Acoustic Guitar is a well paced, step-by-step guitar course that will get you from clueless newbie to jamming guitarist in 2 months. It is not only fun, but with its "quality before quantity" foundation, it will help to save you time and frustration by reducing the risk of learning wrong playing habits. You’ll learn faster and are more likely to stay motivated at the same time.

Curious? Learn what it is all about and what we can do together to reach this goal, even if you have no money to spend…

 

(Stretch) Goals!
$ 6.000 Campaign success (YAAAY!)
$ 8.000 I will make 25 easy beginner guitar lessons (songs) and make them available for free on youtube
$10.000 25 free beginner lessons, but on top of that: a course to improve study results and make it available for free on my website, AND donate 6 months of free guitar lessons to a family in need here in my home town.

 

What’s in it for YOU: The Perks!

Listed on the right is an overview of great perks for your donated money: from Andrew Foy tablatures to "Early Bird" Course Access at 50% off, all the way up to an amazing 8 string guitar! 

  • Almost all the perks are also available as gift cards and donations. If you're interested in this, please contact me at contact@yourguitarworkshop.com
  • "Thank you" and "Live Event" are also for pledges of $5 and above

Note: if you want to donate one of the perks or give them to a friend you can let me know when I contact you after the campaign. The perks are located in the right column.

Note: since the campaign goal is set to flexible it is good to know that I can still uphold my "perk obligations" when campaign goal is not reached. 

What’s in it for YOU: The Giveaways!
You will probably NEVER have a better chance to WIN one or more guitars and guitar gear! Some lottery's have odds of winning like 1/13.000.000. As I tied the more interesting items to higher pledges, your odds may just be too good to resist. And you're helping a good cause in the meantime, win-win if you ask me!

NOTE: Shipping is included in the give aways, but depending on where you live, taxes and import fees may apply on the guitars. These taxes and fees are not included. 

  • "Bronze" --------> Pledge $4 or more and your are automatically entered in the beginner pack give away: Free access to "Easy Acoustic Guitar" or 4 skype lessons, A G7th performance Capo, Dragons Heart Guitar Picks and more.  Total value: $200 approx.)


     
  • "Silver" ---------> Pledge $10 or more and you are automatically entered in the iSolo guitar pick up ($199 Value) give away, AND the beginner pack giveaway. Total Value: $399

     

     

     
  • "Gold" ---------> Pledge $20 or more and you are automatically entered in the Baton Rouge X1C/GACE sun Guitar ($466,0 value) give away, AND both the iSolo and beginner Pack Give Aways. Total Value: $865

     

     

     

     

  • "DIAMOND" ---------> Pledge $50 or more and you are automatically entered in the  Baton Rouge X6C/GACE Mystique Guitar ($690 Value) give away, AND  iSolo guitar pick up ($199 Value), Baton Rouge X1C/GACE sun Guitar ($466 Value), Beginner Pack ($200 Value) give aways! Total value: $1555,-

     

  •  

 

Give Away “Rules” For backers

You’re automatically entered in almost all give aways but…

  • if you want to have a chance to win the iSolo, you have to enter your email address here: https://isolo.typeform.com/to/wGQk6b
  • if you want extra credits in the giveaway and increase your chances, share a post on your facebook, twitter, or google+ timeline with the campaignlink ( http://geni.us/EasyGuitar ) and use the hashtag #easyacousticguitar.


Alternative SUPPORT & alternative give aways!

- There will be an additional give away among those who are active on social media (tag posts with #easyacousticguitar) - 

The give away includes: G7th performance capo, easy acoustic guitar course, skype lessons, & more.

If you are unable to donate (or you donate but want to do even more), you can have an enormous impact on this project by spreading the word and telling your friends about the campaign! I wrote down some suggestions below but use your creativity! (after all you know your friends best) 

  • Share your time: Help me campaigning
  • Share/post the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and make sure you tag Your Guitar Workshop and use #easyacousticguitar, so I can find you easily when picking a winner for the give away. Tagging friends in the post that might be interested in this campaign helps even more. (you'd be helping them ánd me :-) )
    campaign url: http://igg.me/at/easy-guitar
  • Like & share the campaign video on youtube/vimeo/facebook 
    video url: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FOqD1z-4owI
  • Follow me on social media to like/share/retweet (links at bottom of page)instagram•facebook•twitter•youtube
  • Become a YGW member 
  • Tell your friends about Your Guitar Workshop and this course
  • Send me your love and support on my facebook/twitter timeline. I love to read comments :-)
  • Go through all my youtube videos on my channel and "like" them all :-)
    URL: https://www.youtube.com/user/YourGuitarWorkshop/videos

 

Give away "rules" for social media active supporters:

Share a post on your facebook, twitter, instagram or google+ timeline with the campaignlink ( http://geni.us/EasyGuitar ) and use the hashtag #easyacousticguitar and preferably tag your guitar workshop. You can share as much as you like :-)


WHY this course? The short story…

In over 23 years of teaching I have seen so many examples of where things go wrong with learning to play guitar. You see, even though we’re all unique as a person, most of us make the same mistakes when trying to master an instrument. So in those years I’ve learned to, very efficiently and clearly, explain things to help you get past these stages quicker. 

Next to my “analog offline teaching” I’ve been teaching songs in the digital realm of youtube for 5 years now, and I’ve reached more people through internet than here at home (11+ million views). Still, youtube is by far not the ideal learning environment the way it is set up. It is built to present ads, not to serve as a true learning tool. This is why I decided and started to bundle my wealth of “offline and online” teaching experience into this course that will be accessible 24/7 from anywhere in the world. It will feature the quality and environment that is essential for beginning guitarists.

A selection of course features:

  • One time fee - Life Time Access*
  • Full HD video
  • Multi Camera angles & split screens for a birds eye view of what’s going on
  • Clear explanation and step by step instructions with on screen graphics
  • Well paced lessons
  • Logical lesson progression
  • 300+ video tutorials and exercises
  • Option to be coached along side this course
  • Qualified teacher (bachelor & master)
  • No distractions & ad free
  • & more

*Under normal circumstances. No person or business can guarantee a lifetime of access to anything. Usually that is in the small print of the agreement. I don’t like small print so I put it here where it is easy to read :-)

BUDGET: Why would you need $6000?
Without beating around the bush, this is what the estimated costs are for the production of this course and its 300+ videos :

 

  • Video recording, compositing & editing: $5000
  • Audio mixing & mastering$250
  • Media (photo’s & artwork)$250
  • Indiegogo & Paypal Fees (approximately)$600
  • Taxes (estimated) $750
  • Total including Indiegogo & Paypal Fees: $6100
  • Total including Fees & taxes:  $6850

What do you need me for, don’t you have a job?
In fact, I had 2 jobs, but let me get to that in a bit… As I mentioned, I have been making free online lessons for 5 years. A total of 250 videos (most on youtube) that gathered almost 12 million views, and an additional 300K views/month. Those views get me a whopping $40/month! Wait…. WHAT? Yes,… $40 a month… Having a family, my weekly grocery bill is about 3x that amount. (I have a screenshot of my youtube channel statistics as proof) So obviously I am not able to pay things from youtube earnings. It would take me 12,5 years to get just enough for this project. 

So? What about my job then?

My (pregnant) wife, daughter, and I immigrated in 2015 to the lovely town Nelson BC, Canada. For this I had to quit my jobs (I had 2) and I’ve started from scratch over here. I’m working on it but building an income out in the back country isn’t so easy at first. Add to that the fact that I already paid for all the necessary gear, website development, etc with our life savings. (a total of about $25.000) On top of which came an immigration that is not free and you get the picture. 

I am not saying you should do anything because of that, but it is simply the reason why I am here on Indiegogo: We can’t afford the last stage of this process which is production. 

The true reason why you should get involved is because this course will be amazing, it will help many thousands of people to master the guitar, and will get you an immense value for your pledged money, guaranteed!

story:
Project Snowman


It's an undeniable fact of living in Toronto. Winter is coming. Again. 

With it comes the mountain of gear to outfit our kids for the next 5 (please not 6) months.

The right winter wardrobe can mean the difference between enjoying time outside and suffering through the cold weather. The right winter wardrobe is also very expensive. For the almost 146,000 children growing up in low-income families in Toronto, the right winter wardrobe is beyond the limits of their extremely tight budgets. 

We want to help. 

This November Ripple Clothes for Kids wants to outfit 1000 Toronto area babies and children with quality snowsuits. We want to help kids enjoy their morning recess, rather than shivering and counting the minutes until it's over. We want new moms to safely take their babies out to their doctor's appointments even on a cold January morning. 

To do this, we need your help. 


Here's how you can pitch in:

1. Donate your kids' hand-me-down snowsuits

  • We ARE looking for winter jackets, snow pants and one-piece snowsuits in excellent or very good condition (no rips or stains) sizes newborn to 16
  • We CANNOT accept: boots, mittens, hats, other children’s clothing or adult winter wear
  • Please wash donated items, bag them in clear plastic bags and label the bag by size and gender
  • Drop off your snowsuit at our HQ @ 686A St. Clair Ave. West or one of our other drop-off locations or partner schools. Click here for an updated list of drop-off locations and times. You can also email us at rippleclothesforkids@gmail.com to arrange a drop-off.

2. Contribute to our campaign

Help us buy new snowsuits, boots, mittens and toques on your behalf.  Your contribution will also support Project Snowman operational costs and provide seed funding for Ripple Clothes for Kids in the coming months.  

How we will use your money: 

  • 80% new snowsuits, boots, hats, mittens
  • 20% operational costs and seed funding

Please also check out our perks section where you can "purchase" winter clothing items (ie. we'll buy items to donate in your name).

**Please note: at this time we cannot offer tax receipts for your donation. We hope through your support this year, we will be able to incorporate, attain a charitable number and issue receipts for future Project Snowman campaigns!!**

3. Spread the word among your own network

This is huge. We only know so many people. You all know a lot more. Every post to social media or an email to family and friends makes a big difference.  If you think your child's school or your office (or your moms group etc..) would be open to hosting a Project Snowman drive, send us an email at rippleclothesforkids@gmail.com. We can send you a customizable form letter and make a plan for a mass pick-up.  

An early thanks to: Forest Hill PS, Clinton PS, McMurrich PS, St. Cecilia CS, Dewson PS, Humewood PS, Mabin School, Hippo Nursery School, Toronto Prep School and Oakwood Children's House for signing on to help us with our campaign.


About Us

Ripple Clothes for Kids is a charitable initiative started in Toronto in May 2015 by Janis Lempera (a mom of 3-under-6) and a great team of parent volunteers. We collect infant and children’s clothing in excellent condition, sort it by size, gender and season and package it into wardrobe bundles. Through our charitable partners, our packages are distributed to local infants and children in need. Our charitable partners include: Humewood House, North York Women's Shelter, Nellie's Shelter, Dr. Roz's Healing Place, The Redwood Shelter, Mothercraft, Hope for Children Fund, Horizons for Youth, Rosalie Hall and Parkdale Community Health Centre. 

In October, Janis connected with Kate Zed (a mom of 2-under-8) who works in the TDSB with children in Toronto's high priority neighbourhoods. Over coffee, Janis and Kate discussed the huge need for outfitting local children with appropriate clothing for winter...and Project Snowman was born!  

For more information about Ripple Clothes for Kids, visit (and like!) our Facebook page or our website.   


Thank You!

Our campaign isn't glamorous or global, but it's a way to make a concrete difference in the lives of local children this winter using items stuffed in our own closets and basements.  We hope you agree our campaign is worthy of your time, money and snow pants!

   

XO The Ripple Team


PS: A huge thank you to Jennifer Greenberg and Michael Loewith for donating storage space to us (above the future home of their new St. Clair realty office!). Project Snowman would not be possible without your support!
story_txt:
Project SnowmanIt's an undeniable fact of living in Toronto. Winter is coming. Again. 
With it comes the mountain of gear to outfit our kids for the next 5 (please not 6) months.
The right winter wardrobe can mean the difference between enjoying time outside and suffering through the cold weather. The right winter wardrobe is also very expensive. For the almost 146,000 children growing up in low-income families in Toronto, the right winter wardrobe is beyond the limits of their extremely tight budgets. We want to help. This November Ripple Clothes for Kids wants to outfit 1000 Toronto area babies and children with quality snowsuits. We want to help kids enjoy their morning recess, rather than shivering and counting the minutes until it's over. We want new moms to safely take their babies out to their doctor's appointments even on a cold January morning. To do this, we need your help. 
Here's how you can pitch in:
1. Donate your kids' hand-me-down snowsuits

We ARE looking for winter jackets, snow pants and one-piece snowsuits in excellent or very good condition (no rips or stains) sizes newborn to 16
We CANNOT accept: boots, mittens, hats, other children’s clothing or adult winter wear
Please wash donated items, bag them in clear plastic bags and label the bag by size and gender
Drop off your snowsuit at our HQ @ 686A St. Clair Ave. West or one of our other drop-off locations or partner schools. Click here for an updated list of drop-off locations and times. You can also email us at rippleclothesforkids@gmail.com to arrange a drop-off.
2. Contribute to our campaign
Help us buy new snowsuits, boots, mittens and toques on your behalf.  Your contribution will also support Project Snowman operational costs and provide seed funding for Ripple Clothes for Kids in the coming months.  How we will use your money: 

80% new snowsuits, boots, hats, mittens
20% operational costs and seed funding
Please also check out our perks section where you can "purchase" winter clothing items (ie. we'll buy items to donate in your name).**Please note: at this time we cannot offer tax receipts for your donation. We hope through your support this year, we will be able to incorporate, attain a charitable number and issue receipts for future Project Snowman campaigns!!**
3. Spread the word among your own network
This is huge. We only know so many people. You all know a lot more. Every post to social media or an email to family and friends makes a big difference.  If you think your child's school or your office (or your moms group etc..) would be open to hosting a Project Snowman drive, send us an email at rippleclothesforkids@gmail.com. Through our charitable partners, our packages are distributed to local infants and children in need. Our charitable partners include: Humewood House, North York Women's Shelter, Nellie's Shelter, Dr. Roz's Healing Place, The Redwood Shelter, Mothercraft, Hope for Children Fund, Horizons for Youth, Rosalie Hall and Parkdale Community Health Centre. In October, Janis connected with Kate Zed (a mom of 2-under-8) who works in the TDSB with children in Toronto's high priority neighbourhoods. Over coffee, Janis and Kate discussed the huge need for outfitting local children with appropriate clothing for winter...and Project Snowman was born!  For more information about Ripple Clothes for Kids, visit (and like!) our Facebook page or our website.   Thank You!Our campaign isn't glamorous or global, but it's a way to make a concrete difference in the lives of local children this winter using items stuffed in our own closets and basements.  We hope you agree our campaign is worthy of your time, money and snow pants!   XO The Ripple TeamPS: A huge thank you to Jennifer Greenberg and Michael Loewith for donating storage space to us (above the future home of their new St. Clair realty office!). story:
You Can Make A Difference

We invite you to participate in the creation of an illustrated story for children about the virtues of the Peruvian llama highlighting respect for the environment and promoting cultural pride. We will partner with schools to utilize this book as a tool to improve the lives of Andean families throughout the Sacred Valley of Peru.

The Campaign

We are raising $7,500 to produce a 32 page illustrated story in Spanish, native Quechua, and English along with important educational reference pages that reinforces the importance of the llama for our culture and ecosystem.

The first 1,000 books will be given freely to local schools and to more than 700 families of High Andean communities.

Accompanying the publishing of the book will be a program of theatrical presentation introducing the story to children within the schools and community. This is key to ensure full family immersion and participation.

Another 1,000 books will be made available for sale in the Sacred Valley tourist industry and the proceeds from the sales will finance the creation of educational material to support ecological education programs in community schools.

Everyone who donates will have their name listed on a special donor page of the book and receive an electronic version of the book (your gift may also be recognized anonymously if you prefer).

Over $50 + shipping will receive a mailed hard copy of the book with a personal thank you note.

Over $100 will receive a mailed hard copy of the book with a personal thank you note.

Over $250 will also be eligible for a 3-night stay for 2 at the Llama Pack Hostel in Urubamba, Peru.

Over $500, in addition to the above, will have a book presented to a school or community in their name. A plaque with your name will accompany the presentation and we will send you a video of the presentation.

Over $2,500, in addition to everything mentioned, 2 people will also be able to participate in a Llama Pack Project Llama Trek to one of the communities benefiting from your donation.

Over $5,000..well, you get it all - including a visit to the Machu Picchu for 2!

Through a contest, we have found a wonderful illustrator and, once we have completed raising funds, full production will take 3 months. Our objective is to be working with families and schools by August, 2016.

If we do not reach our goal here, funds will be held and combined with those from other sources to ensure completion of the project. We, and our community, are committed to making this happen.

The Impact

The llama, a distinctively Peruvian unique pack animal, is capable of preserving High Andean ecosystems and precious sources of water while providing a source of revenue for the communities living there.

Llama Pack Project has been working to reintroduce the llama as a viable pack animal so that these families, currently living in poverty, may participate in the burgeoning tourist industry that is passing them by.

This story will plant the seed of pride and encourage children of these families to continue the tradition of becoming breeders of llamas while becoming active caretakers of their environment.


Please help make a difference in the lives of children who need it most while protecting some of the most special land on earth. You have an opportunity to open the way for young people to see that raising llamas is a viable and proud future. 

Break the cycle of poverty and please support this project today!

Thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help

To learn more about Llama Pack Project, go to www.llamapackproject.com.

Also, please share this with as many friends and family as you can!

story:
Does Your Child Love Astronomy?

After seeing Saturn for the first time in a telescope, do they dream of growing up to be an Astronomer?

Do you want to help them live the dream?

Well, that is what we are looking to offer here at Apache-Sitgreaves Research Center in Arizona. 

We are first and foremost an educational resource! 

And we are completing the last few needed items to offer the opportunity for young and old alike to Be An Astronomer. 


For personal enjoyment, or as part of our public, private, or homeschooling programs, you will learn about space and stars and what it is to be an Astronomer as you control the telescope and camera. 

Using an internet connection from your home you will log into a telescope's computer at the research center, point the telescope at an object in the night sky, and, take pictures....  These pictures can be used for real science or to hang on your wall!!

I understand contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about. 

This is something I am very passionate about, having built these facilities myself, and together maybe we can make this work. Here are some things about me and this project that I think would appeal to you and get you passionate about it too, that with your help will open the entire Universe to you, your family, and your students.

My name is Steven Aggas and I am the Director of Operations here at Apache-Sitgreaves Research Center.  I am also a telescope designer and builder, and, by night a Telescope Operator.  Because I built the telescopes, and the buildings too, I get to be an Astronomer all year round. 


Our systems are set up to give an 'experience' you, your kids, or your students will not soon forget. 
You, your child, your student can be an Astronomer, just like the Professionals.  Professional Astronomers are generally not at the telescope when gathering data but instead hundreds if not thousands of miles away at their home or University laying out the Observing Plan and then checking in with the Observatory.  At the telescope far away - is where you will find a Telescope Operator on-site that coordinates the Observing Plan, can take phone calls for updates, monitor the telescope systems for proper operation and correct problems, and, monitor the local weather conditions for potential rain.

I would really appreciate it if you could read on about this campaign and the last few remaining milestones to allow you to log into a telescope as part of your own personal astronomy studies. 
  • We need to install the satellite dish for the internet connection to the computer-controlled telescopes. 
  • There is a need for a small building, to house one of the telescope systems with its very wide-angle imaging lens. 
  • There is a Custom Spectrograph project that would be funded to advance the scientific capability of our facility and be a valuable asset in astronomy studies we offer.  We are very excited with the educational potential the Custom Spectrograph would have for public, private and homeschooled students that they could acquire a spectrum showing the Hydrogen, Silicon and Helium absorption lines and further their understanding the chemistry and physics of astronomy!!!  
With a spectrum anyone can then study the chemistry of stars!

What is a Spectrograph?

Here are some details about what a Spectrograph is, and, how much of the Spectrograph project is already completed! 
Below is a color graphic showing the major star spectral types; O, B, A, F, G, K, and M, and you can see the relative strengths of chemicals showing up as dark lines.  Special circumstances in the stars' atmosphere cause the dark, absorption lines.

The Custom Spectrograph for the 36-inch telescope is a medium resolution Spectrograph, R=8000, specifically designed for the f4.5 Newtonian optical configuration and some parts are already built and working, like the Argon and Neon lamp calibration system.  But there is a list of critical, costly items like the 1800 lines per millimeter grating that separates the light that must still be purchased.  This is a fun and challenging project to build and of scientific value.

Custom Spectrograph Design  for 36-inch f4.5 Newtonian Optical Configuration

     

Computer-controlled Argon and Neon Calibration Lamps.

If you look at the various lamp/element spectra below you may see why Argon and Neon are chosen for calibrating a Spectrograph.  With these two elements there are enough emission lines that cover the entire visible spectrum from violet to red.


Imagine the conversations you will have with your child or students after they have taken computer control of a very large, distant telescope and produced an image they can be proud of.

Since I have built the telescopes myself, built the observatories myself, I am the Telescope Operator to assist you through the evening as you gather images (data).  The location of our observatories is at a world-class observing site in northern Arizona at nearly 7000 feet elevation with some of the darkest skies in the northern hemisphere.

A 36-inch telescope has over 20 times the aperture (surface area) of an 8-inch telescope!! The 36-inch collects so much light images are 30 seconds or less each.  Because of Field Rotation we cap all exposures at 30 seconds but they can be easily stacked to combine them. 


If this campaign has sparked your curiosity.

If it has caused you to become passionate about it as I am, these are the details:

What I Need.

The internet connection is needed which would support not only the 36-inch telescope but other, smaller telescope systems that will also generate images (data) and sometimes those systems are better suited to a particular astronomy field of study for your students.  There is a need for a small building, to house one of the telescope systems with its very wide-angle imaging lens.  Plus, allow the completion of the Spectrograph device with this campaign.

What We Offer For Your Support (The Perks).

1. Indiegogo will not allow me to put a Zero-Dollar Perk to help any parent choose the right telescope for their child.  Contact me and I will use my 30+ years in astronomy helping you find the right telescope.
2. Our unique Perks are beautiful photographs of our galaxy The Milky Way, or, of the Moon and Planets!  That is what we do and we hope you will want to claim one or all, frame them, and hang them on your wall!!!  You are not just buying a photo for $50, but rather getting a beautiful memento in exchange for your support that brings this type of experience to children, students and those who might never have the means to experience the wonders of the night sky.

To see samples of the Perk photos click; HERE

3. There are Perks for students, kids of all ages really, to Be The Astronomer!  You will learn the basics of astro-imaging and experience The Universe in the process all from the comfort of your own home.  Telescope Operators work throughout the night at the observatory, so as long as it is night in Arizona we can accommodate your child, student or classroom.
4. For any ASTRONOMY CLUB who wishes to help this campaign, there is a Perk specifically for you.  We can help you offer your younger members a greatly reduced price to operate the 36-inch telescope!!  A 'High-Tech Outreach Program'. Do you think this would encourage more young people to attend more of your meetings?
5. Contribute for a school of your choice.  For the Young Astronomer, do you know a deserving student or school classroom that you would like to contribute, on their behalf, towards a Perk for them for an evening using the 36-inch telescope?  This is entirely possible, and your particular student or school has a unique opportunity to study the Universe.  This Perk also includes a 1-hour video chat with the class.  Topics for a student or school using the 36-inch could be; Determine the motion of an asteroid from several images of its movement among the stars, Reach out and capture an image of a Kuiper Belt Object (Pluto is a Kuiper Belt Object!!), or, image a series of galaxies searching for a new Supernova that has exploded!  These are but a few topics.  Contact me if there is something specific you had in mind.
We do require the remote imaging perks to be claimed within two months after the campaign ends.  Booking must be mutually agreed upon and weather could be a factor in start or end times.

What I Hope.

Obviously we hope to reach the goal amount so students (Young Astronomers) can do more advanced studies in Astrophysics with the Spectrograph....  The Custom Spectrograph system, when bolted to the 36-inch diameter telescope will, undoubtedly, allow for some advanced studies of stars and that can be the core of future astronomy programs for public, private or homeschooled students. 
For instance, Supernovae (plural for Supernova), have several methods that cause that stars annihilation; Thermal Runaway as part of a binary star system because of mass transfer from one to the other, or Core Collapse because a star started with too much mass and as the elements of the periodic table formed and the pressure pushed against gravity, gravity ultimately won.  By studying the Hydrogen, Silicon and Helium absorption lines determinations can be made regarding which type of Supernova it is.  These topics then become conversations the students would be part of.  Imagine the look on a neighbors' face when the 'next-door neighbor kid' is overheard talking about the relative strength of the Carbon emission lines of the Wolf-Rayet spectral class WC7 star in Cygnus.  Would you not want to help that kid...?

Things to remember should we get this campaign to be a success and what your contribution can mean.

  • There will be special, reduced pricing for any public and private schools to operate our telescopes including the 36-inch.
  • For homeschoolers there will be excellent lesson plans bundled with operating the 36-inch telescope.  The lesson plans would be per semester and it is expected that when a pair of lesson plans were purchased together the 36-inch telescope for minimal additional cost.
  • Astronomy clubs will enjoy special, reduced pricing to show their younger members the commitments the clubs have for them to continue the hobby.
There will be a telescope operator helping you, guiding you, on the systems that control the telescope and camera.

If we are fortunate to exceed our goal I imagine great things available to students as a result.


The Impact.

The difference your contribution will make:

  • Large-telescope access is a valuable resource to the United States and the world to study astronomical phenomenon, especially with a custom Spectrograph for future spectral analysis of stars!
  • Your contributions would support a wide range of scientific and educational discovery (think asteroids, comets, or a spectrum of a new Supernova confirming what type it is...)!
  • Your contributions would show your support for science education and how astronomy is done in the 21st century!


Risks & Challenges.

There are risks and obstacles on the way to achieving my goal, but....

So much is already built and ready to go, but, as we know 90% of the effort is spent in getting that last 10% of the project done.  That is why I am asking for help.... 


Please help this campaign...

...so our educational resource at Apache-Sitgreaves helps children recognize their potential.


I do hope I have inspired you, your organization, and your astronomy club to contribute. 

My gratitude goes out to all those who are considering or have contributed already to this endeavor.  It is with your generosity that the campaign can be a success. 


NOTE TO SELF; 
If we are successful, Members of the FaceBook page and Followers on Twitter will be notified of Flash Sales.  When a Flash Sale is posted, to control any of the telescopes, you can enjoy significant savings with a limited window of opportunity spanning several days/nights.  Basically, if I'm working the telescopes and one is unused I will post to FaceBook and Twitter!! 
Join and Follow today!


Check out our Website.
Join our FaceBook Blog.
Follow us on Twitter; @DeepSpaceNow. (Who does not like getting a message from Deep Space, right?)

Obviously we hope to reach the goal amount so students (Young 
Astronomers) can do more advanced studies in Astrophysics with the 
Spectrograph....  The Custom Spectrograph system, when bolted to the 
36-inch diameter telescope will, undoubtedly, allow
 for some advanced studies of stars and that can be the core of future 
astronomy programs for public, private or homeschooled students.  For
 instance, Supernovae (plural for Supernova), have several methods that 
cause that stars annihilation; Thermal Runaway as part of a binary star 
system because of mass transfer from one to the other, or Core Collapse 
because a star started with too much mass and as the elements of the 
periodic table formed and the pressure pushed against gravity, 
gravity ultimately won.  By studying the Hydrogen, Silicon and Helium 
absorption lines determinations can be made regarding which type of 
Supernova it is.  These topics then become conversations the students 
would be part of.  Imagine the look on a neighbors' face when the
 'next-door neighbor kid' is overheard talking about the relative 
strength of the Carbon emission lines of the Wolf-Rayet spectral class 
WC7 star in Cygnus.  Would you not want to help that kid...? Things to remember should we get this campaign to be a success and what your contribution can mean.

There will be special, reduced pricing for any public and private schools to operate our telescopes including the 36-inch.

For homeschoolers there will be excellent lesson plans bundled with operating the 36-inch telescope.  The lesson plans would be per semester and it is expected that when a pair of lesson plans were purchased together the 36-inch telescope for minimal additional cost.

Astronomy clubs will enjoy special, reduced pricing to show their younger members the commitments the clubs have for them to continue the hobby.

There will be a telescope operator helping you, guiding you, on the systems that control the telescope and camera.If we are fortunate to exceed our goal I imagine great things available to students as a result.
    
The Impact. The difference your contribution will make:  Large-telescope access is a valuable resource to the United States and the world to study astronomical phenomenon, especially with a custom Spectrograph for future spectral analysis of stars! Your contributions would support a wide range of scientific and educational discovery (think asteroids, comets, or a spectrum of a new Supernova confirming what type it is...)!
Your contributions would show your support for science education and how astronomy is done in the 21st century!    
Risks & Challenges.  There are risks and obstacles on the way to achieving my goal, but....  So much is already built and ready to go, but, as we know 90% of the effort is spent in getting that last 10% of the project done.  That is why I am asking for help....  
    

Please help this campaign...






...so our educational resource at Apache-Sitgreaves helps children recognize their potential.

I do hope I have inspired you, your organization, and your astronomy club to contribute.  

My gratitude goes out to all those who are considering or have 
contributed already to this endeavor.  It is with your generosity that 
the campaign can be a success.  
NOTE TO SELF;  If we are successful, Members of the FaceBook page and Followers on Twitter
will be notified of Flash Sales.  When a Flash Sale is posted, to 
control any of the telescopes, you can enjoy significant savings with a limited window of opportunity spanning several days/nights.  Basically, if I'm working the telescopes and one is unused I will post to FaceBook and Twitter!!  Join and 
Follow today!


Check out our Website.Join our FaceBook Blog.Follow us on Twitter; @DeepSpaceNow. (Who does not like getting a message from Deep Space, right?)

story:
Summer Art Program

Marisa is a junior in high school who has recently been accepted by Maryland Institute College of Art to attend a summer program for outstanding young artists. This program would allow her to prepare for college and experience one of the best fine art schools in America. Although this program is exciting, it is very expensive, as it is worth college credit, we do not want her to miss out on this oppurtunity.

  • Marisa is very passionate about art and has been recognized nationally and locally.

  • She has been chosen to display her artwork in the Dali Museum, the Tampa Museum of Art, the University of Tampa Museum of Art, the Amelie Arena and schools in Alabama, Florida and Japan.

  • This program would allow her to grow even more as an artist, expanding her exposure to different mediums, while also preparing her for college.

Program Specifics

  • The cost of the program is $4,700 with at least $500 for materials and other additional costs like airfare and shuttles.
  • The program is a 4-week intensive that is worth 3 college credits.
  • Program is located on the MICA campus, one of the top 10 best fine arts schools in the country.
  • Fees include room and board, food, trips to museums, materials, and rigorous college-level classes every day.

Perks

Perks include sketches of mine such as these (level of detail varies): 

And prints of pieces like this:

story:
REASON FOR MY CAMPAIGN

I am mounting this campaign to help raise extra funds to cater for additional costs associated with my admission and partial scholarship package to successfully enrol at De Montfort University (DMU), Leicester-UK.

My passion for rural development has invigorated my desire to pursue an MA course in International Relations/International Business and Management at DMU. 

  • I believe that the best possible way to changing the disparities in Ghana is through education; taking education to rurally deprived communities. That's the main reason why I consider further studies  at DMU to be very germane.

Having been born and bred with basic educational experience in a rural community, Terchire in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and later with high school exposure in a relatively urbanized setting, I came to the realization of the wide rural-urban educational lacuna.

SERVICE TO STUDENTS IN DEPRIVED COMMUNITIES

To help contribute to lessening the rural-urban educational gap, I started leading voluntary expeditions to rurally deprived communities in 2012 so children from school going age could feel motivated and empowered to pursue higher academic feats. Volunteers (primarily university students)handled major courses such as Mathematics, Science, English, Social Studies, Costing, Business Management inter alia.

This exposure tickled my desire to do more for the less privileged by forming the Confederacy of Tertiary Volunteers Initiative (CTVI) based on partnerships with other NGOs and Members of the National Parliament House of Ghana in rural communities in Ghana; Yefri, Terchire, Adrobaa etc.  

Currently, I have devoted my volunteer efforts to NGOs such as Technology without Borders (German-Technik Ohne Grezen e.v) and GYCC; organizations that contribute to providing stationery to school children, dug-out boreholes to rural communities, toilet facilities, teaching computer basics, incinerators, waste management campaigns etc. in Ghana. 

I am also a mentor of Senior High School students in the areas of public speaking, leadership, motivational seminars, change management as well as training them to develop homegrown solutions to the country’s numerous waste problems under the Recycle-Up Ghana Summer camp-2014 and 2015 editions.

ACADEMIC JOURNEY

I completed my Senior High School education from Sunyani Senior High school in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. At the university level, I pursued B.A. (Hons) Degree in Culture and Tourism and was a awarded numerous academic and extracurricular awards; feats that earned me a place in the Department of Geography and Rural Development as a Teaching and Research Assistant. I ably provided assistance in the conduct of undergraduate tutorials and several research projects.

HELP-ME-HELP-OTHERS

I have gained admission and partial scholarship to cover the tuition portion of my studies, but I still have extra costs to waive off. That's where YOU can help me make the difference. I need your help to be able to cater for the items I am personally responsible for funding such as the cost of my airfare, accommodation, visa application, medical aid (health insurance) and living expenses.

Currently, It has been arranged for me to stay with an on-campus lecturer so the issue of accommodation is out of my worries.

I generous donations/contributions to help me cater for the items I am personally responsible for funding. I will cover the balance of the tuition through a personal funding I started a year ago but I need help with the remaining costs of about

4,000 Britain Pounds

in order to waive of the remaining expenses to enable me enrol successfully.

Finally,

Your donation/contribution will give me the much needed finances to take up my postgraduate offer which will ultimately endow me with the requisite knowledge to advance my reach to help bridge the rural-urban educational lacuna from the various communities in Ghana.

story:
Welcome to Hanover High School Track and Field

Funding for Hanover Track

In this era of budget cuts and limited funding for athletics, Hanover Track is not alone. Hanover has a robust group of coaches and student athletes that work hard to compete at the highest levels in track and field but we need your help. We need funding for buses to events, track and field equipment like hurdles and mats for high jump, track maintenance and even uniforms and warm-ups. The kids many of whom are Honor Roll students deserve the chance to compete and train in a safe and well equipped environment. Parents do what we can, as a parent I provide training gear and clothing but not all parents are able to do everything so we are asking your help to provide the big things we need to make Hanover Track a top tier program. 

What will we buy?

We need to upgrade the High Jump Equipment and Hurdles. We currently only have 6 hurdles, we can't even support one lane to train. The foam in the high jump equipment has deteriorated so much that it is an inhalation risk and a health hazzard. 

100% of the money goes to the athletic department to pay for travel, equipment and track maintenance. Hanover County was excellent in  providing the initial facilities but the budget to maintain the track, and field event sites is very limited.

These kids are dedicated and accomplished athletes, they work very hard. Many of the students are the top athletes in the state and others are coming up from the Middle School program that has been undefeated for more than 4 years in a row. High School Track and Field requires more travel and includes more events. All this requires more funding. 

When you see the world as it is today, supporting hard work and achievement is a great way to pay it forward for a better environment for our children and young adults. Boosters and private donations is what drives High School Athletics, your help is needed.  

This Funding Campaign is for both the current Winter Track Season and will also benefit the Spring Track Season, any funding received will stay in the Hanover High School Track Budget for any additional requirements. 

A donation today benefits many students both this year and for future athletes. The equipment lasts for many years and will go on to benifit kids far into the future.
Please give generously!

story:
Hello friend, 

       My name is Alain Dagba and I am the owner and the editor of Success eMagazine. I am originally from Togo, West Africa. I am happily married to my best friend Danielle. We have 3 children genetically and uncountable spiritual children all over the world. I am a Motivational Speaker, a Life-Coach and a Minister.

     Success eMagazine is one of the most efficient avenues I have created to give back to the society what so many people have poured into me.

      There are so many creative souls out there that are struggling to make themselves and their works known. And there are so many people who need to know that they are not the only ones going through life challenges.

       Lastly, there are countless of people who need to be inspired to believe in themselves and dare to dream what seems impossible. In Success eMagazine they all meet to make the world a better place.

One of the nest stories in the January 2016 Issue of Success eMagazine below

                   What is Success eMagazine?

Success eMagazine is to inspire the world with great and real stories and provide an avenue for active entrepreneurs, aspiring entrepreneurs, small business owners and artists to showcase their works in a very effective way in order to achieve maximum success. With your contribution, we will give exposure to a lot of talented entrepreneurs in our community and boost their confidence in reaching their desire.  We would like to print massive copies to distribute in this community and 5 surrounding towns.Here's the e-version of the current and upcoming Success eMagazine:

 http://www.successemagazine.com/january-issue

http://www.successemagazine.com/february-issue


And here are some of our covers with  great featured stories. 

             

    

       

    

     

   

How your contribution will help:

Your money will go directly to printing the eMagazine.To give exposure to the entrepreneurs in this Magazine and others out there. We will print massive copies which will be distributed in the towns listed below: 

Dorchester

Stoughton

Brockton

Boston

Randolph

Weymouth

Your contribution will also help us with: Graphic Design, Contents editing, Original Photography, Digital Setting, Physical Printing and Door to Door Mailing.

The great news about the success of this campaign, Success eMagazine will showcase more entrepreneurs which will bring more clientele to those who are showcased.

Perks: 

Take a look at the sidebar to see the fantastic number of Perks available to contributors of the campaign!


Risks & Challenges

In the near future, we will release our magazine with several independent retailers. Throughout this process, we aim to find a sustainable balance which will allow us to print larger numbers of future issues.


Other Ways You Can Help

:"It takes one person to put food on a family table. But it takes a community to empower the world." __Alain Dagba

Do not keep this fundraising campaign to yourself, please make some noise  by getting the word out on your social networks and your social gatherings. We cannot reach this goal without your assistance. 

We have hot topics coming up in February, You can  subscribe as a reader by clicking the link below: http://www.successemagazine.com/subscribe-as-a-...


"It takes one person to put food on a family table. But it takes a community to empower the world." __Alain Dagba

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mosi Mandisa and I am a published author. I was once aggrieved because hardly any documentation, is done to preserve the knowledge of the elders to pass on to the younger generation in my country.  I decided to do something about it. Consequently, I have dedicated many years of my life researching and documenting information.

Most of my time is spent with senior citizens. I let them know that they are special and the younger residents' lives are better because of them. My reward is when I see them smile. I've been doing this for years. In 2012, I gave G. Washington Archibald commonly known as "Washie" a complimentary copy of one of my books and it was the first time we had a face-to-face discussion.  

He requested that I sit with him as he journeyed down memory lane. He specifically spoke about many social ills and ways in which Kittitians and Nevisians can help the younger generation. I am glad that I took the precious time to discuss certain issues with him, as his speech has been greatly affected after he became ill in 2013. When I visit him, he would remind me about this commitment.


It is with this vow in mind that I am seeking funding to complete the publication of his biography. I have penned his biography in various parts for easy and convenient reading, especially for the younger generation. Thus far I have used my resources and I need assistance to complete the process. I am asking for your support to keep Washie’s Legacy Alive by making a donation. Thereafter, I will publish the other parts after I have passed this hurdle.

He has made a valuable contribution to our country and beyond. Kindly assist in whatever way you can. Thank you for your support and contribution.

story:
Who are we?

We are Seba Academy! Located in Lithonia, Georgia, we’re a private learning center whose mission is to empower students to be leaders of tomorrow, equip them with knowledge regarding their cultural background, and develop them into life-long learners. Founder Willette Akua, formerly a public school teacher, math specialist and instructional coach felt the need for Seba to exist after “No Child Left Behind” initiatives shifted public school focus from child-centered education toward test driven instruction. Husband and co-founder Chike Akua shares Willette’s passion for teaching as he provides national training for teachers to increase student achievement.

What are we looking to do?

In our three year existence, our goal of educating children beyond standardized testing has been extremely successful; 66% of our students perform above grade level, with some performing even two or three levels above their grade. As educators, we would like to see this trend continue with our students, not just for the grades we currently teach (1-5), but in every grade thereafter until Seba’s students reach college. That is why we’re looking for the resources necessary to expand Seba Academy to middle school (grades 6-8). Our plans for expansion include hiring additional teaching staff, expanding school grounds, introducing more STEM initiatives, and purchasing student robotics kits and foreign language software.

Why are we worth helping?

From our inception, Seba Academy has been and always will be about student success. Every element of our expansion plan enhances the learning environment for our students in one way or another. For those who share our enthusiasm for empowering and truly educating the youth, we believe our project is a great opportunity to do so, and we hope you agree! In taking part in our project, you’re investing in the future, you’re telling our young people that you have full confidence in their potential, and most importantly, you’re making a direct impact on young lives.

What’s in it for you?

Unlike some other crowdfunding sites, IndieGoGo allows us to offer perks in exchange for your support, and so we hope you enjoy the mix we’ve put together! If you would like to simply donate without selecting a reward, we invite you to do so as well.  Whatever option you choose, we thank you all in advance for your support and look forward to seeing how this project unfolds.

Here are photos of the perks that are available to you (see side panel for full description):

Perk 1 - Student Creed Scroll

Perk 2 - Laser Pointer Stylus

Perk 3 - Scholar Backpack Case


Perk 4 - External Storage Drive

Perk 5 - Portable Tablet Device

story:
What’s Going On?

  • The global displaced population has nearly tripled (UNHCR) and is the LARGEST since World War II.
  • Desperate people from the Middle East, Asia, and Africa have left their homes in historic numbers fleeing armed conflict and economic disaster.
  • Two-thirds of displaced people reaching Europe land in Greece.
  • Almost 70% of them are aged between 14 and 34 (Mercy Corps).
  • Greece's refugee population currently has no access to education and most are waiting in limbo, often in harsh conditions. 

What’s Our Plan?

We’ve teamed up with Emergency Response Centre International (ERCI), one of the few active NGOs in Greece leading direct-service projects, to launch ERCI EDU.

ERCI EDU is a volunteer project that aims to combine the best practices from our youth leadership curriculum developed for diasporic youth in the United States with practical techniques currently in use by international organizations working with refugee youth in the United States, EU and Middle East.

Beginning in September, ERCI EDU will partner with a refugee camp that supports vulnerable mothers and children in Thessaloniki, Greece to lead an educational program for Syrian, Afghan, and Iraqi youth. Through a series teambuilding and experiential activities, ERCI EDU aims to provide these youth with:

  • Language skills (English and Arabic or Persian);
  • Physical activity and emotion regulation skills;
  • Social integration support; and
  • Experiential activities supporting mental health

ERCI EDU serves youth ages 4-17 years old in interactive learning and teambuilding activities. Our main focus is supporting adolescents, including unaccompanied minors. Currently more than 56,000 refugees are stranded in Greece and nearly 40% of them are minors. Refugees who arrived following the EU-Turkey agreement in March 2016 are still waiting to be processed and their status has yet to be determined.

Who Are We?

We are a two-person team volunteering with ERCI to develop and launch ERCI EDU. Mana Kharrazi and Kayvan Farchadi have over ten years of experience empowering multicultural youth through safe and intentional spaces.  We are intimately familiar with the challenges facing displaced populations and are uniquely positioned to leverage our skills and resources to support refugee youth stuck in Greece’s refugee camps. And we need your help! 

We made our initial visit to Greece in June to meet our partners and understand the current crisis in Greece. Mana Kharrazi is now the (unpaid) Education Director of ERCI EDU and will be supporting the project on an ongoing basis as a volunteer. Mana will be returning to Greece in September to launch the first educational program at a refugee camp based in Thessaloniki, Greece with a team of volunteers. 

What Do We Need?

We’re asking for an initial amount to fund our first major expenses:

  • Travel for our team members who will finalize the curriculum with ERCI, set up the ongoing logistics for our volunteers, and launch the project with 120 kids at a camp in September, and;
  • Educational and recreational materials including: flipcharts and easels, white board and dry-erase markers, notebooks and pens, portable printer and copy paper, soccer balls, cones, books, and educational toys.

The Future of ERCI EDU

ERCI EDU will be a sustainable long-term project that will train and support volunteers to be healthy, positive, culturally-sensitive youth educators and mentors. While we are launching our innovative curriculum at one particular camp in September, we are in talks with the Greek Government and other camps to create a model that we can implement at other sites potentially across the country. Our model can become the model that supports the education and development of a population of children who have experienced the worst trauma imaginable: war. 

Our team is entirely volunteer-run and supported. Please support us as we hope to help empower and educate the more than 22,000 refugee children stranded in Greece. 

Other Ways To Help

  • Share our Indiegogo campaign on social media!
  • Send volunteers our way, especially Arabic and Persian speakers.
  • Connect us to: people currently working in Greece and mental health professionals with a focus on youth and conflict.

Risks & Challenges

The situation in Greece changes daily due to all sort of factors. Of primary importance is the changing status of the March 2016 deal reached between Turkey and the EU. It is likely that the number of refugees traveling from Turkey to Greece will drastically increase after this summer's failed coup attempt and potential changes with the agreement. Greece has been left largely on its own to deal with the 56,000 refugees stranded in its borders.  

A complex web of political and economic factors have led to this historic movement of people. Ultimately, an effective response involves parliaments, bureaucracies, and huge sums of money addressing both the needs of the displaced and the factors that pushed them out. However, any response also requires OUR involvement and advocacy. Generations of people around the globe are being and will be affected by the events unfolding in our time. Though the scale can be paralyzing, it’s our world, and it’s our responsibility.

“...We need to open ourselves up, radically, in our hearts and in our souls, to the realities of suffering to which we are ourselves strangers, and allow ourselves to be pierced and penetrated by the factuality of this misery.” - Leon Wieseltier (full text)
