story:
CriteriCon Prequel Jumps Into IndieGoGo!

Thank you to those who are joining us once more to get our traveling mini convention model off the ground and helping us make CriteriCon it's own full convention as well! Reward perks are available as before (plus new perks!) and our activities' schedule will be updated as we get new additions!

CriteriCon: Prequel is a creativity-promoting, social event happening this August 3-7, 2016 in Las Vegas, Nevada at the Rio Hotel.

Our goal is to help CriteriCon become a traveling mini convention as well as a full-size, independent convention. CriteriCon: Prequel is our interactive business card!

CriteriCon supports and spotlights innovative creators, interactive entertainment, independent production, and great causes. CriteriCon is driven to be exciting, safe, all inclusive, and progressive. We want you to have fun, make friends, and come away with great memories and tools that can help you with your creative interests, goals, and dreams.

CriteriCon: Prequel 2016 Entry - Our Prequel is free to attend, however, we have a limited amount of space available in our suite per activity this year, which is why we offer a reward tier with priority entrance into our events. Our Prequel will operate as a highly active hosting and hospitality room for attendees and hotel visitors who are there already for Star Trek Vegas Con. We operate on our creator's personal funds, your donations at the event, and fundraiser contributions made here.

About CriteriCon's Name - "CriteriCon" is inspired by the meaning of the word "criterion". We want people to get to know and be inspired by the amazing, important people and detailed processes behind works of art, performance, and production.

Check out our featured artist! Keezy Young created our 2016 Backer Design!

The Prequel

We will be hosting a mini schedule of activities in our private suite at the Rio Hotel over the course of five days. Contributions go towards covering the space (which we already reserved) so we can promote, equip, decorate, entertain, offer classes, demos, mixers, media screenings, and test out ideas for future events.

Prequel's 2016 Schedule of Activities (more will be added):

  • "High Tea at the End of the Universe" with Geek ReGeneration, themed event to relax, have tea and snack at, staffed by featured cosplayers and costumed assistants.
  • The Multiverse Flea Market where you can find trinkets, art, props, and more. Larry Nemecek will have some of his amazing Trek collection available at the Flea Market! Other artists, collectors, and attendees will be invited to contribute to our Flea Market.
  • Nighttime Mixers with Trek Radio, The Hollywood Sci-Fi Museum, Roddenberry Mission Log, Trekland / Portal 47, Glue Guns & Phasers, Geek Nation Tours, Not of This Earth, & Bye Bye Robot.
  • Learn Klingon: A Beginner's Guide class taught by Klingon instructor and cosplayer, DeyvID HolQIn.
  • Art Class: Create Your Universe relaxing and fun abstract class taught by Janice Sanborn.
  • "The League of Extraordinary Podcasters: Podcast Summit" hosted by Terry Lynn Shull of the G&T Show, featuring podcasts, internet radio, and audio plays. Producers, writers, editors, and voice actors will be there presenting, offering tips and demos, and hanging out.
  • Multiple Tabletop RPGs hosted by pro game designers and producers, Jesse Heinig and Tad Atkinson.
  • "Dr. Trek Presents" with Larry Nemecek of Trekland, Geek Nation Tours, The Con of Wrath, Stellar Cartography, and Star Trek Continues.
  • Cosplay Photography, Posing, and Etiquette Classes taught by Janice Sanborn.
  • Galaxy Quest Movie Screening Party
  • Con of Wrath Fundraiser Party
  • Other Classes: Costuming, Props, and Voice Acting.
  • See our Full Schedule of Activities as it updates Here!

CriteriCon Prequel's Rio Hotel Masquerade Suite - Room number will be announced closer to the event when the hotel assigns it to us.

"What's ALSO happening at the Rio this year?", they asked knowingly.

We scheduled CriteriCon: Prequel to coincide with another big convention happening at the same time and hotel - Star Trek Vegas (STLV). As long as we don't advertise within STLV, and respect the Rio's rules, we are clear to run our activities in our private room. We have already gotten the approval of the hotel, and reached out to STLV to offer collaboration opportunities, support, and to let them know we respect their rules. As we are also long-time attendees and supporters of STLV, we designed our activities to compliment their schedule - not compete. Our goal is to make this period of events as fun as possible for all attendees and special guests there.

Funding Extras

There are additional charges likely to incur such as WiFi, extra tables and chairs, audio and video equipment, and other hotel services and materials we need for our activities. Fully funding this campaign helps us accommodate our attendees, featured guests, scheduled activities, create an inspiring atmosphere, and gives us room to grow.

We can afford more space and media hookups to host more activities throughout each day at the Rio Hotel if we get additional funds.

Additional funds help us grow and continue our "traveling mini convention" model (inspired by our Prequel), as well as gets us striking out to find our set location for the full convention. We want to take CriteriCon's mini model to every convention that's interested in having us, and we also want to give a home to our annual full-size event.

Help us get a running start via our Prequel!

CriteriCon's Features - Growing us into 2017

We will feature games of all genres and kinds including Alternate Realty Gaming, Live Action Role Playing, Tabletop RPGs, board games, card games, and video games. New games will be play-tested, game designers will run special events, and everyone will have the chance to get involved with at least one of our CriteriCon Special ARG or LARP events where we will merge attendees with people from all over the world! We also want to host a murder mystery dinner!

We will have interactive panels and demos where the audience gets to participate and come away with resources or crafts. We will feature all aspects of production, from indie to big biz, covering development to distribution. Actors, voice actors, stunts people, costumers, FX makeup artists, props & sets designers, VFX and digital artists, sound designers, musicians, writers, modeling & photography instructors, programmers, graphic designers, puppeteers and creature creators, business start-up & union advisors, and more will be there!

We will have exciting and unique entertainment including interactive shows and other performances such as dance, comedy, music, magic, and tech. We will also have costume and craft shows where you get to display creations and even win awards. We will hold special events featuring celebrity performances and mixers, exciting bands, high tea afternoons, and themed dinners.

Our Exhibitor Hall will feature creators and performers in every way possible. We have an optional interactive game event planned that will encourage attendees to check out as many presenters as they can at their booths or events, rewarding everyone in the process. Check out our Hopper Card concept below!

Our Badge and Hopper Card - We are combining our badge with a reward system that ties in with our Exhibitor Hall interactive game event. You get a special sticker and reward for visiting a certain number of specific events or booths, and your Hopper Card will reflect this collection of signatures per visit. This helps our presenters get more focus and intimate opportunities to share their creations with our attendees, making it fun for everyone to participate.

Special Guests & Events - We plan to add more special guests and celebrities, games, interactive events, entertainment, and extras! Already we have a number of exciting, talented and well-known people interested in joining us and presenting or performing in a panel, and we need your help to bring them to Critericon! Do you like John Barrowman? Doug Jones? Charlie Cox? Rosario Dawson? Adrienne Wilkinson? Gigi Edgley? Peter Dinklage? Elvira? Dr. Demento? Doug Drexler? Renee O'Connor? Lex Rudd? Grant Imahara? Do you want us to bring your favorite artist or actor onto the stage or into an interactive demo? Let us know and please support us! We want to make this amazing for you!

CriteriCon 1 2017 (Annual Full Convention Goal), the first full convention set to happen in San Jose, California, local to the creator, Adrianne Grady. She has been developing connections with other local conventions and businesses that she supports, and working to make the community as strong as possible.

Adrianne Grady has been working in art, entertainment, construction, tech, and games all of her life. She often consults for, trains others in, performs in, and helps to develop productions such as live shows, movies, webseries, TV shows, commercials, webseries, interactive theatre, and gaming events.

She created the first west-coast Live Action Roleplay (LARP) Con, co-created Wyrd Con, and co-created the non-profit company, LARP Alliance Inc., which immensely helped to grow the LARP and interactive theatre community by providing staff, tools, education, training, promotion, game rules and mechanics development, social and business networks, and events.

She helped to develop and run the annual Labyrinth of Jareth Masquerade Ball and Sypher Art Studios in SoCal for nearly 14 years. She traveled to Romania and helped to promote and assist the first International Dracula Festival at Corvin Castle with Dacre Stoker and Romanian Treasures Travel. She has worked with many big conventions on the West Coast, theatres, films, amusement parks, and eSports competitions building sets, performing, assisting VIPs, running booths, and helping with sales, production, art, sound, and tech.

Her band, Invocation Array, produced original music for, and licensed music to Trion World's MMO game, ArcheAge, ESL/Intel's AnyKey organization, and various indie films and games. Her band has also produced a number of music videos and are currently working on their second album. With only a team of two (Adrianne and her bandmate Kaia Young of The Luna Sequence), they design, film, promote, write, and produce all of their work.

Adrianne is also a voice actor on a number of games including ArcheAge, Star Trek Online, and Neverwinter. On the side, she consults for and voice acts on podcasts and audioplays, designs and runs LARP and RPG games, and roams cons in character and cosplay.

Her goal with CriteriCon is to take what she's learned from previous ventures and experiences and create a high-quality production with great ethics and the ability to support independent artists, writers, and creators.



Rewards stack unless they say otherwise. That means that contributing to a higher tier will get you those rewards and those beneath it. We are considering adding stretch goals as well, with additional perks to those who have contributed already, and you can help us get there by selecting a reward tier.

Risks and Challenges

We're determined to hold our mini-schedule of activities this year in our private room (as our interactive business card and prequel), and we are driven to make this a full convention as well in 2017. But without funding assistance, it will take far longer to get our convention running, get a great venue booked, get solid resources, special guests, and to grow or even branch out. Contributing to CriteriCon gets you involved immediately, even if you can't attend right away, and by doing so, you also contribute to helping us support other independent businesses and artists all over. We plan to run a traveling smaller version of our convention as often as possible, even if we can't run a big one, and we plan to take it to different conventions all over the world. We need your help here, not only to do this, but to establish a base of operation, a full convention, and to be able to branch out in the future. If you want CriteriCon closer to you, or to keep running, then we need your help. So far, we've put our personal funds into this and we can only go for so long without support. We will hold to our promises if we are able to complete this campaign successfully, and we will still continue to support the causes we believe in and help others in their endeavors.

Possible space overflow: We may experience a surge of interest in our schedule of events over the course of the 5 days we are running our Prequel at the Rio Hotel. In the case where we run out of room for people to fit safely in our suite per event/activity, we will host more than one of these during the day in order to accommodate those who wish to participate. As we are competing for hotel space at this venue, during this particular time of the year, we would need to raise a significant amount in order to secure additional rooms or space in the area. Whether or not that happens, we will be doing our best to utilize our large suite, and will be talking with others who have offered to donate their room space for overflow or additional activities.

We ask for your help in making this as awesome as possible. We have a lot of fun and unique activities planned for everyone and we'd love to make them come alive!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Contact us with suggestions, questions, and let us know if you want to join our team!

Her band, Invocation Array,
 produced original music for, and licensed music to Trion World's MMO 
game, ArcheAge, ESL/Intel's AnyKey organization, and various indie films
 and games. Her band has also produced a number of music videos and are 
currently working on their second album. With only a team of two 
(Adrianne and her bandmate Kaia Young of The Luna Sequence), they 
design, film, promote, write, and produce all of their work. 
Adrianne
 is also a voice actor on a number of games including ArcheAge, Star 
Trek Online, and Neverwinter. On the side, she consults for and voice 
acts on podcasts and audioplays, designs and runs LARP and RPG games, 
and roams cons in character and cosplay.
Her goal with CriteriCon
 is to take what she's learned from previous ventures and experiences 
and create a high-quality production with great ethics and the ability 
to support independent artists, writers, and creators.
















Rewards stack unless they say otherwise. That means that contributing to
 a higher tier will get you those rewards and those beneath it. We are 
considering adding stretch goals as well, with additional perks to those
 who have contributed already, and you can help us get there by 
selecting a reward tier.Risks and Challenges

We're determined to hold our mini-schedule of activities this year in
 our private room (as our interactive business card and prequel), and we
 are driven to make this a full convention as well in 2017. But without 
funding assistance, it will take far longer to get our convention 
running, get a great venue booked, get solid resources, special guests, 
and to grow or even branch out. Contributing to CriteriCon gets you 
involved immediately, even if you can't attend right away, and by doing 
so, you also contribute to helping us support other independent 
businesses and artists all over. We plan to run a traveling smaller 
version of our convention as often as possible, even if we can't run a 
big one, and we plan to take it to different conventions all over the 
world. We need your help here, not only to do this, but to establish a 
base of operation, a full convention, and to be able to branch out in 
the future. If you want CriteriCon closer to you, or to keep running, 
then we need your help. So far, we've put our personal funds into this 
and we can only go for so long without support. We will hold to our 
promises if we are able to complete this campaign successfully, and we 
will still continue to support the causes we believe in and help others 
in their endeavors. 
Possible space overflow: We may experience a surge of interest in our
 schedule of events over the course of the 5 days we are running our 
Prequel at the Rio Hotel. In the case where we run out of room for 
people to fit safely in our suite per event/activity, we will host more 
than one of these during the day in order to accommodate those who wish 
to participate. As we are competing for hotel space at this venue, 
during this particular time of the year, we would need to raise a 
significant amount in order to secure additional rooms or space in the 
area. Whether or not that happens, we will be doing our best to utilize 
our large suite, and will be talking with others who have offered to 
donate their room space for overflow or additional activities.
We ask for your help in making this as awesome as possible. We have a
 lot of fun and unique activities planned for everyone and we'd love to 
make them come alive!
 Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Contact us with suggestions, questions, and let us know if you want to join our team!

story:
About St Faith's High School's Website

St Faith's High School, Rusape Zimbabwe,  is one of the top schools in the country.  The school has enrolled students from all walks of life and of different socioeconomic classes who have  turned out to be noteworthy citizens in Zimbabwe and abroad. St Faith's is a big name in Zimbabwe. However,  the school has zero online presence. The alumni, from all over the world,  cannot click to connect to Fisco. We are building the online home for FISCO. Complete with a fully fledged social network for the alumni to connect and help the school in  any way they can. We are going to contract a developer who will travel to St Faith's, take pictures, record videos, interview stakeholders, train students and teachers on how to maintain and update the website, and then develop a state of the art website for a school that means so much to us. To expect anyone to do this major project pro bono, is a bit unrealistic. This is a big job, and we need current and authentic content. This is why we are reaching out for well wishers. 

  • My name is Francis Chapuredima(Chapu) and I went to St Faith's from 1995 - 2001.
  • This campaign seeks to raise funds for the development of the school website.
  • Your contributions will further help raising the flag high for St Faith's High School.

How can you help? 

Here is what we need:

  • We need US$2000. Here is what it will be for: A school domain name. An SSL server to run the system. A fully fledged, self sustaining website that will showcase the school to the world, including the full history, archives, a Wiki where anyone can write about the school, sports results in real time, including photos. Enrollment information, results, timetables and anything and everything that might need to be showcased. The site will also act as a gateway to the world, for students to be known for where they are coming from. We will also create an extensive marketing campaign for the system so other schools can connect to it.
  • What you get, well, for your contribution, we offer full access to the system, the ability to connect with former peers and the ability to create your own online store where you can sell anything that students need, at a fraction of the normal. 
  • If we don't reach our desired goal, the funds will be used to develop part of the system, and the rest of the system will be developed as we go along.
  • If you cannot donate here please use Ecocash +263772902108 (Tafadzwa Mukoyi)
  • If you would like to use other ways to donate please reach Francis: +97477858233(Whatsapp)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant help financially, we urge you to help in any way you can:

  • Please make some noise about this campaign to your connections and your former peers.
  • Share out campaign link to all your social networks for a more thunderous impact.

LET US PUT FISCO ONLINE.

story:
Karim's been working incredibly hard this year, juggling a job with PIH and its Ebola response with a full-time class load and family responsibilities. We've managed to cobble the funds together for his tuition thus far, and the end is now in sight! Karim has one more year, and tuition--all inclusive--will be $1950. Let's alleviate his stress and worry and get this guy a BSc in Business Management !

Karim's in his final year of college in Freetown, and poised for a great job with PIH or another NGO upon graduating. His life has been transformed by his education, and he's thrilled about finishing up with a specialty in operations and logistics. The financially precarious situation he's been in for the past couple years has been enormously stressful and taken a toll on his health and focus--it would be a huge relief to have the tuition funds paid at the beginning of the school year for him to finish up strong!

story: For eleven years, our work in bringing Chicago history to natives, tourists, students of every age and seniors across the region was well known by our "ghost bus"--the tricked-out black school bus that let everyone know we were out there bringing Chicago's history to anyone who wanted to learn about the city we love.  Sadly, after so many years of running our beloved bus almost every night, even through Chicago winters, we were forced to put her out to pasture, giving her to a dear friend in the paranormal as a team bus.  For the past two years we have been renting charter buses to run our tours, field trips and senior excursions, essentially giving away a over a fourth of our income just to provide buses to run our tours.  We've also had to turn away many low income schools, nursing homes and senior groups who we used to provide free tours or at-cost tours to because we can't afford to cover the bus rentals.  As most of you know, we are a "mom and pop" business--literally--with mom and dad running the company straight through from the beginning, raising our two girls, now teenagers.  Despite our ever-growing business,  record thirteen years in the business and accolades from all over the country, our monthly bus rentals are through the roof, causing us to run fewer tours and preventing us from offering very low or no cost tours to needy schools and groups.   Securing our own bus would again help us run less costly tours, operate more field trips and senior trips at dramatically lower cost to kids and seniors.  Won't you help us regain our ability to provide more tours to more students, seniors, tourists and natives at lower cost and with more autonomy? Check out our incentives.  If you love history and the paranormal and are in the Chicago area, we are offering deeply discounted group tours and even ticket pairs for our supporters! If you can't contribute or don't want to book a private or public tour, won't you please keep our efforts in your prayers?  Thank you so much for your support!

Check out our incentives.  If you love history and the paranormal and are in the Chicago area, we are offering deeply discounted group tours and even ticket pairs for our supporters! If you can't contribute or don't want to book a private or public tour, won't you please keep our efforts in your prayers?  Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Here’s the EXCITING Scoop

Here's two new projects longing to get out to YOU and YOUR FAMILY to help YOU be the best that you can be —

  • Successfully intimate.
  • Cognitively bright.
  • And with a healthy gut to achieve unstoppable wellness!

1. First is my new book and online course — SEXY BRAIN: How Sizzling Intimacy and Balanced Hormones Prevent Alzheimer’s, Cancer, Depression And Divorce

Nature is all about the next generation, even with intimacy!

Nature put pleasure into hugging, cuddling, and orgasms for a reason. To protect your brain. Healthier parents make for happier, more stable families. Sex is supposed to be brain-gasmic. This means filled with ecstasy and brain-boosting power. But you have to know what you are doing.

Just like you can't sit down in front of a piano and magically become an amazing musician, fabulous brain-boosting intimacy needs to be learned. This book introduces a science-based intimacy skill set called the  "hormone language of love."

I am a hormone scholar. I have worked with the top scientists studying and publishing data on everything surrounding hormones. I show how estrogen and testosterone are hard-wired in their deepest biology. I translate the amazing differences between these hormones into what happens in your conversations, therapist’s office, but most importantly, in your bedroom. Understanding the “hormone language of love” will help you achieve amazing brain-boosting sex and the tools to make love stay.

The book will launch along with a 6-week intimacy online course. A sizzling power point will show with great illustrations the mesmerizing understanding of how and why it’s so challenging for men and women to understand each other. And love each other. And have the kind of orgasms that can bathe our brains in intelligence.

I share information never before presented. The scientist Dr. Michael Baker kindly shared with me his not yet published data on how estrogen and testosterone signaling first evolved. This shows you why the Mars/Venus dance can be so exasperating, but gives you the know-how to make it easy and delicious.

Parents can hand this book to their young adults who are about to get married, with peace of mind that it will give them a better chance at happiness, and decrease their risk of divorce.

The online course will be for practitioners, coaches and regular folk, but no one under 18 years old.

2. My other new project is called DIGESTIVE FREEDOM: Eat Your Way To Intestinal Wellness, an online certification course for professionals (and smart patients). This provides natural answers for diverse gut disorders, and many protocols not yet know by most experts.

This is a sequel to my book Healthy Digestion The Natural Way, which was the first gut/nutrition/mind book on the market, and successfully sold for over 20 years. Digestive Freedom now takes gut health further. It introduces the much needed new genre of Nutritional Gastroenterology.

Digestive Freedom  also introduces the unappreciated role of hormones and the gut. I share my personal strategic, safe, and science-based hormone protocols for inflammatory bowel disease and other gut disorders. This information how some colons can be spared from surgeries.

Digestive Freedom (the course and ultimately the 600 page reference book) is filled with firsts. For example, I share a new scientific understanding of how estrogen is produced in the stomach! And how this helps the liver and gallbladder detox. If the liver is fatty or ill, if the gallbladder has stones or has been removed, this estrogen is then shunted mainstream. I help you know what do to about it.

I tell you how normal pregnancies can damage healthy digestive cells and how to identify and fix this. I show how parathyroid issues can be linked to grabbing for an acid blocker. I share foods that fight pathogens better than some meds, proven in randomized trials. I show how glaucoma may be linked to an intestinal infection. And more!

Digestive Freedom starts out as a 6-month certification course for practitioners (MDs, NDs, DCs, health coaches, and more) and ultimately made into a 600-page reference book so many can benefit from this information for years to come. This book is almost ready for the editor. But it is so large and in-depth that the formatting and indexing will take about ¼ of a year to finish and cost about $9000 just for these actions.

My kids —

I could not have children due to a drug my mother was given when pregnant with me.

Thus, my books and projects are my children and legacies.

Help me birth them!

COSTS —

I've already written 18 books—some best-sellers, some out of print, and some still selling. I now want to own all stages of my projects to avoid the growing complexity of the publishing industry.

The costs for editing, formatting, indexing, and cover art for both these projects and courses are huge. SEXY BRAIN will cost about $15,000 to get out there and DIGESTIVE FREEDOM in it’s scope, the first of it’s kind ever so purpose driven and written, will be about double that.

BACKSTORY

I already had to put almost $20,000 into just getting the rights to write and create the online digestive course!

Wiley & Sons published Healthy Digestion in 2000. It sold solidly and is used by the prestigious American Academy of Anti-Aging Medicine as the authority in natural protocols to heal gut health. This group is the largest training institution for functional MDs in over 120 countries.

Wiley then sold all their trade books, including mine, to another company that basically buried it. Two years ago I had to buy my book back for almost $20,000 in order to update and republish it!

I had already honed and used the concepts in this book to reboot my own health as well as the health of thousands of my clients over my 40+ years in practice.  For years I was seriously ill and was told by many doctors that I would never be well. I spent a year in bed . . . until I discovered the amazing healing abilities of strategic hormone balancing, nutrition, and rebooting the gut.

Healing pearl after healing pearl will be in the course and the books!

  • You will learn exact detoxes to reboot receptor function that our toxic environment is damaging.
  • You will learn why and how testosterone can only “take” compared to estrogen and how this translates into sex.
  • You will learn how to treat even recurrent diverticulitis without antibiotics and the scientific articles that even your gastroenterologist doesn’t know.
  • You will learn that more fiber protects the gut from diverticuli is a myth.
  • You will learn what daily task can paralyze your lipoprotein lipase enzymes that line all your digestive organs, and what to do about it.

All this amazing natural set of NEW and SAFE and EXCITING factoids will be available to the practitioners that heal you, and ultimately for your own home reference library.

I am asking for only $22,000, although the actual costs are higher.

Why I need these funds —

  • The scope of both books and courses and the brand new information is enormous and has taken much time and money.
  • I took off much of the last few years to write these courses and books.
  • I bought the rights to Healthy Digestion.
  • I have already paid over $6000 in editing alone for SEXY BRAIN and now it is ready for formatting, indexing and marketing.
  • So I need your help to get them OUT to the public.

Those who know my work, know I write game-changing books.

Examples are —

  • Hormone Deception: One of the first books on endocrine-disrupting compounds in the environment.
  • Natural Answers For Women's Health: The only female reference book on 225 conditions and how they relate to hormones, food, and nutrition.
  • Safe Hormones, Smart Women: One of the breakthrough books on the safety and need for bioidentical hormone replacement.

Help me help you! 

Dr. Devaki Lindsey Berkson 

Austin, TX

Click here for foreword of Digestive Freedom by David Brownstein MD

Click here for advance praise, table of contents and forewords for SEXY BRAIN

Click here for my expanded vitae

story:
Historia (www.HistoriaMediaGroup.com) is set to revolutionize our view of world history. Historia’s vast and unique digital archive of over 14,000 + original high quality maps depict worldwide sequential timeline historic events and will be made available for the first time online at www.Maporia.com. Each map tells a graphic story that would take thousands of words to explain.

Historia’s maps reflect the dynamic sweep of world history, from prehistoric migrations to 21st-century conflicts. These high quality maps cover a vast array of topics and themes, some of them played out on the world stage, others at a more localized scale: from transcontinental trade routes, conquests and empires to the evolution of historic cities and the development of individual nation states.

(This Map shows the Migration Of Homo Sapiens, please visit our website www.HistoriaMediaGroup.com  to see this map (as well as many other high quality informative maps) in greater detail ... we have "zoomed" in on Africa and copy it below)  


All of these unique high quality maps are supported by concise explanatory narrative with suggested links to other maps in the archive. This well-designed, easy-to-navigate online super "one stop" resource will provide not only an unrivaled unique high quality map archive but one which is not available anywhere else in the world. This in-depth super archive resource will provide new horizons and 21st century learning and delivery opportunities, for global education establishments, lecturers, academics, teachers, researchers, students, global businesses, news /media organizations, and other interested individuals and organizations.

              


Historia has numerous "Letters Of Intent" from world institutions each one of which have confirmed their wish to Subscribe to Historia's online portal and thereby access the digital Map Archive. Some of the institutions that have produced Letters Of Intent are

  • Princeton University
  • Massachusetts Institute of Technology
  • US Navy Officer Training Postgraduate School
  • Oxford University
  • Cambridge University
  • British Ministry Of Defence
  • University College, Cork, Ireland

With the online education market expected to top $4 trillion a year within 5 years, Historia / Maporia will be well placed to expand into this marketplace, and deliver highly accurate, detailed and informative maps that help expand a user’s knowledge base in ways never before seen and change the way History, Political Sciences, Geography and many other subjects are taught worldwide.

Quality education and knowledge is a great factor in correctly directing our future generations across the globe. By providing quality and factual material and information, education enhances the way as citizens of the world, we interact with each other and our planet in a respectful humane way.


Malcolm Swanston, FRGS (www.MalcolmSwanston.com), one of the founders of Historia, is a cartographic innovator, with a gifted ability to translate world historical events, accurately, into highly informative, high quality, maps. He has spent over forty years creating historical themed maps and publications of excellence, many of which have been used as reference material. All of these maps are now in digital format.

Malcolm created the maps for the ground-breaking Times Atlas of World History, which has been published in 18 languages and sold millions of copies in many countries. He went on to create many more titles for Times Books and thematic atlases for the international co-editions market. Malcolm’s recent atlases have been published by Oxford University Press, Hachette, Henry Holt Inc., and many more. The latest – Restless Empire – was published by Harvard University Press in 2015. In recognition of his lifelong work of academic excellence Malcolm attained a Fellowship of the Royal Geographical Society, London in 2014.

A Google Search of Malcolm Swanston Maps, or Malcolm Swanston Books returns an incredible list of map works and books that Malcolm has been involved with either through direct production or consultation on, and a whole host of positive book reviews; a true example of academic and map excellence.

Over the next few months Malcolm, and his team supported by a handpicked selection of world-renowned academics will be reviewing, organizing, categorizing the digital archive, and integrating the maps into the portal, in preparation for the launch of Maporia.com.

(This Map Shows the Streets of Medieval London c1350, and can be seen in greater detail on www.HistoriaMediaGroup.com ... again we have "zoomed" in and copy a section below)



This 14,000 + strong digital Map Archive has never been released before. This high quality vast collection of digital maps is not only unique and unrivaled, but there is no similar collection anywhere in the world.

This vast unique unrivaled high quality 14,000 + map collection will provide new horizons and 21st century learning and delivery opportunities for global education establishments, lecturers, academics, teachers, researchers, students, global businesses, news /media organizations, other interested individuals and organizations and nothing remotely similar exists in the world and therefore Historia regularly receives contact from Academia enquiring when this archive will be released.



Many of these maps have never been released, and those that have, have been designed with different publications in mind and are all tailored to be viewed slightly differently. As a result of this, there needs to be a unification process before the maps are all uploaded into the Interactive Map Portal, Maporia; all Fonts need to be of the same type, all rivers the same color, all land needs to be colored the same etc.

Furthermore, narrative needs to be added to a number of maps, and each map needs to be uploaded in a specific way to allow the maps to be easily searchable, with different search terms in mind, for example

  • Location
  • Time Period
  • Map Type (Battle, Economic, Migration, Religious etc.)
  • Map Matter (Tanks, Aircraft, Buildings, Humans etc.)


Historia’s Maps should not be confused with map archives which have been constituted by scanning very old maps produced in the 18th, 19th and 20th century. As commendable and of importance as they are because of their production over the past 200 years ago or so; the very limited methods and technology available in those times means that they are all low quality in design, content, and additionally, have degenerated over time. They do no load well on a computer screen and are difficult to interpret. Historia’s maps are produced in very high quality, vivid colours, and are all digitised using the latest state of the art technology.



Historia requires $5M to fund the digital map unification process, including office rental, staff, as well as all associated office  IT and computer costs. This major unification process will take approximately 25 Digital Graphic specialists and Cartographers, a handful of editors with a substantial knowledge of history as well as the associated admin and support staff. This is expected to take approximately a year due to the sheer size of the 14,000 + map archive. Therefore the funding will be used for

  • the building of the highly sophisticated and secure Interactive Portal that will enable the maps to be searched efficiently, smoothly and in a user friendly manner;
  • establishing a sales and marketing team with multi linguistic abilities to promote the subscription packages on offer on a global basis;
  • and enable the company to grow and develop its multiple income sources after launch, without income until at least 6 months after formal completion of the unification process. It is realistically expected that the first income will be received in months 2 - 3 following the launch;

Should Historia not receive the full requirement of $5M, there are multiple different alternative sources for funding that can be reached out to. These include both equity and borrowing. For obvious reasons these are not the preferred method of funding.



Maporia.com will be a highly interactive, easy to use and smooth interface that will allow the user to access over 14,000 themed maps and “journey through time around the world”.

The user will be presented with an interactive map view of the globe or a flat map. The interactive map will enable the user to move their mouse over various regions of the world, or to rotate the globe. The user will be able to zoom in and out of the interactive map; this will form a large part of the screen.

As the user moves their mouse over the various regions, a vertical ‘stack’ of maps will appear on the page next to a vertical timeline, offering the user a chance to select a map from a specific time in history. If the user was to move over France, for example, they would be presented with maps referring to French historical topics, for example Napoleonic campaigns, WWI and WWII, amongst many others. As the user selects from the vertical stack of maps the selected map would move forward and become the main screen item.

If a user so chooses, they would be able to navigate further into a particular map area; so if they wished to focus on the Pacific Ocean in the 1940's they would be offered maps of the Pearl Harbor Attack, the whole Pacific Theater Campaign, as well as many others.


(Again, we have "zoomed" in and copy a section below)



Users will also have the ability to see a ‘heat map’ of the interactive map, whereby the user will be able to select a time in history and the interactive map ‘glows’ to indicate map coverage. If, for example, a user wanted to know what maps were available for the 1940s, then Europe, Russia, North Africa and the Pacific Ocean would glow vividly to indicate that maps were available.

Maps on the Maporia Portal will be "Geo Aware" i.e. a map of an event in Northern France will be placed in the Portal in such a way that the Portal will "know" that the map is in Northern France,  This Geo Awareness will mean that if a user was operating the Maporia Portal on their Handheld device with Location Services Activated, then as a user moved physically around a landscape, e.g. on the D Day Beaches, then the Maporia Portal would indicate the Users exact location with respect to that Map within the Portal; giving a truly interactive experience for the User.

Each map will be accompanied by explanatory text and users will also be given the opportunity to purchase books based on the map topic selected. This would be routed through an affiliate basis with another web site: for example, a user viewing a map of the Normandy Invasion would be presented with an option specifically relating to purchasing books about the Normandy Invasion/WW II etc. The user would be directed to a website such as Amazon, and Historia would receive commission on every book sale that took place from that referral.



With each map there will be

  • Explanatory Text
  • Related Maps
  • Related Books
  • A Chat Forum to discuss the map and associated events

Within this Forum there will be communities of users discussing particular events in History across the world from each other, the world’s first dedicated online interchange of Map Information and History. There will be users returning to particular maps time and time again to exchange information and learn in unison.

The “Facebook” of the Academic World.



Historia will be receiving income from the following sources

  • Private Subscribers
  • Institutional Subscribers (Schools, Colleges, Universities, Government Departments, Research Organisations, News & Media Companies etc)
  • Advertising Income
  • Sponsorship Income
  • Affiliate Book Sales

Due to the very nature of the Portal having worldwide appeal and customers, it is expected that the business will have major interest from different companies around the world wishing to advertise on, and sponsor key historical events.



Once all of the maps have been unified and integrated into the Maporia Portal, the Cartographic Team will be working on the creation of new maps to continually enhance and develop the archive.
The archive will also be translated into other leading world languages to further elevate the offering and open up the resource to even more users worldwide.

There are also plans to add to the Portal in a way that would be ground breaking worldwide and open the attractiveness of Maporia to truly incredible levels both in content and user appetite; this however will be taking place approximately 12 months after full launch.



To raise funds to enable to unification process and all of the other matters set out above to take place, Historia are offering a number of different perks and opportunities including heavily discounted Advance Subscription Packages. Take up of these will raise the funds required and give those that take part in the perk purchases the unique opportunity to support the worthwhile endeavors of Historia in improving worldwide knowledge and education for future generations.


("Zooming" in again):



Professor Malise Ruthven

After earning a MA in English Literature at Cambridge University, Malise worked as a scriptwriter at the BBC Arabic and World Service and as a consultant on Middle Eastern affairs. He earned his PhD in social and political sciences at Cambridge University. Having pursued a career as a writer, journalist and teacher, he focused his work on religion, fundamentalism and Islamic affairs.

As a journalist his work has appeared in The Sunday Times, The Guardian, The Observer, The New York Review of Books, for which he is a regular contributor and is widely respected, and for many other publications. In 2004 London’s Prospect magazine ranked Malise among the top 100 intellectuals in Britain.

Mark Carnes

Mark has been an academic, teacher and writer since the mid-1970s, gaining his degree at Harvard College in History (magna cum laude). He gained his PhD at Columbia University. Since then he has held Professorships at Columbia University, becoming Chair of American Studies, 1988–89, 1991, 1995–96 and 2000–01.

Among his professional appointments are: General Editor of American National Biography, 2001–09; Executive Board of the Society of American Historians, 1991–2009 and 2012 to present; Executive Director of the Reacting History Consortium, 2013 to present.

Mark’s published works include: The American Nation, Longman, New York; American Destiny: a Narrative of a Nation, Penguin, New York; Mapping America’s Past, Henry Holt, New York; The Historical Atlas of the United States, Routledge, New York. His contributions to the editing of the Library of American Biography include the lives of Sitting Bull, Franklin D.Roosevelt and Ronald Reagan.

Professor Dominic Leiven

Professor Dominic Leiven joined the London School of Economics in 1978, became a Professor in 1998 and a Fellow of the British Academy in 2001. He is a graduate of Cambridge University and was a Kennedy Scholar at Harvard. Subsequently he has been inter-alia a Humbolt fellow in Germany and a Visiting Professor at Tokyo and Harvard. He is now Professor of History at Trinity College, Cambridge.

John Mann

After studying languages at Oxford he did Post-Graduate courses in the History and Philosophy of Science at Oxford and the School of Oriental and African Studies, London. He trained as a journalist with the International Press Agency, Reuters. John later edited the part-work The History of the 20th Century, published by Purnells, London, later joining Time Life Books becoming European Editor.

In the 1990s John worked closely with Transworld Publishing writing the acclaimed bestseller Genghis Khan: Life, Death and Resurrection. Among his other books are: The Terracotta Army, The Great War and Xanadu (on Marco Polo). His latest book –The Mongol Empire – will be published by Transworld Publishing in 2014.


(To "Zoom" in and look at some of the countries Dates Of Independence in the Square White Blocks)



Malcolm Swanston, Cartographic Director

www.MalcolmSwanston.com

Fergal Tobin, Non-Executive Chairman

Publisher and author based in Dublin, Ireland. For more than 25 years, until his retirement in 2013, he was Publishing Director of Gill & McMillan, Ireland’s oldest and largest publishing house. He is currently Consultant Editor to Irish Times Books and is involved in fund raising for a literature support organization. He lectures at Post-Graduate level on the business and practice of publishing as well as on English grammar and usage.

Charles Oates, Managing Director

Charles has spent the greater part of his working life involved in different high value businesses both in a Chief Executive and investor capacity. These have included family businesses and also in partnership with others in strategic ownership / part ownership of both private and public companies, both nationally and internationally.

Types of business have included: service, property, media, finance, manufacturing, metals, minerals, medical, leisure and technology. He has detailed knowledge of M&A, arbitrage, corporate acquisitions, and corporate finance.

Gary Hall, Operations Director

After graduating from Christ Church, Oxford University with a BA (Hons) in Mathematics, he started with a Financial Services Group. He worked as a Senior Underwriter, risk assessing and processing finance applications not only on a brokering basis, but also overseeing the lending of the company’s own funds. His role progressed into advising on Regulatory Issues and providing full operational relief to the Directors as and when required. Over the last 10 years, he has been involved as COO within a number of diverse sectors, from Online Gambling / Gaming to providing Man Power services in Scandinavia for the Oil & Gas Industries. Gary has also operated in a Freelance Management Consultancy Role offering Advice and Direction to businesses Internationally.

Kevin McCay, Finance Director

Kevin is a member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales since 1976. Kevin was senior partner in his own practice; De La Wyche Baker Ltd from 1982 to 2003. The practice was sold to Bennett Verby thereby allowing two of his partners to retire. The firm had clients in Northern Ireland, Belgium, Holland, Germany, France and Spain. In 2003 he was appointed director of the company which bought the practice, Bennett Verby, with full responsibility to run the business on behalf of the buyers. Kevin has extensive experience of; company acquisitions and disposals, strategic financial and tax planning for corporate clients and high net worth individuals.

Liz Wyse, Senior Editor

Writer, editor and Project Manager with extensive experience in the publishing industry. Liz has worked on a wide range of titles, from historical atlases for Times Books and contemporary thematic atlases for Dorling Kindersley, Reader’s Digest and Myriad Editions, to childrens’ encyclopaedias and historical reference books for the major English and American University Presses. She was also responsible for the launch of the new Debrett’s website (www.debretts.com) and promoting it on Twitter and other social media.

Steve Kaye, Senior Technical Consultant

Steve has worked for 38 years in the IT industry in a number of roles: 23 years of Board experience, three as CEO, two as Chairman and one year as Commercial Director. He has managed sales targets up to £50m, founded several new IT concerns successfully with little or no investment, and grew Elyzium Limited to a £6.8m company and successfully took it into a merger creating a £20m organization with ambitious growth potential.

Steve has developed cloud based solutions to assist in the migration of on premise software and data to the 'public' cloud. He has also overseen the sale, implementation of, teaching and support of Google Apps for Business, ESNAtech cloud based telephony systems and other communication and collaboration tools.


Notes

We hope that you have enjoyed looking over the six distinct maps within this thread, and remind you that we have 14,000 + maps!

If a reader was to look at 6 maps a day, 365 days a year, from our collection, it would take the reader well over 6 years to view every one.


All maps in this thread and on our websites are subject to the Copyright of Historia.

and unique digital archive of over 14,000 + original high quality maps depict worldwide
sequential timeline historic events and will be made available for the first time
online at www.Maporia.com. Each map tells a graphic story that would take thousands
of words to explain.
Historia’s maps reflect the dynamic sweep of world history, from
prehistoric migrations to 21st-century conflicts. These high quality maps cover
a vast array of topics and themes, some of them played out on the world stage,
others at a more localized scale: from transcontinental trade routes, conquests
and empires to the evolution of historic cities and the development of
individual nation states.






(This Map shows the Migration Of Homo Sapiens, please visit our website www.HistoriaMediaGroup.com  to see this map (as well as many other high quality informative maps) in greater detail ... we have "zoomed" in on Africa and copy it below)

of these unique high quality maps are supported by concise explanatory

one which is not available anywhere else in the world. This in-depth super
archive resource will provide new horizons and 21st century learning and
delivery opportunities, for global education establishments, lecturers,
academics, teachers, researchers, students, global businesses, news /media
organizations, and other interested individuals and organizations.

retire. The firm had clients in Northern Ireland, Belgium, Holland, Germany,
France and Spain. In 2003 he was appointed director of the company which bought
the practice, Bennett Verby, with full responsibility to run the business on
behalf of the buyers. Kevin has extensive experience of; company acquisitions
and disposals, strategic financial and tax planning for corporate clients and
high net worth individuals.
Liz Wyse, Senior Editor
Writer, editor and Project Manager with
extensive experience in the publishing industry. Liz has worked on a wide range
of titles, from historical atlases for Times Books and contemporary thematic atlases
for Dorling Kindersley, Reader’s Digest and Myriad Editions, to childrens’
encyclopaedias and historical reference books for the major English and
American University Presses. She was also responsible for the launch of the new
Debrett’s website (www.debretts.com) and
promoting it on Twitter and other social media.
Steve Kaye, Senior Technical Consultant
Steve has worked for 38 years
in the IT industry in a number of roles: 23 years of Board experience, three as
CEO, two as Chairman and one year as Commercial Director. He has managed sales
targets up to £50m, founded several new IT concerns successfully with little or
no investment, and grew Elyzium Limited to a £6.8m company and successfully
took it into a merger creating a £20m organization with ambitious growth
potential.
Steve has developed cloud based solutions
to assist in the migration of on premise software and data to the 'public'
cloud. He has also overseen the sale, implementation of, teaching and support
of Google Apps for Business, ESNAtech cloud based telephony systems and other
communication and collaboration tools.

Notes


We hope that you have enjoyed looking over the six distinct
maps within this thread, and remind you that we have 14,000 + maps! 
If a reader was to look at 6 maps a day, 365 days a year, from our collection,
it would take the reader well over 6 years to view every one.

All maps in this thread and on our websites are subject to the Copyright of Historia.

story:
LGBTQ entrepreneurs should never have to choose between the closet and their career.

Almost every LGBTQ entrepreneur has encountered difficulties accessing key resources needed to advance their business. That includes a lack of visible role models, an inability to locate mentors, or being denied critical funding solely because of their sexual orientation or gender identity. As Blendoor's founder Stephanie Lampkin states:

"So clearly I’m the model diversity hire: black, gay, woman… but I’ve still faced many challenges in being taken seriously as an engineer. So it was important for me to build an app and be representative of a different type of tech CEO. StartOut has recognized that."

In 2009, StartOut was founded to provide these missing resources and connect LGBTQ entrepreneurs. Since then, we have become the leading national non-profit for LGBTQ entrepreneurs and our friends and allies. We are organizing over 70 in-person events this year alone, but in only six cities in the U.S. Thus, we are very excited to launch the StartOut Community online and to connect LGBTQ entrepreneurs — no matter where you live. To provide the tools for more member-to-member engagement and accelerate your success, we are building a brand new platform.

StartOut's goal is to create jobs and prosperity for LGBTQ individuals and the local communities where they contribute, and be recognized and respected for those efforts. That's where you come in: we need your support to get there.

The goals of this campaign are twofold: to raise funds to launch our online community and programs; and to encourage broad engagement among LGBTQ entrepreneurs.  More specifically, your contributions will help us to:

  • Connect LGBTQ entrepreneurs beyond our six chapter cities, 24/7 and wherever you live, on your phone or laptop.
  • Showcase our members' successes and challenges, and the positive impact LGBTQ entrepreneurs have on society.
  • Cultivate a vibrant community of mentors and mentees to foster future success.
  • Connect entrepreneurs and potential investors on a secure platform.



Every project faces challenges, and as entrepreneurs, we love a challenge! Ours is to reach a large number of entrepreneurs and their supporters in cities and remote areas alike to build critical mass nationwide.

We are aiming to raise $30K to meet our goals. We trust you will find a contribution level that fits your pocketbook and your heart. The more we raise, the more programs we can fund, the more services we can provide to all of you, and the stronger our Community becomes.  Funds in excess of $30K will go toward accelerated expansion and more programming. 

Numbers matter and together, we can be a powerful group that deserves respect. Together we can change the way society views and experiences our contributions to local communities everywhere. You will find funding, a business partner, great business advice, and an awesome Community of like-minded individuals ready to support you.

 

We will publicize, with permission, our members’ entrepreneurial success stories and help change the conversation in communities everywhere. We just launched the first-of-its-kind study on the State of LGBT Entrepreneurship in the U.S.  Over time and thanks to your participation, we will measure and chronicle our Community's progress. There has never been a more important time to do this, given the charged political and social climate that exists today.

With a successful history of building and responsibly managing StartOut for seven years, we have assembled experienced partners, including the founders of gay.com/gay.net and Here Media, to support building a platform that elevates the outstanding voices of the LGBTQ community in the U.S. They are all intimately involved in launching this platform and are offering their time and experience to this project free of charge. 

Our community needs you now. We invite you to participate in our campaign and build a global network of LGBTQ people who are going to change the world.

Andres Wydler
Executive Director

Even if you're not in a position to support the campaign, you can still be an agent of change by sharing this page with your friends and co-workers! 

-----

We would like to thank our corporate partners for their generous and ongoing support of StartOut, the organization.  Your participation in this campaign will help us to augment our partners' commitments and build the StartOut online Community.

story:
NCSU Design Build 2016



The classroom will be used to compliment the large discovery/sensory garden that is being planted on site, helping a wide age group to understand the complex system of life going on in the garden.  

The garden shed will be used by the museum's landscape volunteers. Currently they are operating out of a small shed that they have outgrown. Unlike the previous shed, our proposed design will be larger, handicap accessible, and easily organized to fit larger groups of volunteers and more equipment. 

Our design is a simple parti of two concrete walls, with the shed tying the two together.  We will be using a Japanese charred wood technique (Yakisugi) on the garden shed. This naturally treats the wood against insects, weather, etc. for over 80 years!  Overhead is a leaf-like roof canopy that bends in the middle to create a channel that guides the water into a rain garden. This cleans the water before returning it to the water table.






We believe our design reflects a bold but simple elegance that will be a destination at the North Carolina Museum of Art. 


This studio is very fast paced, and requires 17 students to work together to make one finished product (a challenge to say the least). As these projects go, we are short on time and a bit over budget.


The money will be used to make sure we get this project done and done well. 

Quality materials: We want this building to stand the test of time! High quality materials make for a longer lasting building, however, they do cost more.

Training: We are not yet architects, and especially not construction workers, masons, landscape architects, or any other job it takes to build a building. But this is great training for when we become architects, so we will better understand how a job site works. 

Machinery: We have needed to rent machinery to facilitate the construction.

Safety: To make sure we are all safe on site, we have everything from hardhats, bug spray, sunscreen, water, and scaffolding. 

Logos of companies that wish to donate will be represented on the structure. 

We need donations ASAP, the studio ends on July 27th and the project is set to be due on July 29th. We'd love to have you visit our wonderful project after completion.

NCSU Design Build has a history of beautiful projects and ours will be no different. 

Thank you for your time and help. 
Any donation will be put to good use.

story:
Students! You have just one task: learning! This is what we would like to give you. A possibility to be more clever and help increase your qualifications. 

 


Teachers! You have also one task: teaching! And what do we want to give you? A possibility to earn money comfortable from your house.  


You did not have too much good chance to take part in a good online learning course or teach online  

                                               UNTIL NOW!               

We have brought you our new webpage and Mobile application where you are able to learn anything and teach what you can.


                        

If you want to start this business with us as one of the first member, you will be able to join us as a student or as a teacher or both of them. 


If you join as a student you will be able to learn everything what you want. You will find on the webpage 2 learning possibility. 

1. Individual : It means that you have a teacher who teaches when you have time to learn something new.

2. Class : It means that there is a teacher who has an online course and you can join him/her if you like the course. Why is it class? Because this course also will be chosen by other student so they will be your classmates. So it is not just about learning, you also can get know new people.

If you join as a teacher you have some tasks before you can start the teaching.

1. You have to choose one or more subject what you can teach

2. You have to prove us  that you have enough qualifications to teach.

If everything is good, you can start the teaching.


                           

We know. There is a lot of webpage like this, BUT this is not a average online teaching-learning webpage. Here you can find a lot innovative things, like live class courses and induvidual education in one platform. 

                      


                     

Since our project is heavily related to the participatement of other people, we need as much advertisement as possible, so we will spend most of the income to that. Secondly, we are not experts at every trick of webdisegning so we plan to hire someone who exclusivevly works with desings. Furthermore, in Hungary having a license and making every right reserved is highly expensive. Besides that, we try not to focus on the financial part of the project, and that is why we ask for only a 10000 dollars. 


If you help us, we could provide everyone the opportunity to study what they really love because if get enough help, we could have limitless lessons, subjects on our webpage.

If you support us you can get a T-shirt with our logo.

Women T-shirts:

Men T-shirts:

(The T-shirts are available in other colours and in every sizes)

A very reasonable question is that where the funds would go if not manage to gather the 10000 dollars. We decided to save the income and start working along school until we gather enough assets.



                     

We are four Hungarian young man and we are full of with ambition. This project is our first big project, but we have already done some little project. These projects were very popular in the Unity Assetstore. 

          Adam Kurucz, Project Leader​

         Barnabás Sallai, Project Manager

        Norbert Farkas, Creative Manager

       Attila Vadász, Creative Designer


Our mission is to produce the best opportunity to make this planet smarter.

This is Our first Crowfunding campaign. We chose Indiegogo because we trust in those people who visit this page.

We are counting on your help not only by supporting us financially but by putting your faith in us.

story:
The big goal:                    $200,000
We've already raised:     $63,400 
Our current goal:            $136,600


* Middle School: Three classrooms and a library.
* Clinic: Waiting room & exam room, staffed by a private doctor once a week.
* Short term mission house: Giving teams from all over the world a hands-on opportunity to serve in Guatemala.
* Staff mission home: An apartment style home above the clinic & team house so our family can finally live in the village we serve.

___________________________________________________________

___________________________________________________________


My boys were starving...

As I was teaching my 5th graders about the importance of GROWING our belief in Christ by reading our Bible and praying, I asked them, "Who goes to church every week?"  I don't know what I was expecting but of the 20 boys in class that day, just 3 raised their hand.  The next day I asked the 6th graders the same question.  Again, just a few hands went up. 

THAT'S when I realized the boys were STARVING.  It's no wonder they were so interested in learning about the Bible!  The only place they were getting fed spiritually was at the academy which was just a few days a week.  My boys were starving, right in front of me and I didn't even know it.

I felt like I was in a burning house with the flames closing in.  I was in the final months with my 6th grade boys.  Next year they would be on their own.  They have all prayed and committed their lives to Christ but...were they ready?  Could they feed themselves???  Had I taught them to search after Him outside of the classroom?

In the most humble part of me I realized, I had not.  I had failed them.  And it was too late.

I prayed about it and I questioned, "What could I have done differently?  What could I do about it NOW...in this moment?"

That's where the idea for a Christian middle school was born.  What if...what if I had THREE MORE YEARS with the 6th graders?  WHAT IF I spent three years discipling them?  Teaching them to search after God...on their own?  What if I could teach them to share what they learned?

This is the answer I received from the Holy Spirit, "You can.  It's not too late.  I am with you."

Building this middle school will have an incredible impact on these boys.  It COMPLETELY changes the direction of their lives.  Yes, they will have the education they need to earn a better living but more importantly, at the end of middle school, they will have a firm foundation in Christ.  

 


 

And yes, please pray for the crazy lady "doctor"

(We met Florinda and Marcos early in our ministry when we were first learning about the state of medical care in the villages of Guatemala.  We wrote this post in 2013.)


This morning we visited Marcos, a 13 month old who has not been feeling well. He’s had a fever for 3 days and diarrhea for over a week. 

“Has he seen a doctor?” I asked his mom, Florinda.

“I’m going to see her today. I’m leaving this morning.”

I was relieved. I wasn’t comfortable with those types of symptoms and if it were my son, we would be visiting a doctor.

“Can we pray for you and Marcos?”

She nodded yes. She seemed so distracted.

As we were praying, I felt the Holy Spirit of God telling me to drive her to the doctor. 

“What time is your appointment?” I asked.

“I don’t have an appointment,” she answered.

“Can we drive you?”

“Yes. Thank you,” she said with a shy smile.

We parked the van and walked down an alley. We passed a parked truck with 5 young men, and an older woman standing around it. The scene seemed sketchy to me. We asked if they know where the Dr.’s office was. The older lady walked up to us and told us that she died yesterday! My mind was racing!  What? 

“I’m just kidding! I’m the doctor!”

We should have just walked away. 

We entered a metal door of what looked like a home, not a doctor’s office. There was a handmade sign outside the door, “Firewood for sale”. As we walked through the narrow hall, there were piles of 2nd hand clothes and another sign, “Clothes for sale”. At the end of the hallway, there were eight chicken crates with live chickens. She seemed to trust this “doctor”, so we kept going. She parted a curtain that led to…her bedroom! I’m not kidding! A bed, a dresser, small refrigerator, mirror, family photos! 

 We should have walked away. 

“Lay your baby on the bed. Tell me, how is your baby feeling?”

After listening to the symptoms and poking around his tummy, she said she had something for Marcos and that she would be right back.  She came back with a small glass of watery oatmeal looking “stuff”. 

At this point I really felt like I might be in shock because I couldn’t seem to speak fast enough. In my best Spanish I tried to understand what she was asking Florinda to give Marcos. He’s trying to swallow but can’t seem to drink it fast enough as this crazy lady is prodding Florinda to force it down. I can confidently say, this lady was NOT a doctor, and we needed to get out of there. 

“How much do we owe you?” I asked.

“20 Quetzales.” Which is the equivalent of $2.50. We overpaid. 

We left the bedroom, walked passed the chickens and clothes and firewood. We walked back down the creepy alley to my van.

“Florinda, can I take you to the doctor I take my kids to?”

She nodded yes. 

We drove 40 minutes and met with a real doctor. When we explained what we had just gone through, he said it's very common and a big problem in Guatemala. Because the smaller villages don’t have a doctor, someone eventually starts mixing home remedies. Unfortunately, every village has a crazy lady “doctor” who knows nothing about medicine.

After examining Marcos and talking with his mom, the doctor explained that the baby has an infection and needs treated right away. BUT, the bigger problem is that Marcos is severely malnourished. He looks like a 5 month old and can’t sit up, let alone crawl or walk. The doctor can’t even prescribe antibiotics because he feels they need to be administered by an IV and watched closely by a physician.

This news is devastating to Florinda. She doesn’t want to go back to the hospital. She was just there with Marcos for a month, and now the doctor is saying Marcos may need 4 more months of hospitalization to get him healthy again.

All I can see is the fear in her eyes.

And here is the root of the problem. As we walked out of the doctor’s office, I paid 150 Quetzales, which is the equivalent of $20 U.S. You and I know that’s an inexpensive doctor visit, but that’s a mountain of money to people of the villages. 

The drive home was quiet. I can’t imagine what she was thinking. I encouraged her and let her know that we would help in any way we could. We would pray for her and visit her. We parked the van and walked her to her home. “If the doctor says we have to take him in, we have to do it,” she said.

I always imagined that as a missionary, my days would end with feelings of satisfaction or at least contentment. But our drive home was a lot like it is on most days, driving quietly, with my heart breaking into a million pieces. 

Please pray that Marcos gets to the hospital this week. Please pray for a full recovery to a healthy weight. Please pray that his parents would have patience and strength. And yes, please pray for the crazy lady “doctor”.


That was 3 years ago!  Florinda took Marcos to the National Hospital and after a few days returned home.  We visited Marcos and delivered PediaSure every week for 6 months.  We prayed and stood by their family as Marcos gained weight and began to grow!  I recently saw Florinda and Marcos walking in the village.  I took this picture and plan to hang it in the clinic as a reminder of God's faithfulness.  

This is why we’re determined to build a clinic.  We want to give moms an alternative to back alley medicine.  Along with a private Guatemalan doctor, we'll have a team of nurses who will visit from the States every month to help moms like Florinda.  They’re committed to teaching about the importance of clean water and clean air stoves.  They’re committed to loving a village that, for the most part, has been forgotten.
 

The Power of Prayer Journal

After 4 years in Guatemala, this is what I've learned. You cannot be impactful as a missionary without God.  It seems obvious but it's not.  AND, we need to draw closer to Him daily through prayer and Bible study.  THOSE are the building blocks of being a missionary.  And those are the building blocks of this journal.


Vonda and I wanted a more organized way to share our thoughts and prayers with God.  Even as missionaries, it can be hard to stay focused on the most important things.  And for us, spending time with God, LOVING God, is THE MOST IMPORTANT thing. 

We dreamed about, designed and printed this journal right here in Guatemala, on the mission field. We LOVE IT, and we want YOU to have it!

When you donate $50 or $100 or even $1,000 toward this project, we want to give you The Power of Prayer Journal.  It’s our gift to you.  It's had SO MUCH IMPACT on our prayer life, we want EVERYONE to have one.

"I love my journal! It's a great way to be intentional about my time with God. I love sitting down before bed and recapping my day and acknowledging who God put in my path. Keeping a prayer list has also allowed me to recognize answered prayers and to give God the praise for how He is on the move! I will not go a day without it!"  - Jackie

Even if you can't donate to this project, you can still get the journal.  Just share this campaign and GET A PDF of The Power of Prayer Journal!

____________________________________________________________


____________________________________________________________


YOU MADE IT TO THE END!  First of all, THAT'S AMAZING!  Now, I need you to do two things.

1. Scroll up and check out the "Perks" on the right.  Pray about how you can support this campaign.  You can also click "BACK IT" near the top where you can donate any amount you want.  

2. Send me an email to let me know you made it to the end.  Everyone who emails me at georgesisneros@gmail.com will be entered to win the BEAUTIFUL, flowered handbag in the photo below.  I'll also stuff it with 10lbs of Guatemalan coffee!  WHAT???  Yea.  I know.  It's valued at $150!  Shhhhh.  Almost no one will have read this far so you have a pretty good chance of winning!  Winner will be announced on January 1st 2017.  ANYONE CAN WIN.  Only immediate family members are disqualified.  Yes, even if you're Taylor Swift or Lisa Bevere, YOU CAN WIN!  

"I always begin my day with two prayers.  Lord, would You put the people in my path that You want me to love today?  And for just a moment, just a few seconds, would You allow me to see them through Your eyes?  With true love?"  George Sisneros, Missionary
