story:
We at Akili Network believe we can enrich the lives of kids and their families in Kenya with quality educational entertainment content.

In 2012, we visited Kenya at the request of the Deputy Chairman of the Kenyan Content Task Force to review some pro-bono work we did on ways Kenya could grow their media sector.  When we proposed doing some children’s programming at a meeting with the government agency overseeing broadcasting, they said "What would be of interest is if you were to do a channel for children.”  We were then invited to apply for a free-to-air digital broadcasting license.

We quickly learned that there are 18 million children under the age of 14,
and there is virtually no quality programming for them, and no one is
producing or distributing inspiring, educational programs that our own
children in the US have access to every day.  We knew that formal education is incredibly important in Kenya and they did make primary education free in 2003.  But having worked in the business of children's educational content, we knew the incredible value of informal education in the home. 


There is extensive scientific research that supports the notion that informal educational content not only supports school readiness and academic success in literacy, STEM and social-emotional awareness, but develops inspiration, builds confidence and sparks imagination.  In the US we take this for granted, since this kind of content has existed for years and is widely distributed and available.   

Our timing was truly auspicious: Kenya was poised to convert from an old analog broadcasting system to an advanced digital one, offering the possibility of many more channels.  We concluded that there was going to be an incredible opportunity to deliver much needed content for children in Kenya and the rest of East Africa.

So we asked ourselves “How could we build a sustainable business model that could reach the maximum number of children and their care givers and support their informal educational needs? How can we give these kids and their families free and unlimited access to the kinds of content that positively impacts our own children's lives every day?” 


The Akili Solution

We have been working on Akili Network (Akili means wisdom in Swahili) for the last four years and have been issued a free-to-air broadcasting license from the Communications Authority of Kenya.  We’ve developed a detailed plan to bring the world’s best culturally appropriate children’s content to Kenya and to produce original local programs working with Kenya’s best creators, artists and production companies. As English is one of two official languages and is the language used in primary schools, the programs will primarily be broadcast in English.

We’ve assembled an amazing team of Kenyans who are experts in their local domains and our global management team has decades of experience developing this type of content with companies like Scholastic, Nickelodeon and Living Books.

To reach the maximum number of children and caregivers, our network will be free whether distributed to digital televisions, mobile devices, tablets or computers.  By maximizing our reach of a large underserved audience, we will support both our social impact goals and our business goals. 

Our business model is commercial advertising and the sale of behavior change communication (think a paid Public Service Announcement) airtime to NGOs (Non-Governmental Organizations) and government ministries. We're also creating supplemental materials that will extend their informal learning experiences into the classroom for teachers who wish to use them, as well as materials for use at home by parents who desire free activities with real-world academic or social-emotional benefits for their kids.

Our business model is meant to be sustainable -- and if it succeeds in Kenya we're poised to enter adjacent East African countries. 

You can also see more at http://www.akilinetwork.com


What We Need & What You Get

The funding we're hoping to raise will help us acquire programs, purchase and install the equipment we've selected to broadcast across platforms, pay for the transmission of the channel and pay our team in Kenya and the US to finalize the ground work for our launch:

  • We're looking to raise $600,000 dollars. This will get us on the air and
    with the funding we've already raised from investors in the US and Kenya, it will close the gap and enable us to get to a self-sustaining business faster.  Any additional funds we raise will be allocated to the development of our long list of new local programs for preschool and school-aged children and their families and caregivers. 
  • Our perks are simple and celebrate your investment in this amazing program. You can get some Akili Network swag, or if you opt out of the swag, we'll pass the dollars saved on to give away Akili pencils, notebooks and soccer balls to kids in Kenya. 
  • If for some reason we aren't able to reach our goal, our funds go first and foremost to purchase our broadcast equipment and focus on early childhood programming only. We can launch with just this programming if we have to, but it is our (and our audiences') goal to have the full offering of programs for ages 2-14 at launch.



The Impact

18 Million children and their families in Kenya will directly benefit from this venture. 

Additional benefits of Akili Network will be: job creation and the growth of Kenya’s media sector, community respect and involvement (an issue highly prized by most Kenyans), and a number of important changes in behavior over time through our selection of programs, including protecting the environment, gender equality, and health practices.

As our audience of children and caregivers grows, we will be an important vehicle for NGOs and government ministries for reaching this important audience with behavior change communications. 

Our messages of positivity and inspiration are the best way to defend against ignorance.  These children truly deserve the best of what the world can offer.  

Our management team has experience leading many ventures in media and education, both large and small, from producing children's programs and educational entertainment, to running successful startups such as Living Books to developing award-winning television series' (like Peep and the Big Wide World) to publishing award-winning reading comprehension educational technology for use in classrooms (ReadAbout for Scholastic) to acquiring the best programming for children for Nickelodeon, Cartoon Network, Qubo and Discovery Kids.  The Kenyan members of our team have sold advertising for one of the largest broadcasters in the country, have led production for the country's Ministry of Information Communication and Telecommunications and have created IP standards for the Kenya's media industry. We even have a successful track record of doing business in Kenya. We know the industry, the region and the audience.

Here are some of the team bringing this to life:

Founders/Management Team:

  • Jeff Schon, CEO - 20+ years TV mgmt and production, Hearst, Living Books, Scholastic
  • Jesse Soleil, President - 20+ years of digital products and marketing, Scholastic, Massiverse, Porter Novelli
  • Gerry Gitonga, General Counsel, 15+ years of Kenyan IP and entertainment law
  • Dea Perez, Head of Programming, Nick, Cartoon Network, Discovery Kids

Advisors:

  • Charlie Deull, International Business Advisor; experience: Scholastic, The Hunger Project
  • Matt Finick, Consulting CFO; experience: Marvel, Reading Rainbow
  • Rafique Keshavjee, Education in Africa; experience: Aga Khan University
  • Andrea Miller, International TV; experience: Cartoon Network, TCM
  • Bruce Paisner, TV/Media Strategy; experience: Hearst, International Emmys
  • Priten Patel, East African Business Advisor; experience: Meditec, Vanguard Group


Risks & Challenges

We have reduced the risk of the venture by extensive business planning, lining up agreements for the programming, establishing relationships with government ministries and production companies and assembling a world-class group of advisors and management team.  All we need now is you!

Truly Akili Networks' biggest risk is not raising all the funding required to launch the channel. To mitigate this, we have decided that if there is a shortfall we will reduce the amount of programs we launch with and initially focus on just preschool programming.  

  • The risks to the business are tied to the speed at which we can grow our audience.  We have developed an extensive marketing and PR program that works with major outlets and on the ground with each of Kenya's 47 counties and their respective leadership to promote the network. 
  • While there is occasional security instability in the region, we believe this venture is less affected by these events.   
  • Our senior leadership will be on the ground in Nairobi to manage Akili.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any investment you might consider, but even if you cannot, we would sincerely appreciate you sharing our venture with your own personal network:

  • Please spread the word about what we are trying to do! You can easily use the sharing tools built right into Indiegogo.
  • We could really use some help executing across our social media channels - if this is of interest we'd love to talk.

We are incredibly passionate about this venture and hope you see the value in it. Thank you for your consideration and investment!

Kindest regards,

Jeff, Jesse and the entire Akili Network crew
story_txt:
We at Akili
Network believe we can enrich the lives of
kids and their families in Kenya with quality educational entertainment content.

In 2012, we visited Kenya at the request of the Deputy
Chairman of the Kenyan Content Task Force to review some pro-bono work we did
on ways Kenya could grow their media sector.  When
we proposed doing some children’s programming at a meeting with the government
agency overseeing broadcasting, they said "What would be of interest is if
you were to do a channel for children.” 
We were then invited to apply for a free-to-air digital broadcasting license.
We quickly learned that there are 18 million children under the age of 14,and there is virtually no quality programming for them, and no one isproducing or distributing inspiring, educational programs that our ownchildren in the US have access to every day.  We knew
that formal education is incredibly important in Kenya and they did make primary
education free in 2003.  But having
worked in the business of children's educational content, we knew the incredible value of
informal education in the home. 



There is extensive scientific research that
supports the notion that informal educational content not only supports
school readiness and academic success in literacy, STEM and social-emotional
awareness, but develops inspiration, builds confidence and sparks imagination.
 In the US we take this for granted, since
this kind of content has existed for years and is widely distributed and
available.   
Our timing was truly auspicious: Kenya was poised to convert
from an old analog broadcasting system to an advanced digital one, offering the
possibility of many more channels.  We
concluded that there was going to be an incredible
opportunity to deliver much needed content for children in Kenya and the rest
of East Africa.
So we asked ourselves “How could we build a
sustainable business model that could reach the maximum number of children and
their care givers and support their informal educational needs? How can we give these kids and their families free and unlimited access to the kinds of content that positively impacts our own children's lives every day?”  

The Akili Solution
We have been working on Akili Network (Akili means wisdom in Swahili)
for the last four years and have been issued a free-to-air broadcasting license
from the Communications Authority of Kenya. 
We’ve developed a detailed plan to bring the world’s best culturally
appropriate children’s content to Kenya and to produce
original local programs working with Kenya’s best creators, artists and
production companies. As English is one of two official languages and is
the language used in primary schools, the programs will primarily be broadcast in English.
We’ve assembled an amazing team of Kenyans
who are experts in their local domains and our global management team has
decades of experience developing this type of content with companies like
Scholastic, Nickelodeon and Living Books.
To reach the maximum number of children and
caregivers, our network will be free whether distributed to digital
televisions, mobile devices, tablets or computers.  By maximizing our reach of a large
underserved audience, we will support both our social impact goals and our
business goals. 

Our business model is commercial advertising and
the sale of behavior change communication (think a paid Public Service Announcement) airtime to NGOs (Non-Governmental Organizations) and government ministries. We're also creating supplemental materials that will extend
their informal learning experiences into the classroom for teachers who wish to
use them, as well as materials for use at home by parents who desire free activities with real-world academic or social-emotional benefits for their
kids.

Our business model is meant to be sustainable -- and if it succeeds in Kenya
we're poised to enter adjacent East African countries. 

You can also see more at http://www.akilinetwork.com




   What We Need & What You Get The funding we're hoping to raise will help us acquire programs, purchase and install the equipment we've selected to broadcast across platforms, pay for the transmission of the channel and pay our team in Kenya and the US to finalize the ground work for our launch:  
We're looking to raise $600,000 dollars. 
This will get us on the air andwith the funding we've already raised from investors in the US and Kenya, it will close the gap and enable us to get to a self-sustaining business faster.  Any additional
funds we raise will be allocated to the development of
our long list of new local programs for preschool and school-aged children and their
families and caregivers.  
Our perks are simple and celebrate your investment in this amazing
program. You can get some Akili Network swag, or if you opt out of the swag, we'll pass the dollars saved on to give away Akili pencils, notebooks and soccer balls to kids in Kenya. 



If
for some reason we aren't able to reach our goal, our funds go first and
foremost to purchase our broadcast equipment and focus on early childhood
programming only. We can launch with just this programming if we have to, but it
is our (and our audiences') goal to have the full offering of programs
for ages 2-14 at launch.

    The Impact 
18 Million children and their families in Kenya will directly benefit from this venture. 


Additional benefits of Akili Network
will be: job creation and the growth of Kenya’s media sector, community respect
and involvement (an issue highly prized by most Kenyans), and a number of
important changes in behavior over time through our selection of programs,
including protecting the environment, gender equality, and health practices. 
As our audience of children and
caregivers grows, we will be an important vehicle for NGOs and government
ministries for reaching this important audience with behavior change
communications.  
Our messages of positivity and
inspiration are the best way to defend against ignorance.  These children truly deserve the best of what
the world can offer.  

Our management team has
experience leading many ventures in media and education, both large and small,
from producing children's programs and educational entertainment, to running successful
startups such as Living Books to developing award-winning television series'
(like Peep and the Big Wide World) to
publishing award-winning reading comprehension educational technology for use
in classrooms (ReadAbout for Scholastic) to acquiring the best programming for
children for Nickelodeon, Cartoon Network, Qubo and Discovery Kids.  The Kenyan members of our team have sold
advertising for one of the largest broadcasters in the country, have led
production for the country's Ministry of Information Communication and
Telecommunications and have created IP standards for the Kenya's media industry.
We even have a successful track record of doing business in Kenya. We know the
industry, the region and the audience.
Here are some of the team bringing this to life:
Founders/Management Team:

Jeff Schon, CEO - 20+ years TV mgmt and production, Hearst, Living Books, Scholastic
Jesse Soleil, President - 20+ years of digital products and marketing, Scholastic, Massiverse, Porter Novelli
Gerry Gitonga, General Counsel, 15+ years of Kenyan IP and entertainment law
Dea Perez, Head of Programming, Nick, Cartoon Network, Discovery Kids


Advisors:

Charlie Deull, International Business Advisor; experience: Scholastic, The Hunger Project
Matt Finick, Consulting CFO; experience: Marvel, Reading Rainbow
Rafique Keshavjee, Education in Africa; experience: Aga Khan University
Andrea Miller, International TV; experience: Cartoon Network, TCM
Bruce Paisner, TV/Media Strategy; experience: Hearst, International Emmys
Priten Patel, East African Business Advisor; experience: Meditec, Vanguard Group



Risks & Challenges
We have reduced the risk of the venture by extensive business planning, lining up agreements for the programming, establishing relationships with government ministries and production companies and assembling a world-class group of advisors and management team.  All we need now is you!
Truly Akili Networks' biggest risk is not raising all the funding required to launch the channel. To mitigate this, we have decided that if there is a shortfall we will reduce the amount of programs we launch with and initially focus on just preschool programming.    The risks to the business are tied to the speed at which we can grow our audience.  We have developed an extensive marketing and PR program that works with major outlets and on the ground with each of Kenya's 47 counties and their respective leadership to promote the network. 
While there is occasional security instability in the region, we believe this venture is less affected by these events.   
Our senior leadership will be on the ground in Nairobi to manage Akili.   
   Other Ways You Can Help We appreciate any investment you might consider, but even if you cannot, we would sincerely appreciate you sharing our venture with your own personal network:  Please spread the word about what we are trying to do! You can easily use the sharing tools built right into Indiegogo.

We could really use some help executing across our social media channels - if this is of interest we'd love to talk.   We are incredibly passionate about this venture and hope you see the value in it. Thank you for your consideration and investment!Kindest regards,Jeff, Jesse and the entire Akili Network crew

story:
Hello, people of the world!

We are Roman Churkin (born 25.01.1977, artist/photographer, email <severnyeogni@yandex.ru>) and Roman Kirillov (born 21.06.1982, artist/designer, <https://vk.com/capdub> ). We have been good friends since 1998 and were both brought up in the town of Petrozavodsk, the capital of the Republic of Karelia, in the north-west of Russia. It has been a long journey but we have decided at last to declare our purpose here on Indiegogo.com

Photo: Roman Kirillov & Roman Churkin, 07.09.2014

The reason for my (Roman Churkin) first visit to the ancient town of Kem was the wedding of some friends. It was then, in 2006, that I first saw the extraordinary architectural masterpiece, the Cathedral of the Assumption. I had spent every summer of my childhood around the town of Pudozh and its local villages and had grown to love the old wooden houses. Wooden architecture became an important part of my life, it is my spiritual root.
I moved to Kem in 2011 and over the next two years I repaired the old wooden house where I now live. I also started to search for an opportunity to create something which might have a long term significance for the cultural life of this small town.

In 2014, my friend Roman Kirillov celebrated the New Year with me and my family in Kem and he too was captivated by the beauty and harmony of the Cathedral. Over New Year we discussed my idea for a ‘Carpentry school’ for the youth of the town. I had already found a land site and was working to finalise the plans to develop the cultural centre, that I hoped would help preserve the carpentry traditions of the Russian North.

After this conversation Roman Kirillov decided to train and work in the workshop of the famous carpenter P.F. Karelin <http://www.master-karelin.ru> in Petrozavodsk.

While finalising the contract to rent the land for the construction of the school we have been amassing a collection of books on the subject of ancient and old Russian wooden architecture. We now have an extensive archive, paper and electronic, useful for our project.

In recent years we have met with I.E. Grishina in the Petrozavodsk State University Office of the Research Institute of Historical and Theoretical Problems of National Architecture and also with P.F. Karelin. We have been in touch with famous carpenter D.A. Sokolov and his team <http://novoestaroe.ru>, the Finnish activist Markku Nieminen to talk of his project <http://juminkeko.fi/viena/en/paanajarvi.html>, with Nieminen's friends and collaborators, the carpenters from Paanajarvi village (100 km from Kem) M. Popov and N. Zolotoverkh, also with the wooden boat builder M.L. Naimark <http://lodka-vodlozero.narod.ru/p5.htm>, and the English photographer Richard Davies <http://www.richarddavies.co.uk/woodenchurches> who kindly helped us check for errors two ready English texts for this campaign, and others.

In collaboration with local journalist V.N. Fedotova we have published a brochure devoted to the 300 year anniversary of the Uspenskiy Cathedral of Kem (1714 – 2014).

Photo: Cover of brochure 'Three centuries of Uspenskiy Cathedral'

We have written some letters telling of our project for the ‘Carpentry school’ in Kem. We have written to the President of Russia V.V. Putin, the Ministry of Culture of Karelia, the Government of Karelia and a few rich oligarchs. Sadly we have had no response so far although our letter to the President has been returned.

We have now decided to appeal to the people of the world with Indiegogo.com

This is what we have:

- A land site ready to build the ‘Carpentry school’ of Kem

Document, scan: The scheme of an arrangement of the building on the land site

Screenshot: Google planet picture, 2015


- A mobile home set up on the site for the carpenters to live in during the summer period of work 

Photo: Land site, 12.09.2015

- The support of experts in the field of wooden architecture, as mentioned above


What is needed over the next three years:

- 250 cubic metres of timber logs (approximately 650 pieces of pine timber logs of 600 cm in length and 26 cm in diameter) to build the two-storeyed, 12x12 metres square, building

Document, draft: The official drawing certified by the architect

- Rocks and stones for the base of the building

Traditional Karelian stone (rock) base

- A mobile crane and some machinery
- A salary for dedicated carpenters and workers

The rock/stone and timber is available locally - all we need now is the money (3.000.000 Rubles/$ 42,254 USD - sum of Indiegogo' fee and - sum of bank wire transfer fee = approximately 2.000.000 Rubles) to make this project a reality.

Draft: Steps 1-6

Draft: Steps 2-3

Draft: Steps 4-5

Apart from the thrill of helping to make this dream come true we will offer each donor a signed postcard(s) of the original design(s) (both of them) for this campaign, an English translation of the Russian brochure and a high quality digital photographs of Kem’s beautiful Cathedral of the Assumption.

Its domes are our beacons, Northern lights that illuminate our path to a better future.

We thank you and please Spread the Word about our campaign in your social networks!

Photo: Severnye ogni/Northern lights, 02.10.2011

Photo: Stormy skies over Cathedral, 26.09.2015

‘Severnye Ogni/Northern Lights’ is the name of our campaign and the name of our ‘Carpentry school’ – our emblem for the future.

Original design of Carpentry school emblem: Memorable card, 10x15 cm

P.S. A feast for the eye. Studying of the old left and collapsing houses in Karelian villages, 25-28.08.2013

Its domes are our beacons, Northern lights that illuminate our path to a better future. story:
We are a group of Mexican social entrepreneurs that want to change the reality of millions of people suffering poverty around the world.



This process started as an idea 8 months ago with the purpose of creating an impact with a problematic that exists in urban crowded spaces: WASTE ACCUMULATION.


In our country, 56 million people live below the poverty line and waste accumulation affects their quality of life in health and economical aspects.

Not only this, but they have to spend 60% of their monthly income in nutritional needs, having to settle for a low-quality nutrition.

We decided  to start in mexico before expanding to the rest of the world because our country has plenty of slums that need assistance. This reality is not something that we had to board plane or simply travel miles to experience it, we only had to look around the corner. We have grown up seeing this issue everyday of our lives, and we are tired of seeing how poverty increases instead of being reduced. we will  increase their quality of life by using a source developed every second which is the waste.



After developing a business model centered in connecting different elements, and in order to provide nutrition and clean the environment, we competed in Hult Prize, an international social-entrepreneurship competition, representing our university (Tecnológico de Monterrey, Campus Guadalajara), representing our country Mexico, and won a ticket to the regional round managing to be one of the six finalists from 25,000 competing teams.

We visited communities in our city to validate and confirm our business model and other elements of our projects, re-structuring it several times to make it more realistic and sustainable.

This resulted in a new direction of the project, the right direction to change the reality of these communities.

We competed in Boston, Massachusetts, and had an amazing feedback from judges,fellow participants and audience from the pitches, and we decided that we didn’t want to stop there, we want to continue our fight to increase the quality of lives of millions of people.


We are their voice, and we want to speak out for them, because they have touched our souls and we have decided that no matter what, we want to change their reality.

How does our system works?

PROtrash is a system that works as an economic accelerator by the connection of several elements. Each family in the communities will collect and separate their recyclable waste on just 3 materials: Pet, Aluminum, and Glass.

ONE family can cover their weekly nutrition needs with their average waste production.


Then they will deposit their materials into our interactive machine, that works mechanically because of the lack of sufficient electricity in this communities. The energy generated from it, will triturate, weigh the trash, and print a ticket.

Then, they will exchange the ticket for food, getting approximately two pounds of food for one pound of waste.

Pro trash tackles malnutrition, and waste accumulation, helping clean the environment, improving quality of life, generating an environmental culture and creating a social fabric for common good. It will create new opportunities for people living in slums.

YOU can help us!

With your donation we will start to change lives!

story:
The 13th International Music Workshop and Festival will take place again at the beautiful castle, Schloss Kirchberg in Germany between August 8 and 21, 2016.


This workshop is a rather intimate course with a spontaneous and family-like atmosphere, open to advanced musicians (instrumentalists and singers). Participants will have lots of lessons and chamber music coaching from all the professors, and will have an opportunity to work on both chamber music and solo repertoire. There will be at least 3 public concerts. Professors will be Kyoko Hashimoto (Piano, McGill University), as well as Rafael Rosenfeld (Cello, Basel Academy) and Alexander Janiczek (Violin, Guildhall School). 


This festival serves to make a very nice community of high-level musicians searching for depth in Music and we have created a rather intimate long-lasting social network of musicians worldwide. 

This workshop/festival has no funding, no subsidies. It has being run through dedication of world class musicians who are passionate about music, education and musical society. The budget for the festival is now in peril, as all the costs including the "scholarships" come from Prof. Hashimoto's own pocket and it is increasingly hard to sustain. These young musicians are keen to have the great experience of participating in the workshop, coming from all over the world - including North America, Asia and Europe - they are very much financially in need. We would like to give as much scholarships as possible to the students, but at the moment it is very difficult. Please help these talented musicians to have great experience they deserve. 

Thank you.

www.imwaf.com

story:
Colabus

Our genesis began with the recognition that in both our social and business lives we needed a simple tool to be effective at how we connect, share, communicate, interact and collaborate. Having worked with the solutions that are currently available, we concluded that something different was required to support what we desired. We wanted a tool that could reduce distractions and add meaning to how we live, work and play. Colabus revolutionizes the way people engage as it facilitates different interaction and communication styles so we are empowered to use our time more effectively. 

Our Vision 

The World on Colabus. Make it accessible to all social and business collaborators.


Products

Colabus Social 
  • Interactions where privacy matters: share with your entire team or restrict with whom you share. 
  • Share experiences real time: conversations, activity, messages, blogs, photos, videos, documents, links, etc, all from one place.
  • Plan & Organize events with family and friends: play dates, BBQ, day at the park, weddings, Eagle Scouts, camping trip, a night out, pick-up basketball, soccer and more. Manage personal and family projects and share with others if desired.
  • Collaborate with your kids on homework while on the go: interact and work from anywhere real time.
  • Mentor Remotely: when time and distance posses a challenge reach out as a big brother/sister. An opportunity to give back to society where it can make an everlasting difference.
  • Stay Connected: Families and friends stay connected real time as they create more time for each other while easily managing life and work activities.
  • A great way for musicians and band members to share!

Colabus Business 


Colabus Enterprise
  • Manage information overload by reducing distractions and staying focused on what is important: eliminate email as your primary means of collaboration so decisions and actions are executed faster.
  • Business Agility: speed up your value streams and maintain your time-to-market-and-revenue advantage.
  • Business Management: manage all of your assets from one place; resources, communication, documents, activities, tasks, projects and company knowledge.  
  • Business Process Improvement:  real time visibility of who and where are your bottlenecks so you can quickly mitigate risk and identify opportunity. Reduce cost and increase productivity.
  • Organization Discipline: put structure around all your unstructured processes.
  • Connected at all times: colleagues can stay focused on delivering key initiatives as communication is streamlined and partitioned so that there is no ambiguity. 

Colabus Enterprise+


Product Genesis


What You get

  • Lifetime subscription for Colabus Social. 
  • Huge discounts on MSRP for the following packages: Business, Enterprise or Enterprise+. 
  • A way to engage meaningfully, at the level and setting you choose - social, business or both. 
  • Colabus as a gift to your preferred Big Brother/Sister mentoring program. 
  • An opportunity to bring meaning to the way you manage life, work and play.  


Gift Offers

Colabus T-shirts

   

Colors/Sizes: blue or grey/S, M, L, XL, XXL

Portable Mobile Phone Chargers [Colors: black or silver]

USB Bracelets [Colors: Black or Sliver for Android or iOS (need to specify)]

Meet The Team

Colabus was founded and developed by a team that passionately embraces collaboration and working as cooperative groups the future for the way people and businesses will interact. Our objective is to reach the entire world on mobile devices with our application.

Ravi Kulasekaran : CEO/Founder - Founded Stridus, Appshop and Simplify Inc. Ravi has worked for Oracle Corporation consulting and development divisions and Valisys Corp as an applications engineer.

Elizabeth Brathwaite : Platform Social Features - Experienced provider of social services in both community and medical arenas. She's worked for San Ramon Unified School District, Kaiser, Alta Bates, Regional Center East Bay, Stanford Medical Center and East Field Ming Quong.

George Brathwaite : Business Development - A former semiconductor professional who has worked in varying capacities from engineering to sales and marketing. Has tenured with Olin, SCP, UTAC, Sony and as an adviser with 3SN Inc.

Antonio Alvarez : Adviser - Has held several executive management positions in the semiconductor sector with emphasis on business operations. Has led operations at Aptina Imaging, Advanced Analogic Technologies, Leadis and Cypress. He is on the board of several hi-tech companies.

Srinivas Tadinada : Customer Solutions & Client Success - Tenured at Virgin America managing all business analytics. Spent several years at Visa leading a team of architects on complex, globally distributed business intelligence implementations and critical strategic initiatives.

Saravanan Balakrishnan : Engineering & Operations - Has held various management positions and served as Senior Director at AT&T Business Services. He has also served as manager of operations at USi.


FAQ

What We Need 

A minimum of $155,000 USD:

It takes human intelligence, human effort and infrastructure to bring our application to life.  
What Your Contributions Support

Completion of the development of our new mobile user interface, automation of help-desk support, hardware and infrastructure upgrades, operations, expansion of our marketing campaign and Colabus deployment to respective social and business users. More importantly your contribution will help deploy a  platform that brings meaning and context to the way people connect and engage. 

How Your Money is Spent


The Importance of Meeting Our Goal 

  • Colabus can be the difference where society collaborates with an objective to deliver collective good.
  • We want to give kids that deserve and need more, unlimited access to big brother/sister mentoring programs by supplying Colabus at no cost so that it serves as a digital bridge. 
  • We want to offer communities as a whole, social and business collaborators, a platform that streamlines and simplifies communication so our time is utilized more effectively.
  • To be able to fulfill all respective and future product offers. 

Risks & Challenges

We have worked on this product for many months and are confident that we have a great platform and application.

Risks

If we do not reach our funding goal it will:

  1. Limit the addition of key resources required to accelerate development efforts on our platform.
  2. Impact the timing of delivery and deployment, and the quality of customer service and technical support of the product.
  3. Reduce our ability to scale infrastructure to support growth and take advantage of market opportunities. 
  4. Increase the level of difficulty in sustaining R&D effort to support new mobile platforms, phones and tablets, and to initiate future product enhancements.
  5. Limit how aggressively we can market our product.

How we Address Challenges

  1. Have initiated separately a direct sales campaign that strictly targets business enterprises as a means of propagating the use of Colabus and to serve as a revenue stream for supporting maintenance of the platform. 
  2. Deployed Colabus internally for managing related development projects as we are able to identify and respond faster to problems thereby maximizing our efficiency. 
  3. Implemented an index that incorporates skill set, versatility, ability to multitask and work in teams for selecting candidates best suited to work in our environment. We are able to maximize impact where resources may be constrained. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cannot contribute please share our campaign with others, socially and within your organization. Access and sharing through Indiegogo is quite simple.
  • Make a small donation of your choice to help us deploy a platform that can bring people together so they interact in a meaningful way. Revolutionize how we manage our life, work and play.
story_txt:
Colabus 
Our genesis began with the recognition that in both our social and business lives we needed a simple tool to be effective at how we connect, share, communicate, interact and collaborate. Having worked with the solutions that are currently available, we concluded that something different was required to support what we desired. We wanted a tool that could reduce distractions and add meaning to how we live, work and play. Colabus revolutionizes the way people engage as it facilitates different interaction and communication styles so we are empowered to use our time more effectively. 

Our Vision 
The World on Colabus. Make it accessible to all social and business collaborators.

Products



Colabus Social 















Interactions where privacy matters: share with your entire team or restrict with whom you share. 

Share experiences real time: conversations, activity, messages, blogs, photos, videos, documents, links, etc, all from one place.
Plan & Organize events with family and friends: play dates, BBQ, day at the park, weddings, Eagle Scouts, camping trip, a night out, pick-up basketball, soccer and more. Manage personal and family projects and share with others if desired.
Collaborate with your kids on homework while on the go: interact and work from anywhere real time.
Mentor Remotely: when time and distance posses a challenge reach out as a big brother/sister. An opportunity to give back to society where it can make an everlasting difference.
Stay Connected: Families and friends stay connected real time as they create more time for each other while easily managing life and work activities.
A great way for musicians and band members to share!



Colabus Business 
















Colabus Enterprise













Manage information overload by reducing distractions and staying focused on what is important: eliminate email as your primary means of collaboration so decisions and actions are executed faster.

Business Agility: speed up your value streams and maintain your time-to-market-and-revenue advantage.

Business Management: manage all of your assets from one place; resources, communication, documents, activities, tasks, projects and company knowledge.  
Business Process Improvement:  real time visibility of who and where are your bottlenecks so you can quickly mitigate risk and identify opportunity. Reduce cost and increase productivity.
Organization Discipline: put structure around all your unstructured processes.
Connected at all times: colleagues can stay focused on delivering key initiatives as communication is streamlined and partitioned so that there is no ambiguity.

story:
Short Summary

Goxhill Primary School is a small rural school in the county of North Lincolnshire in the UK. We teach children of all abilities aged between 3 and 11. Goxhill is a small community of about 2000 people on the banks of the Humber Estuary, close to the North Sea coast. During World War 2 the US Airforce (USAAF Station 345) were stationed there. There has been an Air Force base located in Goxhill since the First World War. The school recognises this link utilising a propeller as part of its logo.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RAF_Goxhill.

The school values every opportunity, so where feasible it tries hard to make links with neighbouring businesses and organisations. As a result of this, the opportunity to make links with CERN, the world renowned scientific establishment based in Geneva, Switzerland was something that we want to do our best to encourage. In 2015 we were able to utilise links with CERN to arrange a visit, and 20 children took the opportunity to go. During this visit, the staff from CERN were impressed by the children's attitude and asked if we could pay a return visit to strengthen links and develop the real world scientific content that links to the children's learning and enable more primary schools to visit and to further develop CERN's understand of the children's requirements and needs. 

We are going, and although we have had 22 children agree to come, the cost is £350 per child. We are aiming to raise £5000. This will enable us to reduce the costs to £150 per child making the trip more affordable to the current cohort of pupils, whilst allowing some funding to film a documentary of the children's experience. 

By contributing to this funding campaign you will be inspiring the scientists of the future. We want you to understand that by contributing or buying a perk, you can help the child’s visit to the Large Hadron Collider. During our last visit in 2015 we met Noble Prize winner Professor Ting, who took time to chat with our children.

What We Need & What You Get

The total cost of the trip per child is currently £350 (all included – flights, food, accommodation etc.), but we would like to make the trip more affordable, so would like to reduce the cost to £150. To do this, we would need £4400, but any money raised will be used to reduce the cost to the children. The sum listed (£5000) includes the cost of a documentary that we would also like to have produced. It goes without saying that money raised will first go to reducing the cost to the children first. The funding for the documentary will only be considered after we have reached this target.

Any money raised over the £5000 we are aiming for will be used to start funding next year’s visit to CERN.

The perks

Up to £10 we get a thank you at the end of the documentary

£10 to £30 buy a 'thank you' letter from one of the children

£50 to £100 buy you a premier showing of the documentary in the school

For £15 you can get a photo of the children at CERN.

Business perks:

£50+ you will get a letter of thank you from a child, a photo from the children at CERN and 'special thank you' on the documentary.

£100+ you will get a letter of thank you from a child, a photo from the children at CERN with a 'thank you ' and your logo and an executive producers credit with your organisation's logo at the end of the documentary and your logo on the T Shirt that the children will wear during the visit to CERN.

The Impact

The most important things that adults can do for children are the following:

1.  Give the children the opportunities to learn and expand their chances in later live,

2.  Inspire them to make the most of the opportunities that life will give them.

This is the 6th trip that Mr Byrne has run to visit CERN, and the 2nd whilst at Goxhill. We originally booked 10 children, but after asking the class, we had to double the number booked! None of the children wanted to leave and they all said that they would quite happily go again as they had got so much out of the trip!

All the trips have been successful and have inspired the children to consider future careers in science as well as continue with their education. The people that the children spoke to scientists that work in there and have realised that they are human being, and that they are all capable of becoming scientists that work at places like CERN!

Risks & Challenges

We are in the fortunate position that the trip is booked, so we will be going. What we are trying to do is make the trip easier to fund for the parents. As I mentioned earlier, the more we are able to raise, the more children you will help to go on this once in a life time trip!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

·  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.

·  Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

We understand that not everyone will be able to contribute funds towards our worthwhile campaign, but everyone can contribute by letting people know about our campaign.

Please let as many people you know about our campaign, and in that way you will be providing a child with the opportunity to experience this once in a life time trip to CERN!

Thanks.

story:
Who Are We?

Not From Here: the International Students’ Cookbook aims to bring students from all around the world together, with every student's second favourite thing: Food! We have collected and curated recipes from students from every corner of the globe and are creating a wonderful cookbook of all their recipes so that you too can enjoy the tastes of their homes.

We want this cookbook to be more than just a cookbook, which is why we’ve added a personal touch. All our recipes are gathered from genuine students and each one includes a short personal description of why this recipe is special to the student and how it reminds them of home. Each recipe is unique and we’ve been truly overwhelmed by the submissions we’ve received: we have recipes that have been handed down from generation to generation, as well as recipes students make every time they are homesick just so they can have that little taste of home.

Money, Money, Money.

We want to produce the best cookbook possible for you to own and cook from! In order to do that we’ve been working hard to recreate all the recipes that have been submitted to us so that we can check them for quality, and so that our resident photographer can take lovely pictures of them to put in the cookbook. Obviously cooking all these recipes costs money, as well as printing a full colour cookbook so you can see the pictures in all of their glory. This is why we’re asking for your money, so that we can make a wonderful product for our customers (that’s you!).

Even if we don’t reach our goal we’re going to do our best to publish as many cookbooks as possible. We really want to share the recipes we’ve collected with everyone, so we’re determined to get them out there no matter the financial barriers.

It's Not Easy Being Us

One of the biggest challenges we have faced while producing our cookbook has been coping with the differences between cultures when it comes to cooking. For example finding some of the ingredients was a challenge, especially since some of them had different names in other languages! As well as this many of the different recipes came with different forms of measurement, some that we’d never seen before, so converting from these was again a difficulty we had to comprehend and overcome. This is one of the main reasons we wanted to cook all the recipes ourselves, so that we could face these cookery challenges ourselves first and then explain how we got round them within our cookbook to make it easier for you when you cook them.

We were also worried when we started out that we wouldn’t get enough recipes to fill out our cookbook. However we pushed hard and created a dedicated marketing campaign that meant that we got all different types recipes from all over the world and we’re now really pleased with the diversity and range of recipes that we have for you.

We are also determined to produce a quality product for our customers and this means spending a lot of time and money on design and production of the book. We don’t want to compromise on the quality of the book and are passionate about creating a great quality product for you.

Money Isn't Everything

Not everyone can afford to donate and we appreciate that! If you want to help but aren’t able to donate the best thing you could do for us is to get the word out to as many people as possible. Share this page, like and share our facebook, twitter, instagram and tumblr. The more people talking about us the better, we want to be able to share our idea with as many people as possible and you can help us do that!

If we do not reach our funding goal, we have a backup plan. We will pursue creating the book in a digital form, for which we will still need your generous donations, and don't worry - you'll still get your perks!

story: Alevîlik inancına dair oldukça fazla ve de farklı yorumla karşılaşmak mümkün. Ancak kadın sözkonusu olunca az bilgi mevcut. Tarih boyunca kadının karartılması gerçekliğini Alevi kadınına vurduğumuzda fazlasıyla karartıldığını ve görünmez kılındığını söylemek gerek. Yazılı tarih anlamında da Alevi kadın neyi ifade ediyordu, tarihsel rolü neydi, inanç bazında nasıl bir işlevi vardı? Sadece bir ana olarak mı anılıyordu? Gerçekten Alevilik felsefesinin iddia ettiği gibi kadın ve erkek eşit ve özgür müydü?

story:
WHAT IS THE JUDAH SOCIETY?

To put it quickly: THE JUDAH SOCIETY is an organization that provides free programs to students in grades 6-12. At The Judah Society, we believe that INCOME ≠ POTENTIAL.

Our mission is to shape the next generation into confident and competent  leaders by providing free, educational resources to students in the community. All of our staff and volunteers are highly vetted and thoroughly background checked. We only believe in giving our best to our future.

We are strong believers in the importance of education, the arts, and teaching the basics of the Word to singers and musicians through our Worship Music Program.

Here at The Society, we believe in cultivating young leaders with service hearts, modeled after The Lion of Judah.

PROGRAMS YOU CAN HELP

Our organization has three programs: Tutoring, Visual Arts, and Worship Music.

  • TUTORING: provides free tutoring to students in grades 6-12. 
  • VISUAL ARTS: focuses on visual art such as photography, drawing, and graphic design. 
  • WORSHIP MUSIC: teach singers and musicians the basics of The Word through music.

 

WHERE IS YOUR MONEY GOING?

Any amount of contribution is helpful and how much you give is completely up to you! Your level of giving will provide a different amount of assistance to a student in need. Here's an example of how funds could be used for the Tutoring Program:

 

WHAT'S IN IT FOR ME?

There's no greater feeling than to be able to give a gift to a student that will better their life. There are a few donation amounts that will afford you the following perks:

$25: You Receive Public, Individual Recognition On The Judah Society Website

With a donation of $25, you'll receive our immense gratitude, PLUS: Public acknowledgment of supporter’s name on a designated page of The Judah Society Website!

 

$100: You'll Be Acknowledged On The 2018 Platinum Donor Page of Our Website

For your donation of $100, you'll receive acknowledgment on our 2018 Platinum Donor Page! We will place your name and/or organization's name with a permanent text link to your website on our 2018 Platinum Donor Page!

 

$300: Your Business Logo On Our Front Page AND Acknowledgement On The 2018 Platinum Donor Page of Our Website!

For your donation of $300, your business logo will be featured on the front page of our website for 1 year! Your logo will be attached to a permanent text link to your website. You or your business will ALSO receive acknowledgment on our 2018 Platinum Donor Page with a permanent text link to your website on our 2018 Platinum Donor Page!

 

MEET OUR TEAM

Chasity K. Williams

FOUNDER & EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR 

 

Franklin D. Williams, Jr.

MARKETING DIRECTOR & VISUAL ARTS PROGRAM COORDINATOR

 

PHOTO COMING SOON

Jasmine Dawkins

TUTORING PROGRAM COORDINATOR

 

PHOTO COMING SOON

Kyler Briscoe

YOUTH EDITOR

WHAT IS THE JUDAH SOCIETY?To put it quickly: THE JUDAH SOCIETY is an organization that provides free programs to students in grades 6-12. At The Judah Society, we believe that INCOME ≠ POTENTIAL.Our mission is to shape the next generation into confident and competent  leaders by providing free, educational resources to students in the community. All of our staff and volunteers are highly vetted and thoroughly background checked. We only believe in giving our best to our future.We are strong believers in the importance of education, the arts, and teaching the basics of the Word to singers and musicians through our Worship Music Program.Here at The Society, we believe in cultivating young leaders with service hearts, modeled after The Lion of Judah.PROGRAMS YOU CAN HELPOur organization has three programs: Tutoring, Visual Arts, and Worship Music.

TUTORING: provides free tutoring to students in grades 6-12. 

VISUAL ARTS: focuses on visual art such as photography, drawing, and graphic design. 

WORSHIP MUSIC: teach singers and musicians the basics of The Word through music.

story:
Project Pencils

Education is a right of every child, not just the privileged few. For children within the slum communities in Lagos, quality education seems beyond their reach and they often make up the over 10.3 million out-of-school children in Nigeria. With increased economic hardship, more children are dropping out of school as a result of their parent's inability to fund their education, and most government facilities are over-stretched and often not well equipped.

 

Vivaville International Schools was founded in August 2017 by Joseph Jikeme, a development worker, with years of experience in the non-governmental sector. Vivaville International Schools (BN 2535865) is registered with the Corporate Affair Commission of the Federal Republic of NIgeria, and it is structured to accommodate indigent children from lower and middle class families, whose parents cannot afford the expensive school fees of regular private schools, and doesn't feel comfortable with the standard of education available in public schools. Our Founder, Joseph Jikeme, who once dropped out of school due to finance, understands the need to create an affordable educational system that meets international standard for the children in slum communities such as Bariga LCDA in Lagos State, where the school is located.

 

Project Pencils is designed to enable 100 children access this tuition-free education being offered by Vivaville International Schools, by providing them with school supplies for one academic session and one nutritious meal every school day. Our research within the community has shown that most of these children are dropping out of school as a result of lack of funds, and vast majority don't eat any meal that contains at least four food groups. We believe that providing this tuition-free education, along with school supplies and a meal every school day will encourage increased registration into primary school and also encourage these young children to learn adequately.

 

With our low-cost running strategy, a donor can take on the financing of a child's annual academic session for just US$80, and we desire to have at least 100 students at the start of the new session in September, hence the need to start this crowdfunding. Donor support will ensure that these children don't miss a day of school, don't go a full day without eating, don't spend their school hours hawking to support their families, and are not exposed to dangers when left unsupervised by their parent during the hours they are supposed to be in school. Your effort towards this project will foster a life changing effect for these young children, who with your consistent support will be guaranteed access to education for better chances of becoming leaders in the nearest future.

story:
What We Need & What You Get

Your Prizes and What You Get at the end

  • We Don't Ask For A Lot of Money, We Get The $15,000 and You Get What You Asked For!
What Happens If We Don't Raise The Money
  • A) We try to keep working with what we have
  • B) We Stop The Whole Thing

Risks & Challenges

The Problems That We Could and Most Likely Will Face

  • We have a small development team. It could take a long time to build a prototype
  • If we face these challenges we  will keep trying

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You could promote our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/Pc.Abacus/
  • Check out our site: pcabacus.weebly.com

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who/what is Medium Plus? 

  • Medium Plus LLC is a company created and led by Nick Davis, a bartender and sommelier based in Seattle. Nick has a background in bars and restaurants, and decided to venture out on his own in May of 2015, powered by the spirit of entrepreneurship and challenge. 
  • The name Medium Plus comes from an ambiguous term in wine-tasting vernacular, in reference to an 'elevated' condition of wine, either in color, aroma or structure. In that tone, the mission of Medium Plus is a 'pursuit of elevated wine and cocktails'.
  • Medium Plus features a spectrum of offerings, including fine wine and cocktail service for private events, educational wine and food presentations, and specialized beverage education for individuals and groups.

What is this Indiegogo product, in a few words?

  • This handbook will cover creative and unique strategies for how to learn about wine on an elevated level.
  • Nick was taught some of these strategies while working in bars and restaurants, and in study groups with other sommeliers. He also created some strategies by necessity, while intensely studying for the Advanced Sommelier exam. 

What will this handbook not cover?

  • This is not another exhaustive encyclopedia about the vast world of wine. Those awesome books have already been written! Rather, this is a working toolkit of learning-and-research strategies, intended to assist any enthusiastic student of wine. Select topics from around the world of wine will be referenced in-depth, for the purposes of illustrating these strategies.

Who is this for? 

  • This handbook is written with the beverage professional or serious enthusiast in mind. Many of the topics covered will be very useful for those undertaking the ever-popular sommelier exams, although the subject matter will be applicable and relevant to anyone seeking to elevate their working knowledge of wine, in the areas of theory, tasting and service.  
  • Most importantly, by using these strategies to gain better knowledge and confidence with wine, readers will become even better enthusiasts and sommeliers, in the service of their guests, friends and colleagues.

How will readers use the handbook? 

  • Following an overview introduction to the world of wine from the sommelier's perspective, the guide will dive into specific study strategies (see a list of topics below).
  • One such strategy is memorization. The handbook will explain a memory technique in reference to a wine region, for example, "Memorizing the 1855 Classification for Bordeaux". Once learned, students can then independently apply that memory technique to any wine region of interest, perhaps the Crus of Burgundy, or islands of Greece. It's the old, "teach a person to fish" trick!
  • Another example would be pronunciations. The handbook will go into depth on strategies for learning Italian pronunciation. Those tools can then be used to explore any foreign language, in relation to wine.
  • When appropriate, written topics will be paired with a video accompaniment. From Champagne service to screen-captures of hyper-efficient internet research, these visual aides will cover the gaps that plain text leaves behind.

Why is this product unique and different?

  • Most wine books are filled to the brim with information, without a user's manual for how to unpack the information. This is that manual.
  • Many of the strategies and learning techniques listed in the handbook will be abstract, and off the beaten path. To achieve remarkable results, remarkable methods are often required!
  • Things like flashcards and rote-memory drills will be avoided, with a focus instead on 'deep-down learning tools', which foster knowledge-retention by using the creative areas of the brain. A succinct example would be: 'trying to intensely memorize a wine list', versus 'learning classic producers by creating a wine list from scratch'.

Topics to be covered in the handbook:

- A mindset for the modern beverage professional: 

  • Humility: (anonymous) short stories of the best and worst personalities from the wine world.
  • Professionalism: notes on attire, attitude, candor and kindness.
  • Enthusiasm: thoughts on 'catching the bug', and getting ecstatic about wine.
  • Test Taking: removing fear and staying strong - from the workplace to the venue on exam day.

- Theory: 

  • Producers: the foundation of the wine-world itself, winemakers are at the heart and soul of every bottle! By learning about producers first, the rest of wine-theory falls into place with surprising ease. Effective study strategies for theory will reference and emphasize producers throughout.
  • Regions: starting with the sixteen essential countries for classic-wine, dive into each and discover the truly important aspects that set specific regions apart, and link others together.
  • Memory: learn Nick's 'Story-Palace' technique, based on the famed 'Memory Palace', to learn and retain unlimited points of raw wine-theory data along with relevant context. Add in 'spaced repetition', 'the Major System', and 'Visual Memory', and you'll be Rainman-level in no time. No flash-cards needed!!
  • How It's Made, with 1-Page Guides: getting down to the nitty-gritty of winemaking methods from around the world, including regional terms and classic examples. But wait, there's more! It will all be done with simple 1-Page explanations and diagrams.
  • Administration of a theory study-group: make leaps and bounds in your theory knowledge with the power of friendship. Tips on what to study, effective frequency, and how to administer any size group.
  • Wine Business Nuts & Bolts: get your mind right, on all the business terms from margin to pour cost and beyond. Learn about the back-end side of wine sales, and discover how wine really gets from grape to glass.

- Tasting: 

  • Grape Personalities: a unique visual-presentation of the 40 most-important grapes and wine styles, which can be considered 'classics'.
  • Deductive Method (aka 'blind tasting'): Nick's Reverse-Pyramid approach for accurate and thorough analysis of a wine, leading to conclusions on grape variety, climate, winemaking style and age.
  • Ultra-Grid: diving deep into deductive tasting using the 'ultra grid', which accounts for every important aspect of a wine, with cause and effect, from color-influence to structure to 'deliciousness', and more. Learn to work with the grid based on priorities, and eventually use it to describe a wine in four-minutes flat.
  • Administration of a tasting study-group: Notes on how to supercharge your tasting skills by working with friends. From tech tools used to effectively manage large groups to specific curricula for effective study, you will be able to have the best tasting group around!

- Service: 

  • Effective and gracious wine service, in the hospitality of guests and friends: how to converse about wine, so that everyone wins.
  • Service Situations: how to stay in the game, even when things go wrong.
  • Tools of the trade: a look a the essentials and extraneous items to have on hand for great service.
  • Still Wine, Champagne and Decanting service: in-depth videos, step-by-step, with multiple camera angles.
  • How to correctly (and safely) polish fine stemware.
  • How to correctly (and safely) carry a tray full of stemware.

Why Indiegogo, and why the $10,000 goal?

  • Naturally, this is a project that could be done on its own, outside of crowdfunding. The thing is, with a public project on the Indiegogo platform, there are stakes. An incredible motivator if ever there was one! Just like in studying for an upcoming exam, having a tangible timeline with public exposure is an excellent motivator.
  • Nick's vision is to share this project with as many people as possible. By keeping the eBook at just $20, the cost is designed to be relatively affordable (the same as a bottle of solid Riesling at the store or a round of drinks at the bar).
  • If 500 supporters back the project at $20, then the goal is met! That's just nine from each state in the US, plus another fifty worldwide. We can do it!

Where will the money go? 

  • Priority 1, Project and Prize Fulfillment: The base goal of $10k will cover costs of design, production, filming, shipping, and administration for the handbook and other Indiegogo prizes.
  • Priority 2, Company Operations: Between $10k and $50k, pledges will help with funding basic Medium Plus operations for the short-term.
  • Priority 3, Company Growth: Above $50k, pledges will assist with the growth of Medium Plus (a small Seattle company). From bringing on more staff and educators to developing additional educational programs, there is limitless potential!

Praise for the teaching work of Nick Davis and Medium Plus:

"I reached out to Nick to ask for help in tasting and theory after I didn't pass the certified exam. He put me on a curriculum that focused on the areas that I needed to work on and assigned me homework each week that emphasized my weaknesses and turned them into strengths. 

Nick has developed his own way of teaching that doesn't revolve around staring at a book and trying to memorize villages, regions, and terms, and it's incredibly helpful. He knows how to train your brain to really retain information and not just memorize for a test. He also has a great way of deductive tasting that expands on the CMS grids and breaks down how to get to a conclusion using clues that the wine is giving you.  

I highly recommend hiring Nick if you need help with anything in the beverage world, not just wine! He is full of knowledge and loves to help other people learn right along with him."  

-Madey Adams, wine sales representative and Bordeaux-buddy.

"My name is David Kim and I am the National Director of Restaurants at Nordstrom. I started a wine tasting group about 2 years ago to assist each group member improve their knowledge base and their ability to network within the industry. Nick joined us in the early stages of the group and has been an integral member from day one. Many people I know have vast knowledge of wines and spirits. But only a select few can convey their message without being pretentious or condescending. Nick is one of those select few that genuinely has an interest in each person's learning progression especially in one on one sessions. I highly recommend Nick to help enhance and elevate your organization's wine education efforts."

-David Kim, restaurant director and Chablis-comrade.

“Last year, Nick Davis and I spent hours together studying feverishly for the Advanced Sommelier exam. His awesome determination to learn the material was only bested by his insistence on investigating the process of learning itself. Passing the exam on his first attempt speaks to the effectiveness of his method, something I’ve seen him develop and evolve over the past year. If his success is any measure of the benefits his practice offers, this is a venture worth supporting. In addition, we both came to see tremendous value in the power of camaraderie and fraternity to promote our studies. Considering this a virtual extension of that connectedness gives everyone a chance to join in."

-Jason Winfield Smith, sommelier and study brother.

"I sought help from Nick at Medium Plus for improving my blind tasting abilities. Even though I had tasted a fair amount, I still found myself unsure of some of the wines in the glass I was presented. Nick broke the process of tasting down to core structural elements using a repeatable method that improved my tasting ability dramatically. 

He is able to explain the process clearly and quickly. Applying theory to what I was observing is in the glass was a great way to improve my wine knowledge and pass tests. If you are going to spend serious time to study for a test, I recommend working with Nick."

-Matt Beach, wine sales representative and friend.

-"Nick is great. He helped me pass certified, no flashcards required. Give him your money, and reap the benefits. Thanks Champagne!"  

Love, Jessica White, sommelier and bottle-poppin' pal.

Risks and challenges

This is the first Indiegogo project organized by Medium Plus.

Risks and Challenges:

-Accommodating Volume: Depending on how large the response is for this project, it may take some creativity to make sure the product is delivered consistently at scale. Medium Plus will need to hire some technical wizards, to help sort out the distribution of digital ebooks, vidoes, hard copies and other prizes.

-Accurate Information: A chief goal for Medium Plus is to deliver useful and accurate information, and to not perpetuate errors. A rigorous editing process will occur before any product delivery.

-Staying Focused: With an entire world of wine waiting to be unpacked, there will be a challenge in not taking on too much. To quote Antoine de Saint Exupéry, "Perfection is Achieved Not When There Is Nothing More to Add, But When There Is Nothing Left to Take Away".
