Nick joined us in the early stages of the group and has been an integral member from day one. Many people I know have vast knowledge of wines and spirits. But only a select few can convey their message without being pretentious or condescending. Nick is one of those select few that genuinely has an interest in each person's learning progression especially in one on one sessions. I highly recommend Nick to help enhance and elevate your organization's wine education efforts."
-David Kim, restaurant director and Chablis-comrade.
“Last year, Nick Davis and I spent hours together studying feverishly for the Advanced Sommelier exam. His awesome determination to learn the material was only bested by his insistence on investigating the process of learning itself. Passing the exam on his first attempt speaks to the effectiveness of his method, something I’ve seen him develop and evolve over the past year. If his success is any measure of the benefits his practice offers, this is a venture worth supporting. In addition, we both came to see tremendous value in the power of camaraderie and fraternity to promote our studies. Considering this a virtual extension of that connectedness gives everyone a chance to join in."

Exploring some great Champagne with Nick, at The 47 Wine Storage, in Seattle
-Jason Winfield Smith, sommelier and study brother.
"I sought help from Nick at Medium Plus for improving my blind tasting abilities. Even though I had tasted a fair amount, I still found myself unsure of some of the wines in the glass I was presented. Nick broke the process of tasting down to core structural elements using a repeatable method that improved my tasting ability dramatically. 
He is able to explain the process clearly and quickly. Applying theory to what I was observing is in the glass was a great way to improve my wine knowledge and pass tests. If you are going to spend serious time to study for a test, I recommend working with Nick."
-Matt Beach, wine sales representative and friend.

Saber time - Thanks Champagne!
-"Nick is great. He helped me pass certified, no flashcards required. Give him your money, and reap the benefits. Thanks Champagne!"  
Love, Jessica White, sommelier and bottle-poppin' pal.
Risks and challengesThis is the first Indiegogo project organized by Medium Plus.Risks and Challenges:-Accommodating Volume: Depending on how large the response is for this project, it may take some creativity to make sure the product is delivered consistently at scale. Medium Plus will need to hire some technical wizards, to help sort out the distribution of digital ebooks, vidoes, hard copies and other prizes.-Accurate Information: A chief goal for Medium Plus is to deliver useful and accurate information, and to not perpetuate errors. A rigorous editing process will occur before any product delivery.-Staying Focused: With an entire world of wine waiting to be unpacked, there will be a challenge in not taking on too much. To quote Antoine de Saint Exupéry, "Perfection is Achieved Not When There Is Nothing More to Add, But When There Is Nothing Left to Take Away".

story:
Research in C. elegans 

Our names are Andrew Lee and Kai Hin Lui. We are two young aspiring scientists at Stuyvesant High School, interested in the biology behind our memories. At our school, we experiment with a species of roundworms called C. elegans, and we study the effects of certain genetic mutations on memory retention. With the guide of two scientists, Dr Hemal Pathak and Dr Jun Liang, we have begun characterizing the behavior of C. elegans, but we are unable to perform tests at a deeper, molecular level due to a lack of funding. As two ambitious students, we need your help to experiment and further pursue our scientific endeavors.

Image by Dustin Updike

Our goal through this campaign is to acquire and utilize the tools necessary for performing advanced molecular techniques. These techniques involve disrupting some of the signaling pathways important to healthy biological systems. Tweaking certain components in these pathways can create abnormalities in an otherwise healthy, normal organism, allowing us to better understand the roles these components normally play. Using the techniques provided by your funding, we can systematically screen for the molecular components underlying memory formation and retention.

Healthy, normally functioning molecular pathways are crucial to evade diseases like cancer, Alzheimer's, and Parkinson's. However, the pathways that lead to many of the symptoms in these diseases are not fully understood. Much of our research is dedicated to finding the pathway in which a certain protein regulates memory retention. We hope our findings can shed light on these enigmatic pathways to provide a basis of knowledge for future research and, hopefully, development of treatments. 

Using a program called WormLab, we can track the memory retention of C. elegans over time. After performing an assay that conditions C. elegans to associate a scent with food, we record the C. elegans’ movement and use WormLab to translate their movement into data. If we quantify the movement of these worms over time, we can develop trends of their behavior to see the strength of their memories. From this, we can compare how well different worm mutants retain memories and discern the role of the gene that was mutated.


We are so thankful for any contribution you make that will help us conduct research at a professional level! Really, it means a lot for providing us such memories.


Professional Guidance

We are trained, guided, and supported by two scientists, Dr. Hemal Pathak and Dr. Jun Liang. Dr. Pathak and Dr. Liang have both performed these molecular techniques many times in the past and are knowledgeable in C. elegans  maintenance and experimentation. Both are successful in their respective fields. Dr. Pathak is a neuroscientist who has been published in the Journal of Neuroscience. Dr. Liang has currently obtained a major grant from the National Institute of Health to study the effects of stress on the longevity of C. elegans. Both are experts at what they do and know how to lead us two growing scientists.

As students, we have also garnered experience in our years at Stuyvesant High School. In addition to basic biology and chemistry courses, we have taken an accelerated research class that taught us common laboratory techniques and allowed us to complete independent studies of our own. Kai Hin studied the effects of melatonin on Brassica rapa (mustard plant) growth and found that melatonin is sufficient for increased plant stem height. In a study using the planarian Dugesia tigrina, Andrew found that conditioning of Ginkgo biloba extract and egg yolk increases memory retention in the posterity of Dugesia tigrina.

We have also taken two semesters of college-leveled biology, molecular biology, and chemistry; and a semester in neuroscience with a particular focus at the cellular and molecular level.

Relevant Links 

Dr Jun Liang - http://faculty.bmcc.cuny.edu/faculty/fp.jsp?f=jrice

Dr Hemal Pathak - http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2211568/


Community Impact

Funding two students probably doesn’t seem like it will have a big impact at first, but many other students in our school are involved as well. We run a club at Stuyvesant called the Neuroscience Club that meets weekly and is open to all students. We discuss current neuroscience literature, guide students toward independent research, find labs for students to work for, and provide them basic laboratory maintenance skills of C. elegans at our workspace.


With the funding that you graciously provide, the strains that we purchase will be available for the use of any student as well as any materials or tools for students to use, learn, and experiment with. We believe hands-on learning is critical for building scientific literacy and thinking, and the money gathered here will be crucial underpinnings for the students in our club and at our school. This kind of unique experience is not something students can easily learn through the school curriculum. Please support us to help create a legacy for scientific research for years to come!


The tools and materials

The money from this campaign will mainly go towards building and purchasing plasmids and reagents for RNA interference, and transgenic C. elegans on which these techniques will be performed. Basic culturing tools such as petri dishes, Nematode Growth Media (agar), and a microscope will also be bought.

The specifics:

Nematode Growth Media stock - $150

6 cm petri dish stock - $150

E.coli OP50 bacteria (food source for C. elegans) - $30

Various C. elegans transgenic strains - $1500

RNAi transformation solutions - $950

95% ethanol, 120mL - $20

15mL conical tubes and rack - $25

Amscope - LED Trinocular Zoom Stereo Microscope 3.5X-90X - $500

The mechanism behind RNA interference (RNAi)


Perks!

Any contribution from you is a HUGE thank you from us. You’d be helping high school students have the opportunity to experience professional science -- something we will never forget! If you make a contribution of $10 or more, we will send you a postcard from the students in our Neuroscience Club and a copy of our finished research paper.


Timing

As students and not full-time scientists, unfortunately, we cannot spend more than our evenings working on our experiments. But by the start of our summer break at the end of June, we will be able to attend our school from morning to evening every day for almost 9 weeks. We hope to gather the funds by the middle of June, when we will purchase all of our materials to get ready for the summer. We plan to release a publication by the fall semester, but if we encounter some roadblocks, we will still see that our project is completed, however long it may take.


Risks and Challenges

Despite being guided by two professional scientists who have performed these techniques many times in the past, as with all scientific experiments, there is always room for human error. But with detailed protocols that are online and easily accessible, thorough revisions to the list of our experiments, months of prior research, behavioral data we have already collected, and a clear goal in mind, we are certain our project will be successful.


Other ways you can help!

Please help spread our campaign by word of mouth, or linking the campaign webpage to your social media platforms! Every person, every thought, and every dollar counts!


Contact Us

If you have any questions or concerns, or would like a more detailed explanation of our project and goals, please message us at stuyneuroscience@gmail.com.

story:
Short Summary

Haiti Community Education is a program started in 2011 at the Saint Charles Institute of Croix de Bouquets (Port-au-Prince, Haiti), with a class of community education addressed to the teachers of the Institute. 

Since then, the teachers of “Saint Charles” continued the community education program over 2 years, following in total 80 hours of class. As a result of the class, the teachers upgraded the didactic and organizational profile of the Institution. In 2013 some of these teachers engaged in an advanced training of community education in order to apply this methodology beyond the context of the Saint Charles Institution. The training consisted of both theoretical sessions and practical on-field workshops. From 2013 to 2016 the group of community educators set up local work teams for tackling distinct community problems. 

Currently, the Haiti Community Education program operates in the towns of Croix des Bouquets, Bon Repos, Cavaillon, Saint Marc, Mirebalais, Marchand Dessalines, Thomonde, Corail, Pétion-ville, representing an area of more than 200 Km2. Besides the community educators, it involves the participation of parents, youth, local teachers, farmers and community leaders.

What We Need & What You Get

The program costs € 4100,00 for year:  € 500, 00 for expenses of transport of the community educators from their homes to the areas where they operate (twice a year); € 600,00 for the expenses of food for all the participants to the two meetings of communities education for year; € 3000,00 for supporting the expenses to sustain the regular activities in each communities.

You can receive regular news about the progress of the program and about Haitian communities.

The Impact

The island of Haiti has been a colony governed by France for almost two centuries. The natives being practically exterminated by the subjugation to the French administration, the manpower was replaced with deported African slaves, which endured the subjection to France until the island became independent in 1804, right after the US independence declaration. After the independence, the country continued to suffer from poverty and political instability, being unable to set up a solid and autonomous economical system. The violent earthquake that devastated the island in 2010 exacerbated the social, political and economical disorder, in spite of the worldwide aid response to the calamity. Community Education is a pedagogical approach that helps the empowerment of local communities by raising the awareness of their own oppressions, necessities and resources. It promotes collective strategies in order to tackle the goals of the community.

It promotes the autonomy of local community from international subventions and subsidy mentality. Therefore, ‘Popoli in Arte’ believes that the methodology of Community Education represents a substantial tool to face the difficult context of Haiti and to enable the inhabitants to develop their own social, political and economical resources. Our  approach allows the spreading of Community Education over a large portion of the country, encouraging the progress and autonomy of local communities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Independently on your economical contribution, you can help the development of the program by:

  • sharing our campaign with your friends 
  • suggesting other possible initiatives for fundraising
  • getting in contact with the Association (https://www.facebook.com/popolinarte/?fref=ts)

story:
***Texte version française au bas de la page

****Vidéo version française: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W1SK0YGE0CQ

 

My name is Émie Jacques, founder of the Brainstorm Factory and the brand “A Girl and A Pig” . To describe me simply: I love to try everything! Curious by nature, I am fascinated by everything around me, and learning for me is bliss! ^^

I am a designer and stylist but have always been interested in collaboration, the exchange of skills and knowledge, and the arts. Always keen to learn, I am self-taught in a number of areas such as nutrition and eco-living. I create jewellery and clothing but also enjoy expressing myself through music, drawing, photography, and other arts. I am passionate about life, creativity, people, and the world we live in, and want to find a way to share this passion with others and to encourage the development of potential.

I created the Brainstorm Factory because many people, like me, do not have the space to practice their art. I wanted to create a place that would allow people to express themselves within a welcoming and conducive atmosphere. This is also a space to exchange ideas, techniques, to be inspired, make discoveries, or simply to enjoy!

Equipment and materials are available free of charge enabling anyone to try their hand at something new. All are welcome, whether beginner or professional, and of any age.

The Brainstorm Factory has three rooms: one for sewing, jewellery, seminars, meetings, and brainstorming sessions, another for music, relaxation, and therapy, with the main room dedicated to all aspects of visual art as well as extra space for seminars and other happenings.

The goal is to learn, facilitate wonderful exchanges, and to express creativity while also respecting the environment.

Seminars will focus on a variety of topics: artistic technique, food and nutrition, community building and support, the environment, the possibilities are endless! We will be open to ideas and will focus on the wants and needs of participants. Some seminars will also be transmitted online.

Happenings are activities where people can gather to express themselves, learn something new, and have fun! Examples of this would be music jams, story circles, potluck meals, and community outreach events.

For some events we might encourage a small fee (5 - 10$) or donation to cover special materials or circumstances, but the aim is always to remain as free and accessible to all as possible.

The Brainstorm Factory needs you!

I strongly believe that this project will have a positive impact on the community. Knowledge, learning, and the rights of creative expression should be accessible to all, not just those with money and resources (because as we know, art and learning can be expensive).

A project like this can educate, help develop cultural and intellectual faculties, and encourage different perspectives about life and the world we live in. An educated and self-aware society is a healthy society. Ideally knowledge, learning, and the means to creative self-expression should be accessible to everyone. This is why it is my intent that access to the Brainstorm Factory and use of equipment and materials will be free wherever possible. To achieve this I need your help! If we give a little together we can gather a lot. With your donation you have the power to create a positive impact!

(Picture of the Inverted Halloween event where we handed out candy and good vibes to people on the streets!)

Let's talk about money

The Brainstorm Factory is a three room space in the heart of Old Quebec City.

Rent is 574.88$ per month (6898.56$ per year).

Commercial insurance is 574.88$ per year

I spent more than 2000$ on the basic equipment and materials that are currently in the space. This includes sewing machines, clothing materials, jewellery materials, furniture, easels, paint, canvasses, and other artistic supplies.

In total I’ve spent 9420.56$ for a basic year. I have gladly funded this out of my own pocket because I truly believe in the positive impact of such a community space, but I need your help to keep it going!

My goal here is to raise 6215$ to cover rent and materials for a few months. If we manage to exceed the amount that will be even better! ^^ because it would allow us to expand our range of equipment and materials, and to initiate more community outreach projects.

Other ways to help

The Brainstorm Factory is a place to nurture open minds - a space with no barriers - the goal simply to learn and create wonderful exchanges. It is very important for me to express my creativity with a minimum of harm and waste to the planet, and to encourage others to do so too. We want to avoid abusing resources for personal pleasure so will endeavour to do everything with respect for the environment and the local community. In this way too you can help!!

We are called the Brainstorm Factory for a reason! This is a place of ideas and creation so if you have any ideas or expertise you'd like to share or exchange with us please do get in touch!

The Brainstorm Factory is based on the principle of sharing <3 I am always on the lookout for second-hand equipment and materials, or ways to facilitate exchange. My own equipment is there and free to use, so why not yours also! If you have any material lying around at home why not come and share it with other artists?!! Maybe you have equipment that you do not use but that someone else could make great use of (or vice versa) !

The desired material is myriad! It could be art materials, old clothing/material, sewing tools, music instruments... everything is accepted! So this is it! I appeal to you to become a part of this project for fulfilment and enjoyment whether you are local to Quebec or not!

If you have things to give, share, or donate: email me!! Of course, even your time is precious! Besides, even if you are not an artist you can always come ''chill'' with us, no matter your age! :D

We are open at least five days a week, including weekends, with the possibility of premises rental on any day of the week for private events or functions.

Hope to see you there: to share, exchange, and experience!

Thank you all for your time and consideration.

**See the perks at the botom of the page

Mon nom est Émie Jacques, fondatrice de Brainstorm Factory et de la marque A girl and A pig.

Un simple mot pour me décrire;

Je suis une touche à tout (comme dirait un Québécois) ! Curieuse de nature, je me suis toujours intéressée à tout ce qu'il y a autour de moi. Apprendre est pour moi le bonheur absolu ! Je suis designer et styliste de formation, mais je me suis toujours intéressée à l'échange collectif et les arts. J’étudie plusieurs domaines de façon autodidacte telles la nutrition, l’écologie, et l’autosuffisance. De plus, je fais de la création de vêtements et de bijoux et je pratique la musique, le dessin et plusieurs autres arts. Bref, tout me fascine et je voulais trouver une façon de partager cette passion avec d’autres pour leur permettre de développer leur potentiel.

J’ai créé ce local, car plusieurs personnes sont en appartement et n’ont pas nécessairement l'espace pour pratiquer leur art. Je voulais donc créer un endroit qui permettrait aux gens de faire tout cela dans une belle atmosphère. Ce lieu permettra, entre autre, d’échanger entre artistes et suscitera l’apprentissage, la création et le perfectionnement.

Le matériel sera accessible GRATUITEMENT pour permettre aux gens d’essayer de nouvelles techniques de création. Que vous soyez débutant ou professionnel, tout le monde est la bienvenue.

Peinture réalisée au Brainstorm factory par Francois Brisson 

Le local est séparé en trois espaces différents.

Pièce #1 :  Couture par le biais de 5 machines à coudre, fils, aiguilles, tissus sur place ainsi que  la création de bijoux

 Pièce #2:  Musique avec différents instruments disponibles pour « jammer» en groupe.

Pièce #3: Art visuel tels le dessin et la peinture. Table à dessin, 3 chevalets et pots de peinture accessibles à tous. 

Vous ne pratiquez pas d’art? Ce n’est pas grave, car ces pièces serviront aussi pour les conférences à prix modique ( 5$ ou 10$ par personne) avec possiblité de Webinar. Les conférences porteront sur divers sujets:art (comment créer sa propre peinture, technique de peinture à l’eau, l’acrylique, les ombres et lumières etc.),alimentation ( crudivorisme, végétarisme, déshydratation des aliments), la photographie, la mode, les green communities, le sport, le jeûne, les tiny-houses etc. Bref, les possibilités sont infinies. Tout dépendra du nombre de personnes qui seront intéressées à celles-ci. D’ailleurs, si vous avez un sujet sur lequel vous aimeriez apprendre ou même enseigner, soumettez-moi vos idées!

Voilà pourquoi nous avons besoins de vous! Je crois qu’il est important de contribuer à un projet comme celui-ci,car il a un gros impact sur notre communauté. Le droit de savoir et le développement de compétences ne devrait pas être accessible seulement à ceux qui ont beaucoup d’argent (car oui tout le monde sait que l’art coûte cher). Un projet comme celui-ci permet d’éduquer les gens, leur permettre de comprendre la culture, développer leurs facultés intellectuelles tout en ayant une vision différente sur la vie, leur apprendre le partage de biens,mais aussi de connaissances. Une société éduquée forme une société en santé. Le droit de savoir et le droit à l’éducation devraient être accessibles à tout le monde. Voilà pourquoi l’accès au local et l’utilisation de matériel seront gratuits, mais pour ce faire j’aurai besoin de votre aide. Tous ensemble, en donnant un peu,on peut amasser beaucoup! Avec votre don,vous avez le pouvoir de créer un impact positif autour de vous!

L'halloween inversé qui consistait à cogner au porte dans les quartiers plus démunis et donner des bonbons

À quoi servira l’argent

Loyer 6899,00 (574.88 par mois )

Enregistrement Obnl 164,00$

Achat de matériel de seconde main 2 000 $

Assurance commerciale 522,00$

Total= 9420.56 $

Tout ce que je demande ici est 6125,ce qui ne comblent pas toutes les dépenses. Avec la location de locaux pendant le jour,je vais réussir à amasser le montant manquant. Cependant, si nous pouvions amasser plus que prévu, cela nous permettrait d’acheter plus d’équipement, payer des activités de sensibilisation communautaire et  garder des fonds pour l’an prochain.

 

 

D'autres façons d'aider

L’ouverture d’esprit sera primordiale dans ce lieu. C’est un endroit où il n’y aura pas de barrière. Le but est d’apprendre et de créer de merveilleux échanges, tout simplement. De plus, il est primordial de pouvoir exprimer ma créativité et permettre aux autres de le faire sans créer des déchets supplémentaires pour la planète. Abuser des ressources pour un plaisir personnel, ce n’est pas super. Alors, tout sera fait le plus possible dans le respect de l’environnement. Voilà donc pourquoi vous pouvez aider autrement!

Le local étant basé sur le principe du partage, j’essaie de récupérer le plus possible de matériel de seconde main pour le rendre accessible à tous. Mon matériel sera aussi disponible.

 Si vous avez du matériel quelconque qui traîne chez vous, venez le partager avec d’autres artistes!

Le matériel recherché est assez varié; que ce soit  peinture, dessin, vieux vêtements ou article de couture, des outils pour la création de bijoux, des instruments de musique… Tout est accepté!  De plus si vous avez une expertise quelconque en communication/marketing/publicité/traduction ou que vous soyez un pro des réseaux sociaux et vous avez du temps à offrir, c’est autant apprécié!  D’ailleurs même si vous n’êtes pas un artiste,vous pouvez toujours venir ‘’chiller’’ avec nous, peu importe votre âge! 
Éventuellement, une fois le tout bien installé, j’offrirai aussi des services de stylisme et de location de locaux, des cours de cuisine végétarienne et je mettrai aussi mon déshydrateur à disposition pour quelques dollars.

Ouvert 5 jours/semaine, incluant la fin de semaine. Notez aussi qu’il y a possibilité de louer les locaux le jour.

Au plaisir de vous y voir et de vous faire découvrir l’art sous plusieurs angles de façon totalement enrichissante! 

 

Contreparties/Perks:

ss

Light-Painting with Alex V photographer

Lucky bracelet/ Energy rock ( Bracelet comes in a variety of different colors->See below )
Bracelet chanceux et pierre d'énergie (Peut venir en différent couleur-> voir ci-dessous)

Transformable scarf by AG|AP

Foulard transformable par AG|AP

Portrait digital par Michael Leclerc 

Portrait Digital par Michael Leclerc
story_txt: ***Texte version française au bas de la page****Vidéo version française: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W1SK0YGE0CQ My name is Émie Jacques, founder of the Brainstorm Factory and the brand “A Girl and A Pig” . To describe me simply: I love to try everything! Curious by nature, I am fascinated by everything around me, and learning for me is bliss! ^^I am a designer and stylist but have always been interested in collaboration, the exchange of skills and knowledge, and the arts. Always keen to learn, I am self-taught in a number of areas such as nutrition and eco-living. I create jewellery and clothing but also enjoy expressing myself through music, drawing, photography, and other arts. I am passionate about life, creativity, people, and the world we live in, and want to find a way to share this passion with others and to encourage the development of potential.I created the Brainstorm Factory because many people, like me, do not have the space to practice their art. I wanted to create a place that would allow people to express themselves within a welcoming and conducive atmosphere. This is also a space to exchange ideas, techniques, to be inspired, make discoveries, or simply to enjoy!Equipment and materials are available free of charge enabling anyone to try their hand at something new. All are welcome, whether beginner or professional, and of any age.The Brainstorm Factory has three rooms: one for sewing, jewellery, seminars, meetings, and brainstorming sessions, another for music, relaxation, and therapy, with the main room dedicated to all aspects of visual art as well as extra space for seminars and other happenings.The goal is to learn, facilitate wonderful exchanges, and to express creativity while also respecting the environment.Seminars will focus on a variety of topics: artistic technique, food and nutrition, community building and support, the environment, the possibilities are endless! We will be open to ideas and will focus on the wants and needs of participants. Some seminars will also be transmitted online.Happenings are activities where people can gather to express themselves, learn something new, and have fun! Examples of this would be music jams, story circles, potluck meals, and community outreach events.For some events we might encourage a small fee (5 - 10$) or donation to cover special materials or circumstances, but the aim is always to remain as free and accessible to all as possible.The Brainstorm Factory needs you!I strongly believe that this project will have a positive impact on the community. Knowledge, learning, and the rights of creative expression should be accessible to all, not just those with money and resources (because as we know, art and learning can be expensive).A project like this can educate, help develop cultural and intellectual faculties, and encourage different perspectives about life and the world we live in. An educated and self-aware society is a healthy society. Ideally knowledge, learning, and the means to creative self-expression should be accessible to everyone. This is why it is my intent that access to the Brainstorm Factory and use of equipment and materials will be free wherever possible. To achieve this I need your help! If we give a little together we can gather a lot. With your donation you have the power to create a positive impact!(Picture of the Inverted Halloween event where we handed out candy and good vibes to people on the streets!)Let's talk about moneyThe Brainstorm Factory is a three room space in the heart of Old Quebec City.Rent is 574.88$ per month (6898.56$ per year).Commercial insurance is 574.88$ per yearI spent more than 2000$ on the basic equipment and materials that are currently in the space. This includes sewing machines, clothing materials, jewellery materials, furniture, easels, paint, canvasses, and other artistic supplies.In total I’ve spent 9420.56$ for a basic year. I have gladly funded this out of my own pocket because I truly believe in the positive impact of such a community space, but I need your help to keep it going!My goal here is to raise 6215$ to cover rent and materials for a few months. If we manage to exceed the amount that will be even better! ^^ because it would allow us to expand our range of equipment and materials, and to initiate more community outreach projects.Other ways to helpThe Brainstorm Factory is a place to nurture open minds - a space with no barriers - the goal simply to learn and create wonderful exchanges. It is very important for me to express my creativity with a minimum of harm and waste to the planet, and to encourage others to do so too. We want to avoid abusing resources for personal pleasure so will endeavour to do everything with respect for the environment and the local community. In this way too you can help!!We are called the Brainstorm Factory for a reason! This is a place of ideas and creation so if you have any ideas or expertise you'd like to share or exchange with us please do get in touch!The Brainstorm Factory is based on the principle of sharing <3 I am always on the lookout for second-hand equipment and materials, or ways to facilitate exchange. My own equipment is there and free to use, so why not yours also! If you have any material lying around at home why not come and share it with other artists?!! Maybe you have equipment that you do not use but that someone else could make great use of (or vice versa) !The desired material is myriad! It could be art materials, old clothing/material, sewing tools, music instruments... everything is accepted! So this is it! I appeal to you to become a part of this project for fulfilment and enjoyment whether you are local to Quebec or not!If you have things to give, share, or donate: email me!! Of course, even your time is precious! Besides, even if you are not an artist you can always come ''chill'' with us, no matter your age! :DWe are open at least five days a week, including weekends, with the possibility of premises rental on any day of the week for private events or functions.Hope to see you there: to share, exchange, and experience!Thank you all for your time and consideration.**See the perks at the botom of the pageMon nom est Émie Jacques, fondatrice de Brainstorm Factory et de la marque A girl and A pig.Un simple mot pour me décrire;Je suis une touche à tout (comme dirait un Québécois) ! Curieuse de nature, je me suis toujours intéressée à tout ce qu'il y a autour de moi. Apprendre est pour moi le bonheur absolu ! Je suis designer et styliste de formation, mais je me suis toujours intéressée à l'échange collectif et les arts. J’étudie plusieurs domaines de façon autodidacte telles la nutrition, l’écologie, et l’autosuffisance. De plus, je fais de la création de vêtements et de bijoux et je pratique la musique, le dessin et plusieurs autres arts. Bref, tout me fascine et je voulais trouver une façon de partager cette passion avec d’autres pour leur permettre de développer leur potentiel.J’ai créé ce local, car plusieurs personnes sont en appartement et n’ont pas nécessairement l'espace pour pratiquer leur art. Je voulais donc créer un endroit qui permettrait aux gens de faire tout cela dans une belle atmosphère. Ce lieu permettra, entre autre, d’échanger entre artistes et suscitera l’apprentissage, la création et le perfectionnement.Le matériel sera accessible GRATUITEMENT pour permettre aux gens d’essayer de nouvelles techniques de création. Que vous soyez débutant ou professionnel, tout le monde est la bienvenue.Peinture réalisée au Brainstorm factory par Francois Brisson Le local est séparé en trois espaces différents.Pièce #1 :  Couture par le biais de 5 machines à coudre, fils, aiguilles, tissus sur place ainsi que  la création de bijoux Pièce #2:  Musique avec différents instruments disponibles pour « jammer» en groupe.Pièce #3: Art visuel tels le dessin et la peinture. Table à dessin, 3 chevalets et pots de peinture accessibles à tous. Vous ne pratiquez pas d’art? Ce n’est pas grave, car ces pièces serviront aussi pour les conférences à prix modique ( 5$ ou 10$ par personne) avec possiblité de Webinar. Les conférences porteront sur divers sujets:art (comment créer sa propre peinture, technique de peinture à l’eau, l’acrylique, les ombres et lumières etc.),alimentation ( crudivorisme, végétarisme, déshydratation des aliments), la photographie, la mode, les green communities, le sport, le jeûne, les tiny-houses etc. Bref, les possibilités sont infinies. Tout dépendra du nombre de personnes qui seront intéressées à celles-ci. D’ailleurs, si vous avez un sujet sur lequel vous aimeriez apprendre ou même enseigner, soumettez-moi vos idées!Voilà pourquoi nous avons besoins de vous! Je crois qu’il est important de contribuer à un projet comme celui-ci,car il a un gros impact sur notre communauté. Le droit de savoir et le développement de compétences ne devrait pas être accessible seulement à ceux qui ont beaucoup d’argent (car oui tout le monde sait que l’art coûte cher). Un projet comme celui-ci permet d’éduquer les gens, leur permettre de comprendre la culture, développer leurs facultés intellectuelles tout en ayant une vision différente sur la vie, leur apprendre le partage de biens,mais aussi de connaissances. Une société éduquée forme une société en santé. Le droit de savoir et le droit à l’éducation devraient être accessibles à tout le monde. Voilà pourquoi l’accès au local et l’utilisation de matériel seront gratuits, mais pour ce faire j’aurai besoin de votre aide. Tous ensemble, en donnant un peu,on peut amasser beaucoup! Avec votre don,vous avez le pouvoir de créer un impact positif autour de vous!L'halloween inversé qui consistait à cogner au porte dans les quartiers plus démunis et donner des bonbonsÀ quoi servira l’argentLoyer 6899,00 (574.88 par mois )Enregistrement Obnl 164,00$Achat de matériel de seconde main 2 000 $Assurance commerciale 522,00$Total= 9420.56 $Tout ce que je demande ici est 6125,ce qui ne comblent pas toutes les dépenses. Avec la location de locaux pendant le jour,je vais réussir à amasser le montant manquant. Cependant, si nous pouvions amasser plus que prévu, cela nous permettrait d’acheter plus d’équipement, payer des activités de sensibilisation communautaire et  garder des fonds pour l’an prochain.  D'autres façons d'aiderL’ouverture d’esprit sera primordiale dans ce lieu. C’est un endroit où il n’y aura pas de barrière. Le but est d’apprendre et de créer de merveilleux échanges, tout simplement. De plus, il est primordial de pouvoir exprimer ma créativité et permettre aux autres de le faire sans créer des déchets supplémentaires pour la planète. Abuser des ressources pour un plaisir personnel, ce n’est pas super. Alors, tout sera fait le plus possible dans le respect de l’environnement. Voilà donc pourquoi vous pouvez aider autrement!Le local étant basé sur le principe du partage, j’essaie de récupérer le plus possible de matériel de seconde main pour le rendre accessible à tous. Mon matériel sera aussi disponible. Si vous avez du matériel quelconque qui traîne chez vous, venez le partager avec d’autres artistes!Le matériel recherché est assez varié; que ce soit  peinture, dessin, vieux vêtements ou article de couture, des outils pour la création de bijoux, des instruments de musique… Tout est accepté!  De plus si vous avez une expertise quelconque en communication/marketing/publicité/traduction ou que vous soyez un pro des réseaux sociaux et vous avez du temps à offrir, c’est autant apprécié!  D’ailleurs même si vous n’êtes pas un artiste,vous pouvez toujours venir ‘’chiller’’ avec nous, peu importe votre âge! Éventuellement, une fois le tout bien installé, j’offrirai aussi des services de stylisme et de location de locaux, des cours de cuisine végétarienne et je mettrai aussi mon déshydrateur à disposition pour quelques dollars.Ouvert 5 jours/semaine, incluant la fin de semaine. Notez aussi qu’il y a possibilité de louer les locaux le jour.Au plaisir de vous y voir et de vous faire découvrir l’art sous plusieurs angles de façon totalement enrichissante!  Contreparties/Perks:ssLight-Painting with Alex V photographerLucky bracelet/ Energy rock ( Bracelet comes in a variety of different colors->See below )Bracelet chanceux et pierre d'énergie (Peut venir en différent couleur-> voir ci-dessous)Transformable scarf by AG|APFoulard transformable par AG|APPortrait digital par Michael Leclerc Portrait Digital par Michael Leclerc

story:
The KayaNet(TM) Story

Back about 10 years ago, like many other researchers I was bemused by all the breathless "New Economy" talk about "networked-this" and "IT-enabled-that."  I knew enough about competition to be skeptical of many of the claims, particularly about "networked models of the firm."  Unproven statements like "the first mover advantage leads to lock-in and market dominance" had me worried that hype had overtaken sound analysis. 

...but at the time, there weren't many good ways to analyze New Economy firms.  We were in the same intellectual hole as the early Darwinists: we couldn't claim survival of the fittest, just survival of the survivors!

Incidentally, one of my weekly diversions was a lunchtime game of Go with an old shipmate.  After many weeks of play, I came to understand that both players in the game are  looking at all the data available--the playing pieces, the board, and the rules of play--but we were each competing against the other's implicit rendition of a different network than the 19x19 grid in front of us.  This different network was a growing network of stones, which morphed with each stone laid by either player.  The implicit network was necessarily a grid, because it had to manifest not in the network of our minds, but in the physical network in front of us.

Exploring the New Economy with a Board Game

I began to wonder what the competition would look like if the board had a different structure.  So I re-wired the board.

The new Network-Centric Go board had the same number of nodes and links (381 nodes, 684 links), but they were arranged not with four links attached to every node in the grid (except, of course, for the edges and corners of the board) but according to the "preferential attachment" process that researchers found in models of the internet and world-wide web.  This kind of network has a very, very large number of lightly connected nodes (in this case, 2 links per node, to comport with the rules of the game), a moderate number of moderately connected nodes, and a very small number of very, very well connected nodes.

You win in Go by capturing stones, and a basic tactic is to place stones on all four nodes adjacent to the node you want to capture (that is, at the end of the four connected links).  It was obvious to assume that the best strategy was to capture the most well connected nodes first.  So Player 1's first move should capture the most well connected node on the board, in this case, one with 54 links.  Player 2 should capture the next most well connected (29 links on our board).  Player 1 would then connect a node with 26 links as a second move (almost as good a move as Player 2's FIRST move.  Player 2 would then capture a node with 19 links, which just so happened to have exactly the same number of links as Player 1's THIRD move.  So you can see that there is a definite first-mover advantage.

I was thinking I had a means of proving some of the New Economy claims, but the 19x19 grid was too hard to play in real life.  Each stone laid changes the calculations, and you couldn't derive these just by looking at the board, you had to actually do the calculations each time.  So we reduced the board to 100 nodes (the same as a 10x10 Go board) and we kept playing to explore more fully.  We found that first mover advantage did indeed persist, so long as we kept playing a "decreasing degree" strategy.

I decided to try something different during play.  While I let Player 1 get his first mover advantage and didn't contest any of the five most well-connected nodes, I played a "decreasing clustering coefficient" strategy.  Clustering Coefficient is a measure of local cohesion, representing the proportion of a node's neighbors that are also neighbors of each other.  Playing this strategy meant that after a few moves, the best clusters became connected with each other, and my stone-capturing network flipped the board in my favor.  In fact, I was able to lock out the first mover advantage that Player 1 had enjoyed.

KayaNet(TM): An HBR Breakthrough Idea!

It was far from a trivial result, and in fact the game was recognized by Harvard Business Review as one of the Top 20 Breakthrough Ideas in their annual ranking.

KayaNet(TM) is a project to digitize the game so that the full 19x19 board (and even higher dimensions) can be played by a wider audience (it is amusing to note that the original 10x10 game was played with MS PowerPoint(TM) and Tic-Tacs (TM).

What's the Funding For?

We will use the funding to build the KayaNet(TM) website, develop the algorithms and player interfaces, and finally to code them into an online version of the game.  This game should be a great educational tool to learn about how networks might compete with networks, and should be of great interest to Computer Science, Cyber Warfare, Network Science and New Economy researchers.

So please give what you can.  We will continue to pursue corporate, government and university funding, but this should give us a start.  If you are a corporate, government and university donor, you'll be giving the online community a great asset, show your thought leadership, and do your part to make this happen without busting your budget.  Individual supporters will be able to have some bragging rights, as you'll be on the ground floor of something that may well be the chess game of the future.  Speaking of that, we have also re-wired and played Battleship(TM), checkers, and chess itself.  We see those as future games on the KayaNet(TM) site!

Why KayaNet(TM)?  Kaya is the wood that the best Japanese Go board are made of.  Coincidentally, Kaya hemp is also used to make mess netting.  ...works on so many levels...

Thanks for contributing!

story:
Short Summary

The Author

I am a small business owner and trained Accountant with over 20 years of experience and education in accounting and finance.  Prior to starting my consulting firm, the Anchor Group in 2009,  I worked as Senior Auditor at Pricewaterhousecoopers, Manager in Transaction Advisory Services Group at Ernst & Young and Senior Director of Business Development at Broadridge Financial Solutions.  My first degree was in Accounting and Economics and my second degree is a  MBA in Finance and Accounting.  I have included my LinkedIn Profile (https://www.linkedin.com/in/kehowell)

 

Motivation to Write this Book

I have had the privilege to train over 1,000 business owners in New York City over the past seven years in several areas of business management.  I observed that many of the business owners and entrepreneurs that attended my sessions were at first very apprehensive and fearful about the topic of financial management.   I also observed that by the middle of my sessions, I received more questions and participation and by the end of the sessions, I saw sparks of hope and excitement about accounting and financial management.   

These sparks of hope and excitement have motivated me to assist more businesses to grow.  However, I realized that I could not provide face-to-face training to most of the small and mid-sized business owners and in some cases, it was cost prohibitive for some business owners to have one-to-one sessions with me.  I figured that I could help more business owners if I replicated my voice, style and my excitement about financial management in a book.  I was very careful not to create another textbook, rather to provide a user friendly and easily followed guide using my years of experience working with large, medium and small businesses and now from running my own company.  

All You Can Eat (AYCE), is a comprehensive financial guide that should be leveraged to strengthen your understanding of business financial management (See link to excerpt from first chapter https://www.slideshare.net/lead-campaigns/new?f...).  

All You Can Eat answers 10 of the most frequently asked questions by small businesses and entrepreneurs about business financial management.  This book should change how entrepreneurs and business managers measure and monitor the financial health of their businesses.   

Earlier this year, I was contracted as one of two NYC Instructor through Interise to facilitate the Small Business Administration Emerging  Leader Program.  During the national offsite training for the Instructors,  I mentioned to one of the instructors that I have been working on a manual for a while to assist SMEs with creating better financial culture throughout their organizations.  I was put on blast and I committed to finishing this book this year, my first book.  I am glad that I have lived up to this commitment, I have completed the book and now I am so excited about sharing it with the world of business managers, entrepreneurs, students and the curious.  I truly believe that this book will help millions of businesses to grow.

Purpose for this Campaign

I need your help.  I need you to collaborate with me in this pre-sale of "All You Can Eat" and help me  raise $35,000 to complete the editing of the manual and publishing and  promotion of the final book. I decided to self publish the book through the economic development and small business network that I have engaged with when I founded Anchor in 2009.   I am committed to this project and the change it will bring to the small business community.

What We Need & What You Get

With your help, I am hoping to raise $35,000 over the next 35 days.  The $35,000 will be used to finalize book edits and publishing and to manage the promotions from February to the end of the summer of  2017.   I  expect to host the first book signing at the end of February 2017,   Below, I have included a break-down of the budget for your review and edification.

I have come up with a number of cool perks for contributors to this campaign.  The lowest contribution level is $5 bucks and is called Stir It Up. 

 

I am committed to completing this project by February.  

Why Should You Contribute To Campaign

This book answers the top 10 financial management questions of entrepreneurs and small businesses in 10 chapters.  

  1. What is financial management and why do I have to worry about it?
  2. How do I set up my business financial management system?
  3. How do I use financial management to grow my business?
  4. What is the best way to manage my business cash flow?
  5. Where can I find cash to grow my business?
  6. The banks and investors are asking for financial projections, where do I start?
  7. How do I protect my business against lawsuits, contingencies and disasters?
  8. What steps do I have to take to build my personal and business credit?
  9. What do I need to know about business taxes?
  10. How much is my business worth?

Small Business Administration research shows that 34 percent of businesses do not make it to two years. One of the top 10 reasons why many businesses fail is due to lack of proper financial management.  

  • Small businesses need this help.  I have consulted with a lot of business owners and many do not know where to start when it comes on to financial management, this book will greatly help.
  • Good financial management increases the possibility of business success.  The Association of Certified Chartered Accountants (ACCA) states that “Financial management is at the heart of running a successful business. It affects every aspect, from managing cash flow and tracking business performance to developing plans that ensure that business owners can make the most of opportunities”.   
  • Content is accurate and organized systematically.  All You Can Eat is better than random googling or online searches as it brings all the fundamental and essential financial management information that a business needs to think about or better yet needs to know in one place.
  • One of its kind manual.  There is no book that is readily available on the market that has fused the theory of accounting and finance with the experiences and nuances of running a business and provided quickly digestible checklists after every chapter for reader friendliness.  

I show in this book that comprehensive financial management is more than timely recording and reporting of transactions in financial statement.  It is about building a culture of measurement that involves planning; forecasting and budgeting; accounting for non-financial business dealings; and resolving and adjusting for any deviations in all functional areas of a business (operations, marketing, sales, technology, strategy, finance). 

Risks & Challenges

The first draft of the complete manuscript has been completed.  I have identified copy editor, publishing coordinator and illustrator to complete the book the final version of the book.  Any delay from our February deadline, would only be due to unforeseen circumstances that might arise associate with pre-publishing steps.  All You Can Eat will be on the market by no later than the first quarter of 2017 with your assistance. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know you might not be able to contribute financially at this time or might not have an need for this book personally.  However, passing the word on about the book and the campaign is also a great help.

  • Pre-purchase a copy for your friend or a business owner you might know that could use some financial management guidance 
  • Please tell a business owner, or 25 business owners, or even more 
  • Post link of this campaign on your social media pages.
  • Even better, post a link to the campaign video on your Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter
  • Click here to FaceBook to like our FaceBook page 

Please connect with the author at:

  • Facebook: www.facebook.com/kevin.howell.3388
  • Twitter: @thekevinhowell
  • Email: khowell@anchorgroupcorp.com
  • #AYCEFinance  #Growth  # SmallBusinesses # Entrepreneurs

Thank you so much for your support!  I want you to take or give this book to a friend, "All You Can Eat", as a travel companion.  This book will guide the reader on his/her journey to grow their business.  

I raise my glass to your business' health.
story_txt:
Short Summary
The Author
I am a small business owner and trained Accountant with over 20 years of experience and education in accounting and finance.  Prior to starting my consulting firm, the Anchor Group in 2009,  I worked as Senior Auditor at Pricewaterhousecoopers, Manager in Transaction Advisory Services Group at Ernst & Young and Senior Director of Business Development at Broadridge Financial Solutions.  My first degree was in Accounting and Economics and my second degree is a  MBA in Finance and Accounting.  I have included my LinkedIn Profile (https://www.linkedin.com/in/kehowell)
 
Motivation to Write this Book
I have had the privilege to train over 1,000 business owners in New York City over the past seven years in several areas of business management.  I observed that many of the business owners and entrepreneurs that attended my sessions were at first very apprehensive and fearful about the topic of financial management.   I also observed that by the middle of my sessions, I received more questions and participation and by the end of the sessions, I saw sparks of hope and excitement about accounting and financial management.   
These sparks of hope and excitement have motivated me to assist more businesses to grow.  However, I realized that I could not provide face-to-face training to most of the small and mid-sized business owners and in some cases, it was cost prohibitive for some business owners to have one-to-one sessions with me.  I figured that I could help more business owners if I replicated my voice, style and my excitement about financial management in a book.  I was very careful not to create another textbook, rather to provide a user friendly and easily followed guide using my years of experience working with large, medium and small businesses and now from running my own company.  
All You Can Eat (AYCE), is a comprehensive financial guide that should be leveraged to strengthen your understanding of business financial management (See link to excerpt from first chapter https://www.slideshare.net/lead-campaigns/new?f...).  
All You Can Eat answers 10 of the most frequently asked questions by small businesses and entrepreneurs about business financial management.  This book should change how entrepreneurs and business managers measure and monitor the financial health of their businesses.   
Earlier this year, I was contracted as one of two NYC Instructor through Interise to facilitate the Small Business Administration Emerging  Leader Program.  During the national offsite training for the Instructors,  I mentioned to one of the instructors that I have been working on a manual for a while to assist SMEs with creating better financial culture throughout their organizations.  I was put on blast and I committed to finishing this book this year, my first book.  I am glad that I have lived up to this commitment, I have completed the book and now I am so excited about sharing it with the world of business managers, entrepreneurs, students and the curious.  I truly believe that this book will help millions of businesses to grow.
Purpose for this Campaign
I need your help.  I need you to collaborate with me in this pre-sale of "All You Can Eat" and help me  raise $35,000 to complete the editing of the manual and publishing and  promotion of the final book. I decided to self publish the book through the economic development and small business network that I have engaged with when I founded Anchor in 2009.   I am committed to this project and the change it will bring to the small business community.
What We Need & What You Get

With your help, I am hoping to raise $35,000 over the next 35 days.  The $35,000 will be used to finalize book edits and publishing and to manage the promotions from February to the end of the summer of  2017.   I  expect to host the first book signing at the end of February 2017,   Below, I have included a break-down of the budget for your review and edification.

I have come up with a number of cool perks for contributors to this campaign.  The lowest contribution level is $5 bucks and is called Stir It Up. 

 
I am committed to completing this project by February.  

Why Should You Contribute To Campaign

How do I set up my business financial management system?
How do I use financial management to grow my business?

Small businesses need this help.  I have consulted with a lot of business owners and many do not know where to start when it comes on to financial management, this book will greatly help.

Good financial management increases the possibility of business success.  The Association of Certified Chartered Accountants (ACCA) states that “Financial management is at the heart of running a successful business. It affects every aspect, from managing cash flow and tracking business performance to developing plans that ensure that business owners can make the most of opportunities”.   


Content is accurate and organized systematically.  All You Can Eat is better than random googling or online searches as it brings all the fundamental and essential financial management information that a business needs to think about or better yet needs to know in one place.

One of its kind manual.  There is no book that is readily available on the market that has fused the theory of accounting and finance with the experiences and nuances of running a business and provided quickly digestible checklists after every chapter for reader friendliness.  

I show in this book that comprehensive financial management is more than timely recording and reporting of transactions in financial statement.  It is about building a culture of measurement that involves planning; forecasting and budgeting; accounting for non-financial business dealings; and resolving and adjusting for any deviations in all functional areas of a business (operations, marketing, sales, technology, strategy, finance).

story:
Yuduyu is out to change the way the world finds jobs. To help the 40% of employers who can’t find the talent they need. To unlock the undiscovered potential of the billion people across the globe. How will we do that?  By focusing on their qualities, aptitudes, values and passions. By empowering people and communities to discover and exploit their talents to find the careers they deserve. And it will always be free for jobseekers.

Yuduyu is inclusive: we care about jobseekers’ potential – potential they may not realize they have. That’s how we’ll bring the young, the inexperienced and the marginalised into the global jobs market.

Yuduyu is effective: we’ll encourage jobseekers to learn more about themselves and then promote their natural talents – through gamified tests, online coaching, selfie videos. They’ll each get their own e-portfolio – a dynamic infographic showing who they are, and who they can become. And our unique career journey maps will them clarity about where they are now, where they want to be, and how to get there.

Yuduyu is good for business: employers see a recruitment crisis – in sectors from tech to construction, healthcare to finance they can’t find the talent they need, so they take what they can find. The result: positions go unfilled, or teams are made up of what they can get.

We’ll help them discover an ocean of talent, building diverse and dynamic teams. Their ‘talent shortage’ will disappear. And countless studies have shown that teams work better where there’s a mix of life experiences and perspectives.

Candidates start with a series of stimulating, gamified assessment tests to help them understand their natural aptitudes and character.

The results generate a personalised Yuduyu e-portfolio, a dynamic infographic of potential.

We then help them create Yuduyu career journey maps - giving them clarity about where they are now, where they want to be, and how to get there.

Yuduyu will also teach job seekers how to create great selfie videos to effectively showcase their unique style to employers.

Yuduyu e-coaching will teach them how to embrace their strengths and even their weaknesses - keeping them motivated but focused.

 

At Yuduyu, we’ve freed employers from the narrow focus on hard skills. They can now search and browse for soft skills too, things like:

  • personality types
  • ambitions
  • passions
  • values
  • emotional intelligence

They’ll be able to view and compare any number of e-portfolios from jobseekers anywhere in the world.

 

The feedback from focus groups couldn’t be better. We’ve got potential partners on board from the worlds of academia, training and recruitment. And we’ve had some early discussions with angel investors. Everyone is eagerly awaiting the prototype.  

This is where you come in and save the world.

We’ve started building the prototype, but we need funding to complete it. That means:

  • Designing and building out the prototype
  • Completing backend development
  • Expanding the geography of our focus groups to ensure that Yuduyu is a truly global solution
  • Creating partnerships in tech, psychometrics and human resources in Europe, the UK and the US

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Kristina Svensson, Co-founder: Kristina’s life has been a 30-year, eight country journey - taking her from college dropout to the world’s top entertainment and fashion companies. It wasn’t a smooth ride: her experiences convinced her of the need to reinvent the recruitment system. Obsessed with how we perceive professional value, she saw the answer in bringing psychometrics to the people who need it most.

David Lubich, Content Designer, has been working with words and ideas for 30 years as a magazine publisher, editor, copywriter and content strategist. His passion is helping people to harness their creative potential - from journalists to mosaic artists.

Morta Kazlauskaitė, Coordinator: Morta is finishing her studies at Sciences Po Paris but she’s a creative spirit at heart. Born and raised in Lithuania, her affinity for meeting new people, social media and tech makes her a natural fit for Yuduyu.

Idan Nesher, UX/UI Designer: After dropping out of high school in his native Israel at age 14, Idan has built a successful career as a UX designer. He is based in Berlin and very active in the local hackathon community.

Danny Issroff, Content Writer, was born in South Africa, grew up in Europe and New York and now lives in Berlin. He eagerly awaits the development of Yuduyu so that he can figure out who he really is. In the meantime, he works as a content editor at Onefootball.

 

If you’d like more details, just email contact@yuduyu.co. We’d love to share our strategy and plans with you!
 

LIKE US at Yuduyu on Facebook

FOLLOW US Yuduyu on Twitter and Instagram

REFER YOUR FRIENDS and FAMILY by sharing our campaign link by email or on Social Media by using the Indiegogo share tools or by sharing this short link: https://igg.me/at/yuduyudotco

SIGN UP FOR OUR NEWSLETTER at the Yuduyu website: www.yuduyu.co

THE OFFICIAL HASHTAGS FOR OUR CAMPAIGN are #yuduyu #beyourselfatwork #theresumeisdead #hiredifferently
