story:
Hello, I am Bolorkhundaga from Mongolia, team leader.

We are working on a project called “Ger Library” which is dedicated to the children who live in the ger district.

About 70% of the Ulaanbaatar city’s people live in a ger district. Therefore 90-95% of the children who live in a ger district go to schools that located in the ger district.

In every corner of the ger district, there is no library except only for the local school’s library. Each school tends to have 1500-2000 students, its library’s capacity is 16-20 students with 16-25m2.  This is not sufficient enough standard.

In Ulaanbaatar, there are only 5 or 6 public libraries for children. If secondary school children who live in ger district want to read books in a public library, they have to travel for 10 to 12km and spend lot of time. Public libraries are located in the downtown of the city.

Children who live in the ger district don’t have enough time for studying and reading.

  • Because of the long distance between their home and school​, they get tired, cold, and hungry.
  • They cannot concentrate on studying at their ger homes
  • They don’t have room to study in

Children are having difficulties with their school library

  • Most public secondary and high school libraries have limited space
  • Book fund is insufficient
  • Inadequate desks and chairs
  • Book fund is not insufficient
  • Long distance between children’ home and school and to might happen any problems
  • They have to spend money, time and effort to travel to public libraries which are located in downtown

As a result from setting up a new ger library in the ger district

  • In ger district, there will be a number of libraries
  • Children who live in the ger district will have more opportunities to study and to read.
  • Children will have options to select the nearest library to their home
  • It will encourage them to study and expand their knowledge
  • They will spend their time properly
  • They will become patient
  • Gaining knowledge and studying, children will develop themselves and have higher self-confidence.
  • Academic performance will improve

              Therefore, in the ger district areas, libraries are much needed.

This project aims to increase the education quality and to encourage children who cannot spend time in a library to study, because of poor and insufficient facilities to study.

“The Ger Library” project implementation will be held in Ulaanbaatar city among its 6 districts.

We have a 2 step plan.

 1st step: First three district, one library for each district, 2017

  • We will launch first library October, 2017
  • Second library November, 2017
  • Third library December, 2017

2nd step:  Next three libraries in 2018.

Locations of the libraries in Ulaanbaatar city's 6 districts.

We are aiming to launch our first library in October 2017.

Expecting results: During 3 years implementation of “Ger Library” project that enhance children’s education

  • Ulaanbaatar city’s ger district will have library
  • Students will have plenty of option to choose the nearest library with their home
  • The city’s children library will increase by six
  • We can serve for 60480 children in one year.
  • Children who live in poor district will have more opportunity to study and read books.

When project is fully completed, we will work with each district education department and transfer the administration responsibility work to the department.

Please take a look at our perks that we offer you and support our project that aims to improve children’s education. Thank you.

We are suggesting you 3 types of ger. You can see the video guide, how to build up.

MiMo Ger /Yurt/ -  90$, 120$

Urgoo puzzle souvenir - 300$
Camping yurt /Ger/ - 2950$
 

In 2017, we planned to build up 3 libraries. Through this project we aim to fundraise money for the first library.

When we have money for 1st library, then we would work on the 2nd and 3rd library projects. In 2017, we are planning to implement 3 library projects which means we will be able to serve 30240 children in following year.

We budgeted $ 25,000 The following items will be included.

  • 1. Purchase a large Mongolian ger which will be the ger library  
  • 2. Book fundraising campaign cost which will collect 2000 books
  • 3. The library furniture and equipment purchase
  • 4. The annual salary of a librarian
  • 5. Ger Library annual operating costs
  • 6. Perks’ cost to supporters
  • 7. Indiegogo.com and bank fees
  • 8. Other costs

Sponsor companies:

Ulaanbaatar City Public Library is a governmental organization which has 5 branches in the city’s downtown. They have been helping us, making library’s book fund, and giving specialized advices since we started our project.

Crowdfunding Mongolia is official partner of Indiegogo.com. Giving advice on social marketing.

 

    Bolorkhundaga Tsogtoo is project founder and leader who has master degree in Agronomy and grew up in ger district. Despite her full-time work, she has been working and implementing projects that aim for ger district children and public. For example: In 2013, March & November, she organized “Protect Environment” ecology training for 1000 high-school students 2 times. In 2014, 2015 spring and fall, she gave lecture “How to Plant a Tree” cooperating with high-schools on national plant a tree day. Since March 2016, she has been initiating and working on the “ger library” project.

    Natsag Byambajav. Ger Library project consultant and librarian. He has been working in Ulaanbaatar City Public Library as staff, director of public services department for 37 years. During this time, he was awarded best librarian as he doing in library public sectors.

     

     

    Gansukh Gonchigsuren.The project crowd funding consultant. He has 4 years of experience in crowd funding in which he has successfully accomplished 4 projects as leader and team member. He is responsiblity of this project is advertising or distributing the project in social media and public. In 2016, he established Crowdfunding Mongolia, which is the official partner site Indiegogo.com

     

    Hulan Purevjav. I am a translator of the team. I graduated from university in 2015, majoring in International Business Management. When I was a student we were required to take a “volunteer learning” class in order to get familiar and help with poor level people. At that time I was involved in “Mongolia-Korea Center” which is dedicated to children who are unable to attend the normal classes and who missed school years. It took me one semester effort which made me really think about these kids and why they are living in a completely different than me and how can I help them. Therefore I have found my team members of the Ger Library project and we will work together. Through the project I am sure we could save at least a few children’s lives.

     

    To give is more blessed than to receive. Please support our project that encourages children’s education.

    * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

    Гэр номын сан - Хүүхдийн боловсролыг дэмжих төсөл

    Улаанбаатар хотын гэр хороололын бүсэд шинэ гэр номын сан байгуулах төсөл маань нийгмийн болон гэр бүлийн олон асуудлаас болж  хотын төв руу номын санд суух боломжгүй байдаг. Гэр хороололын 100 мянга орчим сурагчдын амжилттай сурч боловсроход тулгамдаж буй асуудлыг багасгах нэг хэлбэр буюу бидний шийдэл юм. Улс орны хөгжлийн удаашралт, ядуурлаас шалтгаалж сурч боловсрох эрх нь бусдаас илүү ихээр зөрчигдсөөр байгаа гэр хороололын сурагчдын сурах хүсэл эрмэлзлийг нэмэгдүүлэх, боловсролын чанарыг дээшлүүлэхэд бидний зорилго оршино.

    Гэр хорооллолын 100 мянга орчим хүүхдэд зориулсан анхны номын сан байгуулах төслийг дэмжээрэй.

     

    Сайн байна уу? Намайг Болорхундага гэдэг.

    Бид Улаанбаатар хотын гэр хороололын бүсэд  хүүхдэд зориулсан гэр номын сан байгуулахаар зорьж байна.

    УБ хотын нийт хүн амын 70 орчим хувь  гэр хороололд амьдардаг. Гэр хороололд амьдардаг хүүхдүүдийн 90-95 хувь нь гэр хороололынхоо сургуульд суралцдаг.

    Гэр хороололын аль ч бүсэд тухайн гэр хороололд байгаа сургуулийн өөрийн дотоод номын сангаас өөр ямар ч нэмэлт номын сан байдаггүй. Сургуулийн номын сан нь 16-25 м.кв талбайтай 16-20 хүүхдийн багтаамжтай байдаг. 1500-2000 сурагчтай  гэр хороололын сургуулиудын сурагчдын хувьд энэ үнэхээр хангалтгүй байна.

    УБ хотын хэмжээнд 5-6 ширхэг хүүхдийн нийтийн номын сан байдаг нь  аль ч гэр хороололын хүүхэд очиж суухад нэг талдаа 10-12 км замыг автобусаар 2-3 удаа дамжин очдог. Нийтийн номын сангууд хотын төвд байрладаг.

    Гэр хороололд амьдардаг хүүхдүүд гэртээ гэрийн даалгавар хийх, ном унших боломжгүй байдаг.

    • Холоос хичээлдээ явдаг учраас даарч, өлсөж, ядардаг
    • Гэртээ олуулаа амьдардаг тул гэртээ хичээл хийхэд анхаарал төвлөрдөггүй
    • Хичээл хийх өөрийн гэсэн өрөө байхгүй

    Сурагч өөрийн сургуулийн номын санд ном унших, сууж хичээл хийхэд гардаг бэрхшээл

    • Сургуулийн номын сангийн жижиг танхим дүүрэн байдаг
    • Номын хүрэлцээ хангалттгүй
    • Ширээ, сандал хүрэлцээгүй
    • Номын фонд сонирхолгүй, ядуу 
    • Холоос хичээлдээ явдаг учраас даарч, өлсөж, ядардаг
    • Асран хамгаалагчид нь байнга дууддаг яааруулдаг
    • Сургууль гэр нь зайтай учир замд ямар нэгэн аюул эрсдэлтэй учирч болзошгүй
    • Нийтийн номын санруу явахад автобусны мөнгө шаардлагатай

    ТЭГВЭЛ-Гэр хороололд Гэр номын сан байгуулбал гарах үр дүн

    • Хүүхдийн номын сангийн тоо нэмэгдэнэ
    • Гэр хороололын сурагчид илүү ном унших, хичээл хийх боломж нэмэгдэнэ
    • Сурагч аль ойр номын сандаа суух сонголттой
    • Хүүхдийн ухаан тэлж, мэдлэгтэй болно
    • Чөлөөт цагаа зөв, үр дүнтэй өнгөрөөнө
    • Тэвчээртэй зөв сууж сурна
    • Номын санд сууж сурсанаар өөртөө илүү итгэлтэй болно
    • Сурлагын чанар сайжирна

    Иймд Гэр хороололд  номын сангийн хэрэгцээ шаардлага зайлшгүй хэрэгтэй байна.

    Нийгмийн болон гэр бүлийн асуудлаас шалтгаалж номын санд суух боломжгүй гэр хороололын сурагчдын сурах хүсэл эрмэлзлийг нэмэгдүүлэх, боловсролын чанарыг дээшлүүлэх зорилгоор гэр номын санг байгуулах болно.

    Энэхүү хүүхдийн боловсролыг дэмжих “ Гэр номын сан ” төслийн хэрэгжилт УБ хотын  6 дүүрэг тус бүрт нэг, нэгийг байгуулахаар төлөвлөж байна. Төсөл амжилттай хэрэгжихэд 2 үе шаттай явагдана.

    I-р үе  2017 онд 3 гэр номын сан

    • Нэг дэх номын сангийн нээлтийг 2017.10 сард хийхээр төлөвлөж байна.
    • Хоёр дахь номын сан 2017.11 сард
    • Гурав дахь номын сан 2017.12 сард тус тус нээлтийг хийж 2017 оны зорилттой биелүүлэхээр төлөвлөн ажиллана.

    II-р үе   2018 онд 3 гэр номын сан

    Улаанбаатар хотын 6 дүүрэгт байгуулагдах Гэр номын сангийн байршилүүд:

    Бидний анхны Гэр номын сан байгуулах газар 2017 оны 10-р сард ашиглалтанд оруулахаар зорьж байна.​

    Хүлээгдэж буй үр дүн: “Гэр номын сан” хүүхдийн боловсролыг дэмжих төсөл нь 3 жилийн хугацаанд амжилттай хэрэгжсэнээр:

    • УБ хотын гэр хороолол  номын сантай болно
    • Сурагч аль ойр номын сандаа суух сонголттой
    • Хотын Хүүхдийн номын сангийн тоо 6-аар нэмэгдэнэ
    • Жилд давхардсан тоогоор 60480 хүүхэд хамрагдах боломжтой болох
    • Гэр хороололын сурагчид илүү ном унших, хичээл хийх боломж нээгдэнэ

    Төсөл бүрэн хэрэгжиж дуусах хүртэлх хугацаанд  дүүргүүдийн боловсролын хэлтэсүүдтэй хамтран ажиллаж,  номын санг харьяа  дүүрэгт нь хүлээлгэн өгнө.

    2017 онд 3 номын сан байгуулах зорилготой байна. Энэхүү төслөөр эхний 1 номын сангийн санхүүжилтыг босгох зорилттой ажиллаж байна.

    1 дэх номын сангийн санхүүжилт амжилттай бий болсоноор 2,3 дахь гэх мэт дараа дараагийн  номын сангийн санхүүжилтэндээ хугацаа алдалгүй тэмүүлэхээр зориж байгаа. 2017 онд 3 номын сан байгуулагдсанаар 1 жилд давхардсан тоогоор 30240 хүүхэд хамрагдах бүрэн боломжтой юм.

    Бидний төсөвлөж буй 25000$-д дараах зүйлс багтсан болно.

    • Гэр номын сангаа байгуулах том монгол гэр худалдан авах
    • 2000 ширхэг номын фондийг худалдан авах болон хандиваар ном цуглуулах үйл ажиллагааны зардал
    • Гэр номын сангийн тавилга, төхөөрөмж худалдан авах
    • Номын санчийн нэг жилийн цалин
    • Гэр номын сангийн жилийн ашиглалтын зардал
    • Дэмжигч нарт өгөх перкс-н худалдан авалт
    • Indiegogo болон банкны шимтгэл
    • Бусад зардлууд

    Цогтоогийн Болорхундага. Төслийг санаачлагч, Удирдагч. Агрономич мэргэжилтэй мастер зэрэгтэй. Улаанбаатар хотын гэр хороололын бүсэд өсөж төрсөн. 2013 оноос гэр хороололын хүүхдүүдэд зориулсан нийгмийн ажлуудыг санаачлан зохион байгуулж ирсэн. 2013 оны 5, 11 саруудад “Байгалиа хамгаалъя” экологийн сургалтыг дунд сургуулийн 1000 орчим сурагчдыг хамруулж 2 удаа зохион байгуулсан. 2014, 2015 оны 5 сард бүх нийтийн мод тарих өдрөөр 52, 63-р сургуулиудын хүүхдүүд мод тарих сургалт зохион байгуулсан. 2016 оны 3-р сараас гэр номын сан төслийг санаачлан явж байна.

    Бямбажавын Нацаг. Гэр номын сан төслийн зөвлөх. Номын санч мэргэжилтэй. 1980 оноос хойш  өнөөг хүртэл Д.Нацагдоржийн нэрэмжит Улаанбаатар хотын төв номын санд фондоч, ном ажиллагч, үйлчилгээний номын санч, Олон Нийтэд Үйлчлэх Тасгийн эрхлэгч зэрэг ажиллуудыг хийж 37 дахь жилдээ ажиллаж байна. Номын санчаар ажиллах хугацаандаа номын сангийн уншигч, үйлчлэгчүүдийн хэрэгцээт ном хэвлэл бусад мэдээллээр ханган, хөнгөн шуурхай үйлчилж номын сангийн үндсэн үзүүлэлт болох ном олголт, ирц, уншигчийн төлөвлөөг тогтмол биелүүлж ажилладаг манай улсын тэргүүний номын санч юм.

    Гончигсүрэнгийн Гансүх. Төслийн краудфандинг зөвлөх. Краудфандинг чиглэлээр 4 жил ажилласан туршлагатай. 4 төсөлд удирдагч, багийн гишүүнээр амжилттай оролцож байсан. Гэр номын сан төслийг олон нийтэд танилцуулах сошиол орчимд түгээх ажлыг хариуцсан. 2016 онд Crowdfunding Mongolia-г үүсгэн байгуулсан бөгөөд Indiegogo.com сайтын албан ёсны түнш байгууллага юм.

    Пүрэвжавын Хулан. Төслийн орчуулагч. Олон улсын бизнесийн удирдлагын мэргэжлээр, 2015 онд их сургууль төгссөн. Их сургууль маань биднийг нийгмийн эмзэг давхрагын хүмүүст туслуулахын тулд"сайн үйлсийн" хичээлийг заавал сонгон суралцахыг шаарддаг байсан. Нэг семестрийн хугацаанд би Монгол-Солонгоын төвд ажилласан. Энэ төвд хичээлийн хоцрогдолтой болон сургуулиас завсардсан хүүхдүүд ирж чөлөөт цагаа өнгөрөөдөг.Энд ажилласнаар би эдгээр хүүхдүүд яагаад ийм байдалд орсон болон яаж нийгэмд ийм байдалтай байгаа олон мянган хүүхдүүдэд туслах вэ гэсэн туйлын бодолтой болсон. Тиймдээ ч би Гэр Номын Сан төслийн багийнхантайгаа танилцаж хамтран ажиллахаар болсон. Төслийг хэрэгжүүлснээр бид хүүхдүүдын ирээдүйд сайн хувь нэмэр оруулж чадна гэдэгт итгэлтэй байна.

    Тиймээ өгөх нь авахаасаа илүү ерөөлтэй байдаг. Та бүхэн бидний энэ хүүхдийн боловсролыг дэмжих төслийг маань дэмжээрэй.
story_txt:
Hello, I am Bolorkhundaga from Mongolia, team leader.
We are working on a project called “Ger Library” which is dedicated to the children who live in the ger district.
About 70% of the Ulaanbaatar city’s people live in a ger district. Therefore 90-95% of the children who live in a ger district go to schools that located in the ger district.

In every corner of the ger district, there is no library except only for the local school’s library. Each school tends to have 1500-2000 students, its library’s capacity is 16-20 students with 16-25m2.  This is not sufficient enough standard.


In Ulaanbaatar, there are only 5 or 6 public libraries for children. If secondary school children who live in ger district want to read books in a public library, they have to travel for 10 to 12km and spend lot of time. Public libraries are located in the downtown of the city.


Children who live in the ger district don’t have enough time for studying and reading.
Because of the long distance between their home and school​, they get tired, cold, and hungry.
They cannot concentrate on studying at their ger homes
They don’t have room to study in
Children are having difficulties with their school library
Most public secondary and high school libraries have limited space
Book fund is insufficient
Inadequate desks and chairs
Book fund is not insufficient
Long distance between children’ home and school and to might happen any problems
They have to spend money, time and effort to travel to public libraries which are located in downtown
As a result from setting up a new ger library in the ger district
In ger district, there will be a number of libraries
Children who live in the ger district will have more opportunities to study and to read.
Children will have options to select the nearest library to their home
It will encourage them to study and expand their knowledge
They will spend their time properly
They will become patient
Gaining knowledge and studying, children will develop themselves and have higher self-confidence.
Academic performance will improve
              Therefore, in the ger district areas, libraries are much needed.This project aims to increase the education quality and to encourage children who cannot spend time in a library to study, because of poor and insufficient facilities to study.“The Ger Library” project implementation will be held in Ulaanbaatar city among its 6 districts.We have a 2 step plan. 1st step: First three district, one library for each district, 2017
We will launch first library October, 2017
Second library November, 2017
Third library December, 2017
2nd step:  Next three libraries in 2018.Locations of the libraries in Ulaanbaatar city's 6 districts.We are aiming to launch our first library in October 2017.Expecting results: During 3 years implementation of “Ger Library” project that enhance children’s education
Ulaanbaatar city’s ger district will have library
Students will have plenty of option to choose the nearest library with their home
The city’s children library will increase by six
We can serve for 60480 children in one year.
Children who live in poor district will have more opportunity to study and read books.
When project is fully completed, we will work with each district education department and transfer the administration responsibility work to the department.Please take a look at our perks that we offer you and support our project that aims to improve children’s education. Thank you.We are suggesting you 3 types of ger. You can see the video guide, how to build up.MiMo Ger /Yurt/ -  90$, 120$Urgoo puzzle souvenir - 300$

Camping yurt /Ger/ - 2950$
 In 2017, we planned to build up 3 libraries. Through this project we aim to fundraise money for the first library.When we have money for 1st library, then we would work on the 2nd and 3rd library projects. In 2017, we are planning to implement 3 library projects which means we will be able to serve 30240 children in following year.We budgeted $ 25,000 The following items will be included.
1. Purchase a large Mongolian ger which will be the ger library  
2. Book fundraising campaign cost which will collect 2000 books
3. The library furniture and equipment purchase
4. The annual salary of a librarian
5. Ger Library annual operating costs
6. Perks’ cost to supporters
7. Indiegogo.com and bank fees
8. Other costs
Sponsor companies:Ulaanbaatar City Public Library is a governmental organization which has 5 branches in the city’s downtown. They have been helping us, making library’s book fund, and giving specialized advices since we started our project.Crowdfunding Mongolia is official partner of Indiegogo.com. Giving advice on social marketing. Bolorkhundaga Tsogtoo is project founder and leader who has master degree in Agronomy and grew up in ger district. Despite her full-time work, she has been working and implementing projects that aim for ger district children and public. For example: In 2013, March & November, she organized “Protect Environment” ecology training for 1000 high-school students 2 times. In 2014, 2015 spring and fall, she gave lecture “How to Plant a Tree” cooperating with high-schools on national plant a tree day. Since March 2016, she has been initiating and working on the “ger library” project.Natsag Byambajav. Ger Library project consultant and librarian. He has been working in Ulaanbaatar City Public Library as staff, director of public services department for 37 years. During this time, he was awarded best librarian as he doing in library public sectors.  Gansukh Gonchigsuren.The project crowd funding consultant. He has 4 years of experience in crowd funding in which he has successfully accomplished 4 projects as leader and team member. He is responsiblity of this project is advertising or distributing the project in social media and public. In 2016, he established Crowdfunding Mongolia, which is the official partner site Indiegogo.com Hulan Purevjav. I am a translator of the team. I graduated from university in 2015, majoring in International Business Management. When I was a student we were required to take a “volunteer learning” class in order to get familiar and help with poor level people. At that time I was involved in “Mongolia-Korea Center” which is dedicated to children who are unable to attend the normal classes and who missed school years. It took me one semester effort which made me really think about these kids and why they are living in a completely different than me and how can I help them. Therefore I have found my team members of the Ger Library project and we will work together. Through the project I am sure we could save at least a few children’s lives. To give is more blessed than to receive. Please support our project that encourages children’s education.* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *Гэр номын сан - Хүүхдийн боловсролыг дэмжих төсөлУлаанбаатар хотын гэр хороололын бүсэд шинэ гэр номын сан байгуулах төсөл маань нийгмийн болон гэр бүлийн олон асуудлаас болж  хотын төв руу номын санд суух боломжгүй байдаг. Гэр хороололын 100 мянга орчим сурагчдын амжилттай сурч боловсроход тулгамдаж буй асуудлыг багасгах нэг хэлбэр буюу бидний шийдэл юм. Улс орны хөгжлийн удаашралт, ядуурлаас шалтгаалж сурч боловсрох эрх нь бусдаас илүү ихээр зөрчигдсөөр байгаа гэр хороололын сурагчдын сурах хүсэл эрмэлзлийг нэмэгдүүлэх, боловсролын чанарыг дээшлүүлэхэд бидний зорилго оршино.Гэр хорооллолын 100 мянга орчим хүүхдэд зориулсан анхны номын сан байгуулах төслийг дэмжээрэй. Сайн байна уу? Намайг Болорхундага гэдэг.Бид Улаанбаатар хотын гэр хороололын бүсэд  хүүхдэд зориулсан гэр номын сан байгуулахаар зорьж байна.УБ хотын нийт хүн амын 70 орчим хувь  гэр хороололд амьдардаг. Нийтийн номын санруу явахад автобусны мөнгө шаардлагатай
ТЭГВЭЛ-Гэр хороололд Гэр номын сан байгуулбал гарах үр дүн
Хүүхдийн номын сангийн тоо нэмэгдэнэ
Гэр хороололын сурагчид илүү ном унших, хичээл хийх боломж нэмэгдэнэ
Сурагч аль ойр номын сандаа суух сонголттой
Хүүхдийн ухаан тэлж, мэдлэгтэй болно
Чөлөөт цагаа зөв, үр дүнтэй өнгөрөөнө
Тэвчээртэй зөв сууж сурна
Номын санд сууж сурсанаар өөртөө илүү итгэлтэй болно
Сурлагын чанар сайжирна
Иймд Гэр хороололд  номын сангийн хэрэгцээ шаардлага зайлшгүй хэрэгтэй байна.Нийгмийн болон гэр бүлийн асуудлаас шалтгаалж номын санд суух боломжгүй гэр хороололын сурагчдын сурах хүсэл эрмэлзлийг нэмэгдүүлэх, боловсролын чанарыг дээшлүүлэх зорилгоор гэр номын санг байгуулах болно.Энэхүү хүүхдийн боловсролыг дэмжих “ Гэр номын сан ” төслийн хэрэгжилт УБ хотын  6 дүүрэг тус бүрт нэг, нэгийг байгуулахаар төлөвлөж байна. Төсөл амжилттай хэрэгжихэд 2 үе шаттай явагдана.I-р үе  2017 онд 3 гэр номын сан
Нэг дэх номын сангийн нээлтийг 2017.10 сард хийхээр төлөвлөж байна.
Хоёр дахь номын сан 2017.11 сард
Гурав дахь номын сан 2017.12 сард тус тус нээлтийг хийж 2017 оны зорилттой биелүүлэхээр төлөвлөн ажиллана.
II-р үе   2018 онд 3 гэр номын санУлаанбаатар хотын 6 дүүрэгт байгуулагдах Гэр номын сангийн байршилүүд:Бидний анхны Гэр номын сан байгуулах газар 2017 оны 10-р сард ашиглалтанд оруулахаар зорьж байна.​Хүлээгдэж буй үр дүн: “Гэр номын сан” хүүхдийн боловсролыг дэмжих төсөл нь 3 жилийн хугацаанд амжилттай хэрэгжсэнээр:
УБ хотын гэр хороолол  номын сантай болно
Сурагч аль ойр номын сандаа суух сонголттой
Хотын Хүүхдийн номын сангийн тоо 6-аар нэмэгдэнэ
Жилд давхардсан тоогоор 60480 хүүхэд хамрагдах боломжтой болох
Гэр хороололын сурагчид илүү ном унших, хичээл хийх боломж нээгдэнэ
Төсөл бүрэн хэрэгжиж дуусах хүртэлх хугацаанд  дүүргүүдийн боловсролын хэлтэсүүдтэй хамтран ажиллаж,  номын санг харьяа  дүүрэгт нь хүлээлгэн өгнө.2017 онд 3 номын сан байгуулах зорилготой байна. Энэхүү төслөөр эхний 1 номын сангийн санхүүжилтыг босгох зорилттой ажиллаж байна.1 дэх номын сангийн санхүүжилт амжилттай бий болсоноор 2,3 дахь гэх мэт дараа дараагийн  номын сангийн санхүүжилтэндээ хугацаа алдалгүй тэмүүлэхээр зориж байгаа. 2017 онд 3 номын сан байгуулагдсанаар 1 жилд давхардсан тоогоор 30240 хүүхэд хамрагдах бүрэн боломжтой юм.Бидний төсөвлөж буй 25000$-д дараах зүйлс багтсан болно.
Гэр номын сангаа байгуулах том монгол гэр худалдан авах
2000 ширхэг номын фондийг худалдан авах болон хандиваар ном цуглуулах үйл ажиллагааны зардал
Гэр номын сангийн тавилга, төхөөрөмж худалдан авах
Номын санчийн нэг жилийн цалин
Гэр номын сангийн жилийн ашиглалтын зардал
Дэмжигч нарт өгөх перкс-н худалдан авалт
Indiegogo болон банкны шимтгэл
Бусад зардлууд
Цогтоогийн Болорхундага. Төслийг санаачлагч, Удирдагч. Агрономич мэргэжилтэй мастер зэрэгтэй. Улаанбаатар хотын гэр хороололын бүсэд өсөж төрсөн. 2013 оноос гэр хороололын хүүхдүүдэд зориулсан нийгмийн ажлуудыг санаачлан зохион байгуулж ирсэн. 2013 оны 5, 11 саруудад “Байгалиа хамгаалъя” экологийн сургалтыг дунд сургуулийн 1000 орчим сурагчдыг хамруулж 2 удаа зохион байгуулсан. 2014, 2015 оны 5 сард бүх нийтийн мод тарих өдрөөр 52, 63-р сургуулиудын хүүхдүүд мод тарих сургалт зохион байгуулсан. 2016 оны 3-р сараас гэр номын сан төслийг санаачлан явж байна.Бямбажавын Нацаг. Гэр номын сан төслийн зөвлөх. Номын санч мэргэжилтэй. 1980 оноос хойш  өнөөг хүртэл Д.Нацагдоржийн нэрэмжит Улаанбаатар хотын төв номын санд фондоч, ном ажиллагч, үйлчилгээний номын санч, Олон Нийтэд Үйлчлэх Тасгийн эрхлэгч зэрэг ажиллуудыг хийж 37 дахь жилдээ ажиллаж байна. Номын санчаар ажиллах хугацаандаа номын сангийн уншигч, үйлчлэгчүүдийн хэрэгцээт ном хэвлэл бусад мэдээллээр ханган, хөнгөн шуурхай үйлчилж номын сангийн үндсэн үзүүлэлт болох ном олголт, ирц, уншигчийн төлөвлөөг тогтмол биелүүлж ажилладаг манай улсын тэргүүний номын санч юм.Гончигсүрэнгийн Гансүх. Төслийн краудфандинг зөвлөх. Краудфандинг чиглэлээр 4 жил ажилласан туршлагатай. 4 төсөлд удирдагч, багийн гишүүнээр амжилттай оролцож байсан. Гэр номын сан төслийг олон нийтэд танилцуулах сошиол орчимд түгээх ажлыг хариуцсан. 2016 онд Crowdfunding Mongolia-г үүсгэн байгуулсан бөгөөд Indiegogo.com сайтын албан ёсны түнш байгууллага юм.Пүрэвжавын Хулан. Төслийн орчуулагч. Олон улсын бизнесийн удирдлагын мэргэжлээр, 2015 онд их сургууль төгссөн. Их сургууль маань биднийг нийгмийн эмзэг давхрагын хүмүүст туслуулахын тулд"сайн үйлсийн" хичээлийг заавал сонгон суралцахыг шаарддаг байсан. Нэг семестрийн хугацаанд би Монгол-Солонгоын төвд ажилласан. Энэ төвд хичээлийн хоцрогдолтой болон сургуулиас завсардсан хүүхдүүд ирж чөлөөт цагаа өнгөрөөдөг.Энд ажилласнаар би эдгээр хүүхдүүд яагаад ийм байдалд орсон болон яаж нийгэмд ийм байдалтай байгаа олон мянган хүүхдүүдэд туслах вэ гэсэн туйлын бодолтой болсон. Тиймдээ ч би Гэр Номын Сан төслийн багийнхантайгаа танилцаж хамтран ажиллахаар болсон. Төслийг хэрэгжүүлснээр бид хүүхдүүдын ирээдүйд сайн хувь нэмэр оруулж чадна гэдэгт итгэлтэй байна.Тиймээ өгөх нь авахаасаа илүү ерөөлтэй байдаг. Та бүхэн бидний энэ хүүхдийн боловсролыг дэмжих төслийг маань дэмжээрэй.

story:
I was born in Mumbai, India, and came home to my mom who is Finnish when I was five. I'm 16 now and attend the Tacoma School of the Arts (SOTA) in Washington State where I'm majoring in photography. I love to take pictures! 

 Next year, I have the opportunity to study in Helsinki. I can live with cousins and attend high school and photograph!  I want to keep a terrific photo blog of what I see and do and experience, and you can follow along.  

Of course, it all takes money. My mom is single, working multiple part-time jobs, and caring for my sister and me.  I am hoping to help our family by finding the support to make this trip and to get a real camera (I only have an iPhone right now).  I will need about $1800 for living expenses and about $700 for a good digital camera.  That's where I came up with $2500.  

Your contribution of any size will help me reach my dreams of experiencing a world very different from the streets of Mumbai and even the Pacific Northwest, and of one day working in the creative side of Internet technology.  If it feels right to help, I will be so grateful!

story:
Texto en Español >>>
Jump to: The Problem · Our Solution · Developers · Why it is Important · Funding · Perks · Referral System · Team · How to Help · Risks and Challenges

News

  • Voting for developers and IPs is live. Make your voice heard!
  • Referral system is live. Get your free perks!
  • Secret perk added: Get your favorite game signed by its creator!
  • Added FREE Online Casts of Bitsummit, Comiket and Tokyo Game Show to all perks!
  • We have now interviewed some of our most important developers!
    -Hironobu Sakaguchi
    -Koji Igarashi
    -Goichi Suda
    -Takumi Naramura


The Problem

We are Giacomo and Luis, and our passion is game design. Over the last few years we have had the chance to meet many icons of game development like Hideo Kojima, Fumito Ueda, Hironobu Sakaguchi, and many others.

  • Yet we have noticed that our candid conversations with them about game creation are never reflected in mainstream media. 

Giacomo with Hideyuki Seino [Jukebeat], Yoji Shinkawa, Donna Burke, Hideo Kojima [Metal Gear Solid], and Koji Igarashi [Castlevania].

Our Solution


As game designers ourselves, chatting with these masters of game development was an incredible learning experience  to improve our craft, and we believe more people should have access to that knowledge. Likewise, we believe these masters of game design deserve to have an outlet to talk games, without business pressures. 


  • The only way for them to talk openly about game design is to not be part of the mainstream media, but independent.

Luis with Akihiro Hino [Ni no Kuni], Hironobu Sakaguchi [Final Fantasy] , Toshihiro Nagoshi [Yakuza], and Goichi Suda [Lollipop Chainsaw Massacre] .


We will be traveling Japan for 10 weeks and meeting with creators of amazing Japanese games, interviewing them about how they made their games from a game development standpoint, what it took in terms of personal and professional effort, and what their advice for new game developers is. 

  • We will also ask them your questions! We have rewards that allow you to create and vote for questions to be asked to specific developers, so make sure to check those perks out!


Developers

The process of selecting and contacting developers is very time consuming, and between the community and ourselves we have to be able to make choices on the fly; however we have a working list you can access to view the names we are working with and the progress on interviewing them!


Some of the awesome game developers we are looking to interview!

  • Access the full list of developers here (50+) 

This is a live document and it changes constantly with the community's input.


Why It Is Important


We will be conducting these interviews out of our passion for game design, and with your help we can do so much more than by ourselves. 

With your support we will be able to access more developers, travel to where they are, set up more interviews, and increase production quality. 

  • With your support we can create the first compendium of interviews from classic Japanese game developers fully focused on their game design philosophies - ever.


Funding


We are starting with our personal savings, but those are somewhat limited. With your support, we can expand the project to many more developers!

Costs are mainly divided among the following percentages and categories:


  • Travel: Includes travel within Japan, i.e. Tokyo to Kyoto, Osaka...
  • Lodging: Although we will travel very inexpensively [Giacomo is a fan of capsule hotels!], lodging will definitely increase our costs when visiting developers outside Tokyo.
  • Technical: Cameras, video and audio editing, lights...
  • Misc. expenses: A safety net in case that any emergency should arise when setting up interviews, travelling, or editing.

A capsule hotel: The cheapest way to sleep in Japan!

Should we surpass our funding goal, we will invest all remaining funds in reaching out to more developers. We have calculated that is takes approximately 300$ to 450$ worth of time, travel expenses, and technical needs per developer interview.

  •  The more we can invest in this project, the more and better interviews we can make!

Should we not reach the funding goal, since this is a flexible campaign that is OK too! We will do as many interviews as we can and still fulfill our perks, mostly by cutting on interviews outside Tokyo.

  • We believe this project is bigger than ourselves, so we will keep making progress with it for as long as we can!


Featured Perks


Ask Your Own Questions! - 25$

Send your favorite developer your own questions! You will be granted access to our private forum where you can post questions to be asked in general or to specific developers.

Take this chance to learn specific details and techniques that you have been thinking about, or that you are fighting in your current project.

You will be credited with the question both on the video and printed releases of the interviews.

Questions will be voted by the community and selected according to votes. We do reserve the right to not ask questions which can be considered offensive.


Online Event Casts - FREE

Giacomo at Tokyo Game Show 2015 with Koji Igarashi [Castlevania] , 
Ziang Tan and Hiroaki Yoshiike [Metal Gear Solid V] .


NEW! All perks include a high quality online cast of the 3 biggest gaming events on Japan: Bitsummit, Comiket, and Tokyo Game Show! A fantastic opportunity to get the biggest news of the year from an independent source.


Perks


Perk Matrix - Incremental perks include all previous perks.


Thank you Postcard from Japan - 5$
We thank you for your support, and will be sending you a beautiful postcard from a spot in Japan that holds a special significance in game development history signed by us, plus 2 extra postcards for you to send to your loved ones! You will also appear in the backer thank you list in all interviews, be it video or print.


Online Access to Interviews - 15$
You will receive a unique username and password to access all interviews via online video and audio, to watch whenever and wherever you are from any device. Interviews will be posted as shortly after they are edited, so expect several new interviews to be released every month from July to September 2016.

Downloadable Uncut Interviews - 20$

Download Video and Audio of the interviews to your device for easy access on the go with the highest quality! Additionally these interviews will be uncut so many a candid story will make it to the final video!  This edition will NOT BE AVAILABLE ANYWHERE ELSE!


Videos will be accessible and downloadable from Vimeo on demand, so you know quality will be top-notch!

PDF Book & Vote for IPs - 30$

Receive the PDF book including a full script of all interviews -completely uncut-. Plus, access our private forum to vote for which developers we will interview. There are hundreds of awesome developers in Japan and we will not have time to interview them all. Make your voice heard!


Physical Book - 50$

Get a beautifully printed, premium quality physical book describing our travels to meet all the developers, including full uncut transcripts of all the interviews. 

Shipping worldwide included!


Team Pack - BEST DEAL - 100$

Receive all previous perks for a full team up to 5 people, including voting for all individuals. The package includes 2 physical books sent to your location worldwide. A wise investment for your team, or even for friends who want to save on individual perks!


SECRET PERK: Signed Game & Merchandise


Choose one game [or piece of merchandise] to have signed by its creator!

[Depending on availability - We will contact personally to discuss requirements!]

This is a SECRET perk! Only those who reach the top 5 referral numbers will have access to it, and even then we will only have 5 available! Truly a once in a lifetime chance!



Referral System


Want to upgrade your chosen perk but it is outside your price range? Worry not! We have created a referral system so that you can achieve just that!

  • For each 2 referrals that back the campaign we will upgrade your perk one level!

So let's say you get the 20$ perk but would want all other perks up to the physical book for the same price. It is easy! Just share this campaign with Indiegogo's sharing tools (make sure you are logged in!). We will count your referrals and update your perk with no hassle on your part.



  • Plus, this is the only way to access our secret perk!
A fantastic way to save money and help your friends who might be interested in the campaign at the same time!


Team


Giacomo Vaccari has worked on over a dozen games, is CEO of Lethal Games and founded the International Games Developer Association in Spain. He holds 40 game world records, and his greatest passions are arcade games, and 60s-80s music. He still believes the Sega Saturn is the ultimate arcade-at-home machine.

 Favorite games: Nights Into Dreams, FFVII, Panzer Dragoon Saga, Doom, MGS2 and Saturn Bomberman.

Luis García has worked on game localization in the UK, Spain, Germany, and for the last 8 years in Japan, where his dream of working in Final Fantasy games became true. He also runs his own indie game studio Shinyuden, has a game collection numbering the hundreds, and believes the only right way to eat paella is with a wooden spoon.

Favorite games: Ico, FFVI, Yakuza 0, MGS3, Space Invaders and Kuma Uta.


How to Help

 
The primary way of helping this project is by choosing a perk and backing it!
But hey, even if you can not back the project there are ways you can help! Maybe you are a student or are not employed at the moment. We have been there too! 
You can still support this project by sharing it with your friends in social media, or telling a friend who is passionate about game development! Every bit helps.
     
  • You can follow us on twitter and share our posts holding the hashtag #JapanGameDev.
    •  
  • Share this campaign through Indiegogo's sharing utilities! Every share counts.

  • Join our Reddit community!



Risks and Challenges


We are positive that we can obtain access to many game developers who will have lots to say and teach. However it is possible that some developers turn us down for any number of reasons. Here are some solutions to those risks:

     
  •  We have created a Reddit community to keep you updated of what is going on while we are in Japan, as well as keeping our twitter accounts updated with the #JapanGameDev hashtag. You will always know what's going on!
    •  
  • In those cases where we can not contact a specific developer, we will always make it up by interviewing a person as in their team if possible, or adding developers close to their team, style, and philosophy. Our communities are there so that you can help decide who we approach next!




Campaña en Español


Saltar a: El Problema · La Solución · Desarrolladores · Por Qué es Importante · Fondos · Recompensas · Sistema de Referencias · Equipo · Cómo Ayudar · Riesgos y Desafíos


Noticias

  • Votos para franquicias abiertos. ¡Haz que se oiga tu voz!
  • Sistema de Referencias abierto. ¡Consigue tus recompensas gratis!
  • Recompensa Secreta: ¡Consigue tu juego favorito firmado por su creador!
  • Añadidas retransmisiones GRATUITAS del Bitsummit, Comiket y Tokyo Game Show a todas las recompensas.
  • Ya hemos entrevistado algunos de nuestros desarrolladores mas importantes:
    -Hironobu Sakaguchi
    -Koji Igarashi
    -Goichi Suda
    -Takumi Naramura


El Problema

Somos Giacomo y Luis, y nuestra pasión es el diseño de juegos. En los últimos años hemos tenido la oportunidad de conocer a muchos iconos de la industria de los juegos como Hideo Kojima, Fumito Ueda, Hironobu Sakaguchi, y muchos otros.

  • Sin embargo notamos que nuestras conversaciones con ellos sobre creación de juegos nunca aparecen en los medios mainstream. 

Giacomo con Hideyuki Seino [Jukebeat], Yoji Shinkawa, Donna Burke, Hideo Kojima [Metal Gear Solid], y Koji Igarashi [Castlevania].

La Solución


Siendo nosotros mismos desarrolladores de juegos, hablar con estos maestros del desarrollo de juegos ha sido una experiencia de aprendizaje increíble para mejorar nuestros conocimientos, y creemos que más gente debe tener acceso a sus conocimientos. Así mismo, creemos que estos maestros del diseño de juegos se merecen tener un lugar para hablar sobre juegos, sin presiones comerciales. 


  • La única manera de que hablen abiertamente sobre diseño de juegos es no siendo parte de los medios mainstream, sino independientes.

Luis con Akihiro Hino [Ni no Kuni], Hironobu Sakaguchi [Final Fantasy] , Toshihiro Nagoshi [Yakuza], y Goichi Suda [Lollipop Chainsaw Massacre] .


Recorreremos Japón durante 10 semanas para reunirnos con estos creadores y entrevistarlos sobre cómo crean sus juegos, qué decisiones vitales y profesionales han tenido que tomar, y qué recomiendan a los que empiezan su carrera.

  • ¡Además les haremos tus preguntas! Tenemos recompensas que te permiten crear y votar preguntas para que se las preguntemos a los desarrolladores, así que ¡asegúrate de echarles un vistazo!


Desarrolladores

El proceso de seleccionar y contactar a los desarrolladores lleva mucho tiempo, y entre la comunidad y el equipo tenemos que poder tomar decisiones rápidas; sin embargo tenemos una lista que puedes acceder para ver los nombres con los que estamos trabajando y cómo de cerca estamos de entrevistarlos.


Algunos de los desarrolladores a los que estamos contactando.

  • Accede a la lista de desarrolladores (50+) 

Este documento está "vivo" y cambia continuamente con la ayuda de la comunidad.


Por Qué es Importante


Vamos a realizar estas entrevistas por nuestra pasión al diseño de juegos, y con tu apoyo podemos hacer mucho más que nosotros solos.

Con tu apoyo seremos capaces de acceder a más desarrolladores, viajar a donde están, y producir mejores entrevistas.

  • Con tu apoyo podemos crear la primera biblioteca de entrevistas enfocadas a diseño de juegos por parte de diseñadores de juegos clásicos japoneses en Castellano de la historia.


Fondos


Empezamos el proyecto con nuestros ahorros personales, pero son limitados. ¡Con tu ayuda podemos expandir el proyecto para incluir mucho mas desarrolladores!

Los costes para este proyecto se dividen mayormente en los siguientes porcentajes y categorías:


  • Viaje: Incluye viajes dentro de Japón, tales como de Tokio a Osaka, Kioto, etc...
  • Estancias: Aunque viajaremos "a lo barato" [a Giacomo le encantan los "hoteles cápsula"], las estancias son una buena parte de los gastos fueran de Tokio.
  • Gastos técnicos: Cámaras, edición de video y audio, luces...
  • Otros gastos: Una red de seguridad por si surgen problemas durante las entrevistas, viajes, o edición.

Un "hotel cápsula": ¡La forma más barata de dormir en Japón!

Si sobrepasamos nuestro objetivo de fondos, invertiremos todo lo recaudado en conseguir más entrevistas. Hemos calculado que por cada entrevista los gastos son aproximadamente de unos 270€ a 370€ entre viajes, tiempo, y necesidades técnicas.

  •  Mientras más podamos invertir en el proyecto, más y mejores entrevistas podremos hacer.

Si no llegamos al objetivo de fondos, como esta campaña es "flexible", podremos continuar aunque con menos recursos. Haremos todas las entrevistas posibles y entregaremos todas las recompensas, mayormente eliminando viajes fuera de Tokio.

  • Creemos que este proyecto es de gran importancia, así que seguiremos haciendo entrevistas mientras tengamos fondos.


Recompensa Destacada


¡Haz tus propias preguntas! - 22€

¡Envía tus preguntas a tu desarrollador favorito! Tendrás acceso a nuestro foro privado donde podrás crear preguntas generales, o dirigidas a desarrolladores en concreto. Una gran oportunidad para aprender detalles o técnicas de los maestros y que te puedan ayudar en tu carrera.

Te daremos crédito por tu pregunta tanto en los vídeos como en las versiones impresas de las entrevistas.

Las preguntas se someterán a votación por parte de la comunidad y seleccionadas por mayoría. Nos reservamos el derecho de no hacer preguntas que creamos pueden ofender a los creadores.


Retransmisiones de Eventos - GRATIS

Giacomo en el Tokyo Game Show 2015 con Koji Igarashi [Castlevania] , 
Ziang Tan y Hiroaki Yoshiike [Metal Gear Solid V] .


¡Nuevo! Todas las recompensas incluyen retransmisiones online de alta calidad para los 3 eventos de juegos más grandes de Japón: Bitsummit, Comiket, y Tokyo Game Show. Un oportunidad fantástica de conocer las mayores noticias del año con una fuente independiente.


Recompensas


Matriz de Recompensas - Recompensas superiores incluyen todas las recompensas previas.


Postales de Agradecimiento desde Japón - 5€
Te agradecemos tu apoyo, y te mandaremos una hermosa postal desde un sitio en Japón de especial interés para la historia de los videojuegos firmada por nosotros. Además te mandaremos 2 postales más para que se las envíes a tus amigos. También aparecerás en nuestra lista de agradecimientos en todas las entrevistas ya sea en vídeo o papel.


Acceso Online a las Entrevistas - 14€
Recibirás un usuario y password para acceder a todas las entrevistas online con vídeo y audio, para que las veas cuando y donde te apetezca desde cualquier dispositivo. Las entrevistas se publicarán al poco de ser grabadas, así que podrás ver nuevas entrevistas todos los meses entre julio y septiembre del 2016.

Entrevistas sin Cortes Descargables - 18€

Descarga vídeo y audio a tu dispositivo con la máxima calidad. Además estas entrevistas no tendrán cortes, así que incluirán muchas historias interesantes. ¡Esta edición SOLO ESTARÁ DISPONIBLE EN INDIEGOGO!


Videos will be accessible and downloadable from Vimeo on demand, so you know quality will be top-notch!

Libro en PDF y Vota PIs - 27€

Recibe el libro en PDF con todas las entrevistas transcritas -sin cortes-. Además, podrás acceder a nuestro foro privado y vota a que desarrolladores quieres que entrevistemos. Hay cientos de desarrolladores increíbles en Japón y no tendremos tiempo para todos. ¡Haz que se oiga tu voz!


Libro Físico - 44€

Recibe el libro con calidad premium describiendo nuestros viajes, incluyendo transcripciones completas y sin cortes de las entrevistas.

¡Envío a todo el mundo incluido!


Pack de Equipo - MEJOR OFERTA - 89€

Recibe todas las recompensas para un equipo de hasta 5 personas, ¡incluyendo votaciones para todos! El pack incluye 2 libros físicos y el envío a donde esté el equipo. ¡Una sabia inversión para tu equipo, o incluso para amigos que quieran ahorrar en recompensas individuales!


RECOMPENSA SECRETA: Juego o Merchandise Firmado


¡Elige un juego [o pieza de merchandise] para que la firme su creador!

[Depende de disponibilidad - Te contactaremos personalmente]

¡Esta es una recompensa SECRETA! Sólo aquellos que lleguen al top-5 en número de referencias tendrán acceso, e incluso así sólo hay 5 disponibles. ¡Una oportunidad única en la vida!



Sistema de Referencias


¿Quieres una recompensa mejor pero se sale de tu presupuesto? ¡No te preocupes! Hemos creado un sistema de referencias para que lo puedas conseguir gratis.

  • Por cada 2 referencias que apoyen la campaña te subiremos la recompensa un nivel.

Imagina que has apoyado la recompensa de 20€, pero quieres el libro físico por el mismo precio. ¡Es fácil! Simplemente comparte esta campaña con las utilidades de Indiegogo (asegurate de estar logueado). Nosotros contaremos cuantas referencias siguen tu enlace y subiremos tu recompensa de nivel sin más esfuerzo por tu parte.



  • Además, ésta es la única manera de acceder a la recompensa secreta.
Una manera fantástica de ahorrar dinero y ayudar a tus amigos interesados en la campaña al mismo tiempo.


Equipo


Giacomo Vaccari ha trabajado en más de una docena de juegos, es CEO de Lethal Games y fundó la Organización Internacional de Desarrolladores de Juegos en España. Ha obtenido 40 récords del mundo en juegos, y sus grandes pasiones son los juegos arcade y la música de los 60 a los 80. Aún cree que la Sega Saturn es lo más parecido a tener un arcade en casa.

 Juegos Favoritos: Nights Into Dreams, FFVII, Panzer Dragoon Saga, Doom, MGS2 y Saturn Bomberman.

Luis García ha trabajado en localización de juegos en el Reino Unido, España, Alemania, y durante los últimos 8 años en Japón, donde su sueño de trabajar en la saga Final Fantasy se convirtió en realidad. Además lleva su propio estudio de juegos indie, Shinyuden, tiene una colección de cientos de juegos, y cree que la única manera de comer paella es con una cuchara de palo.

Juegos favoritos: Ico, FFVI, Yakuza 0, MGS3, Space Invaders y Kuma Uta.


Cómo Ayudar

 
¡La mejor forma de ayudar a este proyecto es elegir una recompensar y apoyarla!
Pero incluso si no puedes apoyar una recompensa hay más maneras de ayudar. Quizá seas estudiante, o no tengas empleo... Nosotros también hemos estado en esa situación.
Aún así nos puedes ayudar compartiendo esta campaña a través de tus redes sociales, o contándole a un amigo a quien le apasiona el desarrollo de juegos lo que has visto aquí. Todo ayuda.
     
  • Puedes seguirnos en twitter y compartir nuestros tweets con el hashtag #JapanGameDev.
    •  
  • Comparte esta campaña a través de las utilidades de Indiegogo. Todo ayuda.

  • Únete a nuestra Comunidad de Reddit.



Riesgos y Desafíos


Estamos convencidos de que podemos acceder a muchos desarrolladores que tienen mucho que contar y enseñar. Sin embargo es posible que alguno rechace nuestra entrevista por cualquier razón. Aquí hay algunas soluciones a ese riesgo:

     
  • Hemos creado una comunidad de Reddit para mantenerte informado de lo que está pasando en Japón durante estos 3 meses, además de nuestras cuentas de twitter donde usamos el hashtag #JapanGameDev. ¡Siempre sabrás lo que está ocurriendo!
    •  
  • En aquellos casos en los que no podamos contactar a un desarrollador en concreto, siempre lo solucionaremos entrevistado a alguien de su equipo, o alguien cercano a su equipo, estilo y filosofías. ¡Nuestras comunidades están ahí para que nos ayudes a decidir quién será esa persona!
story_txt:
Texto en Español >>>

Jump to: The Problem · Our Solution · Developers · Why it is Important · Funding · Perks · Referral System · Team · How to Help · Risks and Challenges

News



Voting for developers and IPs is live. Make your voice heard!


Referral system is live. Get your free perks!

Secret perk added: Get your favorite game signed by its creator!
Added FREE Online Casts of Bitsummit, Comiket and Tokyo Game Show to all perks!

We have now interviewed some of our most important developers!-Hironobu Sakaguchi-Koji Igarashi-Goichi Suda-Takumi Naramura





The Problem

We are Giacomo and Luis, and our passion is game design. Over the last few years we have had the chance to meet many icons of game development like Hideo Kojima, Fumito Ueda, Hironobu Sakaguchi, and many others.



Yet we have noticed that our candid conversations with them about game creation are never reflected in mainstream media. 



Giacomo with Hideyuki Seino [Jukebeat], Yoji Shinkawa, Donna Burke, Hideo Kojima [Metal Gear Solid], and Koji Igarashi [Castlevania].


Our Solution




As game designers ourselves, chatting with these masters of game development was an incredible learning experience  to improve our craft, and we believe more people should have access to that knowledge. Likewise, we believe these masters of game design deserve to have an outlet to talk games, without business pressures. 



The only way for them to talk openly about game design is to not be part of the mainstream media, but independent.




Luis with Akihiro Hino [Ni no Kuni], Hironobu Sakaguchi [Final Fantasy] , Toshihiro Nagoshi [Yakuza], and Goichi Suda [Lollipop Chainsaw Massacre] .

We will be traveling Japan for 10 weeks and meeting with creators of amazing Japanese games, interviewing them about how they made their games from a game development standpoint, what it took in terms of personal and professional effort, and what their advice for new game developers is. 


We will also ask them your questions! We have rewards that allow you to create and vote for questions to be asked to specific developers, so make sure to check those perks out!





Developers

The process of selecting and contacting developers is very time consuming, and between the community and ourselves we have to be able to make choices on the fly; however we have a working list you can access to view the names we are working with and the progress on interviewing them!

Some of the awesome game developers we are looking to interview!



Access the full list of developers here (50+) 
This is a live document and it changes constantly with the community's input.

Why It Is Important


We will be conducting these interviews out of our passion for game design, and with your help we can do so much more than by ourselves. 

With your support we will be able to access more developers, travel to where they are, set up more interviews, and increase production quality. 


With your support we can create the first compendium of interviews from classic Japanese game developers fully focused on their game design philosophies - ever.




Funding


We are starting with our personal savings, but those are somewhat limited. With your support, we can expand the project to many more developers!Costs are mainly divided among the following percentages and categories:







Travel: Includes travel within Japan, i.e. Tokyo to Kyoto, Osaka...
Lodging: Although we will travel very inexpensively [Giacomo is a fan of capsule hotels!], lodging will definitely increase our costs when visiting developers outside Tokyo.
Technical: Cameras, video and audio editing, lights...
Misc. expenses: A safety net in case that any emergency should arise when setting up interviews, travelling, or editing.





A capsule hotel: The cheapest way to sleep in Japan!



Should we surpass our funding goal, we will invest all remaining funds in reaching out to more developers. We have calculated that is takes approximately 300$ to 450$ worth of time, travel expenses, and technical needs per developer interview. The more we can invest in this project, the more and better interviews we can make!



Should we not reach the funding goal, since this is a flexible campaign that is OK too! We will do as many interviews as we can and still fulfill our perks, mostly by cutting on interviews outside Tokyo.
We believe this project is bigger than ourselves, so we will keep making progress with it for as long as we can!







Featured Perks





Ask Your Own Questions! - 25$

Send your favorite developer your own questions! You will be granted access to our private forum where you can post questions to be asked in general or to specific developers.
Take this chance to learn specific details and techniques that you have been thinking about, or that you are fighting in your current project.
You will be credited with the question both on the video and printed releases of the interviews.
Questions will be voted by the community and selected according to votes. We do reserve the right to not ask questions which can be considered offensive.




Online Event Casts - FREE





Giacomo at Tokyo Game Show 2015 with Koji Igarashi [Castlevania] , Ziang Tan and Hiroaki Yoshiike [Metal Gear Solid V] .


NEW! All perks include a high quality online cast of the 3 biggest gaming events on Japan: Bitsummit, Comiket, and Tokyo Game Show! A fantastic opportunity to get the biggest news of the year from an independent source.

Perks





Perk Matrix - Incremental perks include all previous perks.

Thank you Postcard from Japan - 5$


We thank you for your support, and will be sending you a beautiful postcard from a spot in Japan that holds a special significance in game development history signed by us, plus 2 extra postcards for you to send to your loved ones! You will also appear in the backer thank you list in all interviews, be it video or print.

Online Access to Interviews - 15$


You will receive a unique username and password to access all interviews via online video and audio, to watch whenever and wherever you are from any device. Interviews will be posted as shortly after they are edited, so expect several new interviews to be released every month from July to September 2016.



Downloadable Uncut Interviews - 20$



Download Video and Audio of the interviews to your device for easy access on the go with the highest quality! Additionally these interviews will be uncut so many a candid story will make it to the final video!  This edition will NOT BE AVAILABLE ANYWHERE ELSE!





Videos will be accessible and downloadable from Vimeo on demand, so you know quality will be top-notch!

PDF Book & Vote for IPs - 30$
Receive the PDF book including a full script of all interviews -completely uncut-. Plus, access our private forum to vote for which developers we will interview. There are hundreds of awesome developers in Japan and we will not have time to interview them all. Make your voice heard!


Physical Book - 50$

Get a beautifully printed, premium quality physical book describing our travels to meet all the developers, including full uncut transcripts of all the interviews. 
Shipping worldwide included!

Team Pack - BEST DEAL - 100$
Receive all previous perks for a full team up to 5 people, including voting for all individuals. The package includes 2 physical books sent to your location worldwide. A wise investment for your team, or even for friends who want to save on individual perks!

SECRET PERK: Signed Game & Merchandise

Choose one game [or piece of merchandise] to have signed by its creator!
[Depending on availability - We will contact personally to discuss requirements!]

This is a SECRET perk! Only those who reach the top 5 referral numbers will have access to it, and even then we will only have 5 available! Truly a once in a lifetime chance!



Referral System




Want to upgrade your chosen perk but it is outside your price range? Worry not! We have created a referral system so that you can achieve just that!For each 2 referrals that back the campaign we will upgrade your perk one level!

So let's say you get the 20$ perk but would want all other perks up to the physical book for the same price. It is easy! Just share this campaign with Indiegogo's sharing tools (make sure you are logged in!). We will count your referrals and update your perk with no hassle on your part.






Plus, this is the only way to access our secret perk!


A fantastic way to save money and help your friends who might be interested in the campaign at the same time!



Team





Giacomo Vaccari has worked on over a dozen games, is CEO of Lethal Games and founded the International Games Developer Association in Spain. He holds 40 game world records, and his greatest passions are arcade games, and 60s-80s music. He still believes the Sega Saturn is the ultimate arcade-at-home machine.

 Favorite games: Nights Into Dreams, FFVII, Panzer Dragoon Saga, Doom, MGS2 and Saturn Bomberman.






Luis García has worked on game localization in the UK, Spain, Germany, and for the last 8 years in Japan, where his dream of working in Final Fantasy games became true. He also runs his own indie game studio Shinyuden, has a game collection numbering the hundreds, and believes the only right way to eat paella is with a wooden spoon.

Favorite games: Ico, FFVI, Yakuza 0, MGS3, Space Invaders and Kuma Uta.






How to Help

 
The primary way of helping this project is by choosing a perk and backing it!

But hey, even if you can not back the project there are ways you can help! Maybe you are a student or are not employed at the moment. We have been there too! 

You can still support this project by sharing it with your friends in social media, or telling a friend who is passionate about game development! Every bit helps. You can follow us on twitter and share our posts holding the hashtag #JapanGameDev. Share this campaign through Indiegogo's sharing utilities! Every share counts.

Join our Reddit community!








Risks and Challenges




We are positive that we can obtain access to many game developers who will have lots to say and teach. However it is possible that some developers turn us down for any number of reasons. Here are some solutions to those risks:
  We have created a Reddit community to keep you updated of what is going on while we are in Japan, as well as keeping our twitter accounts updated with the #JapanGameDev hashtag. You will always know what's going on!
 In those cases where we can not contact a specific developer, we will always make it up by interviewing a person as in their team if possible, or adding developers close to their team, style, and philosophy. Our communities are there so that you can help decide who we approach next!












Campaña en Español


Saltar a: El Problema · La Solución · Desarrolladores · Por Qué es Importante · Fondos · Recompensas · Sistema de Referencias · Equipo · Cómo Ayudar · Riesgos y Desafíos


Noticias



Votos para franquicias abiertos. ¡Haz que se oiga tu voz!


Sistema de Referencias abierto. ¡Consigue tus recompensas gratis!

Recompensa Secreta: ¡Consigue tu juego favorito firmado por su creador!

Añadidas retransmisiones GRATUITAS del Bitsummit, Comiket y Tokyo Game Show a todas las recompensas.

Ya hemos entrevistado algunos de nuestros desarrolladores mas importantes:-Hironobu Sakaguchi-Koji Igarashi-Goichi Suda-Takumi Naramura




El Problema

Somos Giacomo y Luis, y nuestra pasión es el diseño de juegos. En los últimos años hemos tenido la oportunidad de conocer a muchos iconos de la industria de los juegos como Hideo Kojima, Fumito Ueda, Hironobu Sakaguchi, y muchos otros.



Sin embargo notamos que nuestras conversaciones con ellos sobre creación de juegos nunca aparecen en los medios mainstream. 



Giacomo con Hideyuki Seino [Jukebeat], Yoji Shinkawa, Donna Burke, Hideo Kojima [Metal Gear Solid], y Koji Igarashi [Castlevania].


La Solución




Siendo nosotros mismos desarrolladores de juegos, hablar con estos maestros del desarrollo de juegos ha sido una experiencia de aprendizaje increíble para mejorar nuestros conocimientos, y creemos que más gente debe tener acceso a sus conocimientos. Así mismo, creemos que estos maestros del diseño de juegos se merecen tener un lugar para hablar sobre juegos, sin presiones comerciales. 



La única manera de que hablen abiertamente sobre diseño de juegos es no siendo parte de los medios mainstream, sino independientes.




Luis con Akihiro Hino [Ni no Kuni], Hironobu Sakaguchi [Final Fantasy] , Toshihiro Nagoshi [Yakuza], y Goichi Suda [Lollipop Chainsaw Massacre] .

Recorreremos Japón durante 10 semanas para reunirnos con estos creadores y entrevistarlos sobre cómo crean sus juegos, qué decisiones vitales y profesionales han tenido que tomar, y qué recomiendan a los que empiezan su carrera.


¡Además les haremos tus preguntas! Tenemos recompensas que te permiten crear y votar preguntas para que se las preguntemos a los desarrolladores, así que ¡asegúrate de echarles un vistazo!





Desarrolladores

El proceso de seleccionar y contactar a los desarrolladores lleva mucho tiempo, y entre la comunidad y el equipo tenemos que poder tomar decisiones rápidas; sin embargo tenemos una lista que puedes acceder para ver los nombres con los que estamos trabajando y cómo de cerca estamos de entrevistarlos.

Algunos de los desarrolladores a los que estamos contactando.



Accede a la lista de desarrolladores (50+) 
Este documento está "vivo" y cambia continuamente con la ayuda de la comunidad.

Por Qué es Importante


Vamos a realizar estas entrevistas por nuestra pasión al diseño de juegos, y con tu apoyo podemos hacer mucho más que nosotros solos.

Con tu apoyo seremos capaces de acceder a más desarrolladores, viajar a donde están, y producir mejores entrevistas.


Con tu apoyo podemos crear la primera biblioteca de entrevistas enfocadas a diseño de juegos por parte de diseñadores de juegos clásicos japoneses en Castellano de la historia.

Además, ésta es la única manera de acceder a la recompensa secreta.


Una manera fantástica de ahorrar dinero y ayudar a tus amigos interesados en la campaña al mismo tiempo.




Equipo






Giacomo Vaccari ha trabajado en más de una docena de juegos, es CEO de Lethal Games y fundó la Organización Internacional de Desarrolladores de Juegos en España. Ha obtenido 40 récords del mundo en juegos, y sus grandes pasiones son los juegos arcade y la música de los 60 a los 80. Aún cree que la Sega Saturn es lo más parecido a tener un arcade en casa.
 Juegos Favoritos: Nights Into Dreams, FFVII, Panzer Dragoon Saga, Doom, MGS2 y Saturn Bomberman.






Luis García ha trabajado en localización de juegos en el Reino Unido, España, Alemania, y durante los últimos 8 años en Japón, donde su sueño de trabajar en la saga Final Fantasy se convirtió en realidad. Además lleva su propio estudio de juegos indie, Shinyuden, tiene una colección de cientos de juegos, y cree que la única manera de comer paella es con una cuchara de palo.
Juegos favoritos: Ico, FFVI, Yakuza 0, MGS3, Space Invaders y Kuma Uta.






Cómo Ayudar

 
¡La mejor forma de ayudar a este proyecto es elegir una recompensar y apoyarla!

Pero incluso si no puedes apoyar una recompensa hay más maneras de ayudar. Quizá seas estudiante, o no tengas empleo... Nosotros también hemos estado en esa situación.

Aún así nos puedes ayudar compartiendo esta campaña a través de tus redes sociales, o contándole a un amigo a quien le apasiona el desarrollo de juegos lo que has visto aquí. Todo ayuda. Puedes seguirnos en twitter y compartir nuestros tweets con el hashtag #JapanGameDev. Comparte esta campaña a través de las utilidades de Indiegogo. Todo ayuda.

Únete a nuestra Comunidad de Reddit.








Riesgos y Desafíos




Estamos convencidos de que podemos acceder a muchos desarrolladores que tienen mucho que contar y enseñar. Sin embargo es posible que alguno rechace nuestra entrevista por cualquier razón. Aquí hay algunas soluciones a ese riesgo:
 Hemos creado una comunidad de Reddit para mantenerte informado de lo que está pasando en Japón durante estos 3 meses, además de nuestras cuentas de twitter donde usamos el hashtag #JapanGameDev. ¡Siempre sabrás lo que está ocurriendo!
 En aquellos casos en los que no podamos contactar a un desarrollador en concreto, siempre lo solucionaremos entrevistado a alguien de su equipo, o alguien cercano a su equipo, estilo y filosofías. ¡Nuestras comunidades están ahí para que nos ayudes a decidir quién será esa persona!

story:
As School Districts Grapple with Anti-Discrimination Policies, Pittsburgh Youth Ask for Your Support.

Home – An original music video by, for, and about LGBTQA+ youth. Dreams of Hope's first EP, also titled Home, is available for purchase at http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/dreamsofhope. 


Our Story | Dreams of Hope is a 13-year-old, Pittsburgh-based, non-profit arts organization that supports LGBTQA+ youth as they create art, educate their community, and build a sense of home. However, for many LGBTQA+ youth, trying to find a place to really feel at home can be demoralizing – sometimes impossible. The youth leaders of Dreams of Hope have created a music video that calls attention to the need for safe spaces, just as Dreams of Hope’s programming in schools and community organizations is being severely constrained due to lack of funds.

Our newest program, sQool, places youth leaders and teaching artists in classrooms to engage students with LGBTQA+ history, theory, and arts. The program has grown exponentially, showing the real need for this work in local schools. When we think back just a few years to a time when no school would consider bringing us into their building, it is amazing how many schools are now contacting us to ask if we will work with them. Unfortunately, most do not have budgets to cover our expenses and repeatedly we are forced to say, “No.” We have to turn down 70-75% of the requests we receive. Your support will change that.


How We Will Use the Money | For every $2,000 we raise, we can start a new partnership with a local school or community organization. Please help us reach five more schools next year! The money we raise here will be spent on materials, payment for teaching artists, and bus tickets for youth participants. The LGBTQA+ youth community is counting on you. Every donation, no matter what size, helps.


The Impact | In the two years since starting our sQool program, Dreams of Hope has grown from engaging dozens of young people and reaching hundreds, to engaging hundreds and reaching thousands. But our funding has not kept up with our growth. We have shown beyond any doubt, there is great need for what we do. Your support will:

  • Bring LGBTQA+ history, theory, and arts practice into classroom across the Pittsburgh region

  • Create out-of-school-time partnerships that engage LGBTQA+ youth in arts programming

  • Train educators to better support the LGBTQA+ students they work with

Your support can make it possible for more LGBTQA+ youth to feel at home at their own schools.


Other Ways You Can Help | We also understand many people can't donate now, but that doesn't mean you can't help! We need your support in spreading the word about this campaign and the music video. Please share, tweet, and spread the word! #ImHomeWhen the community supports LGBTQA+ youth. Tell us when you feel at home! With your help, maybe folks like Laverne Cox and George Takei might even hear about us and support our work!

story:
Short Summary

To get the project underway, we'll host a collection of 29,500 texts originally collected and proofread by Project Gutenberg (www.gutenberg.org). This is a marvelous project with a great history, one of the jewels of the Internet Age. If you love books, it should be on the top of your list.

The idea behind Project Gutenberg was for people around the world who love books to have an online place where they can access the ones they liked the most. It was also open to contributions, so if the work you wanted wasn't already there, you could type it in yourself and get it added to the collection.

The concept proved to be a major, major success. Retired Professors, Teachers, historians and bibliophiles of all kinds all took advantage of being able to add new works to the Project. They were able to type in books that they loved, but were so long out of print or so rare that they'd all but disappeared. Now, they would live again. The total number of works available at PG now exceeds 50,000.

For a long time, all the texts were typed in as pure text files so that even the lowest common denominator computers could display them easily. This allowed the contents of the books to be preserved, but the metadata, the formatting, the titling, the italics that we come to rely on, had to be discarded. The books came out like they'd been typed on a typewriter.

The original collection, released on DVD in 2010, contained only those plain text versions of the works. The were designed to be read on old computer screens that were text only, no graphics. This made them accessible by the lowest common denominator computers.  Now however, every computer has graphic capability, as do Tablets and eBook readers. Thus, these files need to be put into formats for web browsers and ebook readers. Project Gutenberg has no plans to do this, but they made the files accessible for others that might want to take on the project. We will do it and that's why we need your help.

The conversions take 9 minutes apiece, and for 29,500 files, that will take over 4,400 man-hours. We need to train and recruit the right people and convert the files. Then, we must install them onto a server programmed to handle a vast online library. Total funds needed to get all these things done is $65,000.

When done, though, we'll have provided a library containing many of the most-wanted works in English, a library that is completely free for the downloading and all files are free to share.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to get our great these great and rare works of art, literature, and music to long-lived digital format so that future generations can enjoy them and learn from the past.  Our kids and grand-kids will be able to download and read long-forgotten literary treasures that no commercial publisher will attempt any longer. 

Since all the Foundation Project's files are in public file formats, they can be maintained forever without licensing costs or commercial programs being needed to read them. Everything is free to download or share.

The Impact

Now future generations will be able to enjoy the great works of art just the way we did and still do.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please use the "share" to let others that you know would also care about this incredible cause.

story:
You're invited to be a part.

 

After over 30 years of research, our group has written and published " Who am I and Why am I Here? " (dot com) to help enlighten all who care to read it. It answers many questions that have been asked through the ages and explains how we got here, why we are here and where we are going.


After the first printing, we have decided that translating this book into other languages would be one of the best ways to share the idea that we are all Immortal Spiritual Beings or ISBE's and that the whole of God is fully present in every fragment, no matter how small and infinite.

Consciousness is in everything!

"Chapter 14: What happens when we die?

“There is neither pain nor distress in death as a phenomenon. Death in itself is painless. Not only is it painless, it may be a sensual delight to many who have been living their lives in physical distress. It's a relief to such people: a personal escape from the pain and distress of their wracked organisms..."
​
We would like to ​be able to ​offer it in Spanish....

 

Here is where your contributions will go: 

Editors / Translators $350
Insurance, legal fees $120
Office supplies, software, secure data storage $60
Professional fees $100
Printing and delivery of books $500
Crowdfunding fees (5%) + Credit card fees (3%) $120
TOTAL: $1,250.00

story:
PLEASE contribute  generously. 

Assalam 

I am Amani Ahmed  from the besieged Gaza Strip . You know my friends. We live in the Gaza Strip. In the suffocating siege. Life is very difficult here in the Gaza Strip :

- No freedom

- There are no jobs

- Uemployment

- Poverty 

I graduated from college three years ago, Business Administration, Because of the blockade I am unemployed. 3 years ago. I married and have Two children. I can not meet their needs. I live in fathers house. we have 9 persons in household include my nephew and niece.

The siege, the bad economic situation, and the high unemployment rate made me launched this campaign, Because I can’t find any work for me , So we can’t meet the needs of our children, In addition to that we are drowning in debts.

I hope my friends. Help my children. To meet their needs

I am looking for your generous contributions to help me and my family for live as others.

If I got overall amount that will be 5700$ I will use it like this:

* 3500$ pay for debts

* 700$  clothes for me and my children and school requirements.

* 1500$ to build a small project for my family.

Please contribute for me by :

- contributions.

- Invite your friends to support us and share my campaign .

- Pray for us.

story:
Resumen

CLEI, la Conferencia Latinoamericana de Informática, es el más importante evento del área en Ibero-América, que es auspiciado por el Centro Latinoamericano de Estudios en Informática (CLEI). Tiene más de cuarenta años y reúne investigadores provenientes de más de veinte países, incluso fuera de la región.

Junto a otros colegas, en 2013 organizamos y realizamos en Naiguatá el evento CLEI 2013, desde entonces creamos la Fundación CLEI Venezuela, con el fin de apoyar a nuestros profesores y estudiantes para participar en este tipo de eventos.

En los actuales momentos, con las limitaciones cambiarias y financieras de Venezuela, necesitamos acudir a la ayuda de nuestros amigos y colegas en el extranjero, a tú ayuda, para poder brindar este apoyo de forma sostenida.

Este año apoyaremos a cuatro profesores que irán a Valparaíso, Chile, del 14 al 16 de octubre, para representarnos en CLEI 2016, con la ponencia de cinco artículos. 

Lo que necesitamos 

  • Un boleto aéreo Caracas-Santiago-Caracas cuesta 800 USD
  • La inscripción en CLEI 2016 de un ponente cuesta 300 USD
  • Se paga 150 USD por artículo adicional de un mismo autor
  • Pagaremos 1 boleto + 3 ponentes + 2 artículos adicionales 
  • Éstas son tarifas con descuento del CLEI
  • La cuota anual de membresía institucional es de 350 USD
  • Pagaremos membresía anual de 3 instituciones venezolanas
  • Esto da acceso a los autores a la tarifa con descuento del CLEI
  • También a solicitar otra ayuda económica por parte del CLEI

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Ayúdame a difundir esta campaña por las RRSS 

Razones para apoyar ...

Al agradecer a uno de los donantes, de vuelta escribió:

  • En realidad es al revés; gracias a ti por crear la oportunidad de ayudar y de hacer lo correcto.  Quizás hay también un poco de egoísmo: los llamados de los amigos nos pesan más que los de los desconocidos, aunque no debiese ser así.  Y queda la esperanza de que este grano de arena termine siendo parte de una playa. ...Ya vendrán tiempos mejores.


"Pero el generoso pensará generosidades, 

y por generosidades será exaltado" 

(Isaías 32:8)
