story:
Why Care About Kids and Reading

It may seem obvious, but research shows that independent reading (that is reading for fun, not just assigned school reading) leads to: 

  • Better academic achievement
  • Better social and emotional IQ
  • Even better jobs

Currently, only 30% of kids are frequent readers.  And what's the #1 reason kids give for NOT reading? "I can't find a good book to read."  We want to change that.

 

Building a Community of Young Readers

When my son was 8 he was one of those kids who was always buried in an HP book. (that's Harry Potter for those of you not in the know.) But when he finished that series, he was stuck on what to read next.  I kept offering suggestions and was shocked to see how little my 3rd grader cared about my recommendations. Here’s where things got interesting. When a fellow 3rd grader suggested the same book I did, suddenly my kid couldn't wait to go to the library to get that book. What!? Oh yeah, kids care what friends think more than dear ol' Mom.

This inspired me to create an online community for young readers where kids’ choices and kids’ voices are center stage. In Bookopolis, students can:

  • Share book reviews with kids their age
  • Recommend books to friends
  • Explore curated book lists by grade level and genre
  • Track their reading through digital bookshelves and reading logs

 

The Impact for Students and Teachers

Since its launch, our platform has proven its basic mission, to get kids reading more. Teachers and librarians have adopted our platform as both a replacement for boring old paper logs and a way to build a community of engaged readers in their classroom.  We get messages every day from teachers, parents and students like:

“This website helps me find books I actually want to read. I love it!”  (4th grade student)

"Bookopolis gives my 4th graders the opportunity to become 21st century learners in a safe and monitored way. They have opportunities that stretch beyond the text of the book by reading other students' book reviews.” (4th grade teacher)

"I love to see the excitement of my students when they check the website to see what peers suggest as great reads." (5th grade teacher)

 “Bookopolis has turned my kid into a total reader who loves books. Thank you!” (6th grade parent)

 

Our Growth

With the help of grassroots marketing efforts and a few fancy awards, we have over 13,000 teachers, librarians and parents using our platform with over 200,000 kid readers adding thousands of reviews every week.  We were selected as “Best Teaching and Learning Website” by the American Association of School Librarians, a “Top 100 Educational Websites” by Homeschool.com and earned a “Cool Ed Tech Tools” award from EdTech Digest.

 

How You Can Help Get Kids Reading with Bookopolis

Educators have embraced this free tool as a way to help build a community of engaged readers and writers in the classroom.  Working closely with teachers and librarians from all different types of schools – urban, rural, big, small, well funded, wildly underfunded, and everything in between – has given me a new appreciation of these superheroes. They must simultaneously be a motivational speaker, calm disciplinarian, expert in fractions, nurse, sympathetic shoulder, confidante, role model, planner, and tech guru.

Many educators spend hundreds of dollars of their own money to fill their classroom with basic supplies, new books, and a few tech tools.  We want to keep Bookopolis as a free resource that helps educators honor kid voice and choice as they inspire students to love reading.

The good news is the cost for a classroom to use Bookopolis for the year is just $25.  Help fund a classroom (or two or three) this year and get all kids reading more and loving it.  

Here are some other ways you can help #getkidsreading with Bookoopolis:

  • Share Bookopolis.com with young readers, educators and parents
  • Buy books that kids love for your home or classroom from Bookopolis.com (via our Amazon affiliate link)
  • Start a Bookopolis Book Club in your community

Educators have embraced this free tool as a way to help build a community of engaged readers and writers in the classroom.  Working closely with teachers and librarians from all different types of schools – urban, rural, big, small, well funded, wildly underfunded, and everything in between – has given me a new appreciation of these superheroes. They must simultaneously be a motivational speaker, calm disciplinarian, expert in fractions, nurse, sympathetic shoulder, confidante, role model, planner, and tech guru.
Many educators spend hundreds of dollars of their own money to fill their classroom with basic supplies, new books, and a few tech tools.  We want to keep Bookopolis as a free resource that helps educators honor kid voice and choice as they inspire students to love reading.
The good news is the cost for a classroom to use Bookopolis for the year is just $25.  Help fund a classroom (or two or three) this year and get all kids reading more and loving it.  
Here are some other ways you can help #getkidsreading with Bookoopolis:

Share Bookopolis.com with young readers, educators and parents
Buy books that kids love for your home or classroom from Bookopolis.com (via our Amazon affiliate link)
Start a Bookopolis Book Club in your community

story:
Project Summary

We are serious about Education and we are serious about Fun.  Our mission in the educational arena has always been to continuously foster children’s learning and to make teaching the most positive experience it can be. 

Our games are for everyone and by “everyone” we mean even the most struggling students who get easily distracted or disengaged while learning - by balancing gameplay enjoyment with a challenge, our games are very motivating and, with this, are a powerful tool for addressing learning gaps making participants to pay attention and at the same time make bigger efforts to succeed. 

A constant desire to unlock new ways of making complex or unfamiliar math material accessible, compelling and igniting curiosity in a classroom setting sparked the creation of the first math games back in 2008, hand-made using wood, home printing and hand painting. 

Since then our games have been played by and helping many students to learn math and their increased popularity and recognition for effectiveness resulted in holding the first Math Olympics ("Olimpiadas de las Matematicas") at the Pacific University in Colombia (“Universidad del Pacifico”) with over 300 students from different schools participating.

This year, our top two games have been polished in their design, functionality, and thematic execution as well as adopted new names, “Math Train” and “Math Knights”.  We built our own plastic injection molding tooling, we improved graphic package design, we developed a business plan that includes commercialization, which will allow us to be able to sustain our social effort and our growth.  Finally, we “wrapped” the whole concept and business as Ingithink.

And today, we feel ready to take our project to the next level and by formalizing it expand our reach to the public so our games are played by more children, students, adults and they become board games to bring the entire family together. 

Considering the objectives above, what we need is some help from You to make our games available on the market by launching a full-scale production. 

To ensure that we create an educational future where EVERY child is engaged and excited about learning “one game at a time” we have incorporated charitable giving into our business model and costing structure: by buying one of our games You are automatically creating an equal valuable opportunity to share benefits among your family members and/or friends, schools or organizations of your choice i.e. “Every sold Game Equals One Game as a Gift”.

In the long term we are hoping to become a networking educational platform (Ignithink) where Teachers, Mentors, Parents and critical thinkers alike can engage in the interactive discussions, dialogs and/or debates about hot educational topics, issues, participation/community service learning etc. sharing their educational ideas and insights, teaching tools and methods, games and validate them through voting and ranking by contributors and share same ideas, tools and games via uploads.

 

Our Games

This original game is a single- and multiplayer (up to six participants) game that can be player both at home and/or in a classroom. Like in a fun dominoes game, one needs to link 67 tokens while practicing negative numbers additions and working with mathematical signs and absolute numbers. The winner is the first player to run out of tokens.

What can be better than building math through play!  The best part of Math Knights board game is that participants will engage in learning math without realizing it while experiencing a great adventure – enter into a realm of the two kingdom’s battle and help your King to advance and conquer the opponent’s kingdom by building math concepts (through addition and multiplication of negative and positive numbers).  In order to win one must find a solution while the sand timer runs out.  The game involves rolling dice and using tokens to challenge the opponent (Wizard casting the spell) and counter-attack (Math Knights faithfully serving his King). This game is for two players, play Math Knights in PVP mode or challenge mode, you choose.   

 

Our Next Games

Advanced Math Train Algebraic Expressions - Basic Math Train Natural Numbers - Math Knights Algebraic Expressions - Math Stop of the Pascal Triangle - Danaipe - Off OnTangents - Geo Matriz and more....

Our games are created by Educators in different parts of the world.

 

The Impact of "You + Ignithink"

When we think about the impact one can create by participating in our campaign we inevitable associate this subject with an inspiring story about an anthropologist studying the habits and customs of an African tribe.  The man suggested a game where children had to run towards the basket with fruits.  The first to arrive was to be awarded with the whole basket without obligation to share with anyone else.  The anthropologist was stunned to notice that upon signaling “Now” the children grabbed each others hands and ran to the basket together all at the same time arriving and enjoying the prize all together as well.  When asked why they did it the children responded “Ubantu” or “I am what I am because of who we all are.” 

 By contributing no matter how big or small to our campaign, whether simply by spreading the word or investing you are presented an opportunity not only to recognize the benefits of games and game-based learning but also to support academic achievement of children around the globe and broaden access to educational opportunities for those who are less fortunate.

Sharing a passion for education, advancement, accomplishment and a vision of expanding outreach to underserved communities and children in need together we can do so much more:

- This starts from allowing us to make our dream come true

- Funds received will kick start the mass production; with this, more games to play, more children are engaged  - together we promote Math Literacy and Creativity

- The more we give, the more we get - more new ideas, new games, new projects like Ingithink platform and alike…

- By participating in the program You are also sponsoring games for anybody on the globe, pick from any school and/or organization on the map and we will give away an exact same game you purchased

- Last but not least, you will receive a great product at a very competitive and attractive price that can be enjoyed by the entire family.

___________________________________________

What We Need

Based on a business plan we built in order to launch a successful mass production of our two games, Math Train and Math Knights, we need $34,331 USD.

Our budgeting includes the following:

Legal:

- Graphic designs rights and registrations (9%)

Product:

-Dominoes Injection molding tooling balance payoff (18%)

Marketing & Commercial:

- Webpage (4%)

- Products bar codes (1%)

- Marketing fees (8%)

Production:

- First mass production and final assembly ((60%) the number is based on projected expectations of this campaign and the volume that will justify the target retail price and the absorption of the tooling, designs, fixed costs and logistics)  

* If our goal is not achieved, we will conduct a further assessment to determine what we can accomplish with the funds received and produce as much games as we can at a prototype-level cost.

 

Risks & Challenges

Ignithink is at a prototype to production stage. We have a very good product with the content and design already being validated. Our challenges have to do with resources availability and timelines as we are coordinating designs and supply from different parts of the world. Even though we have firm commitments and schedules, changes may occur, however, we will keep you informed at all stages as our production goes on and/or if the product availability is delayed, and we will take immediate actions to minimize impact to our plan in order to meet your expectations.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the Word. Share and back our project.

Indiegogo campaign allows us to put our games in your hands and in the communities we serve in a very short time. Help us spread the word and this campaign's link. Spread the word about our games with your family and friends, neighbors and your social network. 

 

Who we are

     Freddy Sanchez

Born and raised in Buenaventura, Colombia, Freddy is a Math and Physics Middle School Teacher as well as a Professor at the Universidad del Pacifico.  His dedication to teaching and focus on strengthening the quality of teaching by transforming learning experience and making complex material accessible and relevant led to creation of his first game, Math Dominoes, back in 2008, as a way to boost children’s learning openness and help with STEM.  Since then the practice of experiential learning whether it is games or a playing activity became central for Freddy and made Freddy an active promoter of Ludic Education/Learning. 

     Demian Pedroza

Born and raised in Juarez, Mexico, Demian is a Consultant in the Social Development through Education arena who is starting out his doctoral program in the GWU (Human and Organizational Learning). He is absolutely passionate about Educational reforms and modern ways of effective learning. Demian is a big supporter of educational practices that utilize a behavioral approach to teaching and he strongly believes it is a great way for social and entrepreneurship development for children and young adults to accomplish their personal goals and to build better communities.

story:
Who I Am

With a diploma in Child and Youth Work and a Bachelor's degree in Child and Youth Care, child development is a huge interest of mine. Throughout my career so far, I have had the opportunity to work with parents, caregivers, children and youth in various capacities, and supporting families has become a passion of mine. Although I grew up in Northumberland, I have spent the last decade studying and working in Toronto. Last year I became a mom for the first time, and recently relocated with my growing family to make our home in Port Hope.

Why This Project Matters

Right away I fell in love with this community. I soon noticed how many young families live in this area who are seeking ways to connect with other families and engage with their little ones, yet there are so few quality programs available, like the ones that I enjoyed in the city. As a new mom myself, I understand how challenging early parenthood can be. Social isolation is a major hurdle that new parents, especially moms, face. The good news is that having access to relevant parenting knowledge, together with establishing a sense of connection to others in similar life stages, can be a huge asset to the well-being of both caregivers and children.

Furthermore, recent research in the area of early child development has heightened awareness about the critical importance of children’s earliest experiences. It is becoming more widely understood that the prenatal period until about age 3 is a critical time when children are most profoundly influenced through interactions with their primary caregivers, underscoring the need for programs that empower families with knowledge and skills that could help them flourish.

What We Will Offer

Kindred Parents will offer service in these areas:

  • Child-Parent Programming - based upon healthy child development and wellness
  • Open-Play - let your little ones explore the play area while you chat with other parents and enjoy a hot beverage
  • Parent Education - offering knowledge and information that will help members to flourish in early parenthood
  • Boutique - offering ‘green’ baby products from exclusively Canadian brands, especially small start-ups run by other mom-preneurs across the country

What We Need & The Impact

Kindred Parents has been working to secure start-up funds from various avenues, including personal investment, grants, and loans. As a current stay-at-home mom looking to start a business that will be a benefit to both the community and my own family, I am hoping that this campaign will help to mitigate our initial start-up debt, and support the realization of my vision to provide quality programs and services to families like mine.
 
Your contribution would:
  • support a young mom-preneur
  • support community development & local economy 
  • help to create jobs in the community for qualified professionals (i.e. ECEs, CYWs, or others)
  • enable us to secure the ideal space and equipment needed to create a beautiful and engaging space for you and your little ones
  • afford you some great perks after we open our doors!

Perks

Your contributions are greatly appreciated, and we'd like to show it! For your contributions to the Kindred Parents Studio & Boutique campaign, we are offering you some great perks to enjoy when we open our doors in early 2017. Use them yourself or gift them to a friend!

Some of the perks you can look forward to include:

Drop-in Class Passes

Try out one of our  parent-child classes that run for a duration of  8-10 weeks throughout the year. Each of the classes are designed to match the developmental stage of the child, and will be based around various themes, such as movement, sensory, music, art, wellness, and others.  KP will also offer a selection of child-friendly fitness classes, such as yoga, core strength, and others.

Open-play Memberships

Aside from our scheduled classes we will also be offering open-play times each week, allowing you to drop-in with your children to explore, play, and socialize with other families. For frequent players, Kindred Parents will offer play pass packages and monthly memberships that come with some other great benefits!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every contribution helps, and is greatly appreciated! If you are unable to help out financially, please help us to get the word out by making some noise about our campaign! Please 'share' with your friends, family, and anyone else you think might be interested. Word-of-mouth is a powerful thing, especially in such a tight-knit community!

Thanks in advance for all of your help!

Follow The Kindred Parents Journey:

story: ------

Somos una familia con un sueño en movimiento, conformada por dos adultos enamorados, dos frutos de niños, una perra y un gato, que desde el año 2012 tiene como misión de vida  promover el libro y la lectura con los 5 sentidos, transformando realidades en comunidades rurales y de riesgo social, refugios y casas de abrigo, escuelas, centros de atención al adulto mayor, instituciones para personas con diversidad funcional, parques y hospitales en Venezuela y otras latitudes,

Por este esfuerzo sostenido tuvimos la oportunidad de recibir el galardón del Premio Nacional Del Libro de Venezuela 2014, en la categoría: experiencia en promoción del libro y la lectura.    

Casa Kuentonáutica es una pequeña biblioteca infantil y juvenil de tipo familiar, que se encuentra al servicio de toda la comunidad de Bella Vista, en las profundidades de las montañas andinas, en Venezuela. Una zona rural, habitada por familias de bajos recursos económicos, cuya principal actividad productiva es la agricultura.

El tema que nos conecta como familia con esta comunidad, de la cual somos parte desde hace 5 años, es el poder mantener viva su memoria, vista no solo como un almacén de los recuerdos, sino también como ventana del porvenir. Es por eso que nos planteamos el diseño de una colección de libros interactivos animados, a partir de la recreación de los dibujos hechos por los niños, acerca de las fiestas populares de mayor tradición en la localidad. Para esta ocasión iniciamos la aventura con la fiesta de San Isidro Labrador, patrón de los agricultores. Celebración de agradecimiento a los buenos tiempos otorgados por la tierra para la siembra y la cosecha de los alimentos.

Esta historia de más de 100 años de edad, será contada por los niños y niñas de la aldea Bella Vista, luego de varias entrevistas con los abuelos de la comunidad, así como desde su experiencia de colaboradores en los preparativos de la fiesta, donde tendrán la oportunidad de dibujar los rostros, ocupaciones, altares, personajes tradicionales y actividades relevantes de los protagonistas y líderes de la celebración.

El proceso creativo y la festividad será registrada en formato de cine y posteriormente iniciaremos un recorrido por todo el valle, proyectando el material audiovisual y bautizando los libros impresos, junto a los niños creadores, y finalmente se espera generar un intercambio cultural con familias venezolanas residenciadas en otros países, así como con niños de comunidades internacionales, tales como: Argentina, Paraguay, Nicaragua, Colombia, Costa Rica, Australia, Canadá, Francia, Italia y Estados Unidos.  

¿Porque Volver a pasar por el corazón?

Porque el desarrollo del proyecto será una práctica para valorar el recuerdo de lo que somos, y la palabra Recordar, tiene su origen en el latín Recordis, que significa: volver a pasar por el corazón.

ENGLISH VERSION 

We are a family with a dream in motion, consisting of two lovers adults, two fruits of kids, a dog and a cat, which since 2012 has the mission of life to promote books and reading with the 5 senses, transforming realities rural communities and social risk, shelters and shelter homes, schools, care for the elderly, institutions for people with functional diversity, parks and hospitals in Venezuela and elsewhere,

For this sustained effort we had the opportunity to receive the award from the National Book Award Venezuela 2014, category: experience in promoting books and reading.

Kuentonáutica house is a small children's library of family type, which is to serve the entire community of Bella Vista, in the depths of the Andes mountains in Venezuela. A rural area inhabited by low-income families, whose principal productive activity is agriculture.

The theme that connects us as a family with this community, of which we are a part for 5 years, is to keep his memory alive view not only as a store of memories, but also as a window to the future. That's why we plan to design a collection of animated interactive books, from the recreation of the drawings made by children, about the popular celebrations of greater tradition in the locality. For this occasion we started the adventure with the feast of San Isidro Labrador, patron saint of farmers. Celebration of thanks to the good times granted for land for planting and harvesting food.

This history of over 100 years old, will be told by the children of the village Bella Vista, after several interviews with grandparents community as well as from their experience of collaborating in the preparations for the party, where they will the opportunity to draw faces, occupations, altars, traditional characters and relevant activities of the protagonists and leaders of the celebration.

The creative process and the festival will be recorded in film format and then begin a tour around the valley, driving the audiovisual material and baptizing printed books, along with the creators children, and eventually is expected to generate a cultural exchange with residenciadas Venezuelan families other countries and international communities with children, such as Argentina, Paraguay, Nicaragua, Colombia, Costa Rica, Australia, Canada, France, Italy and the United States.

Why Back to go through the heart again?

Because the project will be a practice to assess the memory of what we are, and the word Remember, it originated in Latin Recordis, which means to go through the heart again.

El tema que nos conecta como familia con esta comunidad, de la cual somos parte desde hace 5 años, es el poder mantener viva su memoria, vista no solo como un almacén de los recuerdos, sino también como ventana del porvenir. Es por eso que nos planteamos el diseño de una colección de libros interactivos animados, a partir de la recreación de los dibujos hechos por los niños, acerca de las fiestas populares de mayor tradición en la localidad. Para esta ocasión iniciamos la aventura con la fiesta de San Isidro Labrador, patrón de los agricultores. Celebración de agradecimiento a los buenos tiempos otorgados por la tierra para la siembra y la cosecha de los alimentos.
Esta historia de más de 100 años de edad, será contada por los niños y niñas de la aldea Bella Vista, luego de varias entrevistas con los abuelos de la comunidad, así como desde su experiencia de colaboradores en los preparativos de la fiesta, donde tendrán la oportunidad de dibujar los rostros, ocupaciones, altares, personajes tradicionales y actividades relevantes de los protagonistas y líderes de la celebración.
El proceso creativo y la festividad será registrada en formato de cine y posteriormente iniciaremos un recorrido por todo el valle, proyectando el material audiovisual y bautizando los libros impresos, junto a los niños creadores, y finalmente se espera generar un intercambio cultural con familias venezolanas residenciadas en otros países, así como con niños de comunidades internacionales, tales como: Argentina, Paraguay, Nicaragua, Colombia, Costa Rica, Australia, Canadá, Francia, Italia y Estados Unidos.  
¿Porque Volver a pasar por el corazón?
Porque el desarrollo del proyecto será una práctica para valorar el recuerdo de lo que somos, y la palabra Recordar, tiene su origen en el latín Recordis, que significa: volver a pasar por el corazón.
ENGLISH VERSION 
We are a family with a dream in motion, consisting of two lovers adults, two fruits of kids, a dog and a cat, which since 2012 has the mission of life to promote books and reading with the 5 senses, transforming realities rural communities and social risk, shelters and shelter homes, schools, care for the elderly, institutions for people with functional diversity, parks and hospitals in Venezuela and elsewhere,
For this sustained effort we had the opportunity to receive the award from the National Book Award Venezuela 2014, category: experience in promoting books and reading.
Kuentonáutica house is a small children's library of family type, which is to serve the entire community of Bella Vista, in the depths of the Andes mountains in Venezuela. A rural area inhabited by low-income families, whose principal productive activity is agriculture.
The theme that connects us as a family with this community, of which we are a part for 5 years, is to keep his memory alive view not only as a store of memories, but also as a window to the future. That's why we plan to design a collection of animated interactive books, from the recreation of the drawings made by children, about the popular celebrations of greater tradition in the locality. For this occasion we started the adventure with the feast of San Isidro Labrador, patron saint of farmers. Celebration of thanks to the good times granted for land for planting and harvesting food.
This history of over 100 years old, will be told by the children of the village Bella Vista, after several interviews with grandparents community as well as from their experience of collaborating in the preparations for the party, where they will the opportunity to draw faces, occupations, altars, traditional characters and relevant activities of the protagonists and leaders of the celebration.
The creative process and the festival will be recorded in film format and then begin a tour around the valley, driving the audiovisual material and baptizing printed books, along with the creators children, and eventually is expected to generate a cultural exchange with residenciadas Venezuelan families other countries and international communities with children, such as Argentina, Paraguay, Nicaragua, Colombia, Costa Rica, Australia, Canada, France, Italy and the United States.
Why Back to go through the heart again?
Because the project will be a practice to assess the memory of what we are, and the word Remember, it originated in Latin Recordis, which means to go through the heart again.

story:
Coded by Kids, a free technology education program, reaches nearly 100 students a week in schools and rec centers across the city of Philadelphia. Currently in its third year, CBK has scaled up quickly to bring a robust coding curriculum to kids ages 5-18.

The successful program has seen participants go on to work as junior developers at local software companies, create apps they hope to bring to market, and most importantly, shown hundreds of kids there is a place for them in the innovation economy.  

We are ready to do more. We have a waiting list of 12 schools community groups that are excited to partner with us.

With your help we can raise the funds to support 12 after school coding programs across Philadelphia, allowing us to to reach 300 students every week.

Every $355 we raise pays for 12 weeks of instruction for 1 child.

 

Who we are

We are committed to providing free tech education, tech industry exposure and career mentorship to children who lack access to these opportunities.

Click the logos below to learn more about our work to date!

              

 

What We Teach

Our dynamic, project-based curriculum teaches students skills used by adult software engineers and web developers every day on the job. The longer a student stays in one of our programs, the more skills they acquire, including:

  • Beginning to advanced web application development
  • Beginning to advanced user interface and user experience design
  • Fundamentals of IT project management
  • Fundamentals of software engineering
  • Fundamentals of tech focused entrepreneurship

Students as young as 5 years old have created websites about their favorite movies and cartoon characters,  know how to code in multiple languages, and use Git/Github for version control and project tracking. 

 

Our vision and plan

Coded by Kids envisions a world where technology education is as accessible as youth sports.

Founded in 2013 when CEO, Sylvester Mobley, volunteered at his neighborhood rec center teaching coding to just one student, the program has grown on a shoestring budget with the help of a dedicated group of volunteers and program partners.

We are strong believers in partnership and its power to help a program like ours quickly and effectively get its services to kids in their own communities.   The funds we raise from this campaign will be used to bring free, high quality after school coding programs directly to the students our partners serve.

  • The ABLE Center (West Philadelphia) - FUNDED!
  • Hackett Elementary (Fishtown) - FUNDED!
  • Adaire Elementary (Fishtown) - FUNDED!
  • Mighty Writer’s West (West Philadelphia) - FUNDED! 
  • Penn Treaty School (Fishtown)
  • Queen Village Neighbors Association (South Philadelphia)
  • Strawberry Mansion Learning Center (North Philadelphia)
  • The U School (North Philadelphia)

Help us identify additional partners! Learn how in the Other Ways You Can Help section below. 

 

Campaign FAQ

1. Why are we crowdfunding?

Coded by Kids is in demand. We've been able to achieve a lot with a little, but we believe crowdfunding is the best way to raise the money we need funds needed to make an impact now. We’re not looking for easy money — we want to make sure Philadelphia students can keep up, and ultimately, lead the way

2. What is our program budget? 

3. How do we intend to scale in the next few years?

4. What happens if we don't raise the full amount of funding?

Our programs will be run in the order that partners signed on to participate in our campaign. If we only raise enough to fund 4 programs, then the first 4 partners to sign onto the campaign will host programs this year. All of our partners are willing to take this chance in order to get their students access to technology education.

5. Can you direct your contribution to a specific campaign partner?

Unfortunately, Indiegogo contributions cannot be earmarked for a specific campaign partner. Instead, we encourage you to help us spread the word about the campaign in order to ensure we achieve our funding goal and all of our partners benefit from our programs!

Have a question we haven't answered here? Email us and we'll get back to you within 3 business days. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and spread the word! We've drafted sample emails (friends and family, employers) and sample social media posts you can use. You can also share this onepager and our campaign video. 
  2. Do you work at a company interested in sponsoring an after school program at one of our partner sites? Share this onepager with the appropriate people and put us in touch!
  3. If you’re interested in becoming one of our campaign partners, we are looking for more! Email us at info@codedbykids.com for more information on becoming part of #CbK300. For more information on our current partners visit our website.

  4. Get involved! We’re always looking for partners to help us with curriculum, volunteer recruitment, and internships/apprenticeships for our older students. Sign-up for our e-list to get notified of future partnership opportunities!

  5. Interested in teaching your kids to code but don’t have Coded by Kids in your community? Check out these online resources: Code.org, Codeacademy, Tynker.

If you’re interested in becoming one of our campaign partners, we are looking for more! Email us at info@codedbykids.com for more information on becoming part of #CbK300. For more information on our current partners visit our website.

story:
Thanks for visiting - this campaign has now ended - please visit http://willowcollege.com to learn more about the Interior Design Course on offer. 

Who are we?

We are Chris and Lee Brown, Interior Designers from New Zealand, a small country renowned for thinking outside the square and being innovative.

We have been Interior Designers for 61 years combined. Together we have built an online community with interiordezine.com where hundreds of thousands of people from around the world have gained new skills and the confidence to take their learning to another level through the ecourses we provided. We have been a positive influence in peoples lives and their future, and we have done it all for free for the last 15 years.

So Why Change a Good Thing?

Technology has changed, and we can now offer a far better way of learning and helping even more people with a mobile learning management system. We have called this Willow College. Short 3-minute bite sized interactive lessons, able to be undertaken, anywhere, anytime. Users can login and see their progress on a dashboard, talk in a community, compete against their friends, generally learn in a fun and interactive environment.

Why Pay Now?

Technology costs money, to provide this system we need to charge you, its as simple as that. 

Problems with Change - Why it Holds us Back

People often procrastinate with further learning because they don’t think that they can fit it into their already busy lifestyles and are too afraid to fail if they try because they are too busy to make the class or do the homework and assignments. With the Willow College system, you can be in a full time career and fit the lessons in anywhere. You can be waiting at the Doctor's surgery, one lesson done, taking a coffee break, that’s another. Queuing up to pay for your groceries, another lesson. It’s as simple as that – we can help you learn interior design without having to change your current lifestyle, but it will make an enormous change to your future. You biggest fear is overcome, you will not fail because we will guide you all the way.

Who Has Spare Time?

It just means when you would normally use 3 minutes to check your Facebook or Instagram account, you are now learning something with Willow College instead.  The course is undertaken at your own pace, there is no time pressure, some weeks you have too many commitments and others you have more downtime. That’s the great thing about this, there is no one chasing you to hand in an assignment. You are in complete control.  

So Why are We Crowd Funding?

It's pretty simple, we have put everything we have into this project, time and money, but we don't quite have enough to get it finished. We have a family to support and a little bit more software to buy, and a couple more helping hands would be great. 

How Can You Help?

Because we have so many fantastic students who have already completed our 3 free courses, we thought they could help us get the word out about what we are doing and in return we could offer them great Foundation Member pricing for the subscription. Anyone that supports us with this funding campaign will keep the same "Perk" subscription rates for life. These Perks - (look right),  are all listed there.

Lee has written an ebook about Interior Designer Insights - you will receive this entertaining and insightful ebook as well as a Subscription to WillowCollege.com. So exciting, you'll love it. We have enjoyed building it and can't wait for you to give it a go, but we need your help. If you help us here by purchasing a "perk" you will receive that life changing Interior Design learning experience. You won't look back, you will have skills, knowledge and confidence to change you life and your career.

How Can You Help Others?

A sponsorship system will be used to help those who can’t afford access to the new way of learning that we offer so they can still have the ability to learn.  Interior design may not seem like an essential learning skill but you have no idea how gaining skills and helping people have a better environment to live in changes lives for the better. We get emails on a daily basis telling us that learning interior design was life changing. We have testimonials from people who’s lives we have made a difference to – please make sure you take a few minutes to read some of them in the updates section (the tabs at the top of this). You can buy a "Perk" for a subscription for yourself and sponsor a student less fortunate.  Be a super hero - sponsor a student.

Why Believe in Chris and Lee?

Because we make things happen, 15 years of interiordezine.com, teaching Interior Design for free online. We are very generous people as you can probably tell by now, we rarely ask for help. We have a lot invested in this project and don’t want it sitting on the shelves for years if we have to go back and get jobs. We are in this to make a difference and won’t stop until its done. 

We have both left our jobs, sold our valued possessions and fully committed ourselves to this project. Our friends have called us crazy - perhaps we are, but good things don't just miraculously happen, they need someone with drive, passion and determination to actively make them happen. 

Thanks 

Thanks so much for visiting, we hope you could contribute and get your Foundation Status and go on to change your career.

Thanks again,

Chris and Lee Brown

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP


If you can't contribute, no worries — here are a few ways you can help out:


•    Please share the Indiegogo link on social media!
•    For updates follow along at

Facebook

Instagram

Twitter

Youtube


Please share our campaign with your friends and community via social media. There are great tools you can use to do this at the top of this page. 

 

P.S. - don't read down here - go choose your Perk now!
